column8: CRM – Implement Sales Ops MDM Search Action and Link to Existing MDM Customer/Prospect
column11:
As a Sales Ops user, I want a dedicated MDM duplicate-check and resolution section on the prospect account form so that I can review pending prospects, link them to existing MDM accounts, or reject them.

 

 *  Add an “MDM Validation” section to the prospect account form (Sales Ops view), showing: 

 *  Address validation status. 
 *  Duplicate-check status and prior system decisions. 
 

 *  Provide an action/button for Sales Ops to trigger MDM duplicate/search again for pending approval prospects. 
 *  Display returned MDM candidates in a selectable list (with key fields like name, sales skill, status, MDM ID). 
 *  Support Sales Ops actions: 

 *  “Use existing account” ? set duplicate-check user selection accordingly, link CRM prospect to selected MDM account/BCA, set approval status = Approved. 
 *  “Reject – duplicate found” ? set approval status = Rejected, record reason, deactivate prospect/BCA if appropriate. 
 

 *  Ensure that upon approval, IF10 is sent (if needed) and CRM fields (MDM ID, account number, MDM number) are updated per defined rules. 
 *  Auto-Populate MDM IDs, Account Number, and MDM Number on Sales Ops Approval 
 *  Implement Sales Ops Reject Prospect Behavior and Prospect BCA Deactivation Rules 
 *  Auto-Populate Approval Metadata and Comments for Auto-Approved and Manually Approved Prospects
column19: Moved out of state Sprint Ready
column22:
*  MDM Validation Section – Visibility & Layout 

 *  Given a prospect is in Pending Approval status 

 *  When a Sales Ops user opens the prospect form 
 *  Then the MDM Validation section must appear under the Account form under the address section (only for 1C accounts). 
 

 *  Given the logged-in user is not Sales Ops 

 *  When viewing the prospect 
 *  Then the MDM Validation section must remain hidden. 
 

 *  Given the MDM Validation section loads 

 *  When fields and controls are rendered 
 *  Then the section must contain the following elements in the Summary Tab after Address Section: 

 *  Address Validation Control Button 
 *  Address Validation Status Icon (Green check = complete / Orange clock = not completed) 
 *  MDM Duplicate Check Button (Search API trigger) 
 

 

 *  Given the SalesOps navigates to the Admin tab, the admin tab must contain the following elements added: 

 *  Fields: Address Verified, Address Verification Bypassed, Is Duplicate Check Completed, Duplicate Check User Selection, MDM ID, Account Number, MDM Number 
 

 

 

 *  Address Validation Behavior in Sales Ops (This is already covered as part of #890506) So no additional dev work is needed for the Address validation required mentioned in the AC)  

 *  Given the Address Validation step was not completed by Sales Rep  

 *  When Sales Ops opens the prospect  
 *  Then Address Validation button must show an orange clock indicator meaning it is not completed  
 

 *  Given Sales Ops clicks Address Validation  

 *  When the MDM Address Validation API returns standardized address results  
 *  Then CRM must display a model window showing address suggestions with:  

 *  Standardized Address Line 1  
 *  City  
 *  State/Province  
 *  Postal Code  
 *  Country  
 

 

 *  Given Sales Ops selects a standardized address  

 *  When they confirm  
 *  Then CRM must:  

 *  Update address fields with selected standardized values  
 *  Set Address Verified = Yes (In Admin tab)  
 *  Set Address Verification Bypassed = No (In Admin Tab)  
 *  Display a green checkmark next to the Address Validation control.  
 

 

 *  Given no results are returned from Address Validation  

 *  When Sales Ops chooses to bypass  
 *  Then CRM sets  

 *  Address Verification Bypassed = Yes.  (In Admin tab)  
 *  Set Address Verified = No.  (In Admin tab)  
 *  Continue to display orange pending indicator against the address validation button 
 

 

 

 *  MDM Duplicate Check / Search Action – Sales Ops Only 

 *  Given Address Validation status is green 

 *  When Sales Ops is viewing the MDM Validation section 
 *  Then the MDM Duplicate Check Button must be visible and enabled. 
 

 *  Given Sales Ops clicks the MDM Duplicate Check button 

 *  When CRM invokes the API via plugin. (The Plugin call the MDM Search API) 
 *  Then results must appear in a modal window. 
 

 

 *  MDM Duplicate/Search Modal – Required Columns 

 *  Given the modal window appears 
 *  When one or more MDM candidates are returned 
 *  Then each row must show the following columns: 

 *  MDM Account Name   
 *  Source Account Number  
 *  MDM Account ID  
 *  Division   
 *  Customer Status Code (Active/Inactive)  
 *  Sales Skill
  
 *  Once Customer Flag (Yes /No) - OneCustomerERP  
 *  Address Line 1  
 *  City,   
 *  State/Province,   
 *  Postal Code  
 *  Country 
 *  Score 
 *  CRM ID 
 

 

 *  Pre-filtered retrieval logic. This ensures SalesOps only interacts with actionable data: 

 *  Strict Filtering: Only retrieve records where SourceID = ECL_EBS. 
 *  Hardstop Logic: The retrieved records will include all results including Hardstop = Y as well as Hardstop = N 
 *  Override Capability: If the retrieved results have hardstop = Y and division = 20 (Food & beverage) then this override capability is NOT applicable. The modal will continue to display all remaining results where hardstop = N. 
 *  Sorting & Prioritization: Results will be sorted in descending order by Match Score to ensure the most relevant records appear first. 
 *  UI Updates: The radio buttons for selection should only be shown for the results where division = 20 (food & beverage), the sales ops should not be able to select results from other division. 
 

 


 

 *  Given multiple MDM matches exist 

 *  When the modal displays them 
 *  Then rows must be sortable by Score in Descending order. 
 

 *  Given the API returns no results 

 *  When the modal opens 
 *  Then CRM must show: 

 *  “No duplicates found in MDM. This prospect will be auto-approved after clicking Save.” 
 

 

 

 *  Sales Ops Action –  
 *  Possible Matches Found 

 *  Given the modal window appears 
 *  When one or more MDM candidates are returned 
 *  Sales Ops has two button options: 

 *  *Proceed --> This button will be disabled until one of the rows on the modal is selected (radio button selection) --- For next steps refer section below 
 *  Cancel --> Close the modal, No data changes, gives opportunity to SalesOps to make any required updates on the Account form 
 

 *  Merge, Reject or linking action buttons are not shown to the SalesOps at this point. 
 

 *  No Matches Found 

 *  Given the modal window appears 
 *  When no matches are found 
 *  Sales Ops has two button options: 

 *  Proceed --> On clicking the Proceed button, Prospect will be auto approved and send to MDM 

 *  When the Prospect is saved, the CRM system must: 
 *  Set IsDuplicateCheckCompleted = Yes 
 *  Set DuplicateCheckUserSelection = “No Duplicate Found” 
 *  Trigger IF10 Prospect Create (Requirement covered in story User Story 892571: CRM – Invoke MDM Prospect Creation post MDM Dup Check) 

 

 

 

 *  Cancel --> Close the modal, No data changes, gives opportunity to SalesOps to make any required updates on the Account form 
 

 

 *  *Proceed 

 *  Given the SalesOps clicks on 'Proceed' after Possible Matches are found 
 *  Then the CRM system evaluates the selected MDM match against the current prospect 

 *  Outcome A: Selected Match has different Sales Skills than the newly added Prospect  

 *  Given that the Selected Match has different Sales Skill than the newly added prospect (Current=Water, Selected Match=Hygiene) 
 *  Then the system will show a modal window 

 *  With message --> “A matching prospect was found with adifferent Sales Skill. Recommended action: link this prospect to the existingaccount ” 
 *  Current Prospect Sales Skill 
 *  Select Match Sales Skill  
 *  BCA Name (if available) 
 

 *  And will have buttons: 

 *  Confirm Link --> CRM links the current prospect to identified BCA 

 *  Update Audit/Log fields: 

 *  Update IsDuplicateCheckCompleted = Yes   
 *  Update DuplicateCheckUserSelection = "Duplicates Found"  
 *  Update CRM.MDMID = MDM.MDMID
   
 *  Update the Account Number as MDM Account Number  
 *  ERP Account Status = Prospect if MDM Customer Status is 02 Prospect | Active if MDM Customer Status is 01 Active 
 *  Account Type = Customer if MDM Customer Status is 01 Active 
 *  Set Approval Status = Approved  
 *  Set Worked By =  LOGGED IN USER  
 *  Set Approval Comment = “Auto-approved – No duplicates found in MDM.” 
 

 

 *  Cancel --> Cancels the modal and returns to Possible Matches Found modal window. 
 

 

 *  Outcome B: Selected Match with same sales skill that may or may not have related entities. 

 *  Given that the Selected Match has same Sales Skill as the current Prospect  
 *  Covered in a separate story for 'Reject' & 'Merge' scenarios #897278 
 

 

 

 

 

 

 *  UI Behavior & Control Visibility Rules 

 *  Given the prospect is pending approval 

 *  When Sales Ops opens the record 
 *  Then both Address Validation and MDM Duplicate Check buttons must be enabled. 
 

 *  Given the prospect is already approved or rejected 

 *  When Sales Ops opens the form 
 *  Then buttons must be disabled in read-only mode. 
 

 *  Given a sales rep opens the prospect 

 *  Then MDM Duplicate Check/Search button must be hidden (Sales Ops only). 
 

 

 *  Data Integrity Rules 

 *  Linking CRM ? MDM must never create a second BCA. 
 *  Existing PCA/BCA relationships must be preserved unless explicitly overridden by Sales Ops selection. 
 *  IF10 messages must always reflect the correct operation: 

 *  New prospect ? create 
 *  New sales skill ? add skill 
 *  Existing MDM match ? update only 
 

 

 *  Error Handling 

 *  Given the MDM Search/Dupe API is unreachable 

 *  When Sales Ops triggers the duplicate check 
 *  Then CRM must: 

 *  Display message: “MDM service unavailable. Please try again or route prospect for manual review.” 
 *  Not approve automatically 
 *  Leave Approval Status = Pending 
 *  Leave MDM ID blank 
 

 

 

 

Note: When New fields are created to support this feature, please ensure you refer to this story to know the list of fields that needs to be created. #890505
 

 
Developer Notes: 

 *  Global Option Set Field Creation on the Account Table 

 *  Given CRM must store duplicate check decisions (Create Duplicate Check User Selection field on Account Table) 

 *  When the Duplicate Check User Selection option set is created 
 *  Then it must contain: 

 *  No Duplicate Found 
 *  I Will Use Existing Account 
 *  Reject - Duplicate Found 
 *  And no default value must be set. 
 

 

 *  Given CRM must track completion of duplicate checks  (Create Is Duplicate Check Completed field on Account Table) 

 *  When the Is Duplicate Check Completed option set is created 
 *  Then it must contain Yes / No, with no default value, and will be maintained only by automated processes.

column11: *  Proceed --> On clicking the Proceed button, Prospect will be auto approved and send to MDM

 *  Update DuplicateCheckUserSelection = "Duplicates Found" 
 *  Update CRM.MDMID = MDM.MDMID
 
 *  Update the Account Number as MDM Account Number 
 *  ERP Account Status = Prospect if MDM Customer Status is 02 Prospect | Active if MDM Customer Status is 01 Active 
 *  Account Type = Customer if MDM Customer Status is 01 Active 
 *  Set Approval Status = Approved 
 *  Set Worked By =  LOGGED IN USER 
 *  Set Approval Comment = “Auto-approved – No duplicates found in MDM.” 
 

 

 *  Cancel --> Cancels the modal and returns to Possible Matches Found modal window 
 

 



Scenario 6: UI Behavior & Control Visibility Rules

Login as FBU sales ops admin  
Create a 1c prospect account / open existing 1C prospect account

 *  Validate both Address Validation and MDM Duplicate Check buttons must be enabled. 
 

 

 *  Prospect is already approved or rejected

column8: CRM – Implement Pre-save CRM Duplicate Check on Prospect (Standardized Address + Sales Skill)
column11:
As a sales rep, I want CRM to perform an internal duplicate checkin the background on prospect save using standardized address and sales skillso that obvious duplicates already in CRM are caught early without Sales Repmaking decision on merge or ignore the duplicates. 
 

 *  Cutover     Plan: 

 *  This      solution requires cutover activity to standardize all the addresses in      CRM system for prospects & customers 
 *  This      requires IT & Business involved and has been documented in user story      895455 & 895456 
 *  This will standardize      addresses and resolve duplicates for Canada 1C-scope prospects in CRM so      there are clean prospect with address & sales skill in the system 
 

 *  On     prospect save (Quick Create and full form), Rep will need to click on     Address Validation: 

 *  Possible      Outcomes: 

 *  Address       Validated Successfully from MDM 
 *  Address       Bypass  (Either invalid address or       API unreachable) 
 

 *  If Address Validation is      successful, CRM system will trigger CRM dup check on: 

 *  Standardized       address (as validated via MDM). 
 *  Sales       skill (for 1C prospects). 
 

 *  Possible     CRM outcomes: 

 *  Duplicates      found --> Prospect will not be saved 
 *  No match      found ? CRM will trigger MDM duplicate check. 

 *  Duplicates       found --> Prospect is saved with pending approval status 
 *  No match       found -->  Prospect is saved       with auto approval status 
 

 

 

 *  Use custom plugin on pre-save for CRM duplicate detection rules on standardized address and sales skill for     1C accounts in the background 
 *  Ensure     behavior is consistent whether the prospect was created from Quick Create,     account form.
column19: Moved out of state In Test
column22:
*  Triggering     pre-save CRM Duplicate Check using Plugin 

 *  Given a      sales rep creates or edits a 1C Prospect using QuickCreate or the full      Account form 

 *  When the       user clicks Save or Save &       Close or Save & Create New 
 *  Then CRM       must automatically perform a pre-save CRM       duplicate check (using custom Plugin to check against 1C accounts only) 
 *  And the       duplicate check must use: 

 *  Standardized        address fields (Street, City, State/Province, Postal Code, Country) -        Exact Match  
 *  Sales        Skill - Exact Match (The list of fields should be made configurable so that this can be adjusted if we need to check on sales skill at a later date/demo) 
 *  And only on Active Account Records. 
 

 

 

 *  Duplicate     Found — Prospect will NOT be saved in the CRM system 

 *  Given the      duplicate check finds one or more matching CRM accounts/prospects on      pre-save 

 *  When the       system finds a duplicate record in the CRM system 
 *  Then CRM       must NOT save the new prospect 
 *  And show a prompt to the user that "You cannot save this prospect since there is a duplicate in the system" 
 *  And show the account name, account number with sales skill (This will be customized based on the attributes matched during pre-save dup check) 
 

 

 *  No     Duplicate Found -- CRM will trigger MDM dup check  

 *  Given CRM      runs the duplicate check 

 *  When no       matches are returned 
 *  Then CRM       will run MDM dup check in the background (Covered in separate user story #890509  

 *  If        duplicates are found in MDM --> Save this prospect record in pending        approval status and add to Sales Ops Review  
 *  If duplicates are not        found in MDM --> Save this prospect in approved status and create        BCA, send IF10 request to MDM for this record  
 

 

 

 *  Duplicate     Detection Dialog will not be user facing and will run only in the     background 
 *  Consistency     Across QuickCreate & Full Form 

 *  Given a      prospect is created via QuickCreate 

 *  When       Save or Save & Close or Save & Create New is clicked 
 *  Then the       CRM pre-save duplicate check behavior using address and sales skill must       match the behavior on the standard Account form. 
 

 *  Given a      prospect is created via the full Account form 

 *  When       Save or Save & Close or Save & Create New is clicked 
 *  Then the       CRM pre-save duplicate check must behave identically. 
 

 

 

Note- This approach needs to be re-evaluated for offline scenario 
Note: When New fields are created to support this feature, please ensure you refer to this story to know the list of fields that needs to be created. #890505

column8: CRM – Implement an override capability for the Sales Ops MDM Search Action to address edge cases where non-standard duplicates are retrieved
column11:
As a Sales Ops user, I want a dedicated MDM duplicate-check and resolution section on the prospect account form so that I can review pending prospects, link them to existing MDM accounts but allow override in a case when the retrieved results are not as expected and I want to approve the newly added prospect into MDM
 

 

 *  Add an “MDM Validation” section to the prospect account form (Sales Ops view), showing: 

 *  Address validation status. 
 *  Duplicate-check status and prior system decisions. 
 

 *  Provide an action/button for Sales Ops to trigger MDM duplicate again for pending approval prospects. 
 *  Display returned MDM candidates in a selectable list (with key fields like name, sales skill, status, MDM ID). 
 *  Support Sales Ops actions: 

 *  No duplicates found --> Prospect saved - approved status 
 *  Duplicates found, the SalesOps can: 

 *  Link (Existing record with different sales skill) -- Covered in #890515 
 *  Reject (Existing record with same sales skill and no related entities)  
 *  Merge (Existing record with same sales skill and related entities) 
 *  Override (Enable prospect creation overrides when identified duplicates are non-standard and do not align with the newly added prospect) 
 

 *  This user story introduces an override capability, empowering Sales Operations to validate potential matches and exercise professional judgment to still create a new prospect when existing records are confirmed to be non-standard or false positives 
 

 *  Ensure that upon approval, IF10 is sent (if needed) and CRM fields (MDM ID, account number, MDM number) are updated per defined rules. 
 *  Auto-Populate MDM IDs, Account Number, and MDM Number on Sales Ops Approval 
 *  Auto-Populate Approval Metadata and Comments for Auto-Approved and Manually Approved Prospects
column19: Moved out of state Sprint Ready
column22:
*  Sales Ops Action –  
 *  Possible Matches Found 

 *  Given the modal window appears 
 *  When one or more MDM candidates are returned 

 *  If the retrieved results have hardstop = Y then this override capability is NOT applicable. Override checkbox should NOT appear if any of the retrieved results has hardstop = Y 
 *  Outcome C: --> Selected Match appears correctly but the Sales Ops would still prefer to add the newly saved Prospect into MDM System 

 *  Context: 

 *  The retrieved results from MDM dup check trigger will showcase the below mentioned columns: 

 *  MDM Account Name 
 *  Source Account Number 
 *  MDM Account ID 
 *  Division 
 *  Customer Status Code (Active/Inactive) 
 *  Sales Skill 
 *  Once Customer Flag (Yes /No) - OneCustomerERP 
 *  Address Line 1 
 *  City,  
 *  State/Province,  
 *  Postal Code 
 *  Country 
 *  CRM ID 
 

 

 *  There is an edge case scenario where the duplicate results are retrieved but the Sales Ops is certain that the retrieved results is different from the newly added prospect, the system must allow override capability so that the SalesOps can choose to save the newly added prospect instead or the available options (Reject/Merge/Link) 
 *  If the retrieved results have hardstop = Y and division = 20 (Food & beverage) then this override capability is NOT applicable. Override checkbox should NOT appear if any of the retrieved results has hardstop = Y and division = 20  
 *  For all other scenarios, the override scenario will be applicable for the sales ops.  
 *  Eventhough the rest of the results with hardstop = N will also be shown on themodal popup. 
 

 *  Given the SalesOps has triggered MDM dup check, then a modal window appears 
 *  When one or more MDM candidates are returned 
 *  Sales Ops has the best judgement to identify that the duplicates retrieved are non-standard 
 *  And will need to add the newly added prospect to the MDM system 

 *  Show message in same modal window with checkbox --> "Ignore MDM matches and proceed with creating a new Prospect into the MDM system"  
 *  Given the SalesOps clicks on the checkbox 
 *  Then the system will trigger a warning modal popup: --> "Warning: You are requesting a new prospect setup in MDM system even when duplicates are retrieved. Are you sure you would like to proceed?" 
 *  SalesOps has two options: 

 *  Proceed --> Created a new prospect in MDM (IF10 request will be sent) 

 *  

 *  Given the SalesOps clicks on 'Procced' to create a new prospect in MDM 
 *  Then CRM must: 

 *  Trigger IF10 Prospect Create message to MDM 
 *  Pass CRM ID (accountid), Account Name (accountname), Standardized Address (street1,ecl_country,city,postalcode,ecl_state), Division, Sales Skill, and other mapped fields 
 *  Pass MDM ID (ecl_mdmid)= blank (because MDM will generate one) 
 

 *  Given IF10 confirmation returns with an MDM ID 

 *  When CRM receives the IF10 response 
 *  Then CRM must update: 

 *  CRM.MDMID = MDM.MDMID 
 *  Update CRM.MDM Sync status = Success 
 *  Update MDM Sync Description = "Prospect create request -  Submitted in MDM successfully" 
 *  Update Last Sync Date = Current Timestamp 
 

 

 *  Given IF10 confirmation returns a failure/ IF10 request has failed 

 *  Then CRM must update: 

 *  Update CRM.MDM Sync status = Failure 
 *  Update MDM Sync Description = "Prospect create request -  Failed in MDM" 
 *  Update Last Sync Date = Current Timestamp 
 

 

 

 

 
 

 *  Cancel --> Warning popup closes, No data changes 
 

 

 

 *  Sales Ops has two button options: 

 *  *Proceed --> This button will be disabled until one of the rows on the modal is selected (radio button selection) --- For next steps refer section below 
 *  Cancel --> Close the modal, No data changes, gives opportunity to SalesOps to make any required updates on the Account form 
 

 *  Merge, Reject or linking action buttons are not shown to the SalesOps at this point. 
 

 *  No Matches Found (Covered in a different story #897278  

 

 

 *  *Proceed 

 *  Given the SalesOps clicks on 'Proceed' after Possible Matches are found 
 *  Then the CRM system evaluates the selected MDM match against the current prospect 

 *  Outcome A: --> Selected Match has different Sales Skills than the newly added Prospect (Covered in #890515)  

 

 

 *  Outcome B: --> Selected Match has same Sales Skills as the newly added Prospect but NO related entities & with related entities

column8: CRM – Create Global Option Sets and Account Fields for Address & Duplicate-Check Status
column11:
As a CRM configuration analyst, I want standardized fields and option sets for address and duplicate-check status so that all prospect records consistently track verification and deduplication outcomes.

 

 *  Create global option sets for: 

 *  Address Verified (e.g., Yes, No). 
 *  Address Verification Bypassed (e.g., Yes, No). 
 *  Duplicate-check user selection (e.g., No Duplicate Found, I Will Use Existing Account, Reject – Duplicate Found). 
 *  Is Duplicate Check Completed (e.g., Yes, No). 
 

 *  Add new fields on the Account entity to store: 

 *  Address Verified (e.g., Yes, No). 
 *  Address Verification Bypassed (e.g., Yes, No). 
 *  Duplicate-check user selection (e.g., No Duplicate Found, I Will Use Existing Account, Reject – Duplicate Found). 
 *  Is Duplicate Check Completed (e.g., Yes, No). 
 

 *  Ensure fields are available on the Prospect and Customer account forms but primarily used for prospect flows. 
 *  Configure basic field-level requirements / visibility rules (e.g., required for 1C prospects).
column22:
*  Global Option Set Field Creation on the Account Table 

 *  Given CRM supports global option sets (Create Address Verified field on Account Table) 

 *  When the Address Verified option set is created 
 *  Then it must contain Yes / No, with no default value, and will be used only by automation. 
 

 *  Given CRM must record bypass behavior (Create Address Verification Bypassed field on Account Table) 

 *  When the Address Verification Bypassed option set is created 
 *  Then it must contain Yes / No, with no default value, and will be updated only by automation. 
 

 *  Given CRM must store duplicate check decisions (Create Duplicate Check User Selection field on Account Table) 

 *  When the Duplicate Check User Selection option set is created 
 *  Then it must contain: 

 *  No Duplicate Found 
 *  I Will Use Existing Account 
 *  Reject - Duplicate Found 
 *  And no default value must be set. 
 

 

 *  Given CRM must track completion of duplicate checks  (Create Is Duplicate Check Completed field on Account Table) 

 *  When the Is Duplicate Check Completed option set is created 
 *  Then it must contain Yes / No, with no default value, and will be maintained only by automated processes. 
 

 

 *  MDMID Field Creation  (Create Is MDMID field on Account Table) 

 *  Given CRM must store the technical identifier for MDM 

 *  When the MDM ID field is Created (ecl_mdmid) 
 *  Then it must be a text field (?100 chars) used only for storing the MDM GUID returned in IF10. 
 

 

 *  Form Layout & Visibility 

 *  Given the account form must display verification and duplicate check details 

 *  When modifying the form 
 *  Then a new section named MDM Validation must be created. 
 

 *  Given the MDM Validation section exists 

 *  When placing fields 
 *  Then all newly created fields must appear inside this section. 
 

 *  Given MDM validation Section is only applicable for 1C accounts 

 *  When users open an account 
 *  Then the entire MDM Validation section must be: 

 *  Visible for 1C accounts 
 *  Hidden for all non-1C accounts 
 

 

 

 *  Field Editability Rules (ALL FIELDS READ-ONLY) 

 *  Given the fields are system-controlled 

 *  When the MDM Validation fields appear on the form 
 *  Then all fields must be set to read-only for both prospects and customers. 
 

 *  Given address validation and duplicate checks are never manually entered 

 *  When the form loads 
 *  Then users must not be able to type or modify manually: 

 *  Address Verified 
 *  Address Verification Bypassed 
 *  Duplicate Check User Selection 
 *  Is Duplicate Check Completed 
 *  MDM ID 
 

 

 

 *  Given the values are populated only via automation 

 *  When any of the duplicate check or address validation processes run 
 *  Then the system must update these read-only fields programmatically. 
 

 *  Backend Save Validation (Logic-Based, Not Form-Required) 

 *  Given address verification outcomes must exist before saving a new 1C Prospect 

 *  When the user clicks Save 
 *  Then backend logic must validate that either Address Verified OR Address Verification Bypassed contains a value, 
 *  And if both are blank, the save must be blocked with a clear error message. 
 

 *  Given non-1C prospects do not use address validation 

 *  When saving a non-1C account 
 *  Then no validation must be applied for these fields.

column8: CRM – Add Address Validation Controls to Prospect Quick Create (Web Only)
column11:
As a sales rep, I want an address validation control on the prospect Quick Create so that I can standardize the prospect’s address via MDM before saving the record.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 

 

 *  Add an “Address Validation” control/section on: 

 *  Prospect Quick Create form.  (Using PCF Control) 
 

 *  When the rep triggers address validation: 

 *  Allow user to click on "Address Validation" button only after all the mandate Address field details are added (Street 1, City, Country, State/Province, ZIP/Postal Code.) 
 *  Call the MDM address validation API (via Plugin)  
 *  Display standardized address suggestions in a modal/popup. - Same behavior as the main account form 
 *  Allow the user to: 

 *  Select a standardized address (update Street, City, State/Province, Postal Code, Country), or 
 *  Bypass address validation if invalid address is retrieved or API is unreachable 
 

 

 *  After successful validation: 

 *  Lock address fields for that operation (to avoid changes after validation). Lock address fields only after the prospect is saved successfully.  Upon saving the account record, the address fields must be locked. Any updates would be done by Sales Ops at a later stage.  
 *  Set “Address verification status” accordingly; if bypassed, set “bypassed” status. 

 *  Bypass option should only be populated if: 

 *  invalid address 
 *  API is unreachable 
 

 

 

 *  Ensure the prospect cannot be saved for 1C districts unless the address validation step has either passed or been explicitly bypassed. 
 *  Enforce Address Validation / Bypass as Pre-Condition Before Prospect Save for 1C Districts 
 *  Implement MDM Address Validation Call and Standardized Address Update on Prospect Create
 
 *  For mobile form, address validation button should not be visible irrespective of the app being used.  

 *  Buttonwon't be visible due to compatibility issues irrespective of the app used onmobile
column19: Moved out of state In Test
column22:
*  Address Validation Control 

 *  Given a user opens Prospect Quick Create form   
 *  When the form loads 

 *  Then an Address Validation control must be displayed under the address block in web. 
 *  And the control must appear only for 1C Prospect Accounts and Address should be validated to save the 1C prospect record 
 *  And must be hidden for non-1C accounts and address validation is not required to save the non-1C account records. 
 

 *  Given the control exists 

 *  When the user enters all mandate Address fields including Street, City, State/Province, Postal Code, and Country 
 *  Then the Address Validation control becomes enabled for the user to click and trigger the MDM address validation. 
 

 

 *  Triggering MDM Address Validation API - Remains same as main account form 

 *  Given the user clicks Validate Address 

 *  When CRM triggers validation 
 *  Then the system must call the MDM Address Validation API 
 *  And pass the required input fields (street, city, state, postal code, country). 
 

 *  Given the API responds successfully 

 *  When standardized address results are returned 
 *  Then a modal dialog must display all returned standardized address candidates 
 *  And the rep must be allowed to select one. 
 

 *  Given the rep selects a standardized address 

 *  When the user confirms 
 *  Then CRM must update all mapped address fields with standardized values 
 *  And set: 

 *  Address Verified = Yes  (Visible only after successfull validation, else hidden) 
 *  Address Verification Bypassed = No  (Should be Hidden ) 
 *  The above fields will be on the same QuickCreate form since PCF control has limitation of colour updates based OnClick or OnChange 
 *  The ADDRESS VALIDATION BUTTON SHOULD BE HIDDEN after validation 
 

 

 *  Given the rep edits the standardized address 

 *  When the user edits the address field (street, city, state, postal code, country) 
 *  The Address Validation button should be visible. 
 *  Then CRM must force the user to validate the address again and user cannot save the record 
 *  And set: 

 *  Address Verified = blank  (Should get hidden if its blank) 
 *  Address Verification Bypassed = blank (Should be hidden) 
 

 

 

 

 

 *  No Match Returned (Bypass Flow) 

 *  Given the API returns no standardized address candidates 

 *  When CRM displays a “No match found” message 
 *  Only Then the user must see a Bypass Address Validation option. 
 

 *  Given the rep clicks Bypass 

 *  When bypass is selected 
 *  Then CRM sets: 

 *  Address Verification Bypassed = Yes  
 *  Address Verified = No  
 *  And address fields on account remain unlocked 
 *  And the record becomes eligible for save. 
 

 

 

 *  Error Handling & Offline Behavior 

 *  Given the API times out, errors, or is unreachable 

 *  When the rep clicks Validate 
 *  Then CRM must show a message “Unable to validate address. Please try again or proceed using Bypass.” 
 *  Then the user must see a Bypass Address Validation option. 

 *  Given the rep clicks Bypass 

 *  When bypass is selected 
 *  Then CRM sets: 

 *  Address Verification Bypassed = Yes (Should be hidden) 
 *  Address Verified = No (Should be visible) 
 *  And allow the save operation. 
 

 

 *  The save button of the dialog modal popup should be disabled until the rep clicks on bypass checkbox. 
 

 

 *  Given the rep is using mobile online or offline mode   

 *  When they attempt to save a new prospect  
 *  Then CRM must automatically set:  
 *  Address Verified = No  
 *  And allow save.  
 *  This record should fall into Sales Ops review by default  
 

 

 *  Save Blocking Logic (1C Prospects Only) 

 *  Given the user attempts to Save a 1C Prospect 

 *  When both fields (Address Verified, Address Verification Bypassed) are blank 
 *  Then CRM must block the save 
 *  And display error: 
 *  “Address validation is required. Please validate or bypass to continue.” 
 

 *  Given the user is creating a non-1C prospect 

 *  When clicking save 
 *  Then CRM must allow save even if validation has not occurred. 
 

 *  Given the user tries to save the prospect without "Address Validation" on QuickCreate form 

 *  When clicking on "Save and Close" or "Save and Create New" without Address validation (To be checked against the value in the field Address Verified? ) 
 *  Then prompt the user to first finish address validation before saving with the message - "Kindly complete Address Validation before proceeding" 
 

 

 *  For mobile form, address validation button should not be visible irrespective of the app being used.  

 *  Button won't be visible due to compatibility issues irrespective of the app used on mobile 
 

 *  When the sync is triggered 

 *  Show error if pre-save has been triggered and there were duplicates - Dependency on #890508  
 

 

 

 *  UI Placement Requirements 

 *  Given the address section exists 

 *  When adding the control 
 *  Then the address validation button must be placed directly below the street/postal fields for QuickCreate  
 

 *  Given the MDM Validation section exists in Admin Section (created in previous story) 

 *  When the user opens the full form 
 *  Then the Address Verified and Address Verification Bypassed read-only fields must appear there. 
 

 

 

Note: When New fields are created to support this feature, please ensure you refer to this story to know the list of fields that needs to be created. #890505
 

 
Developer Notes: 

 *  Global Option Set Field Creation on the Account Table 

 *  Given CRM supports global option sets (Create Address Verified field on Account Table) 

 *  When the Address Verified option set is created 
 *  Then it must contain Yes / No, with no default value, and will be used only by automation. 
 

 *  Given CRM must record bypass behavior (Create Address Verification Bypassed field on Account Table) 

 *  When the Address Verification Bypassed option set is created 
 *  Then it must contain Yes / No, with no default value, and will be updated only by automation.

column8: CRM – Add Address Validation Controls to Prospect Main Account Form
column11:
As a sales rep, I want an address validation control on the prospect main account form so that I can standardize the prospect’s address via MDM before saving the record.
 
 
 
 

 

 *  Add an “Address Validation” control/section below Address Section: 

 *  Prospect Quick Create form.  
 *  Full Account form (prospect context). 
 

 *  When the rep triggers address validation: 

 *  Call the MDM address validation API (via Plugin) only after all the mandate Address field details are added (Street 1, City, Country, State/Province, ZIP/Postal Code.) 
 *  Display standardized address suggestions in a modal/popup. 
 *  Allow the user to: 

 *  Select a standardized address (update Street, City, State/Province, Postal Code, Country), or 
 *  Bypass address validation if no suggested address fits. 
 

 

 *  After successful validation: 

 *  Lock address fields for that operation (to avoid changes after validation). Lock address fields only after the prospect is saved successfully.  Upon saving the prospect record, the address fields must be locked. Any updates would be done by Sales Ops at a later stage if needed.  
 *  Set “Address verification status” accordingly; if bypassed, set “bypassed” status. 
 

 *  Ensure the prospect cannot be saved for 1C districts unless the address validation step has either passed or been explicitly bypassed. 
 *  Enforce Address Validation / Bypass as Pre-Condition Before Prospect Save for 1C Districts 
 *  Implement MDM Address Validation Call and Standardized Address Update on Prospect Create

column22:
*  Address Validation Control Added to Both Forms 

 *  Given a user opens Prospect QuickCreate or Standard Account Form 
 *  When the form loads 

 *  Then an Address Validation control must be displayed under the address block in web and mobile.  
 *  And the control must appear only for 1C Prospect Accounts and Address should be validated to save the 1C prospect record 
 *  And must be hidden for non-1C accounts and address validation is not required to save the non-1C account records. 
 

 *  Given the control exists 

 *  When the user enters at least Street, City, State/Province, Postal Code, and Country 
 *  Then the Address Validation control becomes enabled for the user to click and trigger the MDM address validation. 
 

 

 *  Triggering MDM Address Validation API 

 *  Given the user clicks Validate Address 

 *  When CRM triggers validation 
 *  Then the system must call the MDM Address Validation API 
 *  And pass the required input fields (street, city, state, postal code, country). 
 

 

 *  Given the API responds successfully 

 *  When standardized address results are returned 
 *  Then a modal dialog must display all returned standardized address candidates 
 *  And the rep must be allowed to select one. 
 

 *  Given the rep selects a standardized address 

 *  When the user confirms 
 *  Then CRM must update all mapped address fields with standardized values 
 *  And set: 

 *  Address Verified = Yes 
 *  Address Verification Bypassed = No 
 *  And lock all address fields from further edits.  
 *  The above fields will not be on the summary page, they will be on the Admin page of the account record.  
 

 

 *  Given the rep edits the standardized address 

 *  When the user edits the address field (street, city, state, postal code, country) 
 *  Then CRM must force the user to validate the address again and user cannot save the record 
 *  And set: 

 *  Address Verified = blank 
 *  Address Verification Bypassed = blank 
 

 

 

 

 

 *  No Match Returned (Bypass Flow) 

 *  Given the API returns no standardized address candidates 

 *  When CRM displays a “No match found” message 
 *  Then the user must see a Bypass Address Validation option. 
 

 *  Given the rep clicks Bypass 

 *  When bypass is selected 
 *  Then CRM sets: 

 *  Address Verification Bypassed = Yes 
 *  Address Verified = No 
 *  And address fields on account remain unlocked 
 *  And the record becomes eligible for save. 
 

 

 

 *  Error Handling & Mobile Behavior  

 *  Given the API times out, errors, or is unreachable 

 *  When the rep clicks Validate 
 *  Then CRM must show a message “Unable to validate address. Please try again or proceed using Bypass.” 
 *  Then the user must see a Bypass Address Validation option. 

 *  Given the rep clicks Bypass 

 *  When bypass is selected 
 *  Then CRM sets: 

 *  Address Verification Bypassed = Yes 
 *  Address Verified = No 
 *  And allow the save operation. 
 *  On Save or Save & Close, all the mandate Address fields must be locked out for any new updates 
 

 

 

 

 *  Given the rep is using mobile offline mode  

 *  When they attempt to save a new prospect  
 *  Then CRM must automatically set:  
 *  Address Verified = Leave it blank 
 *  Address Bypassed? = Leave it blank 
 *  And allow save.  
 

 

 *  Save Blocking Logic (1C Prospects Only) 

 *  Given the user attempts to Save a 1C Prospect 

 *  When both fields (Address Verified, Address Verification Bypassed) are blank 
 *  Then CRM must block the save 
 *  And display error: 
 *  “Address validation is required. Please validate or bypass to continue.” 
 

 *  Given the user is creating a non-1C prospect 

 *  When clicking save 
 *  Then CRM must allow save even if validation has not occurred. 
 

 

 *  UI Placement Requirements 

 *  Given the address section exists 

 *  When adding the control 
 *  Then the address validation button must be placed directly below the street/postal fields for QuickCreate and Standard form. 
 

 *  Given the MDM Validation section exists in Admin Section (created in previous story) 

 *  When the user opens the full form 
 *  Then the Address Verified and Address Verification Bypassed read-only fields must appear there. 
 

 

 

Note: When New fields are created to support this feature, please ensure you refer to this story to know the list of fields that needs to be created. #890505 
Developer Notes: 

 *  Global Option Set Field Creation on the Account Table 

 *  Given CRM supports global option sets (Create Address Verified field on Account Table) 

 *  When the Address Verified option set is created 
 *  Then it must contain Yes / No, with no default value, and will be used only by automation. 
 

 *  Given CRM must record bypass behavior (Create Address Verification Bypassed field on Account Table) 

 *  When the Address Verification Bypassed option set is created 
 *  Then it must contain Yes / No, with no default value, and will be updated only by automation.

column7: Automate “Add Sales Skill” integration flow for existing prospects and customers, ensuring new sales skill records sync correctly across CRM, CLM, and MDM.
column11:
Business Objective:
Ensure that when an additional sales skill is required for an existing customer or prospect, the process is seamless and automated across CRM, CLM, and MDM. The system must prevent duplicate prospect creation, enforce use of the “Add Sales Skill” function, and synchronize updates via CLM APIs so that data integrity is maintained and users are guided to the correct workflow. 

 
Business Requirements: 

 *  For Existing Customers 

 *  When a rep or Sales Ops user clicks Add Sales Skill on an existing customer record in CRM: 
 *  A new Sales Skill Account is created under the same BCA in CRM. 
 *  The request triggers an “Add Sales Skill” transaction via CLM API. 
 *  The new Sales Skill Account is flagged as Pending Review until CLM/EBS confirms activation. 
 *  Once approved, ERP number and ERP status are updated in CRM automatically. 
 

 *  For Prospects (Duplicate Handling) 

 *  If a rep attempts to create a new prospect and CLM flags it as an existing prospect/customer: 
 *  CRM must block the save action for the duplicate record. 
 *  The user is redirected to the correct existing record in CRM. 
 *  From that record, the user must use the Add Sales Skill button to initiate the new sales skill creation. 
 *  This ensures only valid, non-duplicate prospects exist in CRM. 
 

 *  Common Rules 

 *  No duplicate sales skill types (e.g., two Water or two Hygiene) should exist under one BCA. 
 *  Status handling: all new sales skill accounts default to Pending Review until CLM/EBS confirmation. 
 *  Users should always be guided to use Add Sales Skill rather than freeform prospect creation when expansion is needed. 
 

 

 
Technical Considerations: 

 *  CRM must: 

 *  Intercept save actions when duplicates are detected (via CLM API response). 
 *  Redirect users to the correct existing record and enforce “Add Sales Skill” usage. 
 *  Trigger outbound CLM API requests for new sales skill creation. 
 

 *  CLM API responses must update: 

 *  ERP account number, 
 *  ERP status, 
 *  and activation state for the new Sales Skill Account in CRM. 
 

 *  Error handling: if the API fails, the Sales Skill Account remains in Pending Review with escalation to Sales Ops. 
 *  Data model: ensure correct linkage between BCA, Sales Skill Accounts, and ERP identifiers. 
 

 
Expected Deliverables: 

 *  Automated and controlled Add Sales Skill workflow in CRM for both existing customers and prospects. 
 *  Block-and-redirect behavior in CRM to prevent duplicate prospect saves. 
 *  New Sales Skill Accounts correctly created under BCAs with API-driven activation. 
 *  ERP identifiers and statuses automatically updated after CLM/EBS confirmation. 
 *  Documentation of the integration flow, error handling, and record ownership. 
 *  Tested scenarios covering: 
 *  Add Sales Skill for existing customer. 
 *  Add Sales Skill triggered when duplicate prospect detected. 
 *  Block-and-redirect logic validation. 
 *  Error/retry handling.

column8: Prevent Duplicate Prospect Creation
column11:
As a Sales Rep
I want the system to block duplicate prospect creation
So that I am redirected to the correct existing record and guided to use the Add Sales Skill workflow.
column22:
Scenario: User attempts to create a duplicate prospect 
  Given the user is creating a new prospect in CRM 
  When CLM API flags the record as an existing customer or prospect 
  Then CRM should block the save action 
  And the user should be redirected to the correct existing record 
  And the user should be prompted to use the "Add Sales Skill" button 

Scenario: Valid prospect creation 
  Given the user is creating a new prospect 
  When CLM API confirms the prospect is not a duplicate 
  Then the prospect record should be saved successfully

column8: CLM API Integration and Data Sync
column11:
As a CRM system
I want to send and receive data from CLM APIs
So that Sales Skill Accounts are correctly activated and updated with ERP identifiers.
column22:
Scenario: Trigger outbound CLM API request 
  Given a new Sales Skill Account is created 
  When the account is flagged as "Pending Review" 
  Then CRM should send an outbound request to CLM API for activation 

Scenario: Receive CLM API response 
  Given CLM API responds with activation confirmation 
  Then CRM should update the ERP account number 
  And update the ERP status and activation state 

 
Scenario: CLM API failure 
  Given the CLM API request fails 
  Then the Sales Skill Account should remain in "Pending Review" 
  And an escalation should be sent to Sales Ops

column8: Add Sales Skill for Existing Customer
column11:
As a Sales Rep or Sales Ops user
I want to add a new Sales Skill to an existing customer record in CRM
So that the system creates a new Sales Skill Account under the same BCA and initiates the CLM workflow for activation.
column22:
Scenario: User adds a new Sales Skill to an existing customer 
  Given the user is viewing an existing customer record in CRM 
  When the user clicks the "Add Sales Skill" button 
  Then a new Sales Skill Account should be created under the same BCA 
  And the account should be flagged as "Pending Review" 
  And an "Add Sales Skill" transaction should be triggered via CLM API 
Scenario: CLM/EBS confirms activation 
  Given the Sales Skill Account is flagged as "Pending Review" 
  When CLM/EBS confirms activation via API response 
  Then the ERP number and ERP status should be updated in CRM 
  And the account status should be changed to "Active"

column6: Integration: Integration of Billing Arrangements from EBS into CRM
column11:
This feature introduces an automated integration to bring billing arrangements from EBS into CRM, replacing the current manual flat-file based process that relies on SAP BI outputs. With the transition of Nalco SAP accounts into EBS, all existing Nalco SAP billing arrangements tied to those accounts will be deactivated, and corresponding new billing arrangements will be created in EBS. The integration must enable CRM to receive, store, and surface these billing arrangements consistently, ensuring account teams have accurate visibility for service, order, and contract processes.

 
What This Feature Introduces 

 *  Deactivation of Legacy Billing Arrangements: Any billing arrangements tied to Nalco SAP accounts that migrate to EBS will be deactivated in CRM to prevent duplication. 
 *  Creation of New Billing Arrangements from EBS: New billing arrangements created in EBS for migrated accounts will flow into CRM through a new integration pipeline. 
 *  Snowflake-Based Integration Path: EBS billing arrangement data will be published to Snowflake. CRM will consume the data from Snowflake, ensuring a standardized and scalable integration approach. 
 *  CRM Billing Arrangement Table Enhancements: CRM billing arrangement records must be updated to reflect the new source (EBS) and maintain links to Sold-To accounts. 
 *  Automation: The new integration will fully replace the manual SAP BI flat-file process, ensuring timeliness, reliability, and auditability of billing arrangement updates.
column14: FBU R2 Release; Integration; Inventory; Refine

column7: 23. Enable Billing Arrangement Retrieval for EBS via Snowflake Integration
column11:
Business Objective
 
To support billing operations for EBS-integrated customers within the ASA (Analytical Sampling App) and other dependent systems, billing arrangement data must be made available in CRM from EBS. Since the legacy method of receiving billing data from the NALCO SAP BI team is not applicable for EBS, a new integration must be built to retrieve billing arrangements from Snowflake and ingest them into CRM in a consistent and structured format. 

 
Business Requirements 

 *  Today, billing arrangements are created in CRM via a flat file integration provided by the NALCO SAP BI team, which loads data into the Billing Arrangement custom table and associated Billing Arrangement Allocations table. 
 *  Each billing arrangement in CRM includes key data elements such as: 

 *  Billing Arrangement Number (SAP unique ID) 
 *  SHIP-TO Account (lookup) 
 *  Sold-To Account (lookup) 
 *  Start Date and End Date 
 *  Billing Arrangement Type (code) 
 *  Ownership and related Allocations 
 

 *  This setup supports NALCO SAP accounts only and will not work for EBS-integrated accounts, where the concept and availability of SHIP-TOs are different or absent. 
 *  For EBS customers, billing arrangement data will be exposed via Snowflake, and a new integration must be established to retrieve, transform, and load this data into CRM. 
 *  The business expects that billing arrangements for EBS customers are: 

 *  Continuously available in CRM 
 *  Accurately linked to the Sold-To account (and potentially to a new structure if SHIP-TO is not applicable) 
 *  Governed as read-only records, consistent with current SAP behavior 
 

 *  The new integration must not disrupt the existing NSAP setup and must allow both NSAP and EBS billing arrangements to coexist within the same CRM data model. 
 *  The data granularity and timing (e.g., daily, near real-time) must be defined in alignment with how ASA and other applications rely on this data during sample creation and billing processes. 
 *  The new Integration must make sure EBS billing arrangements are present in CRM, just like we do for SAP accounts today, so that ASA and other applications can work without disruption. The source will now be Snowflake instead of SAP BI. 
 

 
Technical Considerations 

 *  A technical spike is required to assess: 

 *  What specific billing arrangement data is exposed by EBS in Snowflake 
 *  How the EBS data maps to the existing CRM schema for Billing Arrangements and Billing Arrangement Allocations 
 *  What transformations are needed between the Snowflake source and the CRM data model 
 *  Whether additional CRM fields or schema changes are needed for new EBS-specific fields 
 

 *  The integration will likely involve: 

 *  An Azure Data Factory (ADF) pipeline or equivalent mechanism to pull data from Snowflake 
 *  A data transformation layer (e.g., Azure Functions or Logic Apps) to align incoming records with CRM schema 
 *  A mechanism to create or update CRM Billing Arrangement and Allocation records on a daily or scheduled cadence 
 

 *  Error handling and logging must be implemented to support reconciliation and monitoring of data discrepancies or ingestion failures. 
 *  The system should dynamically identify whether a billing arrangement is coming from EBS vs. SAP, possibly using metadata or ERP indicators. 
 

 
Expected Deliverables 

 *  Completion of a technical spike to: 

 *  Analyze Snowflake billing arrangement structure from EBS 
 *  Define CRM data requirements and mapping logic 
 *  Confirm feasibility and transformation needs 
 

 *  Implementation of a net new ADF pipeline (or equivalent) to extract billing arrangement data from Snowflake 
 *  Logic to populate the CRM Billing Arrangement and Billing Arrangement Allocation tables, consistent with the existing model, but tailored to EBS accounts 
 *  Read-only setup in CRM for all EBS billing arrangement records, consistent with current governance 
 *  Regression testing to confirm ASA and other dependent apps continue functioning correctly with EBS billing arrangements 
 *  Coordination with both the EBS data team and ASA app owners to validate data availability, mappings, and timing 
 

 
Current Billing Arrangement Integration (NSAP ? CRM) 

 

 *  
Nightly flat is generated by the SAP BI team and stored in a shared location. This file is consumed by a CRM Integration job to create/update Billing Arrangements (BA's) in CRM. The SAP BI team generates the file via some automated process that pull all Active BA's in NSAP. 
 
 *  
Each Billing Arrangement is identified by the CRM Object ID field on the flat file (Billing Arrangement Number). 
 

 *  
Leading zeros from SAP are stripped when stored in CRM. 
 
 

 *  
Sold-To and Ship-To numbers are included and used to match Billing Arrangements to CRM accounts. 
 
 *  
ZZ Proc Type (Billing Arrangement Type): 
 

 *  
Indicates arrangement category (e.g., fixed, use risk, special pricing). 
 
 *  
CRM integration excludes any record with a type starting with “7” (e.g., ZSP1 – special pricing).  
 
 

 *  
Start Date and End Date: 
 

 *  
Included in the flat file and reformatted into CRM date fields. 
 
 

 *  
Ownership of BA: 
 

 *  
Derived from the ownership of the associated Ship-To account in CRM. 
 
 

 


 
Billing Arrangement Allocations (Related Table in CRM) 

 *  
In CRM Billing Arrangement Allocations are stored in a related table linked to each Billing Arrangement. 
 
 *  
Material column from the flat file indicates allocation type. 
 

 *  
CRM only pulls two types: Gen Service and Gen Analytical. 
 
 

 *  
Price_MAT column maps to the Allocated Funds field in CRM. 
 
 *  
Currency column indicates allocation currency (e.g., USD, CAD). 
 

 *  
Used for currency conversion and normalization to USD scale in reporting. 
 
 

 *  
A single Billing Arrangement can have multiple allocation rows. 
 
 *  
Allocations are primarily informational for business users. 
 

 *  
Absence of allocations does not break CRM processes. 
 
 *  
However, allocations are used by business teams for analysis and decision-making, so their inclusion remains important. 
 
 

 


 
CRM Entities and Fields Maintained Today 

 *  
Billing Arrangement Table (Header-level): 
 

 *  
Billing Arrangement Number (Object ID). 
 
 *  
Ship-To Account Number. 
 
 *  
Sold-To Account Number. 
 
 *  
Start Date. 
 
 *  
End Date. 
 
 *  
Billing Arrangement Type. 
 
 *  
Owner (derived from Ship-To). 
 
 

 *  
Billing Arrangement Allocation Table (Child/Related): 
 

 *  
Linked to Billing Arrangement by Object ID. 
 
 *  
Allocation Type (Gen Service / Gen Analytical). 
 
 *  
Allocated Funds (from Price_MAT). 
 
 

 


 
Snowflake/EBS Transition Requirements 

 *  
Current flat file integration is being reworked by Ayush to pull directly from NSAP Snowflake views. 
 

 *  
Once this process is finalized, the same approach can be extended to EBS: 
 
 *  
If EBS exposes a Snowflake view with the same fields and logic, the CRM integration can reuse Ayush’s process with minimal changes. 
 
 

 *  
Required expectations for the Snowflake feed from EBS: 
 

 *  
Include all Billing Arrangement header-level fields listed above. 
 
 *  
Include related Allocation-level fields (Allocation Type, Allocated Funds). 
 
 *  
Ensure exclusion logic for special pricing agreements (types with value = ZSP1) is retained. 
 
 *  
Maintain start/end dates and Sold-To/Ship-To fields for matching. 
 
 

 *  
Allocations may not exist for many Billing Arrangements. 
 

 *  
CRM and related processes continue to function without allocations. 
 
 *  
Still recommended to include allocations for completeness and business analysis needs. 
 
 

 


 
Things needed by the CRM team to start building this new EBS to CRM Billing Arrangement Integration: 

 *  
Provide an EBS Snowflake view with the same columns as the NSAP flat file. 
 
 *  
Confirm that allocation-level data will also be included in the view. 
 
 *  
Validate availability of key fields (Billing Arrangement Number, Ship-To, Sold-To, Start/End Dates, Type, Price). 
 
 *  
Once confirmed, we can extend Ayush’s Snowflake-based loader process to use the EBS view.

column8: Update Water Billing Arrangement Retrieval API to Support BA–SHIP-TO Related Table
column11: The Water Billing Arrangement API must be enhanced to support retrieval and filtering of Billing Arrangements based on BA–SHIP-To related associations, in addition to existing Sold-To–based logic. This update is required to ensure that Water use cases (including ASA and Field Service scenarios) can correctly identify and return all applicable Billing Arrangements when the customer context is resolved through SHIP-To–related account structures under the One Customer / EBS model.

column8: Update Snowflake Billing Arrangement Views to Align with 1C Account Relationship Model
column11:
As a reporting and analytics consumer
I want Snowflake Billing Arrangement views to align with the updated 1C CRM data model
 
So that analytics do not rely on deprecated direct account references and instead use the correct Billing Arrangement–to–Account relationship structure.
 

 
Background: 

 *  As part of the One Customer (1C) Billing Arrangement redesign: 

 *  Direct account lookups on the Billing Arrangement entity are being deprecated 
 *  Account relationships are now represented through a dedicated related table in CRM 
 *  Snowflake views must be updated to prevent exposing invalid or misleading data 
 

 *  Currently, the Snowflake view uvw_billingarrangements still exposes direct account reference columns that no longer represent the future-state CRM model. This creates a mismatch between CRM, integrations, and analytics. 
 *  This user story updates Snowflake to: 

 *  Remove deprecated account references from the main Billing Arrangement view 
 *  Introduce a new view to represent Billing Arrangement ? SHIP-TO relationships explicitly
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Main View Cleanup 

 *  Given the uvw_billingarrangements view 
 *  When the view is queried 
 *  Then no deprecated direct account reference columns are present 
 *  And only Billing Arrangement master data is returned 
 *  Required changes: 

 *  Remove all deprecated direct account reference columns 
 *  Retain only Billing Arrangement–level attributes 
 *  Ensure the view does not imply a one-to-one relationship with any account 
 

 

 *  SHIP-TO Relationship View 
 *  Given the uvw_billingarrangementshiptos view 
 *  When the view is queried 
 *  Then each row represents a valid Billing Arrangement–to–SHIP-TO relationship 
 *  And Billing Arrangement and SHIP-TO identifiers and names are populated 
 *  Columns 

 *  Billing Arrangement ID 
 *  Billing Arrangement Number 
 *  Billing Arrangement Name 
 *  SHIP-TO Account ID 
 *  SHIP-TO Account Name 
 *  Created On 
 *  Created By 
 *  Modified On 
 *  Modified By

column8: Update Billing Arrangement Filtering Logic for Service Visits Using BA–SHIP-TO Related Table
column11:
As a Field Service user creating or updating a Service Visit
I want Billing Arrangements to be filtered based on SHIP-TO associations stored in the Billing Arrangement SHIP-TO related table
 
So that the correct Billing Arrangement is available even when Water and Hygiene accounts share the same Billing Arrangement number under the One Customer (1C) model.
 

 
Background: 

 *  Today, Billing Arrangement (BA) filtering on Service Visits works as follows: 

 *  The user selects Sold-To (Sold To) and Ship-To (SHIP-TO) on the Service Visit 
 *  CRM filters Billing Arrangements directly from the Billing Arrangement table 
 *  Matching is done using: 

 *  Sold-To lookup on BA 
 *  Ship-To lookup on BA 
 

 

 *  Under the 1C data model, this approach is no longer sufficient because: 

 *  A single Billing Arrangement can be shared by multiple SHIP-TO accounts (Water and Hygiene) 
 *  The Billing Arrangement table continues to store only one primary SHIP-TO (Water for R1) 
 *  Additional SHIP-TO associations are stored in the Billing Arrangement – SHIP-TO related table 
 

 *  To support this model, Service Visit filtering must be updated to: 

 *  Query the related table first using SHIP-TO 
 *  Then resolve the associated Billing Arrangement 
 

 *  Updated Filtering Behavior 

 *  User selects SHIP-TO (and Sold To , if applicable) on Service Visit 
 *  CRM queries the Billing Arrangement SHIP-TO related table using SHIP-TO 
 *  CRM retrieves the associated Billing Arrangement(s) 
 *  Filtered Billing Arrangements are shown to the user
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Given a Service Visit with Service Performed By = Field Service 
 *  And a SHIP-TO account is selected on the Service Visit 
 *  When the Billing Arrangement lookup is opened 
 *  Then CRM queries the Billing Arrangement linked to SHIP-TO related table using the selected SHIP-TO 
 *  And returns all Billing Arrangements associated to that SHIP-TO 
 *  If the SHIPTO is changed, then the BA should clear out and prompts user to choose the new BA.

column8: Technical Spike: Billing Arrangement for Both Sales Skills
column11:
Business Context:
System to correctly handle Billing Arrangements for customers who have multiple SoldTo accounts under one base customer account,
So that billing can be accurately created for the correct Ship-To account based on the associated sales skill (Water or Hygiene) without duplication or confusion. 

 *  Currently, Billing Arrangements in CRM require ShipTo information as mandatory. 
 *  For the 1FBU project, Billing Arrangements can be generated for Sold To/ShipTo, which can have both the sales skills (Water or Hygiene) 
 *  A single base customer can have:

 *  Two Soldto accounts (one with Water skill, one with Hygiene skill). 
 *  Each Soldto account linked to different Ship-To accounts, sharing same ShipTo Number  
 *  All accounts share one account number. 
 

 

 
 
We need to finalize: 

 *  How to identify the correct ShipTo account when creating a Billing Arrangement based on the sales skill. 
 *  Whether:

 *  A single Billing Arrangement should cover both Sold-To accounts or 
 *  Separate Billing Arrangements should be created for each SoldTo account (with the same Billing Arrangement number). 
 

 
 *  Or, if the Billing Arrangement entity design needs to be changed to support this scenario and adjust the logic in CRM and ASA accordingly.
column22:
Potential Acceptance Criteria - need to refine 

 *  The system must allow Billing Arrangements for customers with multiple ShipTo accounts under base customer account. 
 *  Clear logic for whether one or multiple Billing Arrangements are created. 
 *  If design changes are required, update CRM and ASA integration accordingly.

column8: Technical Spike – Investigate EBS Snowflake View and Create Mapping for Billing Arrangements and Allocations
column11:
As a CRM Integration Developer, I need to analyze the Snowflake view that will provide EBS billing arrangement and allocation data so that I can determine the data availability, transformation needs, and mapping required for CRM ingestion aligned with the existing NSAP process.
 
 

 
Business Requirements:

 *  Identify Require versus Active Fields needed by the Analytics Sampling Application using the mapping document 
 *  Identify Snowflake view(s) containing EBS billing arrangement and allocation data. 
 *  Review column names, data types, and constraints. 
 *  Validate presence of key fields: billing arrangement number, ship-to, sold-to, start date, end date, type, allocation type, amount, and currency. 
 *  Define required transformations (e.g., remove leading zeros, date reformatting, exclusion logic for types starting with “7”). 
 *  Create a detailed mapping document for both header and allocation tables. 
 *  Confirm feasibility of extending current NSAP flat-file ingestion logic to Snowflake source. 
 *  Document any gaps or dependencies for EBS data exposure.

column8: Hub: Update ASA (Analytical Sampling App) Billing Arrangement Filtering to Use BA–SHIP-TO Related Table
column22:
*  Filter Billing Arrangements by applicable Account context 

 *  Given a user launches the ASA app from the Hub for a selected customer/account context 
 *  When the ASA app retrieves Billing Arrangements 
 *  Then only Billing Arrangements associated to the current Account (directly or via the defined BA–Account association model) are returned 
 *  And Billing Arrangements not related to the current Account context are excluded. 
 

 *  Support one-to-many BA-to-Account associations 

 *  Given a Billing Arrangement is associated to multiple Account records (e.g., multiple Sales Skill accounts under the same Sold-To / EBS customer) 
 *  When the ASA app loads Billing Arrangements for any one of those Accounts 
 *  Then the Billing Arrangement is available for selection 
 *  And the association is resolved using the authoritative BA–Account relationship source (e.g., Related Table), not duplicated BA records. 
 

 *  Enforce active and valid Billing Arrangement status 

 *  Given Billing Arrangements exist with different lifecycle states 
 *  When the ASA app retrieves Billing Arrangements 
 *  Then only Billing Arrangements that are: 

 *  Active Effective as of the current date (within start/end dates, if applicable) are shown 
 *  And inactive, expired, or future-dated Billing Arrangements are excluded.

column8: Develop Integration to Load EBS Billing Arrangement Allocations from Snowflake into CRM
column11:
As a CRM Integration Developer, I need to build an integration process to extract and load billing arrangement allocation data from Snowflake into CRM so that each allocation correctly links to its parent billing arrangement and maintains the same business logic used for NSAP allocations.
 

 
Business Requirements:

 *  Extract allocation-level data from Snowflake for EBS accounts. 
 *  Transform and load data into CRM Billing Arrangement Allocation entity. 
 *  Link each allocation record to its corresponding billing arrangement header using billing arrangement ID. 
 *  Support allocation types “Gen Service” and “Gen Analytical” only; exclude others. 
 *  Preserve currency codes (USD/CAD) and normalize to USD scale for reporting. 
 *  Handle scenarios where some billing arrangements have no allocations without causing job failure. 
 *  Ensure incremental updates and idempotent processing. 
 *  Include full logging, error handling, and data validation steps.
column19: Moved out of state In QA
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:

 *  Given EBS allocation data exists in the Snowflake source view 

 *  When the integration job runs 
 *  Then allocation records must be created in CRM and linked to their respective billing arrangement headers. 
 

 *  Given allocation records exist for a billing arrangement 

 *  When the integration job executes subsequent runs 
 *  Then any changes (funds, currency, or allocation type) must be updated accurately without duplication. 
 

 *  Given allocation data includes unsupported allocation types 

 *  When the job executes 
 *  Then those records must be excluded and logged as skipped. 
 

 *  Given a billing arrangement has no allocation rows in Snowflake 

 *  When the job runs 
 *  Then the header record must still load successfully, and the absence of allocations should not cause job failure. 
 

 *  Given allocation data includes multiple currencies 

 *  When data is loaded into CRM 
 *  Then amounts must retain their original currency and be normalized to USD for analytical reporting.

column8: Develop Integration to Load EBS Billing Arrangement (Header) Data from Snowflake into CRM
column11:
As a CRM Integration Developer, I need to build an integration process to pull billing arrangement header data for EBS customers from Snowflake and load it into CRM so that EBS billing arrangements appear in CRM with consistent structure and linkage to sold-to and ship-to accounts.

 
Business Requirements:
 

 *  Develop an automated integration (ADF/SSIS or equivalent) to extract billing arrangement headers from Snowflake. 
 *  Transform data per the mapping defined in the technical spike. #866571 
 *  Load data into the CRM Billing Arrangement entity while maintaining lookups to sold-to and ship-to accounts. 
 *  Apply exclusion logic for special pricing (e.g., ZSP1). 
 *  Preserve start and end dates from EBS; do not modify. 
 *  Ensure ownership aligns with the ship-to account owner. 
 *  Design integration to support incremental nightly loads and prevent duplication. 
 *  Implement comprehensive logging and error handling. 
 *  Ensure coexistence with NSAP billing arrangements without overwriting or conflict.
column19: Moved out of state In QA
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:

 *  Given EBS billing arrangement data is available in Snowflake 

 *  When the integration job runs 
 *  Then CRM must receive and store all valid billing arrangement records with mapped fields populated accurately. 
 

 *  Given a billing arrangement record already exists in CRM 

 *  When the corresponding EBS record is updated in Snowflake 
 *  Then CRM must update the record without creating duplicates. 
 

 *  Given a billing arrangement record in Snowflake has a type (e.g., ZSP1) 

 *  When the integration job executes 
 *  Then the record must be excluded from CRM load. 
 

 *  Given an EBS billing arrangement references both sold-to and ship-to accounts 

 *  When the integration completes 
 *  Then those CRM lookups must resolve correctly and ownership must reflect the ship-to owner. 
 

 *  Given NSAP arrangements exist in CRM 

 *  When EBS data is loaded 
 *  Then both NSAP and EBS arrangements must coexist without impacting ASA functionality.

column8: Deprecate Direct Sold-To and Ship-To Lookups on Billing Arrangement Table (Post-R1)
column11:
As a CRM platform owner
I want to deprecate direct account lookup fields on the Billing Arrangement table after R1
 
So that Billing Arrangement–to–account associations are represented only through the dedicated Billing Arrangement Account Relationship table, which is the valid One Customer (1C) data model.
 

 
Background: 
In the One Customer (1C) model:

 *  A Billing Arrangement may be associated with multiple account records 
 *  These associations are correctly modeled using a separate related table 
 *  During R1, legacy direct lookup fields were temporarily retained for backward compatibility 
 

 
Post R1, continuing to expose or populate these legacy fields results in: 

 *  Invalid data representation 
 *  User confusion (single-account impression vs multi-account reality) 
 *  Increased risk of incorrect downstream usage 
 

 
To align with the approved 1C architecture, direct account references on the Billing Arrangement table must be fully deprecated. 

 
Scope of Change 

 *  This story applies to the Billing Arrangement (Billing Enhancement) table and includes: 

 *  UI cleanup (forms and views) 
 *  Data cleanup 
 *  Prevention of future population 
 *  Enforcing the related table as the authoritative model
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Scenario 1: Hide Deprecated Fields on Forms 

 *  Given a user opens any Billing Arrangement form 
 *  When the form loads 
 *  Then all deprecated direct account lookup fields are hidden 
 *  And users cannot view or edit these fields on any form variant 
 

 *  Scenario 2: Remove Deprecated Fields from Views 

 *  Given any Billing Arrangement view (system or custom) 
 *  When the view is accessed 
 *  Then deprecated account-related columns are removed 
 *  And views do not present Billing Arrangements as being linked to a single account 
 

 *  Scenario 3: Clear Existing Invalid Data 

 *  Given Billing Arrangement records created prior to deprecation 
 *  When the cleanup process runs 
 *  Then values in deprecated account lookup fields are cleared 
 *  And no Billing Arrangement record contains direct account references 
 

 *  Scenario 4: Delete the Sold To And Ship To Columns from the Billing Arrangement Table 

 *  Given I open the Billing Arrangement Table 
 *  Then the Sold To and Ship To fields Should de deleted from the table

column8: DC: Deactivate NSAP Billing Arrangements for R2 Sold-To and Ship-To Accounts
column11:
As a CRM Data Conversion Analyst, I need to identify and deactivate all NSAP billing arrangements associated with R2 Sold-To and Ship-To accounts so that legacy NSAP arrangements are no longer active once EBS billing arrangements are deployed for R2 accounts.
 

 
Business Requirements:

 *  Identify all Sold-To and Ship-To accounts included in the R2 migration list. 
 *  Retrieve all CRM billing arrangements tied to these accounts where legacy source = NSAP. 
 *  Deactivate all identified records in CRM while retaining their existing end dates. 
 *  Ensure deactivated NSAP billing arrangements are excluded from active billing processes and ASA queries. 
 *  Preserve linked allocation records for reference while marking them inactive. 
 *  Record deactivation results with metadata (ID, source, account numbers, deactivation date, and process reference). 
 *  Validate that all intended R2 NSAP billing arrangements have been processed and confirmed inactive.
column19: Moved out of state In Test
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:

 *  Given a billing arrangement belongs to an R2 Sold-To or Ship-To account and originates from NSAP 

 *  When the deactivation process runs 
 *  Then the billing arrangement must be marked inactive while preserving its historical data and end date. 
 

 *  Given NSAP billing arrangements are deactivated 

 *  When ASA or CRM users retrieve active billing arrangements 
 *  Then those records must be excluded from active results. 
 

 *  Given allocation records are linked to deactivated arrangements 

 *  When the job executes 
 *  Then child allocations must remain intact but marked inactive.
