column8: Technical Spike: Determine Source, Model, and CRM Storage Location for NSAP Intercompany Ship-To (Identification Numbers)
column11:
As a technical architect,
I need to investigate how and where the NSAP Intercompany Ship-To identification number is sourced in EBS and Snowflake,
 
so that we can determine the correct Snowflake view, data model, CRM storage location, and required pipeline changes to support CRM enhancements for 1C Tank Orders.
 

 
Context / Background

 *  EBS maintains various Identification Numbers against SOLDTO/SHIPTO accounts. 
 *  Each identification line includes fields such as: 

 *  ID Type 
 *  ID Type Description 
 *  ID Number 
 *  Responsible Institution 
 *  Entry Date 
 *  Country 
 *  Additional metadata 
 

 *  For tank order processing, CRM needs specifically: 

 *  ID Type = ZNSAP ? Represents the NSAP Intercompany Ship-To number. 
 

 *  However: 

 *  We must confirm where this identification data resides in EBS UI and underlying tables 
 *  We need to identify the correct Snowflake view(s) that supply this data 
 *  Future identification numbers may be needed; therefore Snowflake model should support a 1:N relationship (Account ? Identification Numbers) 
 

 *  The spike must determine whether the NSAP Intercompany Ship-To should be stored on: 

 *  Sold-To account, or 
 *  Ship-To account 
 

 *  and outline required ADF pipeline changes accordingly.
column19: Moved out of state In Development

column8: Technical Spike: Design & Recommend Customer Service Notification Mechanism (Per-Order vs Daily Summary) for Tank Orders
column11:
As a technical team,
I need to analyze and design the best solution to automatically notify the Customer Service team when a tank order reaches the Customer Setup workflow stage,
 
so that business can receive timely alerts and take appropriate action on new, label, and product-change tank orders.
 

 
Context and Background: 
Today:

 *  Customer Service monitors tank orders manually via dashboards. 
 *  No automated notification is sent when an order reaches the Customer Setup stage. 
 *  The business prefers automated notifications and wants a clear understanding of: 

 *  Trigger definition 
 *  When the email should fire 
 *  Who should receive the notification 
 *  Per-order email vs daily summary 
 *  Standardized email subject + body formatting 
 

 *  Business’ initial preference: 

 *  Per-order notification (one email per tank order reaching Customer Setup). 
 

 *  However: 

 *  The technical feasibility, complexity, cost, performance impact, and maintainability must be evaluated. 
 *  Daily summary notification (batch model) may still be considered depending on effort, reliability, and scalability. 
 

 

 
This spike must evaluate both models, document the findings, and provide a final recommendation.
column22:
Scope of Analysis

 *  This spike must review, analyze, and document: 

 *  Trigger Logic (When to send the notification) 
 *  Determine the exact workflow stage: Customer Setup stage in the tank order BPF. 
 *  Determine if any edge conditions exist: 

 *  Order reopened 
 *  Order resubmitted 
 *  Order modified after Customer Setup 
 

 *  Confirm whether a notification is required only on first entry into the stage or on any change. 
 *  Targeted Tank Order Types 

 *  New Tank 
 *  Product Change 
 *  Label-Only 
 

 

 *  Notification Modalities to Evaluate 

 *  Per-Order Immediate Notification 
 *  Triggered instantly when order enters Customer Setup stage. 
 *  Emails sent one-by-one. 
 *  Requires evaluating: 
 *  Plugin vs Power Automate 
 *  Performance 
 *  Reliability 
 *  Outlook mail limits 
 *  Logging/audit needs 
 

 *  Daily Summary Notification 

 *  A scheduled process identifies all tank orders in Customer Setup. 
 *  Sends one consolidated email. 
 *  Requires evaluating: 
 *  Batch job scheduling 
 *  Data reliability 
 *  Formatting the summary 
 *  File export vs inline table 
 

 *  Email Formatting & Content 
 *  Provide recommended formatting including: 

 *  Subject Line Template 
 *  e.g., “Tank Order Ready for Customer Setup – Request #{{OrderNumber}} – {{CustomerName}}” 
 *  Body Template 
 *  Should include: 
 *  Tank Order ID 
 *  Request Type 
 *  Customer Account Name / Sold-To 
 *  Ship-To 
 *  Product Information 
 *  Date Submitted 
 *  Link to open the tank order in CRM 
 *  Any additional metadata recommended by UX/Operations 
 

 *  Delivery Mechanism Evaluated 

 *  Spike must analyze feasibility of: 

 *  Power Automate Flow (Cloud Flow triggered by Dataverse) 
 *  Scheduled job (for daily summary) 
 *  Any dependency on dashboards or workflow logs 
 

 

 *  Recipient Mapping 

 *  Confirm: 

 *  Distribution list 
 *  Static email addresses 
 *  Or dynamic based on region/district/customer type 
 

 

 *  Pros & Cons Comparison 

 *  Full evaluation should include: 

 *  Technical feasibility 
 *  Cost/effort 
 *  Maintainability 
 *  Supportability 
 *  Error handling 
 *  Performance 
 *  Impact on Customer Service 
 *  Scalability for future R2+ 
 *  Risk mitigation 
 

 

 *  Final Recommendation 

 *  Identify preferred mechanism (likely Per Order Notification) 
 *  Justify the recommendation 
 *  Provide a recommended implementation approach

column8: Send Automated Notification When Tank Order Appears in Customer Setup Queue (Dependent on Technical Spike #885572)
column11:
As a Customer Service user,
I want to automatically receive a notification when a tank order meets the system-defined criteria for the Customer Setup stage,
 
so that I can review new tank, product change, or label-only requests promptly without relying solely on dashboard monitoring.
 

 
Context and Background  

 *  CRM currently identifies tank orders requiring customer-service action using the TankOrderCustomerSetup view. 
 *  This view includes only orders that meet a very specific set of conditions. 
 *  Today, Customer Service monitors this view manually. 
 *  No automated notification exists. 
 *  The business now requires email notifications triggered when a tank order qualifies for Customer Setup. 
 *  Two notification models remain under consideration: 

 *  Per-Order Event-Triggered Email 
 *  Daily Summary Email 
 

 *  The technical spike #885572  will confirm which model is feasible/preferred. 
 *  This story documents acceptance criteria for both. 
 *  Trigger Criteria 

 *  A tank order must trigger notification only if ALL of the following conditions are true: 

 *  From TankOrder (Parent Entity) 
 *  Status = Active 
 *  Order Status = Customer Setup Pending 
 *  Sales Org ? {1001, 2001, 1500, 2500, US10, CA10} 
 *  (NOTE: Sales org update will be handled in a separate story. For this story, assume the view already includes the correct list.) 
 *  From TankOrderStatusTracker (Related Entity) 
 *  Status = Active 
 *  Record Status = Open 
 *  Request Type = Customer Setup 
 

 *  If a tank order appears in the TankOrderCustomerSetup view as a result of the above filters, it is considered ready for customer setup and must be included in the notification (either event-based or daily). 
 

 *  Required Email Content (Both Models) 

 *  Each tank order in the notification must include: 
 *  Order Type (New Tank / Product Change / New Label Only) 
 *  Request Type 
 *  Sold-To Account Number & Name 
 *  Ship-To Account Number & Name 
 *  NSAP Intercompany Ship-To Number (If available) 
 *  Tank Delivery Business Phone 
 *  CRM Record Link
column14: FBU R2 Release; FBU_QAPush_Dec_Major5; validated in QA; validated in Test
column19: Moved out of state In QA
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Option A – Event-Based Notification (Per Order) 

 *  Trigger When Order Qualifies for Customer Setup 

 *  Given a tank order meets all criteria defined in the TankOrderCustomerSetup view (status = active, order status = customer setup pending, etc.) 
 *  When the record first appears in the view and it is for a 1C account 
 *  Then an automated email must be sent immediately to Customer Service cs-watercare@ecolab.com.  
 

 *  Ensure One Notification Per Order 

 *  Given the tank order remains in customer setup pending 
 *  When the user opens/edits/saves the order 
 *  Then no additional notifications should be sent. 
 

 *  Email Content Requirements 

 *  Given the notification is generated 
 *  Then the email must include: 

 *  Order Type 
 *  Request Type 
 *  Sold-To Account Number & Name 
 *  Ship-To Account Number & Name 
 *  NSAP Intercompany Ship-To Number 
 *  Tank Delivery Business Phone 
 *  CRM Record Link 
 

 

 *  Email Subject & Body Formatting 

 *  Subject Example: 

 *  Tank Order Ready for Customer Setup – {{OrderName}} 
 

 *  Body must include: 

 *  Header identifying tank order 
 *  Attribute/value list (clean layout) 
 *  CRM hyperlink 
 *  No technical IDs visible to business users

column8: CRM – Validation: Ensure “Label Required” Defaults to Yes for Product Change Tank Orders (No Dev Expected Validation only)
column11:
As a CRM user,
I need the Label Required field to automatically default to “Yes” when initiating a Product Change tank order,
 
so that the label workflow is consistently enforced without requiring manual user selection.
 

 
Context: 

 *  In the current CRM configuration, Label Required is already defaulted to Yes for: 

 *  New Tank 
 *  Product Change 
 *  New Label 
 

 *  No new development is expected. 
 *  This story ensures that the default = Yes behavior is validated specifically for Product Change tank orders as part of the 1C R2 scope.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Default Behavior for Product Change 

 *  Given a user creates a new tank order 
 *  And selects Order Type = Product Change 
 *  When the tank order detail form loads 
 *  Then the Label Required field must default to “Yes”. 
 

 *  No Build Required Unless a Defect Is Identified 

 *  If validation confirms the default behavior already works: 
 *  Story can be marked as No Development Required. 
 *  If validation fails at any step: 
 *  A follow-up defect or small config fix story must be created.

column8: CRM – Update Tank Order Workflow Dashboard Views to Support US10/CA10 Sales Orgs
column11:
As a CRM user,
I need updated Tank Order dashboard views that correctly display US10 and CA10 tank orders and show additional account-related columns,
 
so that Sales Rep, Customer Service, Warehouse, Logistics, Delivery Systems, and other operational teams have full visibility into sold-to and ship-to data, including NSAP intercompany ship-to information.
 

 
Context and Background  

 *  The Tank Order Workflow Stages Dashboard contains seven sections, each powered by a dedicated system view. 
 *  Current views only support legacy sales orgs (1001, 2001, 1500, 2500) and do not display NSAP intercompany ship-to information. 
 *  Business requires: 

 *  Support for new 1C sales orgs: US10 and CA10 
 *  Display of additional account-related information: 
 *  Sold-To Account Number 
 *  Ship-To Account Number 
 *  NSAP Intercompany Ship-To Number 
 *  Updating these views automatically updates the dashboard (no dashboard edits required).

column8: CRM – Update Label Information Fields on Tank Order Detail Form for 1C Accounts (EVD label updates)
column11:
As a CRM user working on a tank order,
I need the Label Information section on the Tank Order Detail form to show EBS-based label product numbers and descriptions
 
instead of the legacy NSAP label fields,
 
so that the correct EBS product references are used for new tank, product change, and label-only workflows for 1C customer accounts.
 

 
Context and Background

 *  Today, the Label Information tab shows 8 NSAP product number fields, each named using the pattern: 

 *  NSAPProductNumber – Description 
 

 *  For the 1C program, label requests must transition to EBS product numbers, and only 6 out of 8 NSAP fields have EBS equivalents. 
 *  Business has provided a mapping list (6 EBS product numbers + descriptions). 
 *  Two NSAP label fields have no EBS equivalents and must be removed for 1C accounts. 
 *  For non-1C accounts, the existing NSAP fields must remain unchanged. 
 *  Scope of Change 

 *  Current (Today — NSAP Fields Displayed for All Accounts) 

 *  The Label Information tab contains 8 fields, each representing NSAP product codes. 

 *  241-P0208.88- ABEL LAMINATED 8X11 PRODUCT 
 *  241-P3317.88- LABEL TANK KIT COMPLETE WITH LABEL BOARD 
 *  241-P3320.88-LABEL TANK INCL MYLAR COVER & FILL-LINE 
 *  241-P33480.88-LABEL TANK KIT HAZARD NFPA COMPLETE 
 *  881-P3368.88-LABEL 8X11 PRODUCT 
 *  881-P3369.88-LABEL 11X14 BIOCIDE 
 *  241-P3374.88-LABEL TANK FILL LINE LABELS (2/SET) 
 *  241-P3389.88-LABEL EVD CONNECTION POINT LABEL 
 

 

 *  Future (Required — EBS Fields Displayed for 1C Only) 

 *  For 1C Accounts 

 *  The 8 NSAP label fields must be hidden/suppressed 
 *  6 new EBS label fields must be shown 
 *  Field labels must follow the pattern: EBS Product Number – Description 

 *  53003339- LABEL EVD CONNECTION POINT LABEL 
 *  10133859- LABEL LAMINATED 8X11 PRODUCT 
 *  10122041- LABEL TANK KIT COMPLETE WITH LABEL BOARD 
 *  10133861- LABEL TANK FILL LINE LABLES (2/SET)

column8: CRM – Show NSAP legacy product number when EBS product is selected on tank order details (1C base tanks only)
column11:
As a CRM user creating a tank order for a 1C customer,  
I want the system to automatically show the Legacy NSAP Product Number when I select an EBS product on the Tank Order Detail screen, for 1C customer Accounts so that the Ops Team can easily reference the information. 

 
Context:  
 

 *  Where this appears 

 *  Tank Order ? Product Details tab ? + New Tank Order Detail 
 

 *  Product Selection 

 *  The Product Number dropdown displays EBS product numbers. 
 *  A mapping already exists between EBS Product ? NSAP Product 
 *  (created in dependency Story #872853 – Add Legacy Product Lookup to Product Table). 
 

 *  What should happen 

 *  When a user selects an EBS product, 
 *  The system must display the equivalent NSAP legacy product as a Quick View section on the form. 
 

 *  Applicability 

 *  Only for 1C customer accounts. 
 *  For non-1C customers, NSAP quick view must not be shown. 
 

 *  Additional Verification Needed 

 *  Investigate why the field ecl_oldproductnumber is present on Tank Order Detail table. 
 *  Confirm whether it is still used or can be deprecated.
column19: Moved out of state In QA
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Display NSAP legacy product when EBS product is selected (1C only) 

 *  Given the user selects a Product on the Tank Order Details Form, 
 *  And the Tank Order belongs to a 1C WATER Sales Skill customer, 
 *  When the selected EBS product has a mapped NSAP legacy product (from Story 872853), 
 *  Then the system must display a Quick View showing the NSAP legacy product number next to the Selected Product Number. 
 

 *  Hide NSAP Quick View for non-1C customers 

 *  Given the user selects a product on the Tank Order Details Form, 
 *  And the Tank Order is created for a non-1C customer, 
 *  When the form loads the product selection, 
 *  Then the NSAP legacy product quick view must not be shown. 
 

 *  
 

 

 

 
Dependencies: 

 *  Story #872853 – Add Legacy Product Lookup to Product Table 
 *  Mapping between EBS Product ? NSAP Product must already exist. 
 *  This story relies on that lookup field for the Quick View display. 
 


 

 
Dev Notes:  

 *  Validate the ecl_oldproductnumber field  

 *  Given the system has the Tank Order Detail Table,  
 *  When reviewing the field ecl_oldproductnumber,  
 *  Then confirm whether the field is still required,  
 *  And document how is it used for Product Change requests.

column8: CRM – Restrict tank order creation to Water accounts Only
column11:
As a CRM user,
I want Tank Orders to be created only from eligible accounts based on Sales Skill(for 1C accounts)and Global Business (for Non 1C accounts),
 
so that tank order processing is limited to valid Nalco Water accounts.
 

 
Context (How Users Can Create Tank Orders in CRM)

 *  Creating a Tank Order From an Account ? Tank Orders Tab ? New 

 *  User opens an Account record. 
 *  On Water accounts, the Tank Orders tab is visible. 
 *  User clicks + New, which opens a Tank Order with the Account pre-populated. 
 *  The user can change the pre-populated account, so the system must re-check eligibility. 
 

 *  Creating a Tank Order from Sitemap ? Tank Orders ? New 

 *  User navigates to the Tank Orders view. 
 *  User clicks + New and selects an Account on the form. 
 

 

 
 
In all of these entry points, the selected Account must be validated to ensure it is an eligible Nalco Water account.

 *  Given the user clicks New from the Tank Orders sitemap, 
 *  When the user selects an Account, 
 *  Then filter the Sold To Account Dropdown to only display Accounts with Sales Skill = Water (1C) or Global Business = Nalco Water (Non-1C) 
 

 *  Restriction When Creating From an Account ? Tank Orders Tab ? New and User Changes the Pre-Populated Account  

 *  Given the user opens a Water account and clicks + New under the Tank Orders tab,  
 *  When the Tank Order opens with the Account pre-populated,   
 *  When the user changes the Account to a different one,

 *  And prevent the user from proceeding if the account is not a Water account:

 *  For non 1C account validate if Global Business ? Nalco Water then trigger this validation  
 

 *  And block creation and show error message:  

 *  “Tank Orders can only be created for Water accounts.”  
 

 

 *  Validation Always Runs on Account Selection  

 *  Given the Tank Order form is open (from sitemap or account),  
 *  When the Account field is populated or changed,  
 *  Then eligibility validation must run.

column8: CRM – Lock product, serial, and equipment number fields on “New Label” tank order requests once tank is selected
column11:
As a CRM user submitting a Label-Only tank order request,
I need the Product Number, Serial Number, and Equipment Number to be auto-populated from the selected tank and locked (read-only),
 
so that label-only requests do not accidentally modify tank-level product details that were established during the original tank setup.
 

 
Context and Background: 

 *  When a New Tank request is submitted: 

 *  User enters product information on the Tank Order Detail form 
 *  CRM automatically creates a Tank record behind the scenes 
 *  The tank stores: 

 *  Product number 
 *  Serial number 
 *  Equipment number 
 *  Unloading point 
 *  Additional tank attributes 
 

 *  These values represent the authoritative product configuration for that tank. 
 

 *  What Happens for Label-Only Requests 

 *  When a user submits a Label-Only request, they are not requesting to change the tank’s product or configuration. 
 *  They are only requesting: 

 *  A new label, 
 *  Or a corrected/replacement label. 
 

 

 *  Risk Without Locking 

 *  If CRM continues to allow edits to Product Number, Serial Number, or Equipment Number during a Label-Only request: 
 *  Users may modify tank data unintentionally 
 *  It creates inconsistencies between: 

 *  The tank order 
 *  The Tank record 
 *  NSAP/EBS equipment data 
 

 *  It leads to incorrect product labeling and operational errors 
 

 *  Why Locking Is Required 

 *  Business requires that Label-Only = No changes to tank metadata. 
 *  Therefore: 
 

 *  When a tank is selected on a Label-Only request: 
 *  All identifying fields must be read-only 
 *  No changes should be permitted unless the user explicitly submits a Product Change request type instead 
 

 *  This ensures data integrity for tank master data and preserves the workflow separation between: 
 

 *  Product Change (modifications to tank metadata) 

 *  Label Only (no tank metadata changes allowed) 
 

 *  Scope of Change 

 *  Applies To: 

 *  Label-Only tank order requests 
 *  1C and non-1C customers (same behavior for both) 
 

 

 *  Fields to Lock (Label-Only): 

 *  Product Number 
 *  Serial Number 
 *  Equipment Number (newly displayed) 
 

 *  Fields to Remain Editable (Non-Label Types): 

 *  Product Number and Serial Number remain editable for: 

 *  New Tank 
 *  Product Change 
 

 *  Equipment Number must not appear
column19: Moved out of state In QA
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Product Number must be locked for Label-Only 

 *  Given the tank order request type = Label Only 
 *  And the user selects a tank 
 *  When the Product Number auto-populates from the tank 
 *  Then Product Number must be read-only 
 *  And user must not be able to edit it. 
 

 *  Serial Number must be locked for Label-Only 

 *  Given request type = Label Only 
 *  When the tank is selected 
 *  Then Serial Number auto-populates 
 *  And the field must be read-only. 
 

 *  Equipment Number must be displayed and locked 

 *  Given request type = Label Only 
 *  When a tank is selected 
 *  Then show the Equipment Number field 
 *  And auto-populate it from the tank 
 *  And lock it as read-only. 
 

 

 *  Enforcement regardless of 1C or non-1C 

 *  Given label-only requests can occur on any account 
 *  When the request type = Label Only 
 *  Then all locking rules must apply uniformly.

column8: CRM – Hide bulk tank options on tank order requests for 1C customer accounts
column11:
As a CRM Sales User,
I want the Bulk Tank order type to be hidden whenever the selected Sold-To account belongs to a District where the 1C Flag = Yes,
 
so that only Base Tank orders can be created for 1C customers,
 
and both Base Tank and Bulk Tank order options remain available for all non-1C customers.
 

 
The system must evaluate the District associated with the Sold-To account.
 
If the District’s 1C Flag = Yes, the account is treated as a 1C account and the UI must hide Bulk Tank.
 

 
No change should occur to existing (historical) tank order records.
column14: CodeReviewed; FBU R2 Release; FBU_QAPush_Dec_Major3; ReadyforDemo; validated in QA; validated in Test
column19: Moved out of state In QA
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Hide Bulk Tank for 1C District Accounts 

 *  Given the user is creating a new Tank Order request, 
 *  And the selected Sold-To account belongs to a District where the 1C Flag = Yes, and Sales skill is WATER 
 *  When the user opens the Order Type dropdown, 
 *  Then the system must hide the Bulk Tank option, 
 *  And only Base Tank must be shown. 
 

 *  Show Both Options for Non-1C District Accounts 

 *  Given the user is creating a new Tank Order request, 
 *  And the selected Sold-To account belongs to a District where the 1C Flag = No, 
 *  When the user opens the Order Type dropdown, 
 *  Then the system must display both options: 

 *  Base Tank 
 *  Bulk Tank 
 

 

 *  Re-evaluate Order Type Options When Account Changes 

 *  Given the user changes the Sold-To account on a new Tank Order request, 
 *  When the newly selected account belongs to a District with 1C Flag = Yes, and Sales skill is WATER 
 *  Then the UI must refresh and hide Bulk Tank. 
 *  And When the newly selected account belongs to a District with 1C Flag = No, 
 *  Then the UI must refresh and show Base Tank + Bulk Tank. 
 

 *  No Impact to Historical Records 

 *  Given the user opens an existing tank order created prior to this change, 
 *  When the record is viewed or edited, 
 *  Then the system must not alter the saved order type, 
 *  And must only apply the new logic on new tank order creation or account changes. 
 

 


 

 
Dev Note: Run the below Advanced Find Query to find out if there any Tank Orders for 1C customers that are bulk tanks and not yet completed to test this AC

 *  [Image]

column8: CRM – Auto-populate Ship-To and display NSAP intercompany Ship-To for 1C tank orders
column11:
As a CRM user creating a tank order for a 1C customer,
 
 
I want CRM to automatically populate (and lock) the Ship-To value when a selected Sold-To is linked to only one Ship-To,
 
and I want the NSAP Intercompany Ship-To number to display in the Ship-To quick view,
 
so that I can correctly identify NSAP cross-references required for NSAP downstream processing.
 

 
Work Details:

 *  New Field Needed 

 *  Add new field on Account: NSAP Intercompany Ship-To 
 *  Populated by integration 
 *  Must be included in the Ship-To/Sold-To quick view 
 *  This New Field should appear on the Admin tab of the Account Form 
 

 *  Behavior for 1C vs Non-1C Customers 

 *  1C = Show NSAP Intercompany Ship-To 
 *  Non-1C = Hide or show blank (depending on feasibility) 
 

 *  Auto-Populate + Lock Logic 

 *  If Sold-To has exactly 1 Ship-To, CRM must: 

 *  Auto-populate Ship-To 
 *  Lock the Ship-To lookup field (user cannot change it) 
 

 *  If Sold-To has multiple Ship-Tos, CRM must: 

 *  Not auto-populate 
 *  Keep the field unlocked to allow selection 
 

 

 *  Quick View Updates 

 *  After Ship-To is set (auto or user selection): 
 *  Show NSAP Intercompany Ship-To immediately under Ship-To number 
 *  Other fields remain unchanged
column19: Moved out of state PO Approved
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  New Account field exists 

 *  Given the Account (Ship-To) record exists, 
 *  When viewing it in CRM, 
 *  Then a field named NSAP Intercompany Ship-To must exist and be available for integration. 
 

 *  Auto-populate Ship-To when Sold-To has one Ship-To 

 *  Given a Sold-To account has exactly one Ship-To linked, 
 *  When the user selects this Sold-To on the Tank Order form, 
 *  Then CRM must automatically populate the Ship-To field with that one record. 
 

 *  Lock Ship-To field when auto-populated 

 *  Given the Ship-To field has been auto-populated because the Sold-To has one Ship-To, 
 *  When the user attempts to edit the Ship-To lookup, 
 *  Then the field must be locked, preventing manual changes. 
 

 *  Allow manual selection when multiple Ship-Tos exist 

 *  Given a Sold-To has more than one Ship-To, 
 *  When the user selects that Sold-To, 
 *  Then the Ship-To field must remain unlocked, 
 *  And the user must select one from the dropdown. 
 

 *  Display NSAP Intercompany Ship-To for 1C customers 

 *  Given a Tank Order is created for a 1C account, 
 *  When the Ship-To quick view loads, 
 *  Then the NSAP Intercompany Ship-To field must display its value 
 *  And appear directly below the Ship-To number. 
 

 *  Update the Public View Active Accounts Ship To  View to add the Intercompany Ship To Number  

 *  Given I view the Active Accounts Ship To  View  
 *  When the  view loads, 
 *  Then the NSAP Intercompany Ship-To field must be added to this view  
 *  And appear after the Ship-To number. 
 

 

 *  Suppress NSAP Intercompany Ship-To for non-1C 

 *  Given a Tank Order is created for a non-1C account, 
 *  When the Ship-To quick view loads, 
 *  Then CRM must either: 

 *  Hide the NSAP Intercompany Ship-To (ideal), or 
 *  Show the field with blank value (fallback). 
 

 

 *  Quick view refreshes when Ship-To changes 

 *  Given a user changes the Sold-To or adjusts the Ship-To selection, 
 *  When the new Ship-To is set, 
 *  Then the quick view must refresh 
 *  And display the correct NSAP intercompany Ship-To for that Ship-To. 
 

 

Technical Note:- 

 *  The field should have same metadata as Account Number field.  
 *  The schema name should be ecl_znsapidentifier and the display name should be NSAP Intercompany Ship-To Number 
 *  This new field on the Account table should be added the Key Change Log (Plugin updates needed (Secure configs need to be modified))

column6: CRM: Service - District Services - Handle Unified Service Templates for 1C Org accounts
column11:
Context 
 
 
The Reoccurring Services for District Team functionality within the Service Plan Builder Power App enables Sales Representatives (Reps) and District Managers (DMs) to define and automate service schedules for customer accounts. These services are based on predefined templates or customized inputs and are tied to specific assets or sites. The goal is to ensure consistent service delivery, reduce manual effort, and align with the Statement of Work (SOW) commitments made by Corporate Account Managers (CAMs) to customers. 

Business Value:
This feature streamlines service planning and execution across Water and Hygiene divisions, improving operational efficiency and customer satisfaction. It supports harmonized workflows and ensures alignment between sales commitments and field execution.

 
Groups
Hygiene & Water 
Personas
• Corporate Account Managers (CAMs): Define the SOW at the organization level
• Sales Representatives (Reps): Create and manage service plans at the customer account level
• District Managers (DMs): Create and manage service plans at the customer account level
• OPS Admins: For hygiene accounts, they create service plans and templates due to lack of asset-level data 
Downstream Systems/Integration
• CRM: Hosts the app and stores service plans and schedules
• Asset Harvester: Supplies asset data (currently missing for hygiene)
• Ecolab 3D: Receives service reports generated from plans
• PDF Export: Allows sharing of service plans with customers, though not integrated into contracts 
Impact Considerations
 

 *  Account Type: 

 *  Water: Uses asset-level templates 
 *  Hygiene: Uses site-level templates due to missing asset data 
 

 *  Ship-To vs Site: 

 *  Field Services: Tie services to Ship-To 
 *  Sales/District Teams: Tie services to Site 
 *  Standalone (Street) Accounts: Follow similar process but without parent org account linkage 
 

 

Business Process Flow 

 *  CAM defines SOW using Enterprise Scope Builder 
 *  Service Templates are created for asset types or sites 
 *  Sales Rep/DM launches Service Plan Builder from CRM account 
 *  Plan is created with selected services and frequencies 
 *  Schedules and service records are auto-generated in CRM 
 *  Validation and activation of the plan triggers service visits 
 *  PDF export allows sharing with customers 
 

Key Features
• Auto-population of site and contact data from CRM
• Customization of service frequency and scope
• Ability to add services beyond the template
• PDF export for customer communication. The PDF is NOT stored in CRM by default. Rather, the user selects a save location

column7: Unified Service Template Support for Water & Hygiene in Enterprise Scope Builder
column11:
Business Context
Under the One Customer (1C) model, a customer (H5 account) can serve both Hygiene (F&B) and Water (Nalco Water) business segments. 
Today, Enterprise Scope Builder supports one service template per asset type per org account
 
In the 1C model, both Water and Hygiene sales skill accounts will share the same Org Account, So users must be able to configure both Water and Hygiene services without duplicating templates or managing multiple versions.
 

 *  A business and design decision has been made to: 
 *  Maintain a single template per asset type 
 *  Allow configuration of both sales skills within that template 
 *  Provide UI clarity so users know which sales skill they are configuring 
 *  Ensure clean filtering and UI cues, not complex UX or backend duplication 
 

 
Business Goal 
Enable users to configure and manage service templates for Water & Hygiene in a single unified template, while clearly distinguishing which services belong to which sales skill. 

 
Business Outcomes 

 *  Maintain “One Customer / One Template” operational simplicity 
 *  Avoid template duplication and ongoing maintenance complexity 
 *  Preserve existing UI flow with minimal user disruption 
 *  Provide clear visual controls and cues to avoid confusion 
 *  Future-proof for broader 1C adoption across orgs and service execution models 
 

 
High-Level Requirements 

 *  Users must be able to configure services for either or both sales skills (Water & Hygiene) 
 *  System must not create multiple templates for the same asset type under same org 
 *  Sales skill must be explicitly selected when configuring the template 
 *  Sales skill selection must control which services appear for configuration 
 *  Screens must display the selected sales skill context 
 *  Templates list must indicate the sales skill context (Hygiene / Water / Both) 
 *  If the asset type is applicable to only one sales skill, sales skill should be: 

 *  Automatically defaulted 
 *  Locked (no user choice) 
 

 *  If asset type is applicable to both skills, user should: 
 *  Default to Hygiene first 
 *  Be able to switch to Water 
 *  Complete configuration for each skill as needed 
 

 
User Experience Requirements 

 *  General Experience 

 *  Minimize change to existing workflow 
 *  Provide clear pop-ups and labels where sales skill selection is required 
 *  Ensure consistent sales skill indicator across all relevant screens 
 *  Reinforce clarity without adding multiple pages or duplicate templates 
 

 *  Key User Interaction Touchpoints 

 *  Launch Point 

 *  Access via Enterprise Scope Builder from Org account (current behavior remains) 
 

 *  Sales Skill Selection Pop-Up 

 *  Appears only when asset type supports both skills 
 *  Includes: 

 *  Org (locked) 
 *  Region (locked) 
 *  Asset Type (auto or selectable) 
 *  Sales Skill (default Hygiene; switchable if dual-skill asset) 
 

 

 *  Action buttons: Save & Continue / Cancel 
 *  Template Configuration Screens 

 *  Must show Sales Skill indicator 
 *  Applies to: 
 *  Initial configuration screen 
 *  Service type selection screen 
 *  Frequency selection screens 
 *  Review / Final confirmation screen 
 

 *  Template Gallery View 
 *  Each template entry must display a simple label: 

 *  “Hygiene” 
 *  “Water” 
 *  “Hygiene + Water” (if user configured both) 
 

 *  Do not expose internal fields; present user-friendly text only 
 

 

 
Functional Rules 

 *  One template record per asset type per org 
 *  When asset supports both sales skills: 

 *  Template initially stores Hygiene configuration 
 *  User may re-enter and choose Water to add services 
 *  Both sets of services live under the same template record 
 

 *  When User clicks Create template Asset type availability depends on: 

 *  The sales skill child accounts under that H5 org 
 

 *  When User clicks Create template Sales skill dropdown behavior : 

 *  If only Hygiene child account exists ? default = Hygiene, locked 
 *  If only Water child account exists ? default = Water, locked 
 *  If both exist ? default = Hygiene, user may select Water 
 

 

 
User Flow Overview 

 *  Flow A — Configure from Division Template 

 *  User selects an existing division template 
 *  If dual-skill asset: 

 *  Pop-up Displays: 

 *  Org (locked) 
 *  Region (locked) 
 *  Asset type (Locked based on User selection) 
 *  Sales skill (Defaulted to Hygiene and User can changes it to Water) 
 

 

 *  If Single-skill asset: 

 *  Pop-up doesn't get displayed and user is navigated to the Customize Template screen and Sales skill should be shown on that screen 
 

 *  User configures template 
 *  Sales skill label shown on all config screens 
 *  Template saved as one record 
 *  Customized Template gallery shows skill label 
 

 *  Flow B — Create Template from Scratch 

 *  User selects Create Template 
 *  Pop-up displays: 

 *  Org (locked) 
 *  Region (locked) 
 *  Asset type (filtered based on sales skill accounts) 
 *  Sales skill (Derived from Asset Type) 
 

 *  User configures template 
 *  Sales skill label shown throughout 
 *  Template created as single record 
 

 *  Flow C — Edit Existing Template 

 *  User selects template to modify 
 *  Pop-up shows prior sales skill context 
 *  User may switch to the other skill to add more services if the Asset Type is a Dual Sales Skill Asset Type 
 *  Template continues as unified record 
 

 

 
Non-Functional Requirements 

 *  Must not degrade current EC Builder performance 
 *  Must not change template save logic or backend entity structure 
 *  Must preserve CRUD behavior for templates 
 

 
Success Criteria 

 *  User can create/edit templates with clear sales skill context 
 *  System restricts template creation to one per asset type 
 *  Sales skill displays consistently across screens 
 *  Templates representing dual-skill assets show “Hygiene + Water” 
 *  No change to system behavior for single-skill orgs/assets 
 *  No duplicate templates created 
 *  No backward-compatibility impact on existing templates

column8: Technical Spike: Document “Push Template Changes” logic and dependencies in 1C Sales Skill model
column11:
Business Context

 *  Today, “Push Template Changes” updates agreements and related records for all child accounts under an Org (H5) 
 *  With 1C, Water and Hygiene share the same Org Account 
 *  We must understand impact and determine how propagation should work when Sales Skill scope differs 
 

 

 
Objective 

 *  Understand how the Push Template Changes logic works today and define how it needs to evolve for 1C. 
 

 
Scope 

 *  Investigate and document: 
 *  Trigger point and user action 
 *  Entities/tables updated today 
 *  Relationships and filters used today 
 *  Which agreement types are updated (active vs inactive) 
 *  How updates flow to downstream records (Ex: frequency, surfaces, tasks) 
 *  Which records are not updated today (if any) 
 *  Performance considerations 
 

 
Expected Outputs 

 *  End-to-end flow documentation 
 *  List of impacted entities and key fields 
 *  Logic conditions used today 
 *  Clarification on update scope (all accounts vs active only) 
 *  Guidance for applying updates by Sales Skill in 1C 
 *  Recommendations & dev considerations

column22:

 *  A list of changes required to enable Sales Skill filtering in future state is provided 
 *  Proposed approach for modifying logic in 1C is documented

column8: Support Editing Existing Customized Templates with Sales Skill Context & Dual-Skill Configuration (1C)
column11:
As a user editing an existing customized service template,
I need the system to guide me appropriately when a template supports both Water and Hygiene,
 
so that I can update service templates for the correct Sales Skill without confusion or risk of updating the wrong configuration.
 

 
The system must:
 

 *  Preserve existing edit experience when a template belongs to a single Sales Skill (Water-only or Hygiene-only) 
 *  Prompt the user only when the template is shared across both Sales Skills 
 *  Display Sales Skill context clearly throughout the edit process 
 *  Continue supporting the unified template model (one template per asset type, not per Sales Skill)
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Direct navigation when the template is single-skill 

 *  Given the user is on the Customized Templates screen in Enterprise Scope Builder 
 *  When the selected template is associated with only one Sales Skill (Water only or Hygiene only) 
 *  And the user selects Edit Template 
 *  Then the system must open the existing Customize Template screen directly 
 *  And no Sales Skill pop-up should appear 
 *  And the correct Sales Skill must be displayed as read-only context throughout the edit steps 
 

 *  Pop-up required only when template supports both Sales Skills 

 *  Given the user selects Edit Template for a template that applies to both Water and Hygiene 
 *  When the pop-up opens 
 *  Then the pop-up must display: 

 *  Organization Account (read-only) 
 *  Global Region (read-only) 
 *  Asset Type (read-only) 
 *  Sales Skill (editable dropdown) pre-defaulted to Hygiene 
 *  Buttons: Save & Continue / Cancel 
 

 *  And the user must be able to switch Sales Skill between Hygiene and Water 
 *  So that they can choose which Sales Skill layer they are editing 
 

 *  Asset Type locked during edit 

 *  Given the template already exists 
 *  When the Sales Skill pop-up is shown during edit 
 *  Then the Asset Type must be locked  
 *  So that the scope of the template is preserved and not altered during edit 
 

 *  Navigation after pop-up continues standard edit flow 

 *  Given the user selects Save & Continue on the pop-up 
 *  When the user enters the template edit screens 
 *  Then the edit experience should follow the existing Enterprise Scope Builder template modification flow 
 *  And Sales Skill must remain visible throughout the steps 
 

 *  Cancel behavior 

 *  Given the user selects Cancel on the pop-up 
 *  Then the edit flow must close 
 *  And no changes must be applied to the template 
 

 *  System maintains unified template model 

 *  Given the template supports both Water and Hygiene 
 *  When the user edits either configuration 
 *  Then the system must continue to maintain one unified template record 
 *  And not create duplicate templates by Sales Skill

column8: Enhanced Unified Service Template Creation & Sales Skill Handling in Enterprise Scope Builder
column11:
As a user of the Enterprise Scope Builder, I need a unified experience for creating service templates—whether starting from a divisional template or from scratch—so that the correct asset type, sales skill, and country selections drive the template configuration, while ensuring that only one template exists per asset type and that shared Water/Hygiene asset types can be configured cleanly within the same workflow.

 

 
This user flow must support:
 

 *  Hygiene-only division templates 
 *  Water-only division templates 
 *  Division templates applicable to both Water & Hygiene (shared templates) 
 *  Create a new Service Template from Scratch 

 *  Selecting a Water Asset Type 
 *  Selecting a Hygiene Asset Type 
 *  Select an Asset Type that is common for both Hygiene and Water
column19: Moved out of state PO Approved
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 
Please review the attached Visio and PPT to look at the indicative mockups before approving/building this user story 

 *  Starting from a Divisional Template 

 *  Given the user launches Enterprise Scope Builder from an Org Account 

 *  When the user selects Service Templates and chooses an existing divisional template 
 *  Then a full configuration screen must open showing Organization Account, Global Region, Asset Type, Sales Skill, and Country selection. 
 

 

 *  Asset Type and Sales Skill Rules 

 *  Given the configuration screen loads with a pre-selected asset type 

 *  When the asset type is Water-only 
 *  Then Sales Skill must default to Water and be locked. 
 

 *  Given the asset type is Hygiene-only 

 *  When the screen loads 
 *  Then Sales Skill must default to Hygiene and be locked. 
 

 *  Given the asset type is shared between Water and Hygiene 

 *  When the screen loads 
 *  Then Sales Skill must default to Hygiene and remain editable so the user may switch to Water. 
 

 

 *  Global Region Selection Behavior 

 *  Given that the Org Account has a Global Region, 

 *  When the configuration screen loads 
 *  Then the Global Region should be defaulted to the Org Account Global Region, and should be locked for editing 
 

 

 *  Country Selection Behavior  

 *  Given the Org Account has child accounts in multiple countries  

 *  When the configuration screen loads  
 *  Then all applicable countries belonging to the Global Region selected on the Configuration screen must appear with matching checkboxes, and countries must be auto-selected based on child account presence.  
  

 *  Given the country grid is shown  

 *  When the user checks or unchecks any country  
 *  Then the service types shown later must respect only the selected countries. 
 

 

 *  Creating a Template Using “Create Template” Button 

 *  Given the user clicks Create Template 

 *  When the configuration screen loads 
 *  Then Asset Type must be an editable dropdown filtered as follows: 

 *  Given the H5 has only Hygiene child accounts 
 *  Then only Hygiene asset types must appear. 
 *  Given the H5 has only Water child accounts 
 *  Then only Water asset types must appear. 
 *  Given the H5 has both Water and Hygiene child accounts 
 *  Then both Water, Hygiene, and shared asset types must appear. 
 

 

 *  Given the user selects an asset type 

 *  When the asset type is Water-only or Hygiene-only 
 *  Then Sales Skill must auto-populate accordingly and be locked. 
 

 *  Given the user selects a shared asset type 

 *  When the screen refreshes 
 *  Then Sales Skill must default to Hygiene and remain editable. 
 

 

 *  Select Services Screen 

 *  Given users proceed after the initial configuration 

 *  When the Select Services screen loads 
 *  Then the top header must show Organization Account, Global Region, Asset Type, and Sales Skill. 
 *  and all fields on this header should be locked for editing
 
 

 *  Given the asset type and selected countries determine service offerings 

 *  When the screen loads 
 *  Then only service types applicable to the selected asset type and selected countries must appear. 
 

 

 *  Service Template by Asset Screens 

 *  Given the user selected multiple service types 

 *  When the Service Template by Asset screens display 
 *  Then one screen must appear per service type, each showing the same header (Org Account, Region, Asset Type, Sales Skill). 
 

 *  Given the user sets service details 

 *  When they proceed through each screen 
 *  Then all selections must be saved until completion. 
 

 

 *  Dual-Path Flow for Shared Asset Types 

 *  Given the asset type supports both Water and Hygiene 

 *  When the user completes the final Hygiene configuration screen 
 *  Then an additional button must appear: “Continue for Water Sales Skill.” 
 

 

 *  Given the user chooses Continue for Water 

 *  When the next configuration flow begins 
 *  Then the same series of configuration screens must appear, but now for Water. 
 

 *  Given the user clicks Finish at the end of the Water flow 

 *  Then they must be returned to the Service Templates home screen. 
 

 

 *  Finishing Template Creation 

 *  Given the user completes configuration (Hygiene-only, Water-only, or both) 

 *  When the user finishes the workflow 
 *  Then the template must appear in the Customized Templates gallery. 
 

 *  Given the template shows in the gallery 

 *  When displayed 
 *  Then it must include a clear label such as “Hygiene,” “Water,” or “Water + Hygiene.” 
 

 

 *  One Template Rule 

 *  Given a template already exists for a given asset type 
 *  When a user attempts to create another template for the same asset type 
 *  Then the system must prevent creation and direct the user to the existing template instead. 
 

 *  Validate that the same flow is available while editing a customized template

column8: Enable Sales-Skill Aware Push Template behavior in 1C Service Template Model
column11:
As a CAM managing service templates,
I want Push Template Changes to apply only to accounts belonging to the selected Sales Skill (Hygiene or Water),
 
So that updates are applied correctly without impacting accounts from the other Sales Skill.
 

 
In the 1C model, a single Org Account (H5) may contain both Water and Hygiene customer accounts. Today, when a user updates a Service Template and selects Push Template Changes, the system applies updates to all linked child customer accounts and their active agreements.

 
To support 1C behavior, the system must only update agreements and downstream service records for the Sales Skill (Hygiene or Water) associated with the template being modified.
 
If a template supports both skills, the user’s selection during edit should determine which Sales Skill group receives updates.
 
No changes should apply to the other Sales Skill unless explicitly triggered by a separate user action.
 

 
This ensures template propagation is controlled, accurate, and aligned to the future unified customer model.
column19: Moved out of state In Development
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Scenario 1 — Hygiene template update 

 *  Given the SalesOps update a service template with Services only for Hygiene sales skill 
 *  And when user clicks Push Template Changes 
 *  When the system processes template updates 
 *  Then only Hygiene Child Customer accounts and their related Active Service Plans are updated as per the Service Template 

 *  Note: The update should be carried out as per the existing logic 
 

 *  And no Water Child Customer Accounts and their Active Service Plans are changed/updated 
 

 *  Scenario 2 — Water template update 

 *  Given the SalesOps update a service template with Services only for Water sales skill 
 *  And when user clicks Push Template Changes 
 *  When the system processes template updates 
 *  Then only Water Customer Child Customer accounts and their Active Service Plans are updated as per the Service Template 

 *  Note: The update should be carried out as per the existing logic 
 

 *  And no Hygiene Child Customer Accounts and their Active Service Plans are changed/updated 
 

 *  Scenario 3 — Combined template (Water + Hygiene) 

 *  Given SalesOps update a Service Template that contains with Services for Water & Hygiene sales skill 
 *  And when user clicks Push Template Changes 
 *  Then any changes to Schedules/Activities/Sub Tasks linked to Water Service Type changes should apply to Water Sales Skill Account Active Service Plans and any changes to Schedules/Activities linked to Hygiene Service Type changes should apply to Hygiene Hygiene Sales Skill Account Active Service Plans

column8: Enable Sales Skill Selection When Creating Template (Create Template Button) (1C)
column11:
As a user creating a new Service Template in the Enterprise Scope Builder,
I need the system to intelligently filter asset types and guide me to select the appropriate Sales Skill
 
so that I can create templates correctly for Water or Hygiene, without having to understand internal template logic.
 

 
This functionality must support orgs with:
 

 *  Only Hygiene accounts 
 *  Only Water accounts 
 *  Both Hygiene & Water accounts 
 

 
The platform must continue to maintain one unified template record per asset type, and not create separate templates per Sales Skill.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Pop-up must display when user clicks Create Template 

 *  Given the user is on the Service Templates screen in Enterprise Scope Builder 
 *  When the user selects Create Template 
 *  Then the system must open a pop-up titled “Create Template” 
 *  And the pop-up must display the following fields: 

 *  Organization Account (read-only) 
 *  Global Region (read-only) 
 *  Asset Type (selectable auto filtered as shown below) 
 *  Sales Skill (system-driven, refer below) 
 *  Save & Continue and Cancel buttons 
 

 

 *  Asset Type options filtered based on Org’s linked sales skill accounts 

 *  Given the user opens the Create Template pop-up 
 *  When the system determines which sales skill accounts are linked under the Org 
 *  Then the Asset Type dropdown must only show asset types applicable to those sales skills 
 *  So that the user cannot select an invalid combination. 
 *  Examples: 

 *  If the org has only Hygiene accounts ? only Hygiene-relevant asset types should appear 
 *  If the org has only Water accounts ? only Water-relevant asset types should appear 
 *  If the org has both Water and Hygiene accounts ? both Water- and Hygiene-relevant asset types should appear 
 

 

 *  Sales Skill defaulting and locking 

 *  Given the user selects an asset type in the pop-up 
 *  When the asset type corresponds to only one sales skill (Water-only or Hygiene-only) 
 *  Then the Sales Skill must default to that value and be locked for editing 
 *  Given the user selects an asset type that can be used by both Water and Hygiene 
 *  When the pop-up appears 
 *  Then the Sales Skill must default to Hygiene 
 *  And must be editable so user may switch to Water 
 

 *  Sales Skill must be visible through the template creation journey 

 *  Given the user proceeds past the pop-up 
 *  When they navigate through each screen in the template creation process 

 *  Create Division Template screen 
 *  Service Template by Asset screen(s) 
 

 *  Then the Sales Skill selected must be clearly displayed on each step 
 *  So that the user always knows which Sales Skill they are configuring the template for. 
 

 *  Save & Continue moves into standard template creation flow 

 *  Given the user selects Save & Continue 
 *  When they move into template configuration screens 
 *  Then all UI steps should behave as today 
 *  Except Sales Skill must remain visible 
 

 *  Template record saved and visible 

 *  Given the user completes the template creation and selects Finish 
 *  When the template is successfully created 
 *  Then the new template must appear in the Customized Templates list 
 *  And the template must indicate which Sales Skill it represents (Hygiene, Water, or Both) 
 

 *  Cancel stops the template creation 

 *  Given the user selects Cancel 
 *  When the pop-up closes 
 *  Then no template should be created and nothing should be saved.

column8: Automated Creation and Completion of Hygiene Site Service Templates (Post-SOW Activation)
column11:
As a user,
I want hygiene Site Service Templates to be automatically created when a Scope of Work (SOW) is activated,
 
and I want to edit and complete those templates using the enterprise service-template experience,
 
so that hygiene service expectations flow correctly into service templates and downstream planning tools.
 

 
This automated template must follow all rules for asset type, sales skill, frequency display, header improvements, and filtering logic, while ensuring no Water-related SOW ever triggers a template.
column19: Moved out of state PO Approved
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 
Before Approving/Developing this user story, please review the attached mockups and visios  

 *  Auto-creation only for Hygiene SOWs 

 *  Given a user activates a Scope of Work 

 *  When the SOW is associated with the Hygiene sales skill 
 *  Then the system must auto-create a Site Service Template. 
 *  Note: Follow the exiting logic of Template creation for F&B. For 1C accounts the flow should only trigger for only Hygiene SOW's. 
 

 *  Given a SOW is associated with Water 

 *  When it is activated 
 *  Then no site asset or service template should be auto-created. 
 

 

 *  Auto-created template opens in the Customize Template screen 

 *  Given a hygiene template is auto-created 

 *  When the user selects “Edit Template” 
 *  Then the system must open the Customize Template screen with the unified header containing: (All fields on this header should be locked for editing) 

 *  Organization Account (locked) 
 *  Global Region (Auto Populated from the H5 account and is locked) 
 *  Asset Type (locked – “Site”) 
 *  Sales Skill (defaulted to Hygiene) 
 *  Countries in scope (pre-selected based on linked child accounts, user-editable) 
 

 *  And Then the header must follow the updated layout to improve readability and provide additional space for service types. 
 

 

 *  Asset Type and Sales Skill Behavior 

 *  Given the auto-created template is for a Site asset (common to both sales skills) 

 *  Then Sales Skill must default to Hygiene and remain editable, allowing the user to switch to Water later. 
 

 *  Given an asset type is Water-only or Hygiene-only  

 *  Then Sales Skill must be locked to the corresponding value.  
 

 

 *  Country Selection Rules 

 *  Given the template is auto-created 

 *  Then the list of countries must automatically reflect the countries of child accounts under the H5 organization account. 
 *  When the user opens the template 
 *  Then country checkboxes must be pre-selected and remain editable. 
 

 

 *  Frequency Display Rules (New Requirement)  

 *  Given a service type has multiple possible frequencies (e.g., monthly & quarterly)  

 *  When the service type appears in the template  
 *  Then each frequency must be displayed on a separate line.  
 *  Example:  
 *  Service Type: Equipment Check  
 *  Frequencies: Monthly + Quarterly  
 *  Two lines must appear, one per frequency.  
  

 *  Given templates are auto-created from SOW  

 *  Then frequency lines must reflect the offerings selected in the SOW. 
 

 

 *  “Service Templates by Asset” screen – One screen per service type 

 *  Given the user clicks Next from the Customize Template screen 

 *  Then the system must open the Service Templates by Asset flow with: 
 *  One screen per Service Type 
 *  Each screen showing: 

 *  Asset Type 
 *  Service Type 
 *  Estimated Frequency (one line per frequency) 
 *  Country 
 *  Sales Skill 
 

 

 *  Given multiple offerings map to the same service type 

 *  Then the system must still show the correct “frequency lines” from the SOW. 
 

 

 *  User Selection of Frequencies 

 *  Given the template is auto-created 
 *  Then the user must be able to adjust or confirm frequency choices for each service type. 
 

 *  Water continuation option 

 *  Given the asset type is common between Hygiene and Water 

 *  When the user reaches the final screen 
 *  Then the system must show: 

 *  Finish (Hygiene completed) 
 *  Continue for Water Sales Skill (optional) 
 

 *  When the user clicks “Continue for Water Sales Skill” 
 *  Then the Water template must open with the same asset type and country selections, but fresh frequency selections. 
 

 

 *  Saving and returning to templates 

 *  Given the user clicks Finish 
 *  Then the completed template must be saved 
 *  And Then the user must return to the Service Templates screen 
 *  And Then the template must display in the grid with a clear Sales Skill label: 

 *  Hygiene 
 *  Water 
 *  Both Water & Hygiene 
 

 

 *  One template per asset type per organization 

 *  Given a template is created (manual or auto) 
 *  Then the system must maintain the rule: 
 *  One asset type template per org account, 
 *  even if both sales skills are configured.

column9: Automated Creation and Completion of Hygiene Site Service Templates (Post-SOW Activation) - Fix
column11:
As a user,
I want hygiene Site Service Templates to be automatically created when a Scope of Work (SOW) is activated,
 
and I want to edit and complete those templates using the enterprise service-template experience,
 
so that hygiene service expectations flow correctly into service templates and downstream planning tools.
 

 
This automated template must follow all rules for asset type, sales skill, frequency display, header improvements, and filtering logic, while ensuring no Water-related SOW ever triggers a template.

column8: Regression Testing of CRM Service Plan Records Created via Service Plan Builder Power App post-conversion of Ship-To to Site.
column11:
Regression Testing of the end-to-end process of Service Plan building in the Power App post conversion of Ship-To to Site and account merges. 
 
 

 

 
Business ProcessFlow: 
1.CAMdefines SOW usingthe Enterprise Scope Builder. 
2.ServiceTemplates are created forasset types or sites. 
3.SalesRep/DM launches Service Plan Builder from the CRM account. 
4.Planis created withselected services and frequencies. 
5.Schedulesand service records are auto-generated in CRM. 
6.Validationand activation ofthe plan triggers service visits. 
7.PDFexport allowssharing with customers. 
8.KeyFeatures: 
9.Auto-populationof site and contact data from CRM. 
10.Customizationof service frequency and scope. 
11.Abilityto add services beyond the template. 
12.PDFexport for customer communication 


Requirement 

Conduct regression testing to validate the stability, accuracy, and completeness of CRM service plan records generated through the Service Plan Builder Power App. This ensures that updates, schema changes, and OneCustomer integrations do not disrupt existing workflows or data integrity. 

Business Objective 

To ensure that service plan records created via the Power App remain functional and reliable across Water and Hygiene divisions by: 

 *  Verifying that service plans are correctly generated, stored, and linked in CRM. 
 *  Confirming that business rules, templates, and downstream integrations remain intact. 
 *  Supporting uninterrupted service delivery and reporting across merged and legacy accounts. 
 

Requirements In Scope 

 *  Regression testing of:

 *  Launch behavior of the Power App from CRM child account records. 
 *  Template logic for recurring services (asset-level for Water, site-level for Hygiene). 
 *  Service plan customization and validation workflows. 
 *  Creation of service visit records in CRM upon activation. 
 *  PDF export functionality for customer-facing documents. 
 

 
 *  Validation of:

 *  Site-level schema updates and hierarchy realignment. 
 *  Business rules tied to Ship-To and Sold-To fields. 
 *  Role-based access and visibility for CAMs, DMs, Reps, and OPS Admins. 
 *  Integration with Ecolab 3D and Asset Harvester. 
 

 
 

Technical Considerations & Configuration 

 *  CRM hosts the Power App and stores service plans and schedules. 
 *  Asset Harvester supplies asset data (currently missing for Hygiene). 
 *  Ecolab 3D receives service reports generated from service plans. 
 *  PDF export logic must be tested for formatting and completeness. 
 *  CRM automation flows and plug-ins must be validated for compatibility. 
 *  Regression test scenarios should include:

 *  Launching the app from CRM. 
 *  Selecting and customizing service templates. 
 *  Validating service plan creation and downstream record generation. 
 *  Testing business rules tied to Ship-To/Sold-To transitions. 
 *  Confirming correct provisioning of automation programs post-account merges. 
 

 
 

User Interface Configuration 

 *  Sales Reps and DMs launch the Power App from CRM account records. 
 *  CAMs define Scope of Work (SOW) records that guide service plan creation. 
 *  OPS Admins manage hygiene templates due to lack of asset-level data. 
 *  UI elements must be tested for responsiveness, accuracy, and usability. 
 *  Ensure dropdowns, buttons, and form logic behave consistently across divisions. 
 

Security & Data Governance 

 *  Role-based access must be validated for all personas. 
 *  Audit trails for service plan creation and updates must remain intact. 
 *  Data integrity checks for merged accounts and site-level schema changes. 
 *  Governance over template usage and asset data loading confirmed. 
 *  Ensure compliance with reporting and regulatory requirements tied to service plans. 
 


Context
 
Service Plans are generated by the Service Plan Builder Power App, which enables Sales Representatives (Reps) and District Managers (DMs) to define, schedule, and manage recurring service activities for customer accounts. It automates the creation of service records in CRM based on predefined templates or custom configurations, ensuring consistency and reducing manual effort. The app supports both Water and Hygiene business units, though Hygiene currently operates at a site level due to missing asset data. 
Groups
Water & Hygiene 
Personas 

 *  Corporate Account Managers (CAMs): Define the Scope of Work (SOW) at the organization level. 
 *  Sales Representatives (Reps): Create and customize service plans at the customer account level. 
 *  District Managers (DMs): Create and customize service plans at the customer account level. 
 *  OPS Admins: For Hygiene accounts, they are responsible for creating service plans and templates due to lack of asset-level data. 
 

Downstream Systems / Integration 

 *  CRM: Hosts the app and stores service plans and schedules. 
 *  Asset Harvester: Supplies asset data (currently missing for Hygiene). 
 *  Ecolab 3D: Receives service reports generated from plans. 
 *  PDF Export: Allows sharing of service plans with customers, though not integrated into contracts. 
 

Impact Considerations 

 *  Account Type:

 *  Water: Uses asset-level templates. 
 *  Hygiene: Uses site-level templates due to missing asset data. 
 

 
 *  Ship-To vs Site:

 *  Field Services: Tie services to Ship-To. 
 *  Sales/District Teams: Tie services to Site. 
 

 
 *  Standalone (Street) Accounts: Follow similar process but without parent org account linkage. 
 

Business Process Flow 

 *  CAM defines SOW using the Enterprise Scope Builder. 
 *  Service Templates are created for asset types or sites. 
 *  Sales Rep/DM launches Service Plan Builder from the CRM account. 
 *  Plan is created with selected services and frequencies. 
 *  Schedules and service records are auto-generated in CRM. 
 *  Validation and activation of the plan triggers service visits. 
 *  PDF export allows sharing with customers. 
 

Key Features 

 *  Auto-population of site and contact data from CRM. 
 *  Customization of service frequency and scope. 
 *  Ability to add services beyond the template. 
 *  PDF export for customer communication.

column8: Regression Testing - Link a VAS to a TSR, Opportunity (Retain to Win), TVD program record-  Post Sales Skill Implementation
column11:
As a user, post-Global business shift to Sales Skill, I shall have the ability to link a Value Added Services (VAS) supplemental service record to a TSR, Opportunity Retain to Win, TVD program, or Retain to Win record so that the business motivation behind the service is clearly documented.
 
 


Context
This applies to District Services. Value Added Services (VAS) are supplemental service records tied to customer accounts and Service Activities (Originating Service Activity), used to document and track technical services such as lab analysis, test kits, and other support activities. VAS records help link TSRs (Technical Service Requests) to business motivations like opportunities, TVD programs, or Retain to Win records. They are essential for reporting, billing, and service execution.

Business Process Flow  
VAS records can be created in four ways: 

 *  Manual Entry

 *  Sales Rep clicks “+ New Value Added Service” on the account screen. 
 *  Selects type and value from dropdowns filtered by global business. 
 

 
 *  Via TSR (Life Sciences only)

 *  TSR creation triggers automatic VAS record. 
 *  Motivation (Gain/Grow/Retain) determines mandatory fields (e.g., Opportunity or Retain to Win). 
 

 
 *  Via Service Activity

 *  Sales Rep checks a box during service activity closure. 
 *  Enters VAS type and value. 
 *  System links VAS to the originating service activity. 
 

 
 *  Bulk Upload (Food & Beverage only)

 *  Quarterly or monthly loads submitted via ticket to Client Care. 
 *  Prebuilt package imports VAS records for lab analysis and test kits.
Groups 
 

 
 

 *  Life Sciences Division: Has automated VAS creation linked to TSRs. 
 *  Food & Beverage Division: Uses bulk upload packages for VAS creation. 
 


 
Personas

 *  Sales Representatives: Primary creators of VAS records, either manually or through TSRs or service activities. 
 *  Account Team Members: Can also create VAS records if they have access to the account. 
 *  Field Service Technicians: May contribute to VAS creation via service activities (limited to district visits). 
 *  Client Care Team: Manages bulk upload imports via prebuilt packages.
Downstream Systems/Integration 
 *  CRM Dynamics: Hosts VAS records and links them to TSRs, opportunities, and service activities. 
 *  SAP/EBS: VAS data may influence billing arrangements and service order creation. 
 *  Reporting Systems: VAS records are used for performance tracking and customer insights. 
 

 

Impact Considerations

 *  VAS visibility and required fields are driven by global business and sales skill. 
 *  Future state will hide global business and surface sales skill instead.
column22:
No CRM Dev Needed 

 
  Scenario: Automatically create VAS record via TSR (Life Sciences only) 
    Given I create a TSR in the Life Sciences division 
    When the TSR is submitted 
    Then a VAS record should be automatically created 
    And the system should require linking to Opportunity or Retain to Win based on Gain/Grow/Retain motivation 

 
  Scenario: Create VAS record via Service Activity closure 
    Given I am closing a Service Activity 
    When I check the box to create a VAS record 
    And I enter the VAS type and value 
    Then the system should link the VAS record to the originating Service Activity 
    And allow linking to TSR, Opportunity, TVD Program, or Retain to Win record 

  Scenario: Bulk upload VAS records (Food & Beverage only) 
    Given I am part of the Client Care Team 
    When I submit a bulk upload package for lab analysis or test kits 
    Then the system should import VAS records 
    And link each record to the appropriate TSR, Opportunity, TVD Program, or Retain to Win record 

  Scenario: Visibility and field behavior driven by Sales Skill 
    Given I am creating or viewing a VAS record 
    Then the dropdowns and required fields should be filtered and displayed based on Sales Skill 
    And global business should no longer be visible

column8: Regression Testing - Existing end-to-end process of Reoccurring Services for District Team functionality within the Service Plan Builder Power App
column11:
Business ProcessFlow: 
1.CAMdefinesSOW usingEnterprise Scope Builder. 
2.ServiceTemplates are created forasset types or sites. 
3.SalesRep/DM launches Service Plan Builder from CRM account. 
4.Planis created withselected services and frequencies. 
5.Schedulesand service records are auto-generated in CRM. 
6.Validationand activation ofthe plan triggers service visits. 
7.PDFexport allowssharing with customers. 

Requirement 

Conduct regression testing of the full end-to-end process for reoccurring services managed by District Teams using the Service Plan Builder Power App. This includes validating service plan creation, scheduling, execution, and downstream integrations to ensure continuity and accuracy post system updates and account merges. 

Business Objective 

To ensure that the Service Plan Builder Power App continues to support consistent and automated service delivery across Water and Hygiene divisions by: 

 *  Validating that service plans and recurring schedules are correctly generated and executed. 
 *  Ensuring integration with CRM, SAP/EBS, Asset Harvester, and Ecolab 3D remains stable. 
 *  Supporting District Managers and Sales Representatives in managing service commitments aligned with Scope of Work (SOW) agreements. 
 

Requirements In Scope 

 *  Regression testing of:

 *  Service plan creation from predefined templates or custom configurations. 
 *  Auto-generation of service visits based on recurring schedules. 
 *  Assignment of preferred technicians and service times. 
 *  Validation of billing arrangements and routing logic. 
 *  PDF export of service plans for customer communication. 
 

 
 *  Validation of:

 *  Ship-To vs. Site logic for service location. 
 *  Field visibility and required inputs based on account type and global business. 
 *  Integration with SAP Work Centers and transition to EBS SER codes. 
 *  Mapping of ZR codes to SER codes for billing and reporting. 
 *  Data migration logic for existing service plans and attachments. 
 

 
 

Technical Considerations & Configuration 

 *  CRM Dynamics hosts service plan records and schedules. 
 *  Asset Harvester supplies asset data (currently missing for Hygiene). 
 *  Ecolab 3D receives service reports generated from service visits. 
 *  SAP Work Centers used for routing and billing; transitioning to EBS requires mapping. 
 *  Flat file feeds update BA master data from SAP BW; future integration with EBS is pending. 
 *  Activity types tied to labor rates and billing must be confirmed for compatibility with EBS. 
 *  One-time setup required for service type master data; not dynamically integrated. 
 *  Technical spike needed to validate field requirements across service visit forms. 
 

User Interface Configuration 

 *  Sales Representatives and District Managers launch the Power App from CRM account records. 
 *  CAMs define SOWs that guide service plan creation. 
 *  OPS Admins manage hygiene templates due to lack of asset-level data. 
 *  UI must support:

 *  Auto-population of site and contact data. 
 *  Customization of service frequency and scope. 
 *  Review and validation of schedules and service records. 
 *  Bulk validation of service line items. 
 *  PDF export for customer-facing documentation. 
 

 
 

Security & Data Governance 

 *  Role-based access must be validated for CAMs, Reps, DMs, OPS Admins, and Technicians. 
 *  Audit trails for service plan creation, updates, and execution must remain intact. 
 *  Data integrity checks required for merged accounts and site-level schema changes. 
 *  Governance over template usage, billing arrangements, and asset data loading confirmed. 
 *  Compliance with reporting and regulatory requirements tied to service visits and billing. 
 


 
Business Process Flow 

 *  CAM defines SOW using Enterprise Scope Builder. 
 *  Service Templates are created for asset types or sites. 
 *  Sales Rep/DM launches Service Plan Builder from CRM account. 
 *  Plan is created with selected services and frequencies. 
 *  Schedules and service records are auto-generated in CRM. 
 *  Validation and activation of the plan triggers service visits. 
 *  PDF export allows sharing with customers.

Requirement 

Conduct full regression testing of the Service Plan Builder Power App within CRM to ensure that all existing functionality remains stable and accurate following updates, site hierarchy changes, and OneCustomer integrations. 

Business Objective 

To validate the reliability and performance of the Service Plan Builder Power App across Water and Hygiene business units by: 

 *  Ensuring service plan creation and customization workflows remain intact. 
 *  Confirming compatibility with CRM, Asset Harvester, and Ecolab 3D. 
 *  Preserving user experience for Sales Representatives, District Managers, and OPS Admins. 
 *  Supporting business continuity during structural changes and data migrations. 
 

Requirements In Scope 

 *  Regression testing of:

 *  Launch behavior from CRM child account records. 
 *  Template logic for recurring services (asset-level for Water, site-level for Hygiene). 
 *  Service plan customization and validation workflows. 
 *  PDF export functionality for customer-facing documents. 
 *  CRM record creation and downstream reporting triggers. 
 

 
 *  Validation of:

 *  Site-level schema updates and hierarchy realignment. 
 *  Business rules and automation flows tied to Ship-To and Sold-To fields. 
 *  Role-based access and visibility for CAMs, DMs, Reps, and OPS Admins. 
 *  Integration with Ecolab 3D and Asset Harvester. 
 

 
 

Technical Considerations & Configuration 

 *  CRM hosts the Power App and stores service plans and schedules. 
 *  Asset Harvester supplies asset data (currently missing for Hygiene). 
 *  Ecolab 3D receives service reports generated from service plans. 
 *  PDF export logic must be tested for formatting and completeness. 
 *  CRM automation flows and plug-ins must be validated for compatibility. 
 *  Regression test scenarios should include:

 *  Launching the app from CRM. 
 *  Selecting and customizing service templates. 
 *  Validating service plan creation and downstream record generation. 
 *  Testing business rules tied to Ship-To/Sold-To transitions. 
 

 
 

User Interface Configuration 

 *  Sales Reps and DMs launch the Power App from CRM account records. 
 *  CAMs define Scope of Work (SOW) records that guide service plan creation. 
 *  OPS Admins manage hygiene templates due to lack of asset-level data. 
 *  UI elements must be tested for responsiveness, accuracy, and usability. 
 *  Ensure dropdowns, buttons, and form logic behave consistently across divisions. 
 

Security & Data Governance 

 *  Role-based access must be validated for all personas. 
 *  Audit trails for service plan creation and updates must remain intact. 
 *  Data integrity checks for merged accounts and site-level schema changes. 
 *  Governance over template usage and asset data loading confirmed. 
 *  Ensure compliance with reporting and regulatory requirements tied to service plans. 
 


 
 
 
Context
The Service Plan Builder Power App is designed to streamline the creation of recurring service plans for customer accounts. It enables Sales Representatives (Reps) and District Managers (DMs) to define service schedules based on predefined templates or custom configurations. The app automates the generation of service records in CRM, reducing manual effort and ensuring consistency across Water and Hygiene business units. 
Groups 

 *  Water 
 *  Hygiene 
 

Personas 

 *  District Manager: Uses this to generate service plans for accounts. 
 *  Field Services Reps: Do NOT use the Service Plan Builder Power App. 
 *  Corporate Account Managers (CAMs): Define the Scope of Work (SOW) at the organization level. 
 *  Sales Representatives (Reps): Use the app to create and customize service plans at the customer account level. 
 *  District Managers (DMs): Use the app to create and customize service plans at the customer account level. 
 *  OPS Admins: For Hygiene accounts, responsible for creating service plans and templates due to lack of asset-level data. 
 

Downstream Systems / Integration 

 *  CRM: Hosts the app and stores service plans and schedules. Records are added to CRM per the Service Plan Builder entries. 
 *  Asset Harvester: Supplies asset data (currently missing for Hygiene). 
 *  Ecolab 3D: Receives service reports generated from plans. 
 *  PDF Export: Allows sharing of service plans with customers (not integrated into contracts). 
 

Impact Considerations 

 *  Account Type: No changes required. 
 *  Water: Uses asset-level templates. 
 *  Hygiene: Uses site-level templates due to missing asset data. 
 *  Ship-To vs Site: Changes required.

 *  Field Services: Tie services to Ship-To. 
 *  Sales/District Teams: Tie services to Site. 
 

 
 *  For Org Accounts where Global Business value will not be populated, the Service Plan Builder and SOW Builder will not work.

 *  Determine if a manual workaround is available. 
 *  Determine if this is R1 or R2 scope. 
 

 
 

Business Process Flow 

 *  CAM defines SOW using the Enterprise Scope Builder. 
 *  Sales Rep/DM launches Service Plan Builder from the CRM account by selecting the “Power App” button. 
 *  Sales Rep/DM opens Service Plan Builder. 
 *  Sales Rep/DM selects Create. 
 *  Sales Rep/DM inputs the Service Plan details:

 *  Site Account 
 *  Customer Contact 
 

 
 *  Sales Rep/DM creates the plan with selected services and frequencies. 
 *  Sales Rep/DM selects Customer Contact and Ecolab District Team members who will receive the Service Reports. 
 *  Sales Rep/DM reviews the SOW (no edits allowed). 
 *  Sales Rep/DM creates/edits/reviews the schedules (as defined by the SOW Service Plan Template). 
 *  Schedules and service records are auto-generated in CRM. 
 *  Sales Rep/DM reviews District Services previously created, creates new, or edits:

 *  Bulk validate or validate individual line items 
 *  Validation and activation of the plan triggers service visits. 
 

 
 

Key Features 

 *  Auto-population of site and contact data from CRM 
 *  Customization of service frequency and scope 
 *  Ability to add services beyond the template 
 *  PDF export for customer communication
