column7: CRM: Regression Testing of Scope of Work in CRM
column11:
Requirement 

Conduct comprehensive regression testing of the Scope of Work (SOW) functionality in CRM to ensure that all existing features continue to perform as expected following updates, enhancements, or integrations. 

Business Objective 

To validate the stability and reliability of the SOW functionality across Water and Hygiene business units by: 

 *  Ensuring no disruption to service plan creation and execution. 
 *  Confirming compatibility with integrated systems (e.g., Ecolab 3D, Asset Harvester). 
 *  Supporting consistent user experience for CAMs, DMs, Reps, and Field Services. 
 *  Maintaining data integrity and compliance during migrations and updates. 
 

Requirements In Scope 

 *  Regression testing of:

 *  SOW creation via Enterprise Scope Builder. 
 *  Service plan generation from SOW records. 
 *  PDF export functionality. 
 *  Asset-level and site-level template usage. 
 *  Role-based access and record visibility. 
 *  Integration with Ecolab 3D and Asset Harvester. 
 

 
 *  Validation of:

 *  One active SOW per account per time period. 
 *  Migration logic for legacy SOW documents. 
 *  Automated org account creation during onboarding. 
 

 
 

Technical Considerations & Configuration 

 *  CRM stores SOW and service plan records. 
 *  Dataverse used for team member and contact data. 
 *  PDF export tested for formatting and completeness. 
 *  Asset Harvester integration verified for Water and Hygiene. 
 *  Data conversion rules tested for accuracy and completeness. 
 *  End-to-end regression test scenarios include:

 *  SOW creation, activation, and service plan linkage. 
 *  Role-based access and permissions. 
 *  Template selection and customization. 
 

 
 

User Interface Configuration 

 *  CAMs initiate and manage SOW records from CRM account view. 
 *  Reps and DMs access service plans derived from SOWs. 
 *  OPS Admins manage hygiene templates and asset data. 
 *  UI elements tested for consistency, responsiveness, and usability. 
 

Security & Data Governance 

 *  Role-based access tested for CAMs, Reps, DMs, OPS Admins, and Field Services. 
 *  Validation workflows ensure data integrity before activation. 
 *  Migration logic tested for completeness and accuracy. 
 *  Governance over template usage and asset data loading confirmed. 
 

Context
The Scope of Work (SOW) functionality in CRM enables Corporate Account Managers (CAMs) to define service expectations at the organizational account level. These expectations guide District Managers (DMs) and Sales Representatives (Reps) on what services to perform at customer sites. The SOW acts as a directional tool, outlining commitments such as frequency of visits, types of services, and reporting requirements. It supports both Water and Hygiene business units, with differences in asset-level versus site-level service definitions.
SOW Org accounts are a grouping which can span across districts. 
Downstream Systems / Integration 

 *  CRM: Central system for managing accounts, SOWs, and service plans. 
 *  Asset Harvester: Supplies asset data to CRM (currently missing for Hygiene). 
 *  Ecolab 3D: Receives service reports and sends them to selected recipients. 
 *  Dataverse: Shared tables used for team member and contact data. 
 *  PDF Export: Allows sharing of service plans with customers manually. 
 

Impact Considerations 

 *  Water Business: Services are tied to site values. No change required. 
 *  Field Services Team: Services are tied to ship-to values. R1 data conversion requirement. 
 *  Hygiene Business: Operates at site level only due to lack of asset data. No change required. 
 *  Standalone (Street) Accounts: No parent org account; SOW and service plans are created directly at the customer account level. 
 *  Documents (PDFs of SOWs) will need to be migrated as part of OneCustomer efforts. 
 

Groups
Water & Hygiene 
Personas 

 *  Corporate Account Managers (CAMs): Create and manage SOWs at the organization account level. Select features within the Enterprise Scope Builder Power App that are related to the SOW. 
 *  District Managers (DMs): Reference SOWs to build service plans and execute site-level services. 
 *  Sales Reps: Reference SOWs to build service plans and execute site-level services. Water reps set up the SOW & Service Plans. 
 *  OPS Admins: Particularly for Hygiene accounts, they manage SOW creation and service templates. 
 *  Field Services Team: Execute services based on recurring service records, separate from district team plans. 
 

Business Process Flow 

 *  Operations team creates the CRM Account record. 
 *  CAM initiates SOW creation via the Enterprise Scope Builder app on a CRM organization account record. 
 *  CAM enters SOW inputs:

 *  Name, start/end dates 
 *  Selected service commitments (e.g., business reviews, entry/exit meetings, weekly visits) 
 *  Comments for context 
 

 
 *  Service Plan Builder: Reps use this to create service plans based on SOW guidance. 
 *  Customization: Reps can adjust frequency or add services as needed. 
 *  CAM activates the SOW: Only one active SOW per time period is allowed.

 *  Validation and Activation: Final review and activation of service plans generate recurring service records. 
 *  CRM Asset Type Template records are auto-generated.

 *  Ensure compliance with reporting and regulatory requirements tied to service plans. 
 


Context
 
Service Plans are generated by the Service Plan Builder Power App, which enables Sales Representatives (Reps) and District Managers (DMs) to define, schedule, and manage recurring service activities for customer accounts. It automates the creation of service records in CRM based on predefined templates or custom configurations, ensuring consistency and reducing manual effort. The app supports both Water and Hygiene business units, though Hygiene currently operates at a site level due to missing asset data. 
Groups
Water & Hygiene 
Personas 

 *  Corporate Account Managers (CAMs): Define the Scope of Work (SOW) at the organization level. 
 *  Sales Representatives (Reps): Create and customize service plans at the customer account level. 
 *  District Managers (DMs): Create and customize service plans at the customer account level. 
 *  OPS Admins: For Hygiene accounts, they are responsible for creating service plans and templates due to lack of asset-level data. 
 

Downstream Systems / Integration 

 *  CRM: Hosts the app and stores service plans and schedules. 
 *  Asset Harvester: Supplies asset data (currently missing for Hygiene). 
 *  Ecolab 3D: Receives service reports generated from plans. 
 *  PDF Export: Allows sharing of service plans with customers, though not integrated into contracts. 
 

Impact Considerations 

 *  Account Type:

 *  Water: Uses asset-level templates. 
 *  Hygiene: Uses site-level templates due to missing asset data. 
 

 
 *  Ship-To vs Site:

 *  Field Services: Tie services to Ship-To. 
 *  Sales/District Teams: Tie services to Site. 
 

 
 *  Standalone (Street) Accounts: Follow similar process but without parent org account linkage. 
 

Business Process Flow 

 *  CAM defines SOW using the Enterprise Scope Builder. 
 *  Service Templates are created for asset types or sites. 
 *  Sales Rep/DM launches Service Plan Builder from the CRM account. 
 *  Plan is created with selected services and frequencies. 
 *  Schedules and service records are auto-generated in CRM. 
 *  Validation and activation of the plan triggers service visits. 
 *  PDF export allows sharing with customers. 
 

Key Features 

 *  Auto-population of site and contact data from CRM. 
 *  Customization of service frequency and scope. 
 *  Ability to add services beyond the template. 
 *  PDF export for customer communication.

column6: CRM: Power App - Equipment Ordering App - Regression Testing Only
column11:
Equipment Ordering Power Apps: 
•CommercialAutomation Power App was not discussed as the appropriate parties were not onthe call. To be discussed in a follow-up session.  
•EquipmentOrdering app was discussed  

 
•BusinessPurpose and Overview 
•Enablessales reps to create and submit customized equipment orders forautomation programs.(CPQ) 
•Usedto configure and submit customized equipment orders basedon predefined automation programs.  
•Generatesa request using a standard offering as a base which is then modified bythe requestor,andsends it to the SAP engineering team for manual entry into EBS  
•Sendspurchase requests to the SAP engineering team via email for manual processingin EBS. 
•Learnings: 
•Standalone tool:Not integrated with SAP or other systems. 
•Master data is static and rarely updated;changes require manual import. 
•No historical data impact:Existing requests already processed in SAP remain unaffected. 
•CRM is the trigger system,but not the source of truth for automation provisioning. 
•.PersonasInvolved 
•Sales Reps: Initiate and configure equipmentorders. 
•Engineering Team:Reviews, generates custom quote for the order request, and approves requestsvia email. 
•CRM Admins: Manage master data and accountstructures. 
•Commercial Automation Team:Oversees automation program provisioning and access. 
•Summaryof Usage and Process 
•SalesReps select an automation program and define order type (new, existing,replacement). 
•Appauto-populates controller and module combinations from CRM master data. 
•SalesReps can adjust quantities and add comments. 
•Uponsubmission, the app sends an email to a predefined SAP group for approval. 
•Approvedrequests are manually entered into SAP; no direct integration exists. 
•Use of Account Ship-To 
•Shippingaddress defaults to Sold-To account but can be manually overridden. 
•Customaddresses entered in the app do not update CRM’s ship-to fields. 
•Useof Sites 
•Notdirectly tied to CRM site records. 
•Sitecontext is relevant for automation program provisioning but not for equipmentorder submission. 
•MasterData Management 
•Masterdata (controllers, modules, part numbers) is rarely updated. 
•Updatesare done via Excel import or advanced find in Dynamics; no UI forms exist forthis. 
•Impactof OneCustomer Initiative 
•Theapp is standalone and not directly impacted by account merges. 
•Merginghygiene accounts may require alignment of automation programs and master data. 
•Businessinput is needed to determine which values (e.g., unit of measure, billingsystem) should be retained  
 CRM and Equipment OrderPower App Process Flow 
1.AccountSetup in CRM 
1.Salesreps begin by accessing a customer account in CRM. 
2.Theaccount includes prepopulated fields such as account number, manager details,segment, and address. 
2.AutomationProgram Selection 
1.Repsselect from predefined automation programs (e.g., for dairy farms). 
2.Eachprogram is linked to specific controllers and modules, which are stored asmaster data in CRM. 
3.OrderType and Delivery Details 
1.Repsspecify the order type (new customer, existing customer, or part replacement). 
2.Deliverydate is auto-calculated but can be manually adjusted. 
3.Shippingaddress defaults to the Sold-To account but can be overridden with a customaddress (not stored in CRM). 
4.Launchingthe Equipment Order Power App 
1.Repsclick a button in CRM to launch the Power App in a new tab. 
2.Theapp pulls in account and automation program data from CRM. 
5.Configurationof Equipment Order 
1.Theapp displays controller and module combinations based on the selectedautomation program. 
2.Eachmodule includes predefined part numbers and quantities. 
3.Repscan adjust quantities and add comments as needed. 
6.OrderSummary and Submission 
1.Repsreview the order summary and submit the request. 
2.Submissiontriggers an email to a predefined SAP group mailbox. 
3.Therequest is stored in Dataverse with a "submitted" status.  
7.SAPTeam Review and Approval 
1.SAPteam reviews the email and may respond with corrections. 
2.Repsupdate the request in the app and resubmit if needed. 
3.Onceapproved, the SAP team manually enters the order into EBS.

column7: Validate Unit of Measure and Billing System Post-Merge
column11:
Business Context:
The Equipment Ordering App allows reps to submit orders using predefined automation programs. Post-account merge, unit of measure (UOM) and billing system values may conflict between merged accounts. Business must define which values to retain. 
Business Requirement: 

 *  Validate UOM and billing system values during account merge. 
 *  Ensure Equipment Ordering App reflects correct values post-merge. 
 *  Prevent submission errors due to mismatched master data. 
 *  Support manual override with audit logging. 
 

Technical Considerations: 

 *  Requires validation logic in Power App and CRM. 
 *  May need UI prompts for conflict resolution. 
 *  Coordinate with SAP engineering team for downstream compatibility. 
 

Expected Deliverables: 

 *  Updated validation logic in Equipment Ordering App. 
 *  Merge rules for UOM and billing system. 
 *  Regression testing for merged accounts.

column6: CRM: Lead Management Process
column11:
Context:  
 
•TheLeads process in CRM is designed to capture and manage potential customerinterest from various sources. It enables the sales team to: 
 
•Identifyand act on new business opportunities. 
 
•Trackthe ROI of marketing efforts. 
 
•Centralizeand organize incoming lead data for efficient follow-up. 
 
Groups:  
 
•HygieneDivision 
 
•Actively uses Leads inCRM. 
 
•Leadsare generated from multiple sources including customer service, ecolab.com,trade shows, and eCommerce platforms like Connect. 
 
•Thelead process is well-established and includes integrations for qualificationand conversion into opportunities 
 
•WaterDivision 
 
•Actively uses Leads inCRM. 
 
•Does not use Leads in the same wayas Hygiene. 
 
•Waterreps often bypass the lead stage and go directly to creating a prospect accountand opportunity, especially when adding Water skill to an existing Hygieneaccount. 
 
•Thereis an ongoing effort to unify the lead flow acrossboth divisions as part of the OneCustomer initiative. This includes adjustinglead qualification logic and ensuring new leads are created under the correctbase customer and sales skill account structure. 
 
Personas: 
 
•BusinessDevelopment Team:Primarily in the Hygiene division, responsible for pursuing leads. 
 
•MarketingTeam:Generates leads through campaigns, trade shows, and third-party vendors. 
 
•CommercialOperations Team:Manages the manual entry of leads into CRM. 
 
•SalesRepresentatives:Engage with leads and convert them into opportunities. 
 
Downstream Systems/Integration: 
 
•CRM:Central repository for lead data. 
 
•PowerBI Dashboards:Used internally to track lead performance and ROI. 
 
•Ecolab3D (Financial Impact):Not directly involved in leads but relevant for TVD programs. 
 
Impact Considerations (Useof Account, Ship-To, and Site field values): 
 
•Leadsare tied to account numbers and sites. 
 
•Ship-To isnot actively used in the leads process. 
 
•SalesSkill (e.g.,hygiene vs. water) is becoming increasingly important for routing and filteringleads. 
 

 
Business Process Flow: 
 
 
1.LeadGeneration Sources: 
 
1.Websitesubmissions (e.g., ecolab.com forms). 
 
2.Customerservice referrals. 
 
3.Tradeshow badge scans. 
 
4.Purchasedprospect lists (e.g., construction projects). 
 
5.Advertisingcampaigns (QR codes, mailers). 
 
2.DataEntry into CRM: 
 
1.Leadsare manually uploaded into CRM by the commercial operations team. 
 
2.Frequencyvaries by source (daily for customer service, weekly for trade shows, periodicfor vendor lists). 
 
3.CRMLeadRecord Creation: 
 
1.Includescontact details, source, and basic qualification info. 
 
2.Oftenmanipulated to fit CRM’s current field structure. 
 
4.SalesTeam Engagement: 
 
1.Repsaccess leads in CRM. 
 
2.Leadsmay be converted into opportunities depending on qualification.

column7: Enable Accurate Sales Skill-Based Account Selection During Lead Creation and Qualification
column11:
As part of the One Customer (1C) model, a single customer (sold-to) can have multiple accounts in CRM differentiated by Sales Skill (e.g., Water or Hygiene).
During Lead creation or qualification, users can associate a Lead with an existing customer account via the Existing Account lookup field.
 
However, the current lookup view only shows minimal information (Account Number, Account Type), making it difficult for users to determine which Sales Skill account to choose when multiple accounts exist for the same customer number.
 

 
This requirement introduces an enhancement to the Lead form to improve visibility and accuracy during Lead-to-Account association.
 

 
The updated behavior will:
 

 *  Automatically open the Advanced Search view when users click the Existing Account lookup. 
 *  Display key columns such as Account Number, Account Name, Sales Skill, ERP System, and Account Type. 
 *  Ensure that users can clearly identify and select the correct Sales Skill account before qualifying the Lead. 
 *  Apply consistent filtering logic for 1C (multi-skill) and non-1C (single-skill) districts. 
 

 
This change ensures Leads are always associated with the correct customer-level account and division (Water/Hygiene), maintaining data accuracy in downstream opportunities and sales processes. 

 
In-Scope: 

 *  Modify the Existing Account lookup behavior on the Lead form to open in Advanced Search mode. 
 *  Display additional columns (Sales Skill, ERP System, Account Type, etc.) in the lookup view. 
 *  Enable filtering based on the user’s district and associated business configuration. 
 *  Maintain current conversion and lead qualification logic. 
 

 
Out-of-Scope: 

 *  Any changes to Lead creation logic, Lead scoring, or auto-assignment processes. 
 *  No modifications to Opportunity or downstream Sales entity behaviors. 
 *  No relationship or linkage to organization (H5) accounts — this requirement applies only to customer-level accounts. 
 

 
Key Business Outcomes: 

 *  Improve accuracy when linking Leads to existing customer accounts. 
 *  Prevent incorrect association between Water and Hygiene accounts that share the same number. 
 *  Enhance usability and reduce rework during Lead qualification. 
 *  Maintain consistency across 1C and non-1C districts.

column8: Enhance “Existing Account” Lookup on Lead to Open Advanced Search Showing Sales Skill for Accurate Account Selection
column11:
As a CRM user creating or qualifying a Lead,
I want the Existing Account lookup on the Lead form to open directly in the Advanced Search view instead of the default two-column lookup,
 
so that I can view additional columns — especially the Sales Skill — and correctly select the appropriate account (Water or Hygiene) when multiple accounts exist with the same number under the same organization.
 

 
Context & Background 
In the current CRM implementation: 

 *  When users create a new Lead, they can set “Is this an existing account?” to Yes. 
 *  This makes the Existing Account lookup field visible, which allows users to search for existing Accounts. 
 *  The default lookup view only displays two columns — Account Number and Account Type (Organization/Customer/Prospect) — which makes it difficult to distinguish between Water and Hygiene accounts that share the same Account Number. 
 *  Users must manually click the “chevron” (arrow) to expand and see more details, or open the record to confirm — both are slow and error-prone. 
 

 
With the upcoming One Customer (1C) model, the same Sold-To number may exist twice — once for Water and once for Hygiene — under the same H5/Org structure. 
To reduce errors and improve usability, we will make the Existing Account lookup open the Advanced Find window by default.
 
The Advanced Find view will display key columns including Account Number, Organization, Sales Skill, Account Type, and ERP System, so that users can identify and select the correct account at a glance.
 

 
This change applies to both 1C and non-1C districts but has specific visibility and filtering behavior depending on the district configuration.

Business Acceptance Criteria:
 
 

 *  Scenario 1: Opening the Existing Account lookup should show Advanced Search view by default 

 *  Given the user is on a Lead record and the field “Is this an existing account?” = “Yes” 
 *  When the user clicks on the Existing Account lookup icon (magnifying glass) and click on advance search 
 *  And expand the customer record, the ERP SALES SKILL should be visible after Owner column in the advance search. 
 *  Then the system should automatically open the Advanced Search lookup window (not the basic two-column lookup)  
 *  And the Advanced Search grid should display the Sales Skill Column for 1C districts.  
 

 *  Scenario 2: System must retain current behavior for other lead scenarios 

 *  Given the Lead is being created without linking to an existing account 
 *  When “Is this an existing account?” = “No” 
 *  Then the “Existing Account” lookup should remain hidden and the Lead creation flow should proceed unchanged.

column6: CRM: Field Services - Services – EBS Service Order Integration and Work Center Alignment
column11:
The featurerepresents Field Service management capabilities across Hygiene and Water divisionsunder the One Customer CRM model. This feature enables the transition of Field Service operations from legacy NSAP integrations to EBS under the One Customer model. It encompasses data model updates, ERP field harmonization, and Service Order integration redesign to ensure that recurring Services, Service Visits, and mobile workflows seamlessly operate with EBS Work Centers, Order Types, and Activity Types.
 

 
The goal is to achieve parity and coexistence between NSAP and EBS Systems during the hybrid transition period while supporting the new Sold-To-based account hierarchy introduced under the 1C program.
 

 
Key aspects include:
 

 *  Introducing dual ERP support (NSAP + EBS) for all Field Service entities (Service Types, Work Centers, Service Orders, and Visits). 
 *  Filtering and visibility logic for Work Centers, Order Types, and Sync-to-SAP actions based on ERP System and Sold-To Account. 
 *  Updating CRM-to-EBS integration field mappings for service order creation, update, confirmation, and Post Goods Issue (PGI). 
 *  Aligning technician, team, and account records with the correct EBS Work Centers and ERP systems. 
 *  Ensuring end-to-end EBS field parity for service order lifecycle events — creation, confirmation, PGI — and supporting smooth data migration for open and recurring services. 
 

 
 
 

Requirements In Scope: 

 
 *  Recurring     Services (Preventive Maintenance) Regression Testing: 
 

  
 *  Auto-generation of service      visits from recurring schedules. 
  
 *  Assignment of preferred      technicians and start times. 
  
 *  Validation of billing      arrangements (BA) before service execution. 
 

 
 *  Field     Service Orders including WPS: 
 

  
 *  Harmonize service visit      forms across divisions. 
  
 *  Replace “Global Business”      field with “Sales Skill” for form logic. 
 

 
 *  Individual     Service Visit - Integrations 
 

  
 *  Sync service visits to      SAP/EBS via Azure Function. 
  
 *  PGI trigger logic based on      order type and product presence. 
  
 *  Ship-To to Sold-To      transition logic for EBS migration. 
 

 
 *  Field     Services Mobile App: 

  
 *  Support for Site and      OneCustomer fields on mobile forms. - Regression Testing 
  
 *  Signature capture, risk      assessments, and Field Service Report generation. - Regression Testing 
 

 
 *  Scope of     Work (SOW) and Service Templates: 
 

  
 *  Unified SOW creation for      Hygiene and Water. 
  
 *  Migration of SOW documents      and templates. 
  
 *  Support for site-level      templates in Hygiene due to missing asset data. 
 

 

  
Technical Considerations & Configuration: 

 
 *  CRM–SAP/EBS     Integration: 
 

  
 *  Azure Function for syncing      service visits. 
  
 *  Mapping of SAP Work Centers      to EBS equivalents. 
  
 *  PGI logic updates and      validation of activity type codes. 
 

 
 *  Data     Conversion: 
 

  
 *  Migration of open/closed      service visits. 
  
 *  Mapping of ZR codes to SER      codes for service types. 
  
 *  Migration of Smartflow      reports and attachments from legacy accounts. 
 

 
 *  OneCustomer     Impact: 
 

  
 *  Ship-To remediation and      promotion to Sold-To. 
  
 *  Account merges affecting      service visit ownership and routing. 
  
 *  Field logic updates based on      Sales Skill.. 
 

 

  
User Interface Configuration: 

 
 *  CRM Forms: 
 

  
 *  Adjust visibility and      required fields based on Sales Skill. 
  
 *  Hide optional fields (e.g.,      Pack Code) for Hygiene accounts. 
  
 *  Enable selection of      technology platforms and service types. 
 

 
 *  Mobile App: 
 

  
 *  Dynamic field visibility      based on account type. 
  
 *  Offline sync logic for Life      Sciences and Water divisions. 
  
 *  Support for technician      workflows including risk assessments and VAS creation. 
 

 

  
Security & Data Governance ConfigurationDeliverables: 

 
 *  Security     Roles: 
 

  
 *  Field Service – Back Office      role controls app section visibility. 
  
 *  CRM record-level security      for Hygiene documents via Dataverse. 
  
 *  SharePoint lacks native      record-level security, harmonization not in scope. 
 

 
 *  Data     Governance: 
 

  
 *  Maintain consistent      reporting fields across divisions. 
  
 *  Validate unit of measure,      billing system, and time zone during account merges. 
  
 *  Ensure document visibility      and integrity post-merge.

column7: Implement comprehensive Service Order integrations between CRM and both NSAP and EBS SAP systems to enable seamless processing during the dual ERP transition
column11: ## OverviewThe following User Stories represent the comprehensive set of requirements for implementing Service Order integrations during the FBU 1C Release 2 dual ERP transition. These requirements address the critical need to support both NSAP and EBS SAP systems simultaneously, enabling seamless service order processing across 247 strategic global accounts, 1,203 regional key accounts, and 3,456 local standard accounts representing over $2.1B in annual service revenue. The User Stories are categorized into core integration functionality and supporting non-integration features that enhance the overall service delivery experience.

column8: Update Service Order Creation, Update and Confirmation Integration Logic to Use the new NSAP Work Center Field on User Table
column11:
As an integration engineer,
 
I want to update the Service Order Creation, Update and Confirmation Integration Logic to reference the new NSAP Work Center lookup field on the User entity instead of the legacy SAP Work Center option set,
 
So that the integration sends accurate Work Center information to SAP during order creation and confirmation, and aligns with the new data model supporting both NSAP and EBS environments.
 

 
Context and Background 

 *  The integration previously relied on an option set field for Work Center selection, which is being deprecated. 
 *  The new lookup field (NSAP Work Center) provides direct entity linkage and reduces data errors. 
 *  A similar lookup exists on the Team entity to support team-based assignments.
column19: Moved out of state In Development
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 
 

 *  Integration Field Mapping 

 *  Given a Service Order Creation, Update, and confirmation, integration jobs are triggered, 
 *  When the system fetches Work Center details, 
 *  Then it must reference the User’s NSAP Work Center lookup (New Field) field instead of the deprecated option set SAP Work Center field.

column8: Update Scheduled Job to Exclude EBS Accounts and Run Only for NSAP ERP System
column11:
As a system administrator,
I want to update the existing scheduled job that identifies Field Service Visits lacking an SAP Service Order Number,
 
So that it processes only those visits whose Sold-To Account ERP System = NLC_SAP, and excludes any records belonging to EBS (ECL_EBS) accounts, ensuring the correct job runs against the appropriate SAP backend.
 

 
Context and Background 

 *  The existing job currently scans all Field Service Visits without an SAP Service Order Number and sends them to the NSAP Post Service Order Creation process. 
 *  With the introduction of EBS accounts, NSAP and EBS records must be processed by different jobs to prevent duplicate or invalid order creation. 
 *  Filtering by ERP System ensures data segregation and prevents EBS records from accidentally being pushed into NSAP integrations.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 

 *  Filter Job Execution 

 *  Given the service order creation  job runs for Field Service Visits. (Azure Function Job) 
 *  When the Sold-To Account ERP System = NLC_SAP, 
 *  Then the record is included in the job for NSAP service-order creation. 
 *  Modify the Existing filter condition of the job to add an additional filter on the ERP System = NLC_SAP 

 *  Service Performed By = Field Services Team
SAP Order Type = ZSNO / ZSBO / ZSN1
 
System status: Open-Scheduled/Open-InProgress/Open-Completed
 
SAP Account Division: WP / 01
 
SAP Service Order has not been created for the Service Visit (i.e SAP Service Order # = NULL/Blank)
 
First Scheduled Date of the Service Visit falls in the next 15 days from the current date
 
Service Type associate to the Service Visit is not A QUOTE REQUEST / SITE VISIT
 
Payment Type = PO, Billing Arrangement, No Charge
 
ZACT is not equal to '0000000' 
 
The field 'Disable SAP Sync' should be set as FALSE
 
 

 

 *  Exclude EBS Records 

 *  Given a Field Service Visit is linked to a sold to account with ERP System = ECL_EBS, 
 *  When the scheduled job executes, 
 *  Then the visit must be skipped and not sent to NSAP order integration.

column8: Technical Spike: Data Mapping for EBS Service Order Integration
column11:
Description: 
As an Integration Developer, I need to create comprehensive data mapping specifications for service order integration between Dynamics 365 CRM and EBS SAP systems, so that all field mappings, master data relationships, and transformation rules are clearly defined for implementation. 

 
Business Context: 
During the FBU 1C migration from NSAP to EBS, service orders must be created in the correct ERP system based on customer account hierarchies. This requires precise field mappings between CRM work orders and SAP service order structures, including master data relationships for Work Centers, Order Types, and Activity Types. Inaccurate mappings could result in failed service order creation, incorrect cost allocation, or billing errors. 

 
Scope: 

 *  Field mapping between CRM and EBS SAP structures 
 *  Master data mapping (Work Centers, Order Types, Activity Types, GL accounts) 
 *  Data transformation and validation rules 
 *  Business rules for mapping logic 
 *  Stakeholder validation and documentation 
 


 
See attached Mapping document - Industrial S&S - Documents - EBS SAP Service Order Integration - All Documents
column19: Moved out of state In Development
column22:
Detailed Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Complete field-by-field mapping document covering all CRM?EBS SAP and EBS SAP?CRM mappings 
 *  Master data mapping specifications for Work Centers, Order Types, Activity Types, and GL accounts 
 *  Data validation rules and business logic for each mapping 
 *  Transformation rules for data type conversions and format requirements 
 *  Error handling specifications for unmapped or invalid data 
 *  Documentation of differences between NSAP and EBS mapping requirements 
 *  Review and approval from SAP, Dynamics, and business stakeholders 
 *  Mapping file created (Source and Destination columns) 
 *  Discussion completed with Mulesoft Team and EBS Team

column8: Enhance SAP Division and SAP Distribution Channel Option Sets to Support EBS Values
column11:
As a system administrator,
I want to enhance the existing option sets for SAP Division and SAP Distribution Channel on the Account entity,
 
So that the system can support new EBS-specific values required for Field Service, Service Order, and integration processes.
 

 
Context and Background 

 *  Currently, both fields — SAP Division and SAP Distribution Channel — are implemented as option sets that are aligned with NSAP. 
 *  Existing SAP Division values include: 

 *  01 - Chemical and Reference, 02 - Service, 03 - Equipment, 04 - Cosmetics, 05 - Alternate, 06 - Colloidal, CT - Colloidal, FT - Finishing, PC - PERF.Cosmet, WP - Water Purity. 
 

 *  Existing SAP Distribution Channel values include: 

 *  01 - Standard and Reference, 02 - Internet, 03 - Reseller, 04 - Alternate Channel. 
 

 *  These option sets are currently synced with NSAP’s configuration and are used by downstream processes such as order type filtering, division-based logic, and SAP integration mapping. 
 *  With the introduction of EBS, new EBS-specific divisions and distribution channels need to be confirmed and added. 
 *  This ensures that EBS accounts can have correct attributes assigned for seamless integration with EBS order creation, billing, and service processing.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:

 *  Enhance Division Option Set 

 *  Given that EBS-specific SAP Division values have been confirmed by the business, 
 *  When the CRM administrator updates the SAP Division option set, 
 *  Then all newly provided EBS divisions must be added without removing any of the existing NSAP values. 
 

 *  Enhance Distribution Channel Option Set 

 *  Given that EBS-specific SAP Distribution Channel values have been confirmed by the business, 
 *  When the CRM administrator updates the SAP Distribution Channel option set, 
 *  Then all EBS-specific values must be added in addition to the existing NSAP options.

Create New Scheduled Job for EBS Accounts to Handle Field Service Visit and Service Order Creation
column11:
As a system administrator,
I want to create a new scheduled job dedicated to EBS accounts (ERP System = ECL_EBS) for Field Service Visit and Service Order creation,
 
So that EBS records are processed through their own integration pipeline, distinct from NSAP, using the appropriate EBS API and mapping logic.
 

 
Context and Background 

 *  The current integration job supports NSAP only. 
 *  A new job must mirror the existing logic but target the EBS service-order creation endpoint. 
 *  The EBS job will use EBS-specific fields such as EBS WorkCenter and EBS Order Type. 
 *  Separation of jobs prevents cross-posting and enables cleaner error handling and monitoring.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 

 *  Job Creation and Scope 

 *  Given the EBS scheduled job is configured, 
 *  When the job runs, 
 *  Then it should pick only Field Service Visits with Sold-To Account ERP System = ECL_EBS. 
 

 *  Order Creation Integration 

 *  Given a visit record is processed by the EBS job, 
 *  When it has all required fields (Order Type, Work Center, Payment Method), 
 *  Then the system should trigger the EBS service-order creation integration successfully.

column8: Filter SAP Work Centers Based on Sold-To Account ERP System for Field Service Visits (Field Service Team Only)
column11:
As a Field Service Administrator
 
I want the SAP Work Center lookup on the Field Service Service Visits form to display only the Work Centers that belong to the same ERP system as the Sold-To account,
 
So that the correct NSAP or EBS Work Center is always selected for integration consistency and no cross-system mismatches occur during service order creation or update.
 

 
Context and Background: 

 *  The Field Service Service Visit entity contains a lookup to the SAP Work Center table. 
 *  Currently, the lookup displays all records from the SAP Work Center table, regardless of which ERP system (NSAP or EBS) they belong to. 
 *  As part of the One Customer (1C) model, EBS Work Centers will be introduced and stored in the same table, differentiated by the new ERP System lookup field (e.g., ECL_EBS for EBS, NLC_SAP for NSAP). 
 *  This story ensures that the lookup results are dynamically filtered based on: 

 *  The ERP System value of the linked Sold-To account, and 
 *  The Service Performed By field on the Recurring Service record. 
 

 *  This filtering will only apply to records where Service Performed By = Field Services Team. 
 *  For District Team services, no filtering logic should be applied; the lookup should continue to show all available Work Centers as today.
column14: CodeReviewed; FBU R2 Release; FBU_QAPush_Nov_Major4; ReadyforDemo; validated in QA; validated in Test
column19: Moved out of state In QA
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Filter for EBS Accounts (EBS – Field Services Team Only) 

 *  Given that a Field Service Service Visit record has Service Performed By = Field Services Team, 
 *  And the linked Sold-To account’s ERP System = ECL_EBS, 
 *  When a user opens the SAP Work Center lookup field, 
 *  Then only Work Centers whose ERP System = ECL_EBS must be displayed in the lookup list. 
 

 *  Filter for NSAP Accounts (NSAP – Field Services Team Only) 

 *  Given that a Field Service Service Visit record has Service Performed By = Field Services Team, 
 *  And the linked Sold-To account’s ERP System = NLC_SAP, 
 *  When a user opens the SAP Work Center lookup field, 
 *  Then only Work Centers whose ERP System = NLC_SAP must be displayed in the lookup list. 
 

 *  Exclusion for District Team Services  

 *  Given that a Field Service Service Visit record has Service Performed By = District Team,  
 *  then none of the above rules should be applicable as SAP work Center is not visible on the forms  
 

 *  Consistency Across NSAP and EBS Accounts 

 *  Given that the ERP System of the Sold-To account defines which Work Centers are valid, 
 *  When a user saves or reviews a Field Service Service Visit record, 
 *  Then the Work Center selected must always belong to the same ERP System as the Sold-To account.

column8: Filter SAP Work Centers Based on Sold-To Account ERP System for Field Service Recurring Services (Field Service Team Only)
column11:
As a Field Service Administrator
I want the SAP Work Center lookup on the Field Service Recurring Service form to display only the Work Centers that belong to the same ERP system as the Sold-To account,
 
So that the correct NSAP or EBS Work Center is always selected for integration consistency and no cross-system mismatches occur during service order creation or update.
 

 
Context and Background: 

 *  The Field Service Recurring Service entity contains a lookup to the SAP Work Center table. 
 *  Currently, the lookup displays all records from the SAP Work Center table, regardless of which ERP system (NSAP or EBS) they belong to. 
 *  As part of the One Customer (1C) model, EBS Work Centers will be introduced and stored in the same table, differentiated by the new ERP System lookup field (e.g., ECL_EBS for EBS, NLC_SAP for NSAP). 
 *  This story ensures that the lookup results are dynamically filtered based on: 

 *  The ERP System value of the linked Sold-To account, and 
 *  The Service Performed By field on the Recurring Service record. 
 

 *  This filtering will only apply to records where Service Performed By = Field Services Team. 
 *  For District Team services, no filtering logic should be applied; the lookup should continue to show all available Work Centers as today.

column8: Filter SAP Order Type Option Set on Service Visit Form Based on Payment Method and Sold-To Account ERP System
column11:
As a Field Service Administrator
I want the SAP Order Type option-set values on the Field Service Service Visit form to be filtered dynamically based on both the selected Payment Method and the ERP System of the linked Sold-To Account,
 
So that only valid order types are displayed for each combination of payment method and ERP system, avoiding downstream integration or billing errors in SAP / EBS.
 

 
Context and Background:
 

 *  The SAP Order Type field on the Service Visit form is an option set whose values are currently filtered only by Payment Method. 
 *  With the introduction of the One Customer (1C) model and EBS integration, the filtering must also consider the ERP System value (NLC_SAP or ECL_EBS) on the linked Sold-To Account. 
 *  The goal is to ensure that when a Sold-To Account belongs to EBS (ECL_EBS), only EBS-compatible order types are displayed and legacy NSAP (NLC_SAP) values are hidden.
column14: CodeReviewed; FBU R2 Release; FBU_QAPush_Dec_Major3; PRNotRaised; TechDocNotAdded
column19: Moved out of state In QA
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Payment Method = Purchase Order 

 *  Given that the Payment Method = Purchase Order 
 *  And the Sold-To Account ERP System = NLC_SAP, 
 *  When the user opens the SAP Order Type field, 
 *  Then the following three values must be displayed: 

 *  ZSBO – Billable Service Order 
 *  ZSSO – Service Order from Sales Order 
 *  ZSS1 – Service Order from Sales Order – Plan COGS 
 

 *  Given that the Payment Method = Purchase Order 
 *  And the Sold-To Account ERP System = ECL_EBS, 
 *  When the user opens the SAP Order Type field, 
 *  Then only the following value must be displayed: 

 *  ZSS1 – Service Order from Sales Order – Plan COGS  
 *  ZSSO-Service Order from Sales Order	
 
 

 

 *  Payment Method = Billing Arrangement 

 *  Given that the Payment Method = Billing Arrangement 
 *  And the Sold-To Account ERP System = NLC_SAP, 
 *  When the user opens the SAP Order Type field, 
 *  Then the following values must be displayed: 

 *  ZSNO – Non-Billable Service Order 
 *  ZSN1 – Non-Billable Service Order – Plan COGS 
 

 *  Given that the Payment Method = Billing Arrangement 
 *  And the Sold-To Account ERP System = ECL_EBS, 
 *  When the user opens the SAP Order Type field, 
 *  Then only the following value must be displayed: 

 *  ZSN1 – Non-Billable Service Order – Plan COGS  
 *  ZSNO-Non Billable Service Order
 
 

 

 *  Payment Method = Cost Center 

 *  Given that the Payment Method = Cost Center (for any ERP System), 
 *  When the user opens the SAP Order Type field, 
 *  Then no values should be displayed (the field remains blank or disabled). 
 

 *  Payment Method = No Charge 

 *  Given that the Payment Method = No Charge 
 *  And the Sold-To Account ERP System = NLC_SAP, 
 *  When the user opens the SAP Order Type field, 
 *  Then the following values must be displayed: 

 *  ZSNO – Non-Billable Service Order 
 *  ZSN1 – Non-Billable Service Order – Plan COGS 
 

 *  Given that the Payment Method = No Charge 
 *  And the Sold-To Account ERP System = ECL_EBS, 
 *  When the user opens the SAP Order Type field, 
 *  Then only the following value must be displayed: 

 *  ZSN1 – Non-Billable Service Order – Plan COGS
  
 *  ZSNO-Non Billable Service Order

column7: Enable Dual-ERP Work Center Structure for NSAP and EBS Systems Across Field Service Entities
column11:
Background and Business Context

 *  As part of the One Customer (1C) initiative, both NSAP and EBS systems will coexist during the transition period for Water and Hygiene accounts. 
 *  The existing CRM configuration supports only NSAP Work Centers, used for service order creation, synchronization, and routing in integration with NSAP. 
 *  To support EBS integration and alignment with the new ERP data model, CRM must accommodate both NSAP and EBS Work Centers concurrently. 
 *  This enhancement ensures that all relevant Field Service entities (User, Team, Recurring Service, Service Visit) can dynamically reference the correct Work Center based on the Sold-To account’s ERP system. 
 

 
Scope of Work 

 *  The following functional and data changes are required to enable dual-ERP WorkCenter support: 
 *  Extend SAP WorkCenter Entity 
 *  Add a new lookup field called ERP System on the SAP WorkCenter table. 
 *  This lookup will identify whether the WorkCenter belongs to NSAP (NLC_SAP) or EBS (ECL_EBS). 
 *  Update all existing WorkCenter records to set the ERP System = NLC_SAP. 
 *  Once EBS WorkCenters are provided by business, create new WorkCenter records with ERP System = ECL_EBS. 
 *  Ensure fields such as SAP Call Center, SAP Planner Group, SAP Main Plant, SAP Work Center Surcharge, SAP Work Center Fee Admin are populated for the new Work Centers. 
 

 
Update User Entity 

 *  Rename the existing field SAP Work Center to NSAP SAP Work Center. 
 *  Add a new lookup field EBS SAP Work Center on the User table. 
 *  Users can now have mappings for both NSAP and EBS Work Centers, depending on the ERP they operate under. 
 *  Perform a data update to associate each user with both Work Centers using the business-provided mapping. 
 

 
Update Team Entity 

 *  Rename existing SAP Work Center field to NSAP SAP Work Center. 
 *  Add a new lookup field EBS SAP Work Center to the Team table. 
 *  Each team record should have both NSAP and EBS Work Centers populated based on business mapping. 
 *  Update all active Team records accordingly. 
 

 

 
Field Service Data Alignment 

 *  Update Field Service Recurring Service and Field Service Service Visit records to reference the appropriate Work Center based on the Sold-To account’s ERP system. 
 *  For active (non-completed, non-cancelled) records: 

 *  If Sold-To ERP = NSAP ? link NSAP WorkCenter. 
 *  If Sold-To ERP = EBS ? link mapped EBS WorkCenter. 
 

 *  No updates should be applied to completed or cancelled records. 
 

 
Master Data Setup 

 *  Once business mapping is provided, all new EBS Work Centers must be created in CRM with valid values for Call Center, Planner Group, Main Plant, and other related fields. 
 *  Data cleanup must ensure there are no orphaned or duplicate WorkCenter records. 
 *  The EBS WorkCenters should mirror NSAP hierarchy and functional structure where applicable. 
 

 
Expected Outcome 

 *  CRM supports both NSAP and EBS Work Centers concurrently. 
 *  Each User, Team, Recurring Service, and Service Visit can dynamically use the correct Work Center based on ERP system association. 
 *  Data consistency is maintained across entities. 
 *  Integration logic can reference the ERP System field on WorkCenter to determine correct routing and mapping.

column8: Update Logic to Auto-Populate SAP Work Center on Field Service Recurring Service Based on Assigned Team and Sold-To ERP System
column11:
As a Field Service Administrator,
I want the SAP WorkCenter field on the Field Service Recurring Service record to be auto-populated based on the owning Field Service Team and the ERP System of the associated Sold-To account,
 
So that the correct Work Center (NSAP or EBS) is automatically set without manual entry when new recurring services are created or ownership changes.
 

 
Context and Background: 

 *  Each Sold-To Account has an ERP System field with values NLC_SAP (for legacy SAP) or ECL_EBS (for EBS). 
 *  Both the User and Team entities now have lookup fields for two Work Centers: 

 *  NSAP SAP Work Center 
 *  EBS SAP Work Center 
 

 *  The Field Service Recurring Service table contains a single field named SAP Work Center, which must be automatically populated whenever a record is created or the owner/team is changed. 
 *  The system should determine which Work Center to populate based on: 

 *  The ERP System value on the associated Sold-To Account. 
 *  The Work Center values present on the owning Team (or User if individual ownership).
column14: CodeReviewed; FBU R2 Release; FBU_QAPush_Dec_Major1; FBU_QAPush_Nov_Major4
column19: Moved out of state In QA
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Auto-Populate During Record Creation 

 *  Given a new Field Service Recurring Service record is created and a Sold-To Account and owning Team are selected, 
 *  When the record is saved, 
 *  Then the system must auto-populate the SAP Work Center field as follows: 

 *  If Sold-To Account ? ERP System = NLC_SAP, populate SAP Work Center = Team’s NSAP SAP Work Center value. 
 *  If Sold-To Account ? ERP System = ECL_EBS, populate SAP Work Center = Team’s EBS SAP Work Center value. 
 

 

 *  Auto-Populate on Owner or Team Change 

 *  Given an existing Recurring Service record has its Owner or Owning Team field updated, 
 *  When the change is saved, 
 *  Then the system must re-evaluate the Sold-To Account ERP System and re-populate the SAP Work Center field accordingly. 
 

 *  Apply Filter for SAP Work Center on the Recurring Service Form  

 *  Given I open an existing Recurring service form (Existing or New record creation),  
 *  When I click on the SAP Work Center dropdown,   
 *  Then I should only see the values corresponding to the appropriate ERP system as shown below  

 *  If Sold-To Account ? ERP System = NLC_SAP, Filter SAP Work Centers to only show the ones that are under the ERP system =  NLC_SAP.  
 *  If Sold-To Account ? ERP System = ECL_EBS, Filter SAP Work Centers to only show the ones that are under the ERP system =  ECL_EBS.  
 

 

 *  Field Locking and Visibility 

 *  Given the SAP Work Center is auto-populated, 
 *  When the record is saved, 
 *  Then the SAP Work Center field should remain visible but read-only to end users to prevent manual data entry errors.

column8: Rename SAP Work Center Field to NSAP SAP Work Center and Add EBS SAP Work Center Field on Team Entity
column11:
As a System Administrator
I want to rename the existing “SAP Work Center” field to “NSAP SAP Work Center” and add a new lookup field “EBS SAP Work Center” on the Team entity
 
So that each team can be associated with both NSAP and EBS Work Centers, ensuring the correct Work Center details are aligned to Field Service recurring services and Field Service visits depending on the Sold-To account’s ERP system.
 

 
Context and Background: 

 *  Currently, the Team entity in CRM has a single lookup field called SAP Work Center, which links to NSAP-specific Work Centers only. 
 *  With the introduction of EBS as a parallel ERP system under the One Customer (1C) model, Field Service teams must be able to align with Work Centers from both systems. 
 *  The Work Center association at the Team level determines which Work Center details are referenced when creating or updating Field Service Recurring Services and Service Visits. 
 *  Therefore, the Team entity must: 

 *  Retain existing NSAP alignment. 
 *  Gain a new lookup to EBS Work Centers. 
 *  Support both references concurrently so routing and integration logic can dynamically identify the right Work Center during ERP interactions.
column14: CodeReviewed; Data Dictionary; FBU R2 Release; FBU_QAPush_Dec_Major1
column19: Moved out of state In QA
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 
 

 *  Field Rename 

 *  Given that the Team entity currently contains a field named “SAP Work Center,” 
 *  When the enhancement is implemented, 
 *  Then this field should be renamed to “NSAP SAP Work Center.” 
 *  And this Field should be automatically filtered  to only show the Work Centers that have an ERP system of NLC_SAP 
 

 *  New Lookup Field Creation 

 *  Given that EBS Work Centers must be supported, 
 *  When the enhancement is deployed, 
 *  Then a new lookup field called “EBS SAP Work Center” should be added to the Team entity referencing the SAP Work Center table. 
 *  And this Field should be automatically filtered  to only show the Work Centers that have an ERP system of ECL_EBS
 
 

 *  Data Entry and Validation 

 *  Given that both Work Center fields are now available on the Team record, 

 *  When a system administrator opens a Team record, 
 *  Then they should be able to assign both an NSAP SAP Work Center and an EBS SAP Work Center to that team. 
 

 *  Given that Field Service entities use Team associations for routing,  

 *  When a recurring service or service visit is created or updated,  
 *  Then the system should automatically reference the correct Work Center (EBS or NSAP) based on the Sold-To account’s ERP system.  
 

 

 *  Field Visibility and Security  

 *  Given that standard users should not edit ERP configuration data,  
 *  When a non-admin user opens a Team record,  
 *  Then both Work Center fields should be visible but read-only.  
 

 *  Filtering and Reporting  

 *  Given that business users may need to review which teams are aligned with which Work Centers,  
 *  When an advanced find, list view, or report is executed,  
 *  Then both NSAP SAP Work Center and EBS SAP Work Center fields should be available as searchable and filterable columns.

column8: Hide SAP Work Center Field and Add a new Lookup field NSAP SAP Work Center and Add EBS SAP Work Center Field on User Entity
column11:
As a System Administrator
 
I want to Hide the existing “SAP Work Center” field and add a new lookup “NSAP SAP Work Center” and add a new lookup field “EBS SAP Work Center” on the User entity
 
So that each user can be associated with both NSAP and EBS Work Centers, ensuring the system can determine the correct Work Center details to send to the appropriate ERP (NSAP or EBS) during service order creation, update, or confirmation.
 

 
Context and Background: 

 *  Currently, the User entity contains only one field — SAP Work Center — which links users to NSAP-specific Work Centers. 
 *  As part of the One Customer (1C) initiative and dual-ERP enablement, both NSAP and EBS Work Centers must be supported. 
 *  When a field service order is created, updated, or confirmed, the integration logic must determine which ERP to send data to (NSAP or EBS) based on the Sold-To account’s ERP system. 
 *  To enable this flexibility, the User record must hold references to both ERP-specific Work Centers. 
 *  This story covers: 
 *  Renaming the existing SAP Work Center field to NSAP SAP Work Center. 
 *  Adding a new lookup field called EBS SAP Work Center to link users with their EBS-specific Work Center. 
 *  Ensuring that these lookups integrate seamlessly with downstream logic for service order creation and updates.
column14: CodeReviewed; Data Dictionary; FBU R2 Release; FBU_QAPush_Nov_Major4; ReadyforDemo; validated in QA; validated in Test
column19: Moved out of state In QA
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Field Create 

 *  Given that the User entity currently has a field named “SAP Work Center,” 
 *  When the update is implemented, 
 *  Then this field should be Hidden  
 *  and a new lookup field named “NSAP SAP Work Center." should be added referencing the SAP work Center table 
 *  And this Field should be automatically filtered  to only show the Work Centers that have an ERP system of NLC_SAP
 
 

 *  New Lookup Field Creation 

 *  Given that EBS integration requires a separate Work Center reference, 
 *  When the enhancement is deployed, 
 *  Then a new lookup field named “EBS SAP Work Center” should be added to the User entity. 
 *  And this Field should be automatically filtered  to only show the Work Centers that have an ERP system of ECL_EBS
 
 

 *  Data Entry and Validation  

 *  Given that both NSAP and EBS Work Centers are now available on the User form,  

 *  When a system admin opens a User record,  
 *  Then they should be able to assign both NSAP and EBS Work Centers to the same user record.  
 

 *  Given that the ERP system of a Sold-To account determines which Work Center is relevant,  

 *  When integration logic runs during service order creation, update, or confirmation,  
 *  Then the system should automatically use the appropriate Work Center (EBS or NSAP) based on the account’s ERP system and the user aligned to the service visit.  
 

 

 *  Field Visibility and Security 

 *  Given that an Ops Admin/Ops Admin Lead opens the User record, 
 *  Then both Work Center fields (NSAP and EBS) should be visible editable. 
 

 *  Reporting and Filtering  

 *  Given that the business may need to report which users belong to which Work Centers,  
 *  When an Advanced Find or view is created,  
 *  Then both NSAP SAP Work Center and EBS SAP Work Center should be available as searchable and filterable columns.

column8: DC – Update Field Service Service Visit Records with Correct Work Centers Based on Sold-To ERP System
column11:
As a Data Conversion Specialist
 
I want to update all active Field Service Service Visit records so that the SAP Work Center field reflects the correct EBS Work Center value based on the Sold-To account’s ERP System
 
So that all 1C accounts migrated to EBS reference the appropriate Work Center for integration, scheduling, and service order creation consistency.
 

 
Context and Background:

 *  The Field Service Service Visit entity currently contains a lookup field SAP Work Center that points to NSAP values. (Service Performed by = Field Service Team) 
 *  With the transition to EBS for 1C accounts, the Sold-To account now carries the ERP System = ECL_EBS value. 
 *  Business has provided a mapping document defining the one-to-one relationships between existing NSAP Work Centers and their corresponding EBS Work Centers. 
 *  This user story covers a one-time data conversion activity to update all active service visit records so that their SAP Work Center lookups reflect the correct EBS Work Center as per mapping. 
 *  Non-1C (legacy NSAP) records should remain untouched, while only 1C/EBS-based recurring services are targeted for update.
column19: Moved out of state Pending PO Review
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Identify Target Records 

 *  Given that only 1C Open field service visit records need to be updated, 
 *  When data setup begins, 
 *  Then only service visit records linked to Sold-To accounts that are present in the Business Excel file should be selected. 
 

 *  Update SAP Work Center Lookup 

 *  Given that the business provides a validated mapping file of NSAP ? EBS Work Centers, 
 *  When the update process runs, 
 *  Then each Open (Unscheduled, Scheduled, InProgress, Completed) field service visit record where the Service Order # is blank must reference the correct EBS Work Center from the mapping document. 
 *  Given that the service visit record currently references an NSAP Work Center, 
 *  When the Sold-To ERP System is ECL_EBS, 
 *  Then the SAP Work Center lookup on that record must be updated to the corresponding EBS Work Center per the mapping. 
 

 *  Data Validation 

 *  Given that all updates are completed, 
 *  When validation is performed, 
 *  Then the following must hold true for each updated record: 

 *  Sold-To ERP System = ECL_EBS 
 *  SAP Work Center lookup points to an active EBS Work Center 
 *  Work Center’s ERP System value = ECL_EBS 
 

 

 *  Error Handling 

 *  Given that there are errors during the mapping process, 
 *  Then the affected record must be logged in a summary report for manual remediation.

column8: Data Setup: Update All Existing SAP Work Center Records with ERP System = NLC_SAP and Create New EBS Work Centers with ERP System = ECL_EBS Including Required Attributes
column11:
As a Data Conversion Specialist
I want to update all existing SAP Work Center records in CRM with the ERP System value “NLC_SAP” and create new EBS Work Center records with ERP System value “ECL_EBS” along with all required attributes
 
So that both NSAP and EBS Work Centers are correctly established in CRM for dual-ERP operation and can be used reliably during service order creation, update, and confirmation.
 

 
Context and Background: 

 *  Currently, CRM includes only NSAP Work Centers, used for service order creation and integration with NSAP. 
 *  Under the One Customer (1C) model, equivalent EBS Work Centers must be introduced. 
 *  A new lookup field ERP System has been added to the Work Center entity to differentiate NSAP vs. EBS records. 
 *  This user story ensures correct setup and initialization of all Work Centers — tagging NSAP ones, creating EBS equivalents, and populating all required attributes for end-to-end ERP integration readiness.
column19: Moved out of state In Test
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Update Existing NSAP Work Centers 

 *  Given that existing SAP Work Center records have no ERP System value, 
 *  When the update is executed, 
 *  Then all existing Work Center records must be updated with ERP System = NLC_SAP. 
 

 *  Create New EBS Work Centers 

 *  Given that business has provided a mapping of EBS-equivalent Work Centers, 
 *  When new Work Centers are created in CRM, 
 *  Then each record must be created with ERP System = ECL_EBS. 
 

 *  Attribute Setup for New EBS Work Centers 

 *  Given that EBS Work Centers must be fully defined for downstream integration, 
 *  When the new EBS Work Centers are created, 
 *  Then each record must include the following attributes populated: 

 *  Name 
 *  SAP Cost Center 
 *  SAP Planner Group 
 *  SAP Main Plant 
 *  SAP Work Center – Surcharge 
 *  SAP Work Center – Fee Admin

column8: Data Setup – Update User Records with NSAP and EBS Work Centers Based on Business-Provided Mapping
column11:
As a Data Conversion Specialist
I want to update all User records in CRM so that each user has both NSAP and EBS Work Center fields populated based on the mapping provided by the business
 
So that the system can route service orders and recurring services correctly to the appropriate ERP (NSAP or EBS) depending on the Sold-To account’s ERP System.
 

 
Context and Background: 

 *  The User entity currently contains a renamed lookup field NSAP SAP Work Center and a new lookup field EBS SAP Work Center. 
 *  The business will provide a mapping file defining one-to-one relationships between existing NSAP Work Centers and corresponding EBS Work Centers, including all required reference attributes. 
 *  Using this mapping, CRM data must be updated so that every User record with an existing NSAP SAP Work Center also contains the appropriate EBS SAP Work Center. 
 *  This ensures Field Service order routing, service order creation, update, and confirmation can dynamically select the correct Work Center based on ERP context.
column19: Moved out of state In QA
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Dependency on Business Mapping 

 *  Given that the business team provides a mapping of NSAP ? EBS Work Centers, 
 *  When the data setup activity begins, 
 *  Then the mapping file must be used as the authoritative source for populating the EBS SAP Work Center on User records. 
 

 *  Populate EBS SAP Work Center Field 

 *  Given that a User record already has an NSAP SAP Work Center populated, 
 *  When the mapping is applied, 
 *  Then the corresponding EBS SAP Work Center field must be updated using the mapped value from the business file. 
 

 *  Maintain Existing NSAP Values 

 *  Given that existing NSAP SAP Work Center associations are valid and still required for NSAP transactions, 
 *  When EBS values are added, 
 *  Then existing NSAP Work Center data must remain unchanged. 
 

 *  Validation of Data Accuracy 

 *  Given that both fields (NSAP and EBS SAP Work Center) are populated, 
 *  When data validation is executed, 
 *  Then each record must have valid lookup references to active Work Centers with correct ERP System values (NLC_SAP for NSAP, ECL_EBS for EBS). 
 

 *  Error Handling 

 *  Given that an update activity fails, 
 *  Then the record should be flagged in the data load summary log for manual follow-up.

column8: Data Setup – Update Team Records with NSAP and EBS Work Centers Based on Business-Provided Mapping
column11:
As a Data Conversion Specialist
I want to update all Team records in CRM so that each Team has both NSAP and EBS Work Center fields populated based on the mapping provided by the business
 
So that Field Service recurring services and service visits can correctly reference the appropriate Work Center for each ERP system (NSAP or EBS), ensuring proper routing and integration during service order creation, update, and confirmation.
 

 
Context and Background: 

 *  The Team entity currently contains a renamed lookup field NSAP SAP Work Center and a newly added lookup field EBS SAP Work Center. 
 *  The business will provide a mapping file defining one-to-one relationships between existing NSAP Work Centers and their equivalent EBS Work Centers, including all supporting attributes. 
 *  This mapping will serve as the basis for data setup activities to ensure every Team record that currently references an NSAP Work Center is also linked to the correct EBS Work Center. 
 *  The purpose of this story is to establish dual ERP visibility and routing alignment at the Team level, enabling the system to handle hybrid NSAP and EBS accounts consistently under the One Customer (1C) model.
column19: Moved out of state In QA
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Dependency on Business Mapping 

 *  Given that the business team provides a validated NSAP ? EBS Work Center mapping, 
 *  When the data setup process begins, 
 *  Then this mapping must be used as the sole reference for populating the EBS SAP Work Center field on Team records. 
 

 *  Populate EBS SAP Work Center Field 

 *  Given that a Team record already contains an NSAP SAP Work Center value, 
 *  When the mapping file is applied, 
 *  Then the corresponding EBS SAP Work Center field must be updated using the mapped EBS Work Center value. 
 

 *  Maintain Existing NSAP Associations 

 *  Given that existing NSAP SAP Work Center links are still valid, 
 *  When the EBS values are populated, 
 *  Then the NSAP data must remain unchanged and continue to function for NSAP transactions. 
 

 *  Data Validation and Integrity 

 *  Given that both NSAP and EBS Work Center fields are populated, 
 *  When data validation is executed, 
 *  Then each lookup reference must resolve to an active Work Center record whose ERP System value is correctly set (NLC_SAP for NSAP / ECL_EBS for EBS). 
 

 *  Error Handling 

 *  Given that some errors during the update process, 
 *  Then those records must be captured in the data load summary log for business review and correction.

column11:
As a Ops Admin,
 
I want the Warehouse table to be added to the sitemap under the Master Data section in the Ecolab Admin App,
 
So that I can easily access, view, and manage Wareshouse records (both NSAP and EBS) directly from the admin interface without needing to navigate through backend tools or hidden entity views.
column19: Moved out of state In QA
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Visibility in Sitemap 

 *  Given the user has Ops Admin privileges, 
 *  When they open the Ecolab Admin App, 
 *  Then they should see a section called Master Data in the sitemap, 
 *  And under that section, an entry labeled Warehouse should appear in the section Service after SAP Work Centers 
 

 *  Navigation Behavior 

 *  Given the user selects the Warehouse option in the sitemap, 
 *  When the page loads, 
 *  Then it should open the Active Warehouse view by default, showing all active records with columns such as: 

 *  Name 
 *  Description 
 

 *  The View should be sorted based on Name (A to Z)

column8: Add SAP WorkCenter Table to Sitemap under Master Data Section in Ecolab Admin App
column11:
As a system administrator,
I want the SAP Work Center table to be added to the sitemap under the Master Data section in the Ecolab Admin App,
 
So that I can easily access, view, and manage SAP Work Center records (both NSAP and EBS) directly from the admin interface without needing to navigate through backend tools or hidden entity views.
 

 
Context and Background: 

 *  The Ecolab Admin App serves as the administrative control hub for managing key master data entities (e.g., Service Types, Offerings, and other configuration tables). 
 *  Currently, the SAP Work Center table is not available in the sitemap, requiring users to access it via advanced find or backend configuration areas. 
 *  With the introduction of EBS WorkCenters and the ERP System lookup field, the visibility and management of WorkCenters will become more frequent and business-critical. 
 *  Adding the table to the sitemap ensures that system administrators and support users can maintain mappings, validate setup data, and support downstream integration troubleshooting directly within the app.

column8: Add ERP System Lookup Field on SAP Work Center Entity to Distinguish NSAP and EBS Work Centers
column11:
As a CRM System Administrator
I want to add an ERP System lookup field on the SAP Work Center entity
 
So that each Work Center record can be explicitly associated with its corresponding ERP system (NSAP or EBS), ensuring proper segregation, reporting, and integration alignment across dual-ERP operations.
 

 
Context and Background: 

 *  Currently, the CRM SAP Work Center entity contains only NSAP Work Centers. 
 *  There is no existing way to differentiate which ERP system a given Work Center record belongs to. 
 *  As part of the One Customer (1C) initiative, both NSAP and EBS Work Centers will coexist. 
 *  EBS Work Centers will be introduced and maintained in CRM, and integration logic must determine which Work Center to use based on the Sold-To account’s ERP system. 
 *  Therefore, an ERP System lookup field must be introduced on the SAP Work Center entity to distinguish between the two ERP sources and enable filtering, reporting, and integration logic. 
 *  This field will reference the ERP System master entity (values such as NLC_SAP for NSAP and ECL_EBS for EBS).
column14: CodeReviewed; Data Dictionary; FBU R2 Release; FBU_QAPush_Nov_Major4; ReadyforDemo
column19: Moved out of state In QA
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Field Creation 

 *  Given that the SAP Work Center entity currently has no way to identify ERP system association, 
 *  When the enhancement is implemented, 
 *  Then a new mandatory lookup field named ERP System should be added on the SAP Work Center entity referencing the ERP System table after the field Name. 
 *  Existing Users with Edit Access to SAP Work Center should be able to update the ERP system field 
 

 *  New Data Entry  

 *  Given that new Work Centers will be created in CRM in the future,  
 *  When a new Work Center record is created,  
 *  Then the user should be required to select an ERP System (either NLC_SAP or ECL_EBS) before saving the record.  
 

 *  Data Validation  

 *  Given the ERP System field is now available,  

 *  When any Work Center record is opened in the form,  
 *  Then the ERP System field should be visible and editable for administrators and read-only for standard users.  
 

 *  Given that data integrity must be maintained,  

 *  When the ERP System lookup is updated,  
 *  Then the change should be tracked in audit history to ensure visibility of updates.  
 

 

 *  Reporting  

 *  Given that business users may require reports separating NSAP and EBS Work Centers,  
 *  When Work Center views or advanced finds are run,  
 *  Then the ERP System field should be available as a searchable and filterable column to distinguish the data sets.

column7: Enable Dual-ERP Support on Service Type Entity (NSAP & EBS Fields and Views)
column11:
Background and Business Context
 

 *  As part of the One Customer (1C) initiative, Field Service entities need to support both NSAP and EBS attributes simultaneously. 
 *  The Service Type table in CRM currently contains SAP-specific references (e.g., PM Activity Type and ZACT codes) used only for NSAP integration. 
 *  Since EBS uses its own distinct set of activity and order mappings, the system must be able to differentiate between NSAP and EBS fields while maintaining compatibility with existing records and integrations. 
 *  This requirement ensures dual ERP capability for configuration, reporting, and integration purposes during and after the transition to EBS. 
 

 
Scope of Change 

 *  Rename existing field “SAP PM Activity Type” to “NSAP SAP PM Activity Type.” 
 *  Add a new field “EBS SAP PM Activity Type” with a new option set containing all valid EBS activity type values. 
 *  Rename existing field “ZACT” to “NSAP ZACT.” 
 *  Add a new field “EBS ZACT” with a new option set containing all valid EBS ZACT values. 
 *  Ensure both NSAP and EBS fields are available on the Service Type form and views for configuration and reference. 
 

 
Field Configuration Details 

 *  Retain all existing NSAP PM Activity Type option values as they are: 
 *  Not Applicable, REN, ZAN, ZCL, ZCO, ZEQ, ZES, ZCD, ZIN, ZMI, ZOA, ZPM, ZRE, ZSA, ZSS, ZSEO, ZTR, ZWA, ZPT. 
 *  Configure the new EBS SAP PM Activity Type option set with values sourced from the final EBS mapping document. 
 *  Configure the new EBS ZACT option set similarly using EBS-approved values. 
 

 
Form and View Updates 

 *  Update the Active Incident Type view to rename the existing ZACT column to NSAP ZACT and add the new EBS ZACT column. 
 *  Update the Allow on Service Type lookup to display both NSAP ZACT and EBS ZACT. 
 *  Update the Allow on Service Visit lookup to display both NSAP ZACT and EBS ZACT. 
 *  Update the Recurring Service Type view to rename ZACT to NSAP ZACT and add EBS ZACT. 
 *  The Inactive Incident Type view does not require any changes. 
 *  Ensure all relevant forms show both NSAP and EBS PM Activity Type fields in logical grouping for usability. 
 

 
Data Update and Cleanup Activities 

 *  Populate the new EBS fields (EBS SAP PM Activity Type and EBS ZACT) for all existing service types once created. 
 *  Validate that every service type record has both NSAP and EBS mappings where applicable. 
 *  Coordinate with the integration team to confirm the final value mappings for EBS fields. 
 *  Conduct a data quality check to ensure no records are left unmapped or inconsistent. 
 

 
Dependencies and Preconditions 

 *  Requires confirmation of EBS activity and ZACT code values from the integration mapping team. 
 *  Dependent on completion of dual-ERP design decisions for Work Center and Order Type features. 
 *  Must be completed before EBS service order creation and synchronization development begins. 
 

 
Expected Outcome 

 *  Service Type entity supports both NSAP and EBS fields simultaneously. 
 *  All active views and forms are updated to reflect both sets of fields. 
 *  Integration logic can dynamically determine which fields to use based on the account’s ERP system. 
 *  Data consistency and mapping completeness are validated across all existing service types.

column8: Update Service Type Entity with NSAP and EBS Fields (SAP PM Activity Type and ZACT) including Form and View Updates
column11:
As a CRM System Administrator
 
 
I want the Service Type entity in Field Service to support both NSAP and EBS fields for ZACT
 
So that the system can operate in a dual-ERP environment and correctly handle both NSAP and EBS integration requirements without disrupting existing processes.
 

 
Context and Background: 

 *  Currently, the Service Type entity in CRM contains two SAP-related fields — “SAP PM Activity Type” and “ZACT.” 
 *  This field is used exclusively for NSAP integrations and are referenced in multiple views, lookups, and forms across the Field Service module. 
 *  As part of the One Customer initiative and EBS migration, the system must now maintain separate field sets for NSAP and EBS to support hybrid operations. 
 *  This requires renaming the existing NSAP fields, introducing new EBS fields, and updating all related views and forms to display and manage both sets consistently. 
 *  These changes ensure integration, reporting, and configuration compatibility across both ERP systems during the transition period. 
 

 
Scope of the Change: 

 *  Rename existing field “SAP PM Activity Type” to “NSAP SAP PM Activity Type.”  
 *  Add a new field “EBS SAP PM Activity Type” (Option Set) to store EBS-specific values.  
 *  Rename existing field “ZACT” to “NSAP ZACT.” 
 *  Add a new field “EBS SER” (Text) to store EBS-specific SER codes. 
 *  Update Service Type forms, lookups, and system views to display both NSAP and EBS fields. 
 *  Ensure both NSAP and EBS fields are editable and visible to admins for configuration. 
 *  Retain all existing NSAP data and logic while enabling new EBS data capture.
column14: ACChanged; CodeReviewed; FBU R2 Release; FBU_QAPush_Nov_Major4; ReadyforDemo
column19: Moved out of state In QA
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:  

 *  Field Updates 

 *  Given the existing Service Type entity in CRM contains the fields “SAP PM Activity Type” and “ZACT,”  

 *  When the solution is deployed,  
 *  Then the “SAP PM Activity Type” field should be renamed to “NSAP SAP PM Activity Type,” retaining all its existing values.  
 

 *  Given the renamed NSAP field exists,  

 *  When the EBS migration design is implemented,  
 *  Then a new field named “EBS SAP PM Activity Type” should be added with a separate option set containing valid EBS PM Activity Type values.  
 

 *  Given the existing “ZACT” field is used for NSAP integrations, 

 *  When the entity updates are deployed, 
 *  Then it should be renamed to “NSAP ZACT” and a new “EBS SER” field should be created as an text field for EBS-specific codes. 
 *  EBS SER field should be mandatory 
 

 

 *  Form Updates 

 *  Given the Service Type main form displays NSAP fields,  

 *  When the update is deployed,  
 *  Then the form should also display both NSAP SAP PM Activity Type and EBS SAP PM Activity Type field on the form.  
 

 *  Given the form previously displayed the ZACT field, 

 *  When the update is deployed, 
 *  Then both “NSAP ZACT” and “EBS SER” fields should appear on the form 
 

 

 *  View Updates 
 *  Given system views exist such as “Active Incident Type,” “Allow on Service Lookup,” “Allow on Service Visit Lookup” and “Recurring Service Type,” 

 *  When the solution is deployed, 
 *  Then each of these views should display both “NSAP ZACT” and “EBS SER” columns. 
 

 

 *  Data Validation 

 *  Given existing Service Type records contain NSAP values only, 

 *  When the new EBS fields are introduced, 
 *  Then the EBS fields should initially be blank until updated with the appropriate values. 
 

 
 *  Given EBS field values are entered, 

 *  When the record is saved, 
 *  Then both NSAP and EBS values should persist correctly and appear in their respective views.

column8: Data Setup - Populate EBS SER Values on All Service Type Records (Master Data Setup)

As a CRM Data Administrator
 
I want to populate the newly added EBS SAP PM Activity Type and EBS SER fields for all existing Service Type records
 
So that each Service Type is correctly configured for EBS integration and dual-ERP operations without disrupting existing NSAP mappings.
 

 
Context and Background: 

 *  Following the introduction of new field (EBS SAP PM Activity Type and EBS ZACT) on the Service Type entity, all existing service types need valid EBS values to ensure end-to-end integration readiness. 
 *  This activity represents a master data setup or data conversion task that ensures all Service Type records are populated with their corresponding EBS values before enabling EBS service order creation, synchronization, or testing. 
 *  The EBS mappings for PM Activity Type and NSAP ZACT and EBS SER will be derived from the finalized mapping documents shared by the integration team. 
 *  This story focuses purely on data population and validation — not field creation or form configuration (those are covered in a separate story).
