column8: DC - Merge Ship To Accounts
column11:
As a data conversion analyst,
I need to build a merge package that reads flagged records from the data conversion table (using survivor account mapping and legacy source details) and merges duplicate Water and Hygiene ship to accounts for the same customer into their respective survivor accounts,
 
so that CRM and downstream systems maintain a single accurate version of each account while preserving child relationships and data integrity.
 

 
Background and Rationale: 
During the One Customer (1C) implementation, Water (NSAP) and Hygiene (EBS) systems each contain duplicate or versioned Ship-To accounts. These must be merged within their respective legacy sources prior to final BCA linkage. 

 
The merge package will:
 

 *  Use a data conversion control table that lists each account, its country, legacy source, legacy Sold-To or Ship-To numbers, survivor account ID, and target EBS account number. 
 *  Group and merge accounts based on survivor account and legacy source (EBS or NSAP). 
 *  Automatically migrate child records (Opportunities, TVD Programs, RTW, etc.) to the survivor account. 
 *  Flag records for exception handling and produce reconciliation reports. 
 

 
This ensures that for each ERP source, one Water account and one Hygiene account survive per customer — ready for BCA creation.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 
 

 *  Scenario 1: Hygiene Accounts Ship To Creation after Sold To merge 

 *  Given a ship to is not found in CRM but is listed as an account in EBS 
 *  When the merge package runs 
 *  A ship to will be created and linked to the sold to 
 

 *  Scenario 2: Water Accounts Ship to Merge after sold to merge 

 *  Given multiple Water Ship To accounts exist for the same customer within a 1C district 
 *  When the merge package runs, 
 *  Then all Water Ship To accounts are consolidated into a single survivor Water account. and related to the survivor sold to 
 

 *  Scenario 3: Child Record Migration 

 *  Given child records 

TPA 

Tank Orders 

Tank 

Reocuring services 

Quotes 

On Demand requests 

E-Data Configurations 

Analytical Sample Templates 

Analytical Samples 

Service Visits 

Billing Arrangments 

 
 
 *  When the merge package runs, 
 *  Then all child records are re-parented to the surviving account without data loss. 
 

 *  Scenario 4: Exception Handling 

 *  Given a child record cannot be re-parented (e.g., timeouts or exceptions), 
 *  When the merge process runs, 
 *  Then the exception is logged with details for reconciliation. 
 

 

Business Requirements: 
 

 *  Account Consolidation 

 *  Identify and create Hygiene ship to accounts  
 *  Identify and merge duplicate Water ship to accounts into one Water ship tosurvivor account. 
 

 *  Child Record Re-Parenting 

 *  Re-parent all related records from source accounts to the survivor account: 

 *  

TPA 

Tank Orders 

Tank 

Reocuring services 

Quotes 

On Demand requests 

E-Data Configurations 

Analytical Sample Templates 

Analytical Samples 

Service Visits 

Billing Arrangments

column7: SalesOrg Harmonization and Data Conversion for One Customer – Transition from 2001 to CA10
column11:
Business Objective:
To enable a unified product, sales, and reporting experience across Water and Hygiene divisions under the One Customer – Canada model by standardizing and harmonizing SalesOrg (Sales Organization) values. 
The goal is to transition all applicable Water accounts and related transactional data from SalesOrg 2001 to the unified Hygiene SalesOrg CA10, ensuring seamless continuity in product filtering, opportunity management, and downstream reporting once all divisions operate under the single SalesOrg CA10.
 

 
Business Requirement: 

 *  SalesOrg Alignment: 

 *  All active Water accounts currently under SalesOrg 2001 must be updated to the unified SalesOrg CA10. 
 *  This update must cascade to all dependent entities (Opportunities, RTW, Lost Business, Sales Activities, and Tank Orders) to maintain alignment between Account-level and record-level SalesOrg values. 
 

 *  Product–SalesOrg Synchronization: 

 *  Products available today under SalesOrg 2001 (Water) must be made available under CA10 (Hygiene) using their equivalent EBS Product Numbers provided by the business. 
 *  A new Product–SalesOrg linkage should be created for CA10 in CRM, ensuring the right product filtering logic works for Opportunities, RTW, and Lost Business entries post-migration. 
 

 *  Data Consistency Across Related Entities: 

 *  All transactional records referencing Water accounts must be updated to reflect the correct SalesOrg (CA10) to prevent discrepancies in filtering, validation, and reporting logic. 
 

 

 

 
Deliverables:
 

 *  Updated SalesOrg values across all relevant CRM entities for Water accounts migrated to CA10. 
 *  New Product–SalesOrg mappings created for CA10 using EBS Product Numbers (per business-provided mapping file). 
 *  Validation and Audit Reports capturing: 

 *  Total records processed per entity. 
 *  Old vs. New SalesOrg values. 
 *  Missing or skipped records (e.g., missing EBS mappings). 
 

 *  Configuration validation confirming Opportunities, RTW, and Lost Business entities correctly filter products based on CA10 SalesOrg. 
 *  Documentation update outlining SalesOrg dependency tables, field names, and synchronization logic for long-term maintenance.

column8: Load and Validate Product–Sales Org Mapping for New EBS Products (Canada Go-Live)
column11:
As a data conversion analyst supporting the One Customer Canada Go-Live
I want to validate and create new product records and sales org mappings in CRM using the EBS product list shared by business
 
So that all new EBS products are correctly represented in CRM and linked to the proper sales orgs (CA10 for Hygiene, 2001 for Water) before conversion.
 

 
Business Context / Rationale 

 *  The business provided a validated Excel sheet listing legacy NSAP products and their corresponding new EBS product numbers and names. 
 *  Canada’s F&B (1C) model uses two key Sales Orgs: 

 *  CA10 ? Hygiene 
 *  2001 ? Water 
 

 *  These EBS products must be created and mapped to the correct sales orgs before cutover to ensure that transactions, price lists, and service templates reference valid CRM products. 
 *  CRM must also maintain backward traceability — each new EBS product should link to its corresponding NSAP product using an Existing Product Lookup field. 
 *  This story focuses on data validation and creation within CRM (not integration logic). 
 *  Separate stories will handle ongoing product–sales org mapping logic and data sync validation. 
 

 
Business Requirements: 

 *  Load the business-provided Excel data into a staging table (ProductConversion_Staging). 
 *  Filter and process only the rows where: 

 *  Sales Org = 2001 (Water) 
 *  Scope = ‘F&B – In Scope’ 
 *  New EBS Product Number is not blank, zero, or invalid (#N/A, Delayed, etc.). 
 

 *  Retrieve distinct New EBS Product Numbers from this filtered data. 
 *  For each EBS product number: 

 *  Check if the product already exists in CRM. 
 *  If not, create a new product record in CRM with attributes from the Excel sheet (Name, Product Number, Description, etc., Legacy product Number). 
 *  If the product already exists, update the staging table to mark the record as “Exists in CRM.” 
 

 *  For each newly created or existing product, populate the Existing Product Lookup field to reference the NSAP product. 
 *  Ensure proper Product–Sales Org Mapping is established: 

 *  CA10 for Hygiene 
 *  2001 for Water 
 

 *  Log results in the staging table for traceability (Created, Updated, Exists). 
 *  These steps must be completed before cutover so that pricing and product associations work seamlessly during go-live.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Validate source product list 

 *  Given the business has provided the EBS Product Excel sheet 
 *  When the data is loaded into the staging table 
 *  Then the system must validate all entries where Sales Org = 2001 and Scope = F&B – In Scope 
 *  And exclude records with invalid or missing new EBS product numbers. 
 

 *  Identify distinct EBS products 

 *  Given the staging table contains valid product data 
 *  When the distinct New EBS Product Numbers are retrieved 
 *  Then the system must prepare a list of unique EBS products for validation and creation. 
 

 *  Check for existing products in CRM 

 *  Given a list of EBS Product Numbers from staging 
 *  When the CRM product table is queried 
 *  Then any matching products must be marked as “Exists in CRM” in the staging table 
 *  And must not be recreated. 
 *  and the Legacy product Number lookup should be updated on this existing record to match the NSAP product ID 
 

 *  Create new EBS products if not found 

 *  Given an EBS product does not exist in CRM 
 *  When the process executes 
 *  Then the product must be created in CRM with all key attributes from the Excel source 
 *  And the Existing Product Lookup field must reference the NSAP legacy product. 
 

 *  Log results and validation summary 

 *  Given all products are processed 
 *  When the conversion process completes 
 *  Then the staging table must record Created / Exists / Updated statuses for each product 
 *  And a summary report must display total counts by status and success percentage. 
 

 *  No duplicate products 

 *  Given product creation is complete 
 *  When CRM is validated post-load 
 *  Then no duplicate product numbers must exist across NSAP and EBS product tables. 
 

 

The List of Product Sales Org Mapping shared by Business is provided below 
 
ProductSalesOrg.xlsx
 

 

 
Developer Notes: 

 *  Create a new staging table in the data conversion schema to store and process the business-provided product mapping file. 

 *  Proposed table name: NSAP_EBS_Product_SalesOrg_Mapping 
 

 *  Columns to include: 

 *  All columns from the business spreadsheet (e.g., Existing Product Name, Existing Product Number, Scope, Sales Org, Origin, New EBS Product Name, New EBS Product Number, Product Status). 
 

 *  Derived / additional columns: 

 *  Existing_Product_GUID ? stores the GUID of the NSAP (legacy) product fetched from CRM Product table. 
 *  New_EBS_Product_GUID ? stores the GUID of the newly created or existing EBS product in CRM Product table. 
 *  Processing_Status ? flags each record as CREATE_NEW, UPDATE_EXISTING, or SKIP. 
 *  Execution_Status ? logs final outcome: SUCCESS, FAILURE, or VALIDATION_ERROR. 
 *  Execution_Timestamp ? date/time when the record was last processed. 
 *  Error_Message ? short description of any exception or validation issue (nullable). 
 

 *  Processing logic: 

 *  Load the business Excel data into this table (one-time load). 
 *  For each record: 
 *  Use the Existing Product Number to find its CRM product GUID; populate Existing_Product_GUID. 
 *  Check if the New EBS Product Number already exists in CRM. 
 *  If exists, populate New_EBS_Product_GUID, mark Processing_Status = UPDATE_EXISTING. 
 *  If not exists, create the product in CRM, capture the GUID, mark Processing_Status = CREATE_NEW. 
 

 *  Update Execution_Status to SUCCESS upon completion. 

 *  If an error occurs (e.g., product creation failure, invalid lookup, or missing key field): 
 *  Log details in the generic data conversion error log table. 
 *  Update Execution_Status = FAILURE and record the error message in the staging table. 
 

 *  Post-processing: 

 *  Verify counts between source Excel and staging table (total, created, updated). 
 *  Generate validation output showing: 
 *  Total records processed 
 *  Successfully created 
 *  Updated 
 *  Failed (with reasons)

column8: DC-TECHNICAL SPIKE: Understand account Site merges
column11:
As an CAM / BDM / Sys Admin. I need to view site account data in the new 1C model. I need to analyze the source data (Snowflake view) and create a new pipeline (ADF or SSIS) so that newly merged sites are correctly mapped. Duplicate sites will be unlinked and de-activated, and all site associations will remain intact.
 

 
Determine view to use and site merge and deactivation strategy

 *  ShipTo_Create_Update_Pipeline

 *  NSAP Pipelines

 *  Product
 
 

 

 

 

 
Analyze Current Logic

New Site mappings

• Document impact's on current pipeline with the new view
 

 

 
Identify the ETL pipeline technology

•Identify risks with the snowflake connector for both options
 

 
 
New ETL pipeline

• Identify an error logging system to log errors when a load does not occur and plans to reload them.
 
• Ensure legacy account number is stored somewhere
 

 
Analyze Record Counts

Identify load testing environment

Identify load plan
 
• Identify cutover plan, and at what step Site merges should happen (after SSA consolidation, and Org mapping console job is done)
 

 
Impact Assessment
 
• List areas that maybe be impacted with the Site merge load 

 
Testing Approach
 
• Define scenarios to confirm current behavior? future behavior?
 
• Develop Site merge validation to ensure data and counts are correct
 

 
Deliverables
 
• Site mapping document
 
• Documentation on findings above 
• Effort estimate and prerequisites for implementing the change.

column8: DC: Update SalesOrg to CA10 for Opportunities, RTW, Lost Business, Sales Activities, and Tank Orders Linked to Water Accounts Migrating Under CA10
column11:
As a data conversion analyst,
 
 
 
 
I want to update the SalesOrg field to CA10 across all key CRM entities linked to Water accounts that are transitioning to CA10 under the One Customer model,
 
so that product filtering, sales logic, and reporting continue to function correctly for all related records post-migration.
 

 
Background and Rationale: 

 *  Under the One Customer – R1 Canada initiative, all Water accounts associated with legacy SalesOrg 2001 are being updated to the unified SalesOrg CA10 (Hygiene). 
 *  This alignment must be cascaded to all related CRM entities that reference the SalesOrg field directly or indirectly. 
 *  In CRM, the SalesOrg value drives Product filtering – determining which products appear on Opportunities, RTW, and Lost Business records. 
 *  Because these entities depend on the parent Account’s SalesOrg, when Accounts move from 2001 to CA10, all associated child records must also reflect CA10. 
 *  The following related entities are in scope for this update: 

 *  Opportunities (ecl_accountsalesorgid, SalesOrg LookUp) 
 *  Opportunity Products (ecl_productsalesorgid, ProductSalesOrg LoopUp; ecl_opptysalesorgid, SalesOrg LookUp) 
 *  Retain-to-Win (RTW) records (ecl_productsalesorgid, ProductSalesOrg LoopUp) 
 *  RTW Products (field: ecl_productsalesorgid)  
 *  Lost Business records (ecl_salesorgid, SalesOrg LookUp) 
 *  Lost Business Products (ecl_productsalesorgid, ProductSalesOrg LoopUp) 
 *  Sales Activities SalesOrg (ecl_salesorgid, SalesOrg LookUp) and Product SalesOrg (ecl_productsalesorgid, ProductSalesOrg LoopUp)  
 *  Tank Orders (ecl_salesorgid, SalesOrg LookUp)  
 *  Tank Order Detail Product SalesOrg (ecl_productsalesorgid, ProductSalesOrg LoopUp) and Account SalesOrg (ecl_opptysalesorgid, SalesOrg LookUp)
 
 

 *  This change ensures the unified SalesOrg (CA10) is consistently represented across all data layers, maintaining integrity in product selection, reporting, and downstream integrations.
column19: Moved out of state In Development
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 
 
 

 *  Scenario 1 – Identify All Impacted Water Accounts 

 *  Given all Water accounts currently linked with SalesOrg 2001, 
 *  When those accounts are flagged for migration to CA10, 
 *  Then a list of impacted Account IDs must be compiled for use across dependent entity updates. 
 

 *  Scenario 2 – Update Related Opportunities and Products 

 *  Given opportunities linked to those migrated accounts, 
 *  When the data conversion executes, 
 *  Then the Opportunity SalesOrg (ecl_accountsalesorgid, SalesOrg LookUp) field must be updated from 2001 ? CA10. 
 *  And the Opportunity Product SalesOrg (ecl_productsalesorgid, ProductSalesOrg LoopUp; ecl_opptysalesorgid, SalesOrg LookUp) must be updated to CA10 as well. 

 *  Product SalesOrg should be linked to the equivalent EBS Product Sales org Record  
 

 

 *  Scenario 3 – Update RTW and RTW Products  

 *  Given RTW records associated with migrated accounts,  
 *  When the update runs,  
 *  Then both RTW Retain To Win Product SalesOrg field (ecl_productsalesorgid, ProductSalesOrg LoopUp) must be updated to CA10 

 *  Product SalesOrg should be linked to the equivalent EBS Product Sales org Record 
 

 

 *  Scenario 4 – Update Lost Business and Lost Business Products 

 *  Given Lost Business records linked to migrated accounts, 
 *  When the conversion runs, 
 *  Then Lost Business SalesOrg (ecl_salesorgid, SalesOrg LookUp) and Product SalesOrg (ecl_productsalesorgid, ProductSalesOrg LoopUp) fields must be updated to CA10. 

 *  Product SalesOrg should be linked to the equivalent EBS Product Sales org Record  
 

 

 *  Scenario 5 – Update Sales Activities 

 *  Given Sales Activity records referencing migrated accounts, 
 *  When the process runs, 
 *  Then the SalesOrg (ecl_salesorgid, SalesOrg LookUp) and Product SalesOrg (ecl_productsalesorgid, ProductSalesOrg LoopUp) field must be updated to CA10. 

 *  Product SalesOrg should be linked to the equivalent EBS Product Sales org Record  
 

 

 *  Scenario 6 – Update Tank Orders and Tank Order Detail  

 *  Given Tank Order records linked to the same accounts,  
 *  When the conversion runs,  
 *  Then the SalesOrg field (ecl_salesorgid, SalesOrg LookUp) on Tank Orders must be updated to CA10.  
 *  And the Tank Order Detail Product SalesOrg (ecl_productsalesorgid, ProductSalesOrg LoopUp) and Account SalesOrg (ecl_opptysalesorgid, SalesOrg LookUp) must be updated to CA10 as well.  

 *  Product SalesOrg should be linked to the equivalent EBS Product Sales org Record   
 

 

 *  Scenario 7 – Validation and Audit Logging 

 *  Given all entity updates are complete, 
 *  When validation is performed, 
 *  Then every record associated with migrated accounts must show SalesOrg = CA10. 
 *  all the updates must be audited, so that I can see the Old Value and the new value from the audit logs 
 

 

 
Dependencies: 

 *  Completion of Water Account SalesOrg migration to CA10.

XRM Query:
SELECT 
  
    o.name, 
  
    o.ecl_planttypeid, 
  
    o.ecl_paccodeid, 
  
    o.parentaccountid, 
  
    o.ecl_opportunitystage, 
  
    o.opportunityid, 
  
    o.ecl_accountsalesorgid, 
  
     o.ecl_accountsalesorgidname, 
  
    Accunt.accountnumber, 
  
    Accunt.ecl_salesorgid, 
  
    Accunt.ecl_legacyaccountid 
  
FROM 
  
    opportunity o 
  
INNER JOIN account Accunt 
  
    ON Accunt.accountid = o.parentaccountid 
  
WHERE 
  
    -- Sales Org filter on Opportunity 
  
    o.ecl_accountsalesorgid = '{BDC9F77C-7440-E011-B5B7-005056822B14}' 
  
    -- Account filters 
  
    AND Accunt.ecl_countryid = '{7E8E7493-6E09-E011-B857-005056823A59}' 
  
    AND Accunt.ecl_legacyaccountid IS NOT NULL 
  
    AND Accunt.ecl_erpsalesskillid = '{02F7EDDC-6094-F011-B4CC-000D3A3B1696}' 
  
    AND Accunt.statecode = 0
AND ecl_salesorgmainid is Not Null

column8: DC: Update Product and Sales Org Lookups to CA10 EBS Products for 1C Accounts (Tanks, Tank Orders and Tank Order Details)
column11:
As a CRM data and integration platform,
I want product and sales org lookups updated to CA10 EBS equivalents for all records linked to 1C accounts,
 
so that users transact only on valid CA10 products and sales orgs, and downstream EBS and 1C integrations remain consistent.
 

 
Business Context & Background
 

 *  As part of the One Customer (1C) initiative, Water (NSAP) accounts are being aligned and linked with Hygiene accounts under the CA10 sales organization. 
 *  To support this alignment, all downstream transactional records associated with 1C accounts must: 

 *  Reference CA10 (EBS) products, not legacy NSAP products 
 *  Reference CA10 Sales Org, not legacy sales orgs 
 

 *  Today, several CRM tables for 1C records still reference: 

 *  NSAP product records 
 *  Non-CA10 sales org values 
 

 *  If left unchanged: 

 *  Users may continue to see and transact on incorrect products 
 *  Product selection may not align with EBS 
 *  1C migration and downstream integrations will be impacted 
 

 *  This user story ensures that all in-scope transactional records tied to 1C accounts are normalized to CA10 sales org and EBS products. 
 *  The following CRM tables are in scope for this update: 

 *  ECL_Tank 
 *  ECL_TankOrder 
 *  ECL_OrderDetail (Tank Order Detail) 
 

 *  Scope Rules 

 *  Updates apply only to records linked to 1C accounts 

 *  1C account = account linked to a district with 1C flag enabled 
 

 *  Non-1C accounts are explicitly out of scope 
 *  Mapping from NSAP product ? EBS product is based on the approved product mapping file 
 *  No new product creation is in scope—existing EBS product records only
column19: Moved out of state In QA
column22:
*  Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Identify In-Scope Records for 1C Canada release 
 *  Given An account is identified as a 1C account and Related records exist in Tank, Tank Order, or Tank Order Detail tables 
 *  When The update process runs 
 *  Then Only records linked to 1C accounts are selected for updates 
 

 *  Update Product Lookup on Tank (ecl_tank) 

 *  Given An ecl_tank record is linked to a 1C account ecl_productnumber currently references an NSAP product 
 *  When An equivalent EBS (CA10) product exists in the mapping 
 *  Then ecl_productnumber is updated to the EBS product GUID 
 *  And The NSAP product reference is replaced 
 *  And No update occurs if no valid EBS equivalent exists (Identify such Products) 
 *  Fields Updated : ecl_productnumber (lookup ? Product) 
 

 *  Update Sales Org on Tank Order (ecl_tankorder) 

 *  Given An ecl_tankorder record is linked to a 1C account 
 *  When The update process runs 
 *  Then ecl_salesorgid is set to CA10 
 *  Fields Updated ecl_salesorgid (lookup ? Sales Org) 
 

 

Update Product Lookup on Tank Order Detail (ecl_orderdetail)

 *  Given An ecl_orderdetail record is linked to a 1C account ecl_productnumberid and ecl_tankproductnumber references an NSAP product 
 

 *  When A mapped EBS product exists 
 

 *  Then ecl_productnumberid and ecl_tankproductnumber is updated to the EBS product GUID 
 

 *  Fields Updated ecl_productnumberid and ecl_tankproductnumber (lookup ? Product)  
 

 *  Sync Product Name on Tank Order Detail 

 *  Given ecl_productnumberid is updated to an EBS product 
 *  When The update completes Then 
 *  ECL_ProductName is updated to match the name of the EBS product 
 *  And Product name reflects the Product table value, not legacy text 
 *  Fields Updated: ECL_ProductName (text)

Test Scenarios 

 
a. Tank (ecl_tank)

c. Tank Order Details (ecl_orderdetails)

column8: DC: Create Product–SalesOrg Mappings for CA10 Using EBS Equivalent Products from SalesOrg 2001
column11:
As a data conversion analyst,
 
I want to create new Product–SalesOrg linkages in CRM for SalesOrg CA10,
 
so that all EBS (Hygiene) equivalent products currently associated with SalesOrg 2001 (Water) are available for use under CA10 opportunities and quotes as part of the One Customer model for FBU Canada.
 

 
Background and Rationale:

 *  Under the One Customer R1 Canada initiative, all FBU Canada accounts are transitioning to a unified Hygiene SalesOrg (CA10). 
 *  Currently, products used by Water accounts are linked to SalesOrg 2001 in CRM. 
 *  To enable those same products for use by Hygiene accounts, we must create corresponding Product–SalesOrg records for CA10 using the EBS equivalent product numbers provided by the business. 
 *  The business has been asked to share a validated mapping file that includes: 

 *  Product Number (2001 Water) 
 *  Product Name (2001 Water) 
 *  EBS Product Name (Hygiene Equivalent) 
 *  EBS Product Number (Hygiene Equivalent) 
 *  “Needed under CA10” (Y/N) 
 

 *  Using this file, the CRM data team will create records in the Product Sales Org table (linking EBS products to CA10). 
 *  This ensures that EBS products are available for CA10 transactions and that product filtering logic remains consistent for Water and Hygiene accounts after the transition. 
 
 *  The business-approved Excel mapping file identifies legacy NSAP products and their new EBS equivalents. 
 *  Some products available for Water (2001) must also be available for Hygiene (CA-10). 
 *  The file includes a flag “Needed under CA-10” = Yes indicating which EBS products require mapping to CA-10. 
 *  After EBS products are created in CRM (per the previous story), those flagged items must also appear under CA-10 for pricing, templates, and transactional readiness.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 

 *  Identify eligible products 

 *  Given the validated business Excel file lists products linked to sales org 2001, 
 *  When a product’s “Needed under CA10  flag is marked Yes, 
 *  Then that product must be evaluated for creation of a CA-10 mapping. 
 

 *  Verify product presence 

 *  Given a product marked “Needed under CA10  has already been created in CRM, 
 *  When validation is performed, 
 *  Then that product must also appear as available under sales org CA10 . 
 

 *  Prevent duplicates 

 *  Given a product is already linked to CA10 in CRM, 
 *  When the data-conversion script runs, 
 *  Then no additional duplicate mapping should be created for that same product. 
 

 *  Capture errors and completion 

 *  Given all flagged products are processed, 
 *  When mapping results are reviewed, 
 *  Then every product should have a clear outcome recorded – Created, Already Exists, or Failed – and summary counts should match expectations. 
 

 

 

 


 
 
Dependencies:

 *  Business dependency: Business to provide EBS Product mapping file for SalesOrg 2001 with columns: 

 *  Needed under CA10 (Y/N) 
 *  EBS Product Name 
 *  EBS Product Number 
 

 *  Integration dependency: EBS equivalent products must exist in CRM before linkage creation. 
 


 
Developer Notes: 

 *  Target table: ecl_productsalesorg (N:N relationship between Product and Sales Org). 
 *  Source table: NSAP_EBS_Product_SalesOrg_Mapping (from previous story). 
 *  Required technical elements: 

 *  Add a column SalesOrg_GUID to store the CRM GUID for each sales org used during mapping creation. 
 *  Use this GUID when inserting into the NH20_ProductSalesOrg_Mapping table to avoid lookup ambiguity. 
 

 *  Processing logic: 

 *  Filter records where SalesOrg = 2001 and Needed_Under_CA10 = 'Yes' and New_EBS_Product_GUID is not null. 
 *  Check for existing CA-10 mappings in NH20_ProductSalesOrg_Mapping. 
 *  If not found, insert a new mapping using the CA-10 Sales Org GUID and the EBS Product GUID. 
 *  Update staging table status (Created / Exists / Failed) and timestamp. 
 *  Log exceptions to the generic conversion error log table. 
 *  Produce a post-execution summary (total processed, created, exists, failed). 
 

 *  Validation: compare source Excel counts vs CRM mappings to confirm 1-to-1 coverage of all “Needed under CA-10” products.

*  Validate that the EBS Products (ProductSalesOrg.xlsx) are loaded into the CRM Product Master if it's not present already in the Product Master (Please refer to the data in the FINAL_MAPPING Data tab) 

 *  Refer column D (New EBS Product Number) to compare the Product Numbers within CRM (Ignore rows that have #N/A for this comparison. These #N/A product records should not created in CRM) 
 *  CRM Products Number might contain leading zeros hence comparison should take this into account 

 *  If the Product number exists in CRM, do not create it just update it 
 *  If the Product number doesn't exist in CRM, then Create It 
 

 

 *  If a product doesn't exists and has to be created then Validate that the attributes are mapped as below when creating new Products in CRM based on the excel 

 *  Name - New EBS Product Name (Column D) 
 *  Product Name - New EBS Product Name (Column D) 
 *  Product ID - New EBS Product Number (Column C) 
 *  Product Type - Family (Column E) 
 *  Product PAC - PAC (Column F) 
 *  Product SubPAC - Sub Pac (Column G) 
 *  Legacy Product - GUID of the NSAP Product Number present in the column B 
 

 *  If a product exists and has to be updated then Validate that legacy product number is updated on this existing product 

 *  Legacy Product - GUID of the NSAP Product Number present in the column B. If the NSAP Product is not found, then leave it as blank 
 

 

 *  Validate that all the EBS Products are linked to SalesOrg CA10/US10 based on Country column H  

 *  A product SalesOrg record needs to be created if not already present for that combination of Product and Sales Org 
 *  If the product is applicable for Canada then create CA10 SalesOrg for the product 

 *  Column J Canada Sales Org has  a value of CA10 
 

 *  If the product is applicable for USA then create US10 SalesOrg for the product 

 *  Column I USA Sales Org has  a value of US10
 
 

 *  If the product is applicable for USA and Canada then create US10 SalesOrg and CA10 SalesOrg for the product 

 *  Column J Canada Sales Org has  a value of CA10 and
 
 *  Column I USA Sales Org has  a value of US10

Match the product number with CRM first check without begin with 0 match update product, check product number with 0 match update product else create the product in CRM 
Mapp product and SalesOrg as per the product sheet.

User story - 882190 

 
Source system - ProductSalesOrg.xlsx spreadsheet 
Target system - Ecolab Test CRM Environment 

 
Scenario 1 

 *  Precondition - New EBS Product Number (Column D in ProductSalesOrg.xlsx) is not #N/A and corresponding product not available in CRM. 
 *  Search for the same product by adding '0' as a prefix to the Product Number and still not found. 
 *  Post the execution of data conversion package, for the Product records that are not found in CRM create records with the New EBS Product Number with the below values matching. 
 *  Product Name - New EBS Product Name (Column D) 
 *  Product ID - New EBS Product Number (Column C) 
 *  Product Type - Family (Column E) 
 *  Product PAC - PAC (Column F) 
 *  Product Sub-PAC - Sub-PAC (Column G) 
 *  Legacy Product - GUID values of NSAP Product 
 *  If the Product is applicable only for Canada, then CA10 product - Sales Org mapping should be created for the Product. If it's only applicable for USA, then US10 product -Sales Org mapping should be created for the Product. If the Product is applicable for both Canada and USA, then both CA10 & US10 product- Sales Orgs mapping should be created for the Product. 
 


 
 
Scenario 2 

 *  Precondition - New EBS Product Number is not #N/A and corresponding product is found in CRM with or without adding '0' as prefix to the New EBS Product Number. 
 *  Then the 'Legacy Product' field should be updated with GUID values of NSAP Product. 
 *  If the Product is applicable only for Canada, then CA10 product - Sales Org mapping should be created for the Product. If it's only applicable for USA, then US10 product - Sales Org mapping  should be created for the Product. If the Product is applicable for both Canada and USA, then both CA10 & US10 product - Sales Org mapping  should be created for the Product.

column9: Ecolab Environment Setup – SQL Server, SSIS, Visual Studio, KingswaySoft Dynamic CRM and SSIS Production Pack
column11:
Description:
 
Set up and configure a complete development environment required for SSIS-based Dynamics 365/Dataverse data integration. The environment setup includes installation, configuration, and verification of the following components: 

 *  
SQL Server (Database Engine + Integration Services): 

 *  
Install SQL Server (Developer/Enterprise edition as per policy). 
 
 *  
Enable Integration Services feature. 
 
 *  
Configure Mixed Mode authentication and create SSISDB catalog. 
 
 

 
 *  
SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS): 

 *  
Install latest SSMS version. 
 
 *  
Verify connectivity to local SQL instance and SSISDB. 
 
 *  
Confirm ability to create and query staging databases. 
 
 

 
 *  
Visual Studio with SSIS (SSDT): 

 *  
Install Visual Studio (Community/Professional). 
 
 *  
Add SQL Server Data Tools (Integration Services Project support). 
 
 *  
Verify ability to create a new SSIS project and open packages. 
 
 

 
 *  
KingswaySoft SSIS Integration Toolkit for Dynamics 365/CRM: 

 *  
Download and install the latest KingswaySoft toolkit. 
 
 *  
Activate trial or enter license key if provided. 
 
 *  
Verify SSIS Toolbox contains Dynamics CRM Source/Destination components. 
 
 

 
 *  
KingswaySoft SSIS Productivity Pack (Optional but Recommended): 

 *  
Install Productivity Pack for advanced transforms (Premium Lookup, Derived Column, etc.). 
 
 *  
Verify availability in SSIS Toolbox.

column7: 39. Forced Merge Triggers for Redundant Sales Skill Accounts
column11:
This requirement is to ensure from a data migration perspective when multiple CRM records exist for the same customer (multiple water hygiene and water accounts) they are merged into 1 SSA. 
To Do: 
-Determine what sales skill accounts are duplicates rules are TBD and finalized. View from snowflake if applicable needs to be identified. 
-Decide on how to merge the duplicate sales skill. What tool do to use (Kingsway soft SSIS, ADF) 
-Mappings and which attribute is the true value. 
 Business Capabilities: 
 

 *   Identify cases where multiple CRM records exist for the same customer (e.g., multiple hygiene or water accounts). 
 *   Trigger controlled merges in CRM to consolidate duplicates before linking to the BCA. 
 *   Ensure merges preserve data integrity and maintain CDM key continuity. 
 

 
Technical Implementation: 

 *  Existing Account Analysis: Detailed account extract from CRM will need to be identified. Rules are TBD and finalized.

 

 
 *  Existing Account Update / Merge: Once analysis is complete the extract will need to be run in the pipeline and deactivate the duplicate sales skill, and either create a new SSA with the new merged SSA information or merge the SSA into an existing on 
 

Deliverables:

 *  Accounts marked as a 1C account which have duplicate Sales Skills will be merged into 1 with the relevant attributes.

column8: DC: Update Parent Account (H5) Alignment Across Linked Accounts
column11:
As a data conversion analyst,
I need to update the Parent Account (H5) field on Water and Hygiene account records based on business-provided mappings and existing Hygiene H5 relationships,
 
so that all account records reflect the correct parent H5 link under the One Customer (1C) model and ensure accurate hierarchical alignment between Water (NSAP) and Hygiene (EBS) accounts.

 
Background and Rationale: 
 
Under the One Customer (1C) model, each customer will have a single parent H5 account representing the unified relationship across business divisions.
Currently:
 

 *  Water (NSAP) and Hygiene (EBS) accounts have separate H5 parent accounts. 
 *  Some Water accounts have no valid H5 from EBS. 
 *  Hygiene H5s from EBS are considered the system of record for surviving H5s post–One Customer transition. 
 

 
The objective of this data conversion story is to: 

 *  Align Water accounts with the same H5 as their corresponding Hygiene accounts where both exist. 
 *  Update Water-only accounts using the H5s provided by the business mapping extract. 
 *  Identify and flag accounts where the provided H5 does not yet exist in CRM — to be created and linked automatically by integration. 
 *  Skip Hygiene-only accounts, as they already have the correct H5 linkage from EBS integration. 
 

 
This process ensures all accounts are correctly parented under the right H5, preserving downstream visibility and roll-up logic for CRM, Power BI, and Hub-integrated applications.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 

 *  Scenario 1 – Update H5 Alignment for Water + Hygiene Accounts 

 *  Given a Water account (Legacy Source = NSAP) and a Hygiene account (Legacy Source = EBS) exist for the same customer, 
 *  When the data conversion process runs, 
 *  Then: 

 *  The Water account’s Parent Account (H5) field must be updated to match the H5 value from the linked Hygiene account. 
 *  Both accounts must reflect the same parent H5 in CRM. 
 *  The output extract must list both records with the validation status as “Updated – Matched to Hygiene H5”. 
 

 

 *  Scenario 2 – Update H5 for Water-Only Accounts (Business Mapping Provided)  

 *  Sub-scenario 2a – H5 Exists in CRM  

 *  Given a Water account (Legacy Source = NSAP) with no Hygiene counterpart exists, and the business has provided an H5 mapping,  
 *  When the provided H5 exists in CRM,  
 *  Then:  

 *  The data conversion process must update the account’s Parent Account (H5) field with the provided H5 record.  
 *  The process must log the record as “Updated – H5 Assigned from Mapping” in the extract.  
 

 

 *  Sub-scenario 2b – H5 Does Not Exist in CRM  

 *  Given a Water account (Legacy Source = NSAP) with no Hygiene counterpart exists, and the provided H5 mapping refers to an H5 not found in CRM,  
 *  When the data conversion process runs,  
 *  Then:  

 *  The account must not be updated.  
 *  The record must be flagged in the output extract with the status “Skipped – Pending Integration Creation.”  
 *  The integration process will subsequently create the missing H5 in CRM and establish the link automatically.  
 *  No updates are performed by this data conversion job in this scenario.  
 

 

 

 *  Scenario 3 – Hygiene-Only Accounts (No Update Needed) 

 *  Given an account (Legacy Source = EBS) with Sales Skill = Hygiene and no corresponding Water account exists, 
 *  When the data conversion process runs, 
 *  Then: 

 *  The Parent Account (H5) field remains unchanged. 
 *  The record is logged in the extract as “No Action – Hygiene Account Retains Existing H5.”

column8: DC: Update Market Segment and Sub-Segment Alignment Across Linked Accounts
column11:
As a data conversion analyst,
I need to update the Market Segment and Sub-Segment fields across all Water and Hygiene accounts impacted by the One Customer (1C) program,
 
so that the Market Segment/Sub-Segment values remain harmonized and aligned with business-provided mappings or Hygiene account values, ensuring consistency across linked accounts in CRM and downstream systems.

 
Background and Rationale:
In the One Customer (1C) model, Water (NSAP) and Hygiene (EBS) accounts that belong to the same customer will be aligned under a single Base Customer Account (BCA). 
Currently, both divisions maintain independent Market Segment and Sub-Segment values — often using different naming conventions and hierarchies.
 
To achieve harmonization: 

 *  For Water-only accounts (no Hygiene counterpart), the business will provide a mapping sheet that specifies: 

 *  Existing Water Market Segment / Sub-Segment 
 *  Equivalent EBS (Hygiene) Market Segment / Sub-Segment to be updated to. 
 *  This mapping will be applied by the data conversion script. 
 

 *  For Water + Hygiene pairs under the same customer (linked by BCA), the Market Segment and Sub-Segment values from the Hygiene account will serve as the system of record, and must be propagated to the corresponding Water account. 
 

 
This ensures harmonization of segmentation data and prevents misalignment across CRM, reporting, and analytics platforms post-migration.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:

 *  Scenario 1 – Water-Only Account (Business Mapping Driven) 

 *  Given an account exists in CRM with: 
 *  Legacy Source = NSAP 
 *  Sales Skill = Water 
 *  and no linked Hygiene account under the same BCA, 
 *  When the data conversion process runs, 
 *  Then: 

 *  The process must reference the business-provided mapping file containing old (Water) ? new (EBS equivalent) Market Segment/Sub-Segment pairs. 
 *  The Market Segment and Sub-Segment fields on the Water account must be updated to the new mapped values. 
 *  The update must only occur if both new mapped values are available in the file. 
 *  If a valid mapping is missing, the record must be flagged in an exception log for manual review. 
 

 

 *  Scenario 2 – Linked Water and Hygiene Accounts (Copy Hygiene Values) 

 *  Given a Water account (Legacy Source = NSAP) and a Hygiene account (Legacy Source = EBS) exist for the same customer, both linked to the same BCA, 
 *  When the data conversion process runs, 
 *  Then: 

 *  The process must copy the Market Segment and Sub-Segment values from the Hygiene account to the Water account. 
 *  Both fields on the Water account must exactly match the Hygiene account’s values. 
 *  The update must overwrite any existing Water values to ensure alignment. 
 *  A confirmation log entry must record the Hygiene ? Water account ID mapping and the new applied values. 
 

 

 *  Scenario 3 – Null or Incomplete Hygiene Values 

 *  Given a Water account is linked to a Hygiene account under the same BCA, 
 *  When the Hygiene account has null or blank Market Segment or Sub-Segment values, 
 *  Then: 

 *  The Water account must not be updated. 
 *  The record must be logged in the exception report with the message “Missing Hygiene Segment/Sub-Segment” for business follow-up.

column8: DC: Single-System Sold-To Accounts (Hygiene in EBS or Water in NSAP) - SOLD_TO_1 and SOLD_TO_7
column11:
As a data conversion analyst,
I need to update and harmonize single-system Sold-To accounts (either hygiene-only in EBS or water-only in NSAP) during the 1C consolidation,
 
so that these accounts are properly aligned to the One Customer model, linked to a Base Customer Account (BCA), and updated with the correct master data.
 

 
In the hygiene-only (EBS) scenario, minimal updates are needed — simply update the sales skill to Hygiene, create a BCA, and establish linkage.
 

 
In the water-only (NSAP) scenario, more extensive enrichment is required to align with EBS standards, including updates to account number, ERP system, name, address, district, sales org, and market segment/sub-segment mappings.
 

 
This ensures consistency, data integrity, and readiness for R1 Canada go-live, while maintaining a scalable pattern for future markets (e.g., U.S. in R2)
Business Requirements: 

 *  Hygiene-Only (EBS) 

 *  Update sales skill on the account record to Hygiene 
 *  Flag the Account record for a new BCA creation 
 *  Create a BCA record does not exist already 
 *  Link the BCA with the account 
 

 *  Water-Only (NSAP) 

 *  Update the following account attributes: 
 *  Account number ? EBS-provided number 
 *  ERP system ? ECL_EBS 
 *  Account name ? EBS-provided name 
 *  District ? fetched from hygiene district linked to same primary owner 
 *  Sales Org ? fetched from SalesOrg–District intersection (for Canada R1 = C8N) 
 *  Flag the Account record for a new BCA creation
 
 *  Address (Street1, Street2, City, State/Province, Country, Zip Code) ? updated from EBS values 
 

 *  Market Segment / Sub-Segment mapping: 

 *  Dependency on business to provide mapping list from Water ? Hygiene equivalents 
 *  Update all impacted accounts per mapping file 
 

 *  Parent Account field: 

 *  If business provides surviving H5 ? update accordingly 
 *  If not provided ? leave blank; allow EBS downstream sync to populate 
 

 *  Update sales skill to Water 
 *  Create BCA and link with account 
 *  Dependencies 

 *  Business to provide Water ? Hygiene Market Segment & Sub-Segment mapping list 
 *  Business to provide surviving H5 account li?nkages for relevant Water-only accounts

column9: Design SQL queries to Perform Scenario Hygiene-only Sold-To exists in EBS
Design SQL queries  to Perform Scenario Water-only Sold-To exists in NSAP

column11:
863527 - DC:Single-System Sold-To Accounts (Hygiene in EBS or Water in NSAP) - SOLD_TO_1and SOLD_TO_7 
  
Sourcesystem - SQL tables  
Target System - CRM 
Scenario1: Hygiene-only Sold-To exists in EBS 
1. Precondition:an account exists in EBS with sales skill = Hygiene and no water counterpart inNSAP 
2. After the Data Conversion package is executed, the sales skill on the accountrecord with legacy source as EBS is updated to Hygiene  
3. Validatethat the account should be flagged for a new BCA in the SQL Stagging Table 
  
Scenario 2:Water-only Sold-To exists in NSAP 
1. Precondition:an account exists in NSAP with sales skill = Water and no Hygiene counterpartin EBS 
2. After the Data Conversion package is executed, the sales skill on the accountrecord with legacy source as NSAP is updated to Water  
3. Validatethat the account number in NSAP has been updated to match the survivor accountnumber from EBS. Update the Account number to match the EBS Account number. 
4. Validatethat the ERP system for the account in NSAP is updated to reflect the ECL_EBSsystem. 
5.Validatethat the accounts name in NSAP is updated to match the name provided by EBS 
6. Validate thatThe District should be updated by fetching the corresponding Hygienedistrict linked to the Account Owning Team (via the mapping providedby the business). 

 
 *  If there are two districts     related to the team, a query must be executed to retrieve the primary     owner's manager. The district should be updated to the manager’s     district. 
 

7. Validatethat the sales organization has been updated based on the district-sales orgmapping logic.  
7. Validate that the SalesOrg is updated as CA10. 
8. Validatethat account is flagged for BCA creation in the SQL Stagging Table 

 
SQL QUERY: 
For EBS 
SELECT LegacyAccountName, LegacySoldTo, LegacySource,ERPsystem, Snw_EBSAccountDistrict, Snw_EBSAccountSalesOrg, Snw_EBSAccountName SurvivorAccount, EBSAccountNumber, AccountNumbertoUpdateinCRM, SurvivorAccountName, SalesSkill, LegacyeqSurvivor, SoldToMerge, MergeintoSoldToAccount, CreateNewBCA, BCAAction
FROM dbo.[1CGoLiveExcelData]
WHERE SurvivorAccount = '502662946'
 
For NSAP 
SELECT LegacyAccountName, LegacySoldTo, LegacySource,ERPsystem, Snw_EBSAccountDistrict, Snw_EBSAccountSalesOrg, Snw_EBSAccountName SurvivorAccount, EBSAccountNumber, AccountNumbertoUpdateinCRM, SurvivorAccountName, SalesSkill, LegacyeqSurvivor, SoldToMerge, MergeintoSoldToAccount, CreateNewBCA, BCAAction
FROM dbo.[1CGoLiveExcelData]
WHERE SurvivorAccount = '2000205'

column8: DC: Harmonize One-to-One Hygiene + Water Cross-System Sold-To - SOLD_TO_3
column11:
As a data conversion analyst, I need to handle the special case where a single surviving account exists across both EBS and NSAP systems with duplicate Sold-To records but different legacy account numbers, so that the consolidated records correctly reflect sales skill alignment, account numbers, addresses, and parent hierarchy in line with the One Customer model.
 

 
Background & Example:
 

 *  Example Survivor Account: 502662615 
 *  Situation: One Hygiene Sold-To exists in EBS and one Water Sold-To exists in NSAP, both mapping to the same survivor account but holding different legacy account numbers. 
 *  Requirement: Ensure proper alignment of sales skill, account number, address, parent account (H5), and market attributes between the survivor and both sales skill accounts during conversion. 
 

 
This ensures that data continuity is maintained across systems, both Hygiene and Water sales skill accounts are fully aligned, and all necessary attributes are consistently carried over. 

 

 
Business Requirements:

 *  Sales Skill Alignment 

 *  Update the sales skill on the account record with legacy source = EBS ? Hygiene. 
 *  Update the sales skill on the account record with legacy source = NSAP ? Water. 
 

 *  Account Number Updates 

 *  Update the account number of the survivor account (502662615) consistently across both Water and Hygiene sales skill accounts. 
 

 *  District & Sales Org Alignment 

 *  Ensure that Market Segment, Sub-Segment, District, and Sales Org values are updated and aligned correctly on the Water sales skill account. 
 

 *  Address Synchronization 

 *  On the Hygiene sales skill account, ensure the following address fields are updated and correct: 

 *  Address Line 1 
 *  Address Line 2 
 *  City 
 *  Country 
 *  State/Province 
 *  Zip/Postal Code 
 

 *  Propagate the same address values from the Hygiene sales skill account to the Water sales skill account to maintain consistency. 
 

 *  Parent Account (H5) Alignment 

 *  The H5 parent account value present on the Hygiene account must also be updated and linked to the Water account to ensure both share the same parent H5.
column19: Moved out of state In Test
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 
 

 *  Scenario 1: Sales Skill Updates 

 *  Given an account record exists with legacy source = EBS tied to the survivor account, 
 *  When the data conversion process runs, 
 *  Then the sales skill on the record is updated to Hygiene. 
 *  And for the NSAP record (legacy source = NSAP), the sales skill is updated to Water. 
 

 *  Scenario 2: Account Number Updates 

 *  Given duplicate legacy Sold-To accounts exist across EBS and NSAP, 
 *  When the survivor account number (502662615) is identified, 
 *  Then both the Water and Hygiene sales skill accounts are updated to carry this same survivor account number. 
 

 *  Scenario 3: District/Sales Org Alignment 

 *  Given the Water sales skill account exists under the survivor record, 
 *  When the data conversion updates are applied, 
 *  Then Market Segment, Sub-Segment, District, and Sales Org values must be populated consistently from the survivor Hygiene account 
 

 *  Scenario 4: Address Synchronization (This will be handled via the new EBS ADF Integration ) 

 *  Given the Hygiene sales skill account is updated with complete address fields,  
 *  When data conversion updates run,  
 *  Then those same address values are copied into the corresponding Water sales skill account.  
 

 *  Scenario 5: Parent H5 Alignment (Covered as a part of a different user story) 

 *  Given the Hygiene sales skill account has a parent H5 assigned,  
 *  When the conversion completes,  
 *  Then the Water sales skill account is updated with the same H5 parent value.

column9: FaultFix and Debug on SOLD_TO_3_QA_Data validation Mismatch issues
Design SSIS package to Harmonize One-to-One Hygiene + Water Cross-System Sold-To - SOLD_TO_3

column11: Validating Mismatched data for SLOD TO 3 Scenario
Validating mismatched data for SOLD TO 3 Scenario

TestCases 
  
Sourcesystem - SQL tables, Target System - CRM 
Scenario1: Update Sales Skill for EBS and NSAP Legacy Source 
1. Precondition:Multiple Hygiene Sold-To exists in EBS and Multiple Water Sold-To exists inNSAP, both mapping to the same survivor account but holding different legacyaccount numbers
2.   After the Data Conversion package executed, the sales skill on theaccount record with legacy source as EBS is updated to Hygiene and account withlegacy source as NSAP is updated to Water 
  
Scenario2: Account Number Update 
 1. Precondition: Duplicate legacy Sold-To accounts existacross EBS and NSAP, 
2.The survivor account number is identified before mergingfor all Sold To accounts in EBS and NSAP 
3. Afterthe Data Conversion package executed, validate that both the Water and Hygienesales skill accounts are updated to carry this same survivor account numberafter merge and original legacy account details will be stored on legacyaccount field on sold to records 
  
Scenario 3 District & Sales Org Alignment 
 1. Precondition: Hygiene accountexists having District and Sales org details associated with survivor account 
2. After the Data Conversion package executed, validate that Districtand Sales Org values must be populated consistently from the survivor Hygieneaccount on associated Water account  
4. If Hygiene account exists with No District and Sales orgdetails then no details will be published on Water account 

 
Scenario 4: Survivor account only with EBS account and not havingNSAP account 
1. Precondition: Multiple Hygiene Sold-To exists in EBS withno   Water Sold-To exists in NSAP, mapping to thesame survivor account but holding different legacy account numbers
2.   After the Data Conversion package is executed, the sales skill on theaccount record with legacy source as EBS is updated to Hygiene and No waterskills should be added under survivor account 
  
Scenario 5: Survivor account only with NSAP account and nothaving EBS account 
1. Precondition: No Hygiene Sold-To exists in EBS and Multiple   Water Sold-To exists in NSAP, mapping to thesame survivor account but holding different legacy account numbers
2.   After the Data Conversion package is executed, the sales skill on theaccount record with legacy source as NSAP is updated to Water and No Hygieneskills should be added under survivor account 
  

 
SQL Queries: 
Scenario 1 ,2: 
select * from [dbo].[1CGoLiveExcelData]  
WHERE soldscenarioid = "SOLD_TO_3"
AND SurvivorAccount IN(
SELECT SurvivorAccount
FROM[dbo].[1CGoLiveExcelData]
GROUP BY SurvivorAccount
HAVING COUNT(*) >1 )
ORDER BY SurvivorAccount
 

 
Scenario 3 
WITH DuplicateSurvivors AS (
    SELECT SurvivorAccount
    FROM [dbo].[1CGoLiveExcelData]
    WHERE Soldtoscenarioid = 'SOLD_TO_3'
    GROUP BY SurvivorAccount
    HAVING COUNT(*) > 1
),
AccountData AS (
    SELECT
        a.SurvivorAccount,
        a.LegacyAccountShipTo,
        a.Soldtoscenarioid,
        a.SalesSkill,              -- e.g., 'EBS', 'NSAP', 'Water', 'Hygiene'
        a.DistrictId,
        a.SalesOrgId,
        a.LegacyAccountName,
        COUNT(*) OVER (PARTITION BY a.SurvivorAccount) AS DuplicateCount
    FROM [dbo].[1CGoLiveExcelData] AS a
    WHERE a.Soldtoscenarioid = 'SOLD_TO_3'
      AND a.SurvivorAccount IN (SELECT SurvivorAccount FROM DuplicateSurvivors)
)

SELECT
    w.SurvivorAccount,
    h.LegacyAccountName AS HygieneLegacyAccount,
    w.LegacyAccountName AS WaterLegacyAccount,
    h.DistrictId AS HygieneDistrict,
    h.SalesOrgId AS HygieneSalesOrg,
    w.DistrictId AS WaterDistrict,
    w.SalesOrgId AS WaterSalesOrg,
    CASE
        WHEN h.DistrictId IS NOT NULL AND h.SalesOrgId IS NOT NULL
             AND (w.DistrictId <> h.DistrictId OR w.SalesOrgId <> h.SalesOrgId)
             THEN '? Mismatch – Water account not aligned with Hygiene survivor'
        WHEN h.DistrictId IS NULL AND h.SalesOrgId IS NULL
             AND (w.DistrictId IS NOT NULL OR w.SalesOrgId IS NOT NULL)
             THEN '?? Invalid – Hygiene has no details, but Water has values'
        ELSE '? Valid – Data consistent with Hygiene survivor'
    END AS ValidationStatus
FROM AccountData h
INNER JOIN AccountData w
    ON h.SurvivorAccount = w.SurvivorAccount
   AND h.SalesSkill = 'Hygiene'
   AND w.SalesSkill = 'Water'
ORDER BY w.SurvivorAccount; 

 
Scenario 4  
SELECT *
FROM [dbo].[1CGoLiveExcelData]
WHERE SurvivorAccount IN (
    SELECT SurvivorAccount
    FROM [dbo].[1CGoLiveExcelData]
    GROUP BY SurvivorAccount
    HAVING
        COUNT(*) > 1
        AND SUM(CASE WHEN LegacySource = 'EBS' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) > 0
        AND SUM(CASE WHEN LegacySource = 'NSAP' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) = 0
)
AND LegacySource = 'EBS'
ORDER BY SurvivorAccount;
 
Scenario 5 
SELECT *
FROM [dbo].[1CGoLiveExcelData]
WHERE SurvivorAccount IN (
    SELECT SurvivorAccount
    FROM [dbo].[1CGoLiveExcelData]
    GROUP BY SurvivorAccount
    HAVING
        COUNT(*) > 1
        AND SUM(CASE WHEN LegacySource = 'EBS' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) > 0
        AND SUM(CASE WHEN LegacySource = 'NSAP' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) = 0
)
AND LegacySource = 'NSAP'
ORDER BY SurvivorAccount;

column8: DC: Data Preparation: Generate Market Segment and Sub-Segment Mapping Extract for Business Validation
column11:
As a data conversion analyst,
I need to generate and share a comprehensive extract of all accounts requiring Market Segment and Sub-Segment validation,
 
so that the business can review current Water and Hygiene account segment data, confirm mappings, and provide equivalent EBS-aligned Market Segment and Sub-Segment values for the Canada scope under the One Customer program.
 

 
Background and Rationale 
Under the One Customer (1C) initiative, Water (NSAP) and Hygiene (EBS) accounts are being consolidated under a unified Base Customer Account (BCA) model. 
To ensure data consistency, Market Segment and Sub-Segment fields on legacy Water accounts must be aligned to their EBS equivalents before migration.
 
The business will validate and provide mapping logic that ensures harmonized segmentation across both divisions for all Canadian accounts.
 

 
The IT team will therefore generate an extract of all applicable accounts — primarily Water-only accounts, but also paired Water and Hygiene accounts for reference — capturing key identifiers and classification details.
 
This extract will serve as the foundation for business mapping input (dependency D1).
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Scenario 1 – Identify All Relevant Accounts 

 *  Given the CRM data source contains both Water (NSAP) and Hygiene (EBS) accounts for Canada, 
 *  When the extract process executes, 
 *  Then all Water-only accounts (those without Hygiene counterparts) must be included, 
 *  And any paired Water + Hygiene accounts belonging to the same customer or potential BCA must also be included for comparison. 
 

 *  Scenario 2 – Extract Required Account Attributes 

 *  Given accounts are identified for inclusion, 
 *  When the extract is generated, 
 *  Then the following columns must be populated for each record: 

 *  Account GUID 
 *  Account Number 
 *  Account Name 
 *  Legacy Source (EBS or NSAP) 
 *  Sales Skill (Water / Hygiene) 
 *  Current Market Segment 
 *  Current Sub-Segment 
 *  Primary Owner 
 *  Owner 
 *  District Name  
 *  Sales Org  
 *  Country (should = “Canada") 
 *  Account Status (Active / Inactive) 
 *  Future Market Segment (Must be left blank for Business to provide) 
 *  Future Sub-Segment  (Must be left blank for Business to provide) 
 

 

 *  Scenario 3 – Apply Inclusion & Filtering Logic 

 *  Given multiple account records exist in CRM, 
 *  When the extract logic runs, 
 *  Then include only: 
 *  Accounts where Country = Canada 
 *  Account Type = Customer or Sales Skill Account 
 *  Active Status = True 
 *  And exclude test and deactivated records. 
 

 *  Scenario 4 – Output & Delivery 

 *  Given the extract generation completes successfully, 
 *  When the file is finalized, 
 *  Then it must be exported in .xlsx format, 
 *  And stored in the designated SharePoint folder, 
 *  And the business team must be notified with a timestamp and record count summary. 
 

 *  Scenario 5 – Data Quality Verification 

 *  Given the extract is ready for delivery, 
 *  When developer performs pre-delivery checks, 
 *  Then total record count and column completeness must match expected account totals, 
 *  And any records with blank Market Segment or Sub-Segment values must be flagged in a separate “Exception Tab” within the workbook for business attention.

column8: DC: Data Preparation: Generate H5 Parent Account Alignment Extract for Business Review
column11:
As a data conversion analyst,
I need to generate an extract listing all Water and Hygiene accounts requiring H5 parent account alignment validation,
 
so that the business can confirm or provide the correct Hygiene H5 (parent account) linkage for each Water-only account, ensuring proper hierarchy and data consistency for the One Customer (1C) migration.
 

 
Background and Rationale: 
In the current CRM environment, both Water (NSAP) and Hygiene (EBS) accounts have Parent Account (H5) values populated. 
However, for Water-only accounts, the existing H5 (Parent Account) reference is tied to Water H5 records, which will no longer be valid after the One Customer migration.
 

 
Under the new model, all accounts should roll up to a Hygiene-derived H5 (from EBS).
 
Therefore, business validation is required to identify — for each Water-only account — which Hygiene H5 should become its future Parent Account.
 

 
The development team will share an extract of accounts where alignment is required. The business will review and populate the corresponding Hygiene H5 name and number, or confirm if a new H5 needs to be created.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:

 *  Scenario 1 – Identify Accounts Requiring H5 Parent Account Alignment 

 *  Given the CRM dataset contains all active Canada accounts from EBS (Hygiene) and NSAP (Water), 
 *  When the extract generation logic runs, 
 *  Then it must identify: 
 *  All Water-only accounts (Legacy Source = NSAP) that currently reference a Water H5, and 
 *  Any Water + Hygiene pairs linked to different H5s, 
 *  So that business can review and confirm which Hygiene H5 should serve as the future parent for each Water account. 
 

 *  Scenario 2 – Include Required Data Fields in Extract 

 *  Given the accounts are identified for H5 alignment validation, 
 *  When the extract is generated, 
 *  Then each record must include the following columns: 

 *  Account GUID 
 *  Account Number 
 *  Account Name 
 *  Legacy Source (EBS / NSAP) 
 *  Sales Skill (Water / Hygiene) 
 *  Current Parent Account Name 
 *  Current Parent Account Number 
 *  Owner (Owner field value in CRM) 
 *  Primary Owner  
 *  District Name 
 *  Sales Org 
 *  Country (e.g., CA) 
 *  Account Status (Active / Inactive) 
 *  Future Parent Account Name (Must be left blank for the business to fill) 
 *  Future Parent Account Number (Must be left blank for the business to fill) 
 

 *  And any Water accounts with Parent Account tied to Water H5 should be clearly marked as “Requires Hygiene H5 Alignment.” 
 

 *  Scenario 3 – Apply Inclusion and Filtering Logic 

 *  Given the CRM dataset contains accounts from multiple countries and types, 
 *  When the extract logic executes, 
 *  Then include only: 

 *  Active accounts with Country = Canada 
 *  Account Type = Customer or Sales Skill Account 
 

 *  And exclude: 

 *  Deactivated or test accounts 
 *  Non-customer reference accounts 
 

 

 *  Scenario 4 – Output and Delivery Format 

 *  Given the extract completes successfully, 
 *  When the file is generated, 
 *  Then it must be delivered as an Excel (.xlsx) file containing: 

 *  Sheet 1: All accounts requiring H5 parent validation 
 *  Sheet 2: Exception list (where Parent Account is missing, invalid, or flagged for Water H5 replacement) 
 

 *  And the extract must include clear column headers, date/time stamp, and be delivered to the business data validation team for review. 
 

 *  Scenario 5 – Data Quality and Traceability 

 *  Given the extract is finalized, 
 *  When developer performs internal validation, 
 *  Then: 

 *  The number of records must reconcile with the expected count of Water-only and mismatched H5 accounts for 1C migration. 
 *  The “Requires Hygiene H5 Alignment” flag must appear correctly for impacted records. 
 

 *  Any missing or ambiguous data should appear in the exception sheet with a clear “Reason” column (e.g., Missing H5, Invalid Reference, No Hygiene Match).

column8: DC: Consolidate Multi-System Sold-To Accounts (Hygiene-only in EBS, Water-only in NSAP) Within One System - SOLD_TO_2 and SOLD_TO_9
column11:
As a data conversion analyst,
 
I need to merge and harmonize Sold-To accounts that exist only in a single system (either multiple Hygiene in EBS or multiple Water in NSAP),
 
so that duplicate Sold-To accounts are consolidated into one surviving record, enriched with the correct master data, and properly linked to a Base Customer Account (BCA).
 

 
This ensures clean account hierarchies, accurate sales skill alignment, and full compatibility with the One Customer model.
 

 *  SOLD_TO_2 (Hygiene-only in EBS): Multiple Hygiene Sold-To accounts exist in EBS, no Water counterpart in NSAP. (e.g. 502662556) 
 *  SOLD_TO_9 (Water-only in NSAP): Multiple Water Sold-To accounts exist in NSAP, no Hygiene counterpart in EBS.(e.g. 500086342) 
 

 
Both require merge activities (survivor account chosen, others deactivated), updates to sales skill and master data fields, and BCA creation/linkage. 


Business Requirements: 

 *  Merge Process 

 *  Trigger merge activity for multiple Sold-To accounts ? survivor account remains, others deactivated. 
 *  Child records (contacts, activities, opportunities, SOWs, etc.) must be merged into surviving account. 
 *  Merge logic should be developed as a reusable SSIS package for other conversion scenarios. 
 

 *  Hygiene-only Accounts (SOLD_TO_2) 

 *  Update sales skill = Hygiene 
 *  Create and link BCA 
 

 *  Water-only Accounts (SOLD_TO_9) 

 *  Update sales skill = Water 
 *  Enrich account with updated account number, name, ERP system, address, district, sales org, market segment/sub-segment, parent account (if provided) 
 *  Create and link BCA 
 

 *  Dependencies 

 *  Business to provide Water ? Hygiene Market Segment/Sub-Segment mapping 
 *  Business to confirm Food & Beverage district if multiple candidates exist 
 *  Business to provide surviving H5 parent accounts for re-parenting
column19: Moved out of state In Test
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  SOLD_TO_2  – Multiple Hygiene Sold-To in EBS, No Water in NSAP 

 *  Given multiple Hygiene Sold-To accounts exist in EBS with no Water account in NSAP 
 *  When the data conversion process runs 
 *  Then all the relevant accounts that needs to be merged are flagged for merging, so that all Hygiene Sold-To accounts for the same customer are merged into a single surviving account, with duplicates deactivated (The actual merging is handled in a different user story. This story should group and flag such records that needs to be merged into 1 account so that the other merge SSIS package can be triggered to perform the actual merge) 
 *  And the sales skill on the surviving account is updated to Hygiene 
 *  Flag the surviving Account record for BCA creation 
 *  And a Base Customer Account (BCA) is created and linked to the surviving account (Handled in a different user story) 
 

 *  SOLD_TO_9  – Multiple Water Sold-To in NSAP, No Hygiene in EBS 

 *  Given multiple Water Sold-To accounts exist in NSAP with no Hygiene account in EBS 
 *  When the data conversion process runs 
 *  Then all the relevant accounts that needs to be merged are flagged for merging, so that all Water Sold-To accounts for the same customer are merged into a single surviving account, with duplicates deactivated (The actual merging is handled in a different user story. This story should group and flag such records that needs to be merged into 1 account so that the other merge SSIS package can be triggered to perform the actual merge) 
 *  And the following updates must occur on the surviving account: 

 *  Sales skill updated to Water 
 *  Account number updated to the survivor EBS number 
 *  ERP system updated to ECL_EBS 
 *  Account name updated to match the EBS-provided name 
 *  Address fields (Street1, Street2, City, State/Province, Country, Zip Code) updated to match EBS (This is will be done the new EBS ADF integration) 
 *  District updated by fetching associated Food & Beverage district from the owning team; 

 *  If multiple valid districts exist, business must confirm which one applies 
 

 *  Sales Org updated using District–Sales Org intersection logic (Canada R1 = CA10; must be generic for future rollouts) 
 *  Market Segment and Sub-Segment updated based on mapping provided by business from Water ? Hygiene equivalents (This is handled in a different user story) 
 *  Parent Account updated only if business provides surviving H5 link; otherwise left blank for EBS downstream sync. (This is handled in a different user story) 
 

 *  Flag the surviving Account record for BCA creation 
 *  And a Base Customer Account (BCA) is created and linked to the surviving account. (Handled in a different user story) 
 

 *  Exception Handling 

 *  Given merge cannot be completed due time out or any other conflicts 
 *  When the process runs 
 *  Then exceptions must be logged in an error report with full details for reconciliation with business

column9: Design SQL Queries and validate to Perform Scenario Multiple Hygiene Sold-To in EBS, No Water in NSAP
Design SQL Queries and Validate  to Perform Scenario Multiple Water Sold-To in NSAP, No Hygiene in EBS

column11:
User story - 863528 

 
Source - SQL Staging Table 
Target - SQL Staging Table 

 
Scenario 1 

 *  Precondition– Multiple Sold-To accounts for Hygiene in EBS, but no account for Water inNSAP. 
 *  Afterthe data conversion package is executed, verify all the duplicate EBS accounts areflagged for merging in the SQL staging table as per the business approved list. 
 *  Verifythat the surviving account is flagged for creating a Base Customer Account(BCA), in staging table. 
 

  
Scenario 2 

 *  Precondition– Multiple Sold-To accounts for Water in NSAP, but no account for Hygiene in EBS. 
 *  Afterthe data conversion package is executed, verify all the duplicate NSAP accounts areflagged for merging in the SQL staging table as per the business approved list. 
 *  Verifythat the surviving account is flagged for creating a Base Customer Account(BCA) in staging table. 
 

  

 

 

SQL Queries 

 
Scenario 1: 

 
SELECT *
FROM dbo.[1CGoLiveExcelData]
 
WHERE SoldToScenarioID = 'SOLD_TO_2'
 

 
SELECT LegacyAccountName, LegacySoldTo, SurvivorAccount, EBSAccountNumber, AccountNumbertoUpdateinCRM, SurvivorAccountName, SalesSkill, LegacyeqSurvivor, SoldToMerge, MergeintoSoldToAccount, CreateNewBCA, BCAAction
 
FROM dbo.[1CGoLiveExcelData]
 
WHERE SurvivorAccount = '508731310'
 

 

 
Scenario 2: 

 
SELECT *
FROM dbo.[1CGoLiveExcelDistrict]
 
WHERE SoldToScenarioID = 'SOLD_TO_9'
 

 
SELECT LegacyAccountName, LegacySoldTo, SurvivorAccount, EBSAccountNumber, AccountNumbertoUpdateinCRM, SurvivorAccountName, SalesSkill, LegacyeqSurvivor, SoldToMerge, MergeintoSoldToAccount, CreateNewBCA, BCAAction, ERPsystem, DistrictId, Snw_EBSAccountNumber, SalesOrgId, Snw_EBSAccountSalesOrg
 
FROM dbo.[1CGoLiveExcelData]
 
WHERE SurvivorAccount = '500063580'

column8: DC: Complex Harmonization with Multiple Hygiene + Multiple Water Sold-To - SOLD_TO_4 , SOLD_TO_5 and SOLD_TO_6
column11:
As a data conversion analyst,
I need to merge and align multiple Hygiene and Water Sold-To accounts where a Hygiene account already exists in EBS,
 
so that duplicate accounts are consolidated, all values on Water accounts are synchronized with the Hygiene survivor, and both accounts are linked to the same Base Customer Account (BCA).
 

 
This ensures:
 

 *  Hygiene (EBS) is always the anchor record. 
 *  Water (NSAP) accounts are harmonized to reflect EBS values. 
 *  Both Sales Skills (Hygiene + Water) coexist under the same survivor customer. 
 *  Data integrity and downstream consistency are maintained under the One Customer model. 
 

 
This story covers: 

 *  SOLD_TO_4 (Example: Survivor Account 502662871) 
 *  SOLD_TO_5 (Example: Survivor Account 502669640) 
 *  SOLD_TO_6 (Example: Survivor Account 502951283 
 *  
 
 *  Business Requirements: 
 *  

 *  Merge Logic 

 *  Use SSIS package to merge multiple accounts into survivor ? deactivate duplicates. 
 *  Ensure all child records (contacts, activities, opportunities, SOWs, etc.) are reparented to survivor. 
 *  Reusable package logic to support SOLD_TO_4, SOLD_TO_5, SOLD_TO_6. 
 

 *  Account Field Updates 

 *  From Hygiene survivor (EBS) copy values to Water survivor (NSAP): 
 *  Account Number ? surviving account number 
 *  Account Name ? match EBS Hygiene name 
 *  Address fields (Street1, Street2, City, State/Province, Zip, Country) ? match Hygiene 
 *  District + Sales Org ? match Hygiene (Sales Org via District–Sales Org intersection, generic logic for R1 Canada and future R2 US rollout) 
 *  Market Segment + Sub-Segment ? match Hygiene 
 *  Parent Account ? copy from Hygiene (if present) 
 

 *  Sales Skill Alignment 

 *  Hygiene record ? Sales Skill = Hygiene 
 *  Water record ? Sales Skill = Water 
 

 *  ERP System 

 *  On Water survivor ? set ECL_EBS 
 

 *  BCA Creation & Linkage 

 *  Flag appropriate account records for BCA creation. The actual BCA creation will be handled as part of different user story. 
 *  Create one BCA per consolidated customer 
 *  Link BCA to both Hygiene and Water survivor accounts
column19: Moved out of state In Test
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 

 *  SOLD_TO_4 – Multiple Hygiene (EBS) + One Water (NSAP) 

 *  Example Survivor Account: 502662871 
 *  Given multiple Hygiene Sold-To accounts exist in EBS and one Water Sold-To account exists in NSAP 
 *  When the data conversion process runs 

 *  Then Hygiene accounts must be flagged for merge into one surviving Hygiene account. The actual merge will be done as part of a different user story 
 *  And Water account must be updated with the same values as the Hygiene survivor (account number, name, address, district, sales org, parent account, market segment/sub-segment) 
 *  And Sales Skills must be updated (Hygiene for Hygiene record, Water for Water record) 
 *  And the surviving accounts must be flagged for BCA creation. The actual BCA creation and linking the account to this created BCA is handled in a different user story.  
 

 

 *  SOLD_TO_5 – One Hygiene (EBS) + Multiple Water (NSAP) 

 *  Example Survivor Account: 502669640 
 *  Given one Hygiene Sold-To exists in EBS and multiple Water Sold-Tos exist in NSAP 
 *  When the data conversion process runs 

 *  Then Water accounts must be flagged for merge into one surviving Water account. The actual merge will be done as part of a different user story 
 *  And the surviving Water account must inherit all aligned values from Hygiene (account number, name, address, district, sales org, parent account, market segment/sub-segment) 
 *  And Sales Skills must be updated (Hygiene for Hygiene record, Water for Water record) 
 *  And the surviving accounts must be flagged for BCA creation. The actual BCA creation and linking the account to this created BCA is handled in a different user story.  
 

 

 *  SOLD_TO_6 – Multiple Hygiene (EBS) + Multiple Water (NSAP) 

 *  Example Survivor Account: 502951283 
 *  Given multiple Hygiene Sold-To accounts exist in EBS and multiple Water Sold-To accounts exist in NSAP 
 *  When the data conversion process runs 

 *  Then Hygiene accounts must be flagged for merge into one surviving Hygiene account. The actual merge will be done as part of a different user story 
 *  And Water accounts must be flagged for merge into one surviving Water account. The actual merge will be done as part of a different user story 
 *  And both survivor accounts must be aligned with the same values (account number, name, address, district, sales org, parent account, market segment/sub-segment) 
 *  And Sales Skills must be updated (Hygiene for Hygiene record, Water for Water record) 
 *  And the surviving accounts must be flagged for BCA creation. The actual BCA creation and linking the account to this created BCA is handled in a different user story.  
 

 

 *  Exception Handling 

 *  Given a merge or update cannot complete due to timeout issues 
 *  When the process runs 
 *  Then exceptions must be logged in an error report with record details for business reconciliation
