column6: CRM: Corporate Account (H5) Enablement and Global Business Field Remediation
column11:
This feature introduces the design and remediation work needed to align corporate accounts (H5/Org accounts) under the One Customer (1C) model.

 
Under the new approach:
 

 *  Hygiene H5 accounts will survive as the single corporate account. 
 *  Water H5 accounts will be merged into the Hygiene H5 accounts. 
 *  The Global Business field will be hidden from the user interface while retaining Food & Beverage as the backend value, ensuring consistency with existing business rules and downstream logic. 
 *  Opportunities, process flows, and related data tied to H5 accounts will follow Food & Beverage business rules only, simplifying the user experience and alignment. 
 

 
This feature covers remediation of Global Business usage, tab visibility changes, harmonization of related tabs, and a specific focus on how Scope of Work (SOW) records will be handled when Water and Hygiene corporate accounts are merged. 

 
Key Scope Items 

 *  1. Global Business Field Remediation 

 *  Hide the Global Business field from H5/Org account forms. 
 *  Retain Food & Beverage as the backend value for merged Hygiene H5 accounts. 
 *  Conduct a technical spike to document where Global Business is referenced across CRM (opportunity forms, quick create forms, BPFs, action forms) and dependent apps (e.g., Enterprise Scope Builder). 
 *  Define a remediation plan to ensure functionality is preserved without relying on the Global Business field. 
 

 *  Opportunities & Sales Skill Considerations 

 *  All new opportunities linked to H5 accounts will follow Food & Beverage logic. 
 *  Water-specific opportunity logic (e.g., drop-down values, BPF rules) will no longer apply. 
 *  Confirm with business whether Sales Skill should be introduced on the opportunity to help differentiate Water vs. Hygiene opportunities in a unified H5 model. 
 *  Defer opportunity harmonization unless explicitly approved by business. 
 

 *  Scope of Work (SOW) Handling 

 *  Background: Today, Water and Hygiene can each have separate H5 accounts, each with its own SOW. In the new model, both will share the same H5 (the Hygiene H5 will survive, Water H5 will be merged). 
 *  Problem: After merging, this can result in two SOWs tied to one H5, which is not permitted. CRM allows only one active SOW per corporate account. 
 *  Decision Needed: Business must define rules for consolidation. Options include: 

 *  Deactivate the Water SOW and merge its line items into the surviving Hygiene SOW. 
 *  Provide business-driven rules for how line items should be combined (e.g., which fields override, how duplicates are handled). 
 

 *  Expectation: The result must be a single active SOW tied to the merged H5 account, containing both Water and Hygiene details as appropriate. 
 *  Next Step: Provide the business with data extracts to inform their decision and then configure the merge logic accordingly. 
 

 *  Tab Visibility & Configuration 

 *  Cases tab ? Hidden on H5 accounts. 
 *  Enterprise Onboarding tab ? Hidden on H5 accounts. 
 *  TSR tab ? Remains visible and functional. 
 *  Team Member tab ? Harmonize to remove irrelevant roles (e.g., District Manager, Sales Manager) and align with business-approved roles. 
 *  Other Tabs (e.g., Key Business Drivers, Email Domains, Secondary Org Accounts) ? Review visibility with business and configure accordingly. 
 

 *  Enterprise Scope Builder & Related Apps 

 *  Validate if the Enterprise Scope Builder (PowerApp) or other related apps rely on the Global Business field. 
 *  If yes, remediation must ensure filtering/logic works in the new H5 model (either always using Food & Beverage backend value or shifting to Sales Skill as the filter). 
 

 

 
Expected Deliverables 

 *  Technical Spike Outcomes: Documented inventory of Global Business usage across CRM + Enterprise Scope Builder with remediation plan. 
 *  Form & Field Updates: Global Business field hidden from H5 UI; backend value retained as Food & Beverage. 
 *  Scope of Work: Agreed business rules for merging Water/Hygiene SOWs, with configuration ensuring only one active SOW per H5. 
 *  Tab Configuration: Cases and Enterprise Onboarding hidden; TSR remains visible; Team Member/Scope of Work harmonized. 
 *  Business Rule Documentation: Clear articulation of how opportunities, SOW, and Sales Skill will behave in the unified model. 
 *  Implementation Readiness: R1 vs. R2 scope documented with business-approved decisions.

column8: Hide Enterprise Onboarding Tab for  Food & Beverage Organization Accounts
column11:
As a CRM user managing H5 (Organization) accounts,
 
I should not see the Enterprise Onboarding tab on H5 accounts that belong to Nalco Water or Food & Beverage global businesses,
 
So that users in these business areas are not exposed to irrelevant or unused functionality.
 

 
Currently:
 

 *  The Enterprise Onboarding tab exists on all H5 account forms. 
 *  The tab is not actively used by Nalco Water or Food & Beverage business units. 
 

 
Future State: 

 *  The Enterprise Onboarding tab must be hidden for all Nalco Water and Food & Beverage H5 accounts, regardless of whether they are 1C or non-1C. 
 *  For H5 accounts in other global businesses, the tab will remain visible as-is.

column8: Enable Corporate Key Business Drivers (CKBD) Tab for 1C H5 Accounts
column11:
As a CAM (Customer Account Manager) working on corporate (H5) accounts,
 
 
 
 
I need to see the Corporate Key Business Drivers (CKBD) tab enabled on Hygiene H5 accounts that are in a 1C district or linked with Sales Skill accounts in 1C districts,
 
So that I can continue to view and manage corporate drivers even after Water and Hygiene accounts are merged under the One Customer (1C) model.
 

 
Currently:
 

 *  CKBD tab is visible only for Nalco Water H5 accounts . 
 *  Hygiene H5 accounts do not display the CKBD tab. 
 

 
Future state: 

 *  When a Water H5 account is merged into a Hygiene H5 account (under 1C) , CKBD records must be linked to the surviving Hygiene H5. 
 *  The CKBD tab must then be displayed for these merged Hygiene H5 accounts. 
 *  The KBD tab must then be displayed on the 1C Hygiene sales skill accounts.
 
 

For non-1C Hygiene H5s or non-1C Nalco Water H5s, no changes — CKBD tab remains hidden(for hygiene only).

column7: Opportunity Alignment with Unified H5

column8: Handling Enterprise Opportunities on Corporate H5 Accounts (R1 Scope)
column11:
Context: 
Two user stories were created to address new requirements on Enterprise Opportunities for Corporate H5 accounts:

 *  857159: Require Sales Skill Selection When Creating Opportunities on H5 Accounts (1C Only) - https://ecolaboip.visualstudio.com/Dynamics%20365%20Convergence/_workitems/edit/857159 
 *  857160: Display and Enforce Technology Platform Field on H5 Opportunities (1C Only and Water Sales Skill Only) - https://ecolaboip.visualstudio.com/Dynamics%20365%20Convergence/_workitems/edit/857160 
 

 
During review with Arpit and Shamil, it was determined these enhancements are not required for R1 and should instead be treated as future enhancements (R2 or beyond). 
 

 
Decision (R1): 

 *  For R1, when a user creates an Enterprise Opportunity on a Corporate H5 account: 

 *  The Food & Beverage Opportunity form (Hygiene H5 template) will always load. 
 *  The Nalco Water Opportunity form will not appear (since the surviving H5 is always a Hygiene H5). 
 *  Sales Skill field will not be introduced on the Opportunity form. 
 *  Technology Platform field will not be introduced on the Opportunity form. 
 

 *  Users can utilize the Opportunity Description field to manually indicate: 

 *  Whether the opportunity is for Water or Hygiene. 
 *  Any Technology Platform details that are relevant. 
 

 

Workaround for R1: 

 *  Sales Skill segregation ? captured in the Opportunity Description field. 
 *  Technology Platform ? captured in the Opportunity Description field. 
 

 
Future Consideration (R2 or beyond): 

 *  A dedicated Sales Skill field on Opportunities. 
 *  Enforceable Technology Platform field on Water opportunities. 
 *  These may be revisited as part of broader Opportunity harmonization. 
 

 
Implications if Business Rejects This Decision: 
If Bri and Tracy do not approve this decision, the two user stories will remain in scope for R1: 
 

 *  857159: Require Sales Skill Selection When Creating Opportunities on H5 Accounts (1C Only) - https://ecolaboip.visualstudio.com/Dynamics%20365%20Convergence/_workitems/edit/857159 
 *  857160: Display and Enforce Technology Platform Field on H5 Opportunities (1C Only and Water Sales Skill Only) - https://ecolaboip.visualstudio.com/Dynamics%20365%20Convergence/_workitems/edit/857160 
 

Owners / Approvers: 

 *  Business Owners: Bri, Tracy 
 *  Decision Reviewed With: Arpit, Shamil

column8: DC: Re-Parent Water H5 Opportunities to Surviving Hygiene H5 with Sales Skill, Technology Platform, and PAC Code Updates in Description
column11:
As a data conversion analyst, I need to re-parent all Water H5 opportunities (active and closed) to the surviving Hygiene H5 account during 1C consolidation, while preserving critical context by appending key Water-specific fields (Sales Skill, Technology Platform, and PAC Code) into the description field, so that business users retain visibility of these attributes in R1 despite the absence of harmonized opportunity forms.
 
 
Background & Rationale:

 *  Current State: 

 *  Opportunities in Water require Technology Platform. 
 *  Opportunities in Hygiene require Innovation Growth. 
 *  These values are not harmonized across global business units. 
 *  Opportunity forms differ for Water vs. Hygiene. 
 

 *  Future State (R2+): 

 *  Business wants to introduce a Sales Skill field on Opportunities for harmonization. 
 *  This will unify Water and Hygiene opportunities under a single Food & Beverage H5 account. 
 

 *  R1 Workaround: 

 *  Since harmonization cannot be delivered in R1, the manual workaround is to surface this data in the Opportunity Description field. 
 *  For migrated Water opportunities, the description will include: 

 *  Sales Skill: Water 
 *  Technology Platform: <Platform Value> 
 *  PAC Code: <PAC Code Value> 
 

 

 *  This ensures users retain visibility of critical Water fields when opportunities are moved under Hygiene H5. 
 

 *  Scope: 

 *  Applies to 1C Water H5 opportunities only. 
 *  Non-1C Water H5 opportunities remain unchanged. 
 *  For mixed H5s (where not all child accounts are part of 1C), business must handle migration manually (or decide on automation if volumes are high). 
 

 

Business Requirements:
 

 *  Re-parenting Logic: Re-parent all opportunities from Water H5 ? Hygiene H5 as part of 1C migration (active and closed). 
 *  Description Updates: Append Sales Skill, Technology Platform, and PAC Code into the Opportunity Description while preserving existing description content. 
 *  Formatting: Values must be clearly labeled with prefixes (Sales Skill:, Technology Platform:, PAC Code:) and separated by line breaks. 
 *  Scope Restriction: Applies only to 1C Water H5s. Non-1C remain unchanged. 
 *  Exception Handling: For mixed Water H5s (child accounts not fully part of 1C), log exception for manual resolution. 
 *  Data Validation: Post-conversion, validate that all re-parented opportunities on Hygiene H5 accounts show correct description updates and maintain all original fields (dates, owner, stage, etc.).
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 
 

 *  Scenario 1 – Active Water H5 Opportunity in 1C 

 *  Given a Water H5 account is merged to a Hygiene H5 under 1C, and the Water H5 has an active opportunity 
 *  When the data conversion runs 
 *  Then the opportunity is re-parented to the Hygiene H5, and the description field is updated to append: 

 *  Sales Skill: Water 
 *  Technology Platform: <Platform Value> 
 *  PAC Code: <PAC Code Value> 
 *  with all original description text preserved. 
 

 

 *  Scenario 2 – Closed/Inactive Water H5 Opportunity 

 *  Given a Water H5 account under 1C with closed or inactive opportunities 
 *  When the data conversion runs 
 *  Then those opportunities are re-parented to the Hygiene H5, and the description field is updated with the same Sales Skill, Technology Platform, and PAC Code details. 
 

 *  Scenario 3 – Non-1C Water H5  

 *  Given a Water H5 account not part of 1C migration  
 *  When the data conversion runs  
 *  Then the Water H5 opportunities remain unchanged and no description updates are applied.  
 

 *  Scenario 4 – Mixed Accounts (Exception Case) 

 *  Given a Water H5 account has child accounts not fully part of 1C migration 
 *  When the data conversion runs 
 *  Then the process must flag the opportunities as exceptions, log them in an exception report, and business must handle migration manually (or determine automation if volume is high).

column11:
Source - Target:  
Scenario1 – Active Water H5 Opportunity in 1C 
Steps: 
               1.Precondition:Water H5 account is merged to a Hygiene H5 under 1C, and the Water H5 has an active opportunity  
       2. After the Data conversion package is executedthen validates that  
The opportunity is re-parented to the Hygiene H5, and the description field is updated to append: 

 *  Sales Skill: Water 
 *  Technology Platform: <Platform Value> 
 *  PAC Code: <PAC Code Value> 
 *  with all original description text preserved. 
 

 


 
 
Scenario 2 – Closed Water H5 Opportunity 
Steps: 
               1.Precondition: Water H5 account under 1C with closed  opportunities 
       2. After the Data conversion package is executed then validates that those opportunities are re-parented to the Hygiene H5, and the description field is updated with the same Sales Skill, Technology Platform, and PAC Code details. 

 
 
Scenario 3 – Inactive Water H5 Opportunity 
Steps: 
               1.Precondition: Water H5 account under 1C with Inactive opportunities 
       2. After the Data conversion package is executed then validates that those opportunities are re-parented to the Hygiene H5, and the description field is updated with the same Sales Skill, Technology Platform, and PAC Code details. 

 
 
 
Scenario 4 – Mixed Accounts (Exception Case) 
Steps: 
               1.Precondition:  Water H5 account has child accounts not fully part of 1C migration 
       2. After the Data conversion package is executed then validates that process must flag the opportunities as exceptions, log them in an exception report, and business must handle migration manually (or determine automation if volume is high).

column8: Hide Global Business Field and Add Sales Skill for 1C Org Accounts
column11:
As a CRM user,
I want the Global Business field on H5/Org account forms to be hidden whenever the account is part of the One Customer (1C) program,
 
So that users no longer interact with Global Business directly, while ensuring all processes continue to run on Food & Beverage rules behind the scenes.
 

 
This story ensures that:
 

 *  For 1C-linked H5/Org accounts (those tied to at least one Sales Skill account under a district flagged as 1C = Yes), the Global Business field will be hidden from the UI but automatically set to “Food & Beverage” in the backend. 
 *  For non-1C H5/Org accounts, the Global Business field will remain visible but read-only (not editable), consistent with existing system behavior. 
 *  All dependent processes (opportunity forms, quick create forms, business process flows, and related downstream apps) for 1C H5 accounts can safely assume F&B rules.

column7: Enable Scope of Work (SOW) Segregation by Sales Skill on H5 Accounts for One Customer
column11:
Business requires the ability to manage parallel Scope of Work (SOW) records for Water and Hygiene under a single H5 account in One Customer (1C) districts. Today, CRM restricts H5 accounts to one active SOW at a time; new submissions deactivate existing SOWs. With the new model, both Water and Hygiene can co-exist under the same H5 account while maintaining correct segregation, filtering, and downstream visibility.
 

 
This requirement includes:
 

 *  Sales Skill Integration: 

 *  Add Sales Skill lookup field on the SOW header record (mandatory for 1C org accounts, hidden for non-1C). 
 *  Lock Sales Skill once submitted. 
 *  Global Business field continues to exist behind the scenes (derived from Sales Skill, hidden from users). 
 

 *  Offerings & Features Filtering: 

 *  Add multi-select Global Business Option set on Offering table. 
 *  Filter feature selection in Enterprise Scope Builder so that only features with offerings tied to the selected Sales Skill display (Global Business). 
 *  Filter offering selection so that only offerings tied to both the selected feature and Sales Skill display (Global Business). 
 

 *  Enterprise Scope Builder (Power App) Flow: 

 *  General Information Screen: Add Sales Skill lookup, mandatory for 1C orgs. 
 *  Feature Selection Screen: Show only features relevant to selected Sales Skill. 
 *  Offering Screen: Show only offerings linked to both Sales Skill + feature(s). 
 *  Lock Sales Skill once submitted. 
 

 *  SOW Grid (H5 Tab): 

 *  Add Sales Skill column to the editable grid displayed on the Scope of Work tab of H5 accounts. 
 *  Allow users to clearly identify which Sales Skill each SOW belongs to alongside existing fields (name, start date, end date, status, owner). 
 

 *  Validation & Logic: 

 *  Update uniqueness validation: allow parallel SOWs for the same H5, but only one per Sales Skill at a time. 
 *  Update trickle-down plugin/Azure function so that only relevant SOWs appear on the matching Sales Skill accounts. 
 

 *  Data Conversion: 

 *  Reparent existing Water SOWs to surviving Hygiene H5s. 
 *  Populate Sales Skill lookup on migrated SOWs. 
 *  Audit overlapping SOWs and reconcile counts before/after migration. 
 

 *  Safeguards: 

 *  All changes apply only to 1C org accounts (H5 linked to a 1C district). 
 *  Non-1C org accounts remain unaffected, continuing with current one-SOW-per-H5 logic. 
 

 

 
This ensures sales teams can manage dual SOWs on the same H5, see clear Sales Skill context, and have correct downstream visibility in child Sales Skill accounts.

column8: Update Uniqueness Validation Logic on SOW – Allow Parallel Active SOWs by Sales Skill (1C Only)
column11:
As a sales user creating a Scope of Work (SOW) on an H5 account,
I need the uniqueness validation logic updated to allow parallel active SOWs by Sales Skill
 
so that I can create and maintain separate Water and Hygiene SOWs for the same H5 without deactivating or blocking one another.
 

 
Background / Current State:
 

 *  Currently, CRM + ESB PowerApp enforce a restriction where only one active SOW can exist per H5 at a time. 
 *  When a new SOW is submitted with overlapping dates, the Submit button is disabled on the Review screen, preventing submission. 
 *  If submitted, the system automatically deactivates the overlapping existing SOW, regardless of Sales Skill. 
 *  This prevents the business from managing parallel Water and Hygiene SOWs under the same H5. 
 

 
Future State 1C: 

 *  Validation logic must respect Sales Skill context: 
 *  If a new SOW is created with the same Sales Skill and overlapping dates ? existing logic applies (only one can be active). 
 *  If a new SOW is created with a different Sales Skill and overlapping dates ? submission should be allowed and both remain active in parallel. 
 

 
This applies both to the Review screen Submit button validation and any backend deactivation logic. 

 
For non-1C districts, existing behavior of the app remains unchanged.
column14: FBU_QAPush_Nov_Major3; ProdPush_Nov_FBU_R1; TechDocNotAdded; validated in QA
column19: Moved out of state Pending Prod Release
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 

 *  Scenario 1 – 1C: Same Sales Skill, Overlapping Period 

 *  Given an H5 account already has an active SOW with Sales Skill = Water 
 *  When I attempt to submit Activate a new SOW with Sales Skill = Water with overlapping dates 
 *  Then the Submit Activate SoW button is disabled and I cannot proceed until the date range does not overlap. 
 

 *  Scenario 2 – 1C: Same Sales Skill, Non-Overlapping Period 

 *  Given an H5 account already has an active SOW with Sales Skill = Water 
 *  When I submit Activate a new SOW with Sales Skill = Water with non-overlapping dates 
 *  Then the Submit Activate SoW button is enabled and both SOWs can be linked to the Account. 
 

 *  Scenario 3 – 1C: Different Sales Skill, Overlapping Period 

 *  Given an H5 account already has an active SOW with Sales Skill = Water 
 *  When I submit Activate a new SOW with Sales Skill = Hygiene with overlapping dates 
 *  Then the Submit Activate SoW button is enabled, and both SOWs (Water + Hygiene) remain active in parallel. 
 

 *  Scenario 4 – 1C: Different Sales Skill, Non-Overlapping Period 

 *  Given an H5 account already has an active SOW with Sales Skill = Water 
 *  When I submit Activate SoW a new SOW with Sales Skill = Hygiene with non-overlapping dates 
 *  Then the Submit Activate SoW button is enabled, and both SOWs remain active in parallel. 
 

 *  Scenario 5 – 1C: Null / Missing Sales Skill Values 

 *  Given a SOW record has a null or missing Sales Skill 
 *  When a user attempts to submit Activate another SOW 
 *  Then the system enforces validation as though both are the same Sales Skill (block overlaps until cleaned up). 
 

 *  Scenario 6 – Non-1C (All Cases) 

 *  Given an H5 account not linked to a 1C district 
 *  When a user attempts to create Activate a new SOW (overlapping or non-overlapping) 
 *  Then the current behavior applies: only one active SOW per H5 is permitted.

column8: Update Trickle-Down Logic: Ensure Only Matching Sales Skill Accounts Receive the Relevant SOW.
column11:
As a Sales user working on Sales Skill accounts,
I need the trickle-down logic for Scope of Work (SOW) records updated,
 
So that only SOWs with a matching Sales Skill appear on the relevant Sales Skill account tab,
 
Ensuring Water users only see Water SOWs and Hygiene users only see Hygiene SOWs.
 

 
Current State:
 

 *  When an SOW is submitted and activated, a process (plugin/Azure Function) automatically establishes a record in the out-of-the-box N:N relationship table (ECL_ECL_scopeofwork_account). 
 *  This N:N relationship links the SOW record to all child Sales Skill accounts under the H5 account. 
 *  Because there is no filtering, both Water and Hygiene SOWs appear on all linked Sales Skill accounts, causing confusion. 
 

 
Future State: 

 *  The relationship logic must check that the Sales Skill of the SOW matches the Sales Skill of the Sales Skill account before creating the relationship. 
 *  Example: 

 *  If the H5 has both Water and Hygiene SOWs, and I open the Water Sales Skill account, I should only see Water SOWs. 
 *  If I open the Hygiene Sales Skill account, I should only see Hygiene SOWs. 
 

 *  Non-1C accounts remain unaffected (existing logic continues without change).
column19: Moved out of state Pending Prod Release

Business Acceptance Criteria:
 

 *  Scenario 1 – Matching Sales Skill 

 *  Given an active SOW exists with a Sales Skill on the Organization Account (H5), 
 *  When I view the Scope of Work tab on the child Sales Skill Account form, 
 *  Then only the SOW(s) matching that Sales Skill must be displayed. 
 

 *  Scenario 2 – Multiple Active SOWs 

 *  Given multiple active SOWs exist for the same Organization Account (H5) (e.g., one for Water and one for Hygiene), 
 *  When I view the Scope of Work tab on the child Sales Skill Account form, 
 *  Then only the SOW(s) matching that Sales Skill must be displayed. 
 

 *  Scenario 3 – Non-1C Organization Account (H5) Accounts 

 *  Given I open a Customer account linked to an Organization Account (H5) in a non-1C district, 
 *  When I view the Scope of Work tab on the child Account form, 
 *  Then the current behavior remains unchanged (all linked SOWs display without filtering).

column8: Regression Testing - End-to-end Scope of Work Business Process post account merge
column11:
End-to-end Scope of Work Business Process post account merge.
 


Business Process Flow: 
1.Operationsteam creates the CRM Account record. 
2.CAMinitiatesSOWcreation viathe Enterprise Scope Builder app on a CRM organization account record. 
3.CAMenters SOW inputs: 
1.Name,start/end dates 
2.Selectedservice commitments (e.g., business reviews, entry/exit meetings, weeklyvisits) 
3.Commentsfor context 
4.Service Plan Builder:Reps use this to create service plans based on SOW guidance. 
5.Customization:Reps can adjust frequency or add services as needed. 
4.CAMactivates the SOW:Only one active SOW per timeperiod isallowed. 
1.Validation and Activation:Final review and activation of service plans generate reoccurring servicerecords. 
2.CRM Asset Type Template records areauto-generated 

Requirement 

Conduct comprehensive regression testing of the Scope of Work (SOW) functionality in CRM to ensure that all existing features continue to perform as expected following updates, enhancements, or integrations. 

Business Objective 

To validate the stability and reliability of the SOW functionality across Water and Hygiene business units by: 

 *  Ensuring no disruption to service plan creation and execution. 
 *  Confirming compatibility with integrated systems (e.g., Ecolab 3D, Asset Harvester). 
 *  Supporting consistent user experience for CAMs, DMs, Reps, and Field Services. 
 *  Maintaining data integrity and compliance during migrations and updates. 
 

Requirements In Scope 

 *  Regression testing of:

 *  SOW creation via Enterprise Scope Builder. 
 *  Service plan generation from SOW records. 
 *  PDF export functionality. 
 *  Asset-level and site-level template usage. 
 *  Role-based access and record visibility. 
 *  Integration with Ecolab 3D and Asset Harvester. 
 

 
 *  Validation of:

 *  One active SOW per account per time period. 
 *  Migration logic for legacy SOW documents. 
 *  Automated org account creation during onboarding. 
 

 
 

Technical Considerations & Configuration 

 *  CRM stores SOW and service plan records. 
 *  Dataverse used for team member and contact data. 
 *  PDF export tested for formatting and completeness. 
 *  Asset Harvester integration verified for Water and Hygiene. 
 *  Data conversion rules tested for accuracy and completeness. 
 *  End-to-end regression test scenarios include:

 *  SOW creation, activation, and service plan linkage. 
 *  Role-based access and permissions. 
 *  Template selection and customization. 
 

 
 

User Interface Configuration 

 *  CAMs initiate and manage SOW records from CRM account view. 
 *  Reps and DMs access service plans derived from SOWs. 
 *  OPS Admins manage hygiene templates and asset data. 
 *  UI elements tested for consistency, responsiveness, and usability. 
 

Security & Data Governance 

 *  Role-based access tested for CAMs, Reps, DMs, OPS Admins, and Field Services. 
 *  Validation workflows ensure data integrity before activation. 
 *  Migration logic tested for completeness and accuracy. 
 *  Governance over template usage and asset data loading confirmed. 
 

Context
The Scope of Work (SOW) functionality in CRM enables Corporate Account Managers (CAMs) to define service expectations at the organizational account level. These expectations guide District Managers (DMs) and Sales Representatives (Reps) on what services to perform at customer sites. The SOW acts as a directional tool, outlining commitments such as frequency of visits, types of services, and reporting requirements. It supports both Water and Hygiene business units, with differences in asset-level versus site-level service definitions.
SOW Org accounts are a grouping which can span across districts. 
Downstream Systems / Integration 

 *  CRM: Central system for managing accounts, SOWs, and service plans. 
 *  Asset Harvester: Supplies asset data to CRM (currently missing for Hygiene). 
 *  Ecolab 3D: Receives service reports and sends them to selected recipients. 
 *  Dataverse: Shared tables used for team member and contact data. 
 *  PDF Export: Allows sharing of service plans with customers manually. 
 

Impact Considerations 

 *  Water Business: Services are tied to site values. No change required. 
 *  Field Services Team: Services are tied to ship-to values. R1 data conversion requirement. 
 *  Hygiene Business: Operates at site level only due to lack of asset data. No change required. 
 *  Standalone (Street) Accounts: No parent org account; SOW and service plans are created directly at the customer account level. 
 *  Documents (PDFs of SOWs) will need to be migrated as part of OneCustomer efforts. 
 

Groups
Water & Hygiene 
Personas 

 *  Corporate Account Managers (CAMs): Create and manage SOWs at the organization account level. Select features within the Enterprise Scope Builder Power App that are related to the SOW. 
 *  District Managers (DMs): Reference SOWs to build service plans and execute site-level services. 
 *  Sales Reps: Reference SOWs to build service plans and execute site-level services. Water reps set up the SOW & Service Plans. 
 *  OPS Admins: Particularly for Hygiene accounts, they manage SOW creation and service templates. 
 *  Field Services Team: Execute services based on recurring service records, separate from district team plans. 
 

Business Process Flow 

 *  Operations team creates the CRM Account record. 
 *  CAM initiates SOW creation via the Enterprise Scope Builder app on a CRM organization account record. 
 *  CAM enters SOW inputs:

 *  Name, start/end dates 
 *  Selected service commitments (e.g., business reviews, entry/exit meetings, weekly visits) 
 *  Comments for context 
 

 
 *  Service Plan Builder: Reps use this to create service plans based on SOW guidance. 
 *  Customization: Reps can adjust frequency or add services as needed. 
 *  CAM activates the SOW: Only one active SOW per time period is allowed.

 *  Validation and Activation: Final review and activation of service plans generate recurring service records. 
 *  CRM Asset Type Template records are auto-generated.

column8: ESB PowerApp – Update Review SOW Screen to Display Locked Sales Skill Field
column11:
As a Sales or CAM user creating a Scope of Work (SOW) in the ESB PowerApp,
I need to see the Sales Skill value displayed on the Review SOW screen in read-only mode,
 
So that I have visibility into which Sales Skill (Water or Hygiene) the SOW belongs to, and I can confirm the alignment with the features, and offerings selected, without being able to change it at this stage.
 

 
Background & Rationale:
 

 *  Sales Skill is first selected on the General Information screen. 
 *  It drives the filtering of Features and Offerings in subsequent steps. 
 *  On the Review SOW screen, users today see key information like SOW Name, Account, Start Date, End Date, and Status — but Sales Skill is missing. 
 *  Since Sales Skill determines all downstream filtering, it must be displayed for review, but must remain locked/uneditable, as changing it at this stage would invalidate previous selections. 
 *  This ensures clarity for users while preserving data integrity.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:

 *  Scenario 1 – Sales Skill Display on Review Screen 

 *  Given a user has created an SOW in the ESB PowerApp and reached the Review screen, 
 *  When the Review screen loads, 
 *  Then the Sales Skill field must be displayed along with existing fields (Name, Account, Start Date, End Date, Status). 
 

 *  Scenario 2 – Lock Sales Skill for Editing 

 *  Given a user is on the Review SOW screen, 
 *  When the Sales Skill value is displayed, 
 *  Then the field must be read-only/locked and cannot be edited by the user. 
 

 *  Scenario 3 – Propagate Selected Sales Skill 

 *  Given a Sales Skill was selected on the General Information screen, 
 *  When the Review screen loads, 
 *  Then the same Sales Skill value must be carried forward and displayed on the Review screen without modification. 
 

 *  Scenario 4 – Non-1C Accounts 

 *  Given the SOW belongs to a non-1C account, 
 *  When the Review screen loads, 
 *  Then the Sales Skill field must not be displayed, and the current behavior (no Sales Skill) remains unchanged.

column8: ESB PowerApp – Enhance Copy SOW Functionality with Sales Skill Support (Azure Function)
column11:
As a sales user working in the Enterprise Scope Builder (ESB) PowerApp,
 
I want the Copy SOW functionality to copy the Sales Skill field into the cloned draft record,
 
So that I have full visibility of the Sales Skill being cloned, and I can update it before submission.
 

 
Background & Rationale:
 

 *  Today, Copy SOW pop-up displays Account name, Start Date, End Date. 
 *  When copying, the system creates a new Draft SOW with “: Clone” appended to the name and copies over the dates. 
 *  With the introduction of Sales Skill for 1C districts, the Copy process must: 

 *  Display Sales Skill in the pop-up for awareness, (Requirement is now covered in user story 863482) 
 *  Clone the Sales Skill value into the new Draft SOW, 
 *  Lock edits to Sales Skill Field on the Cloned record. 
 

 *  For non-1C accounts, no Sales Skill field should be shown in the pop-up or cloned record. 
 *  For Street accounts (with dedicated Sales Skill), the Sales Skill should also display in the pop-up and copy correctly.(Requirement is now covered in user story 863482)

column8: ESB PowerApp – End-to-End UI Enhancements with Sales Skill (1C vs Non-1C)
column11:
As a Sales User or CAM creating or managing a Scope of Work (SOW) in the Enterprise Scope Builder (ESB) PowerApp,
 
 
I need the application screens (General Information, Feature Selection, Commitments, Review, and Copy) to incorporate Sales Skill selection, filtering, and display logic only for 1C accounts,
 
so that SOWs can be correctly tied to Water/Hygiene Sales Skills, ensuring downstream accuracy.
 
For non-1C accounts, the behavior must remain exactly as today with no changes to forms or filtering.
 

 
Background & Rationale:
Today, the Enterprise Scope Builder (ESB) PowerApp does not distinguish Water vs Hygiene SOWs within the same H5 account. 

 
Currently, CRM allows only one active SOW per H5 at a time. Creating a new one deactivates the previous, regardless of business line.
 
With OneCustomer, a single H5 can now represent both Water and Hygiene, and business needs the ability to maintain parallel active SOWs—one for each Sales Skill.
 
To achieve this, ESB must capture the Sales Skill at the time of SOW creation, and filter features/offerings accordingly.
 
This field must also drive downstream filtering, validation, and visibility for users so they only see what is relevant.
 

 
[Image]
 

 
Key Principle: 

 *  For 1C districts/accounts, Sales Skill functionality must be introduced (visible, required, used for filtering, review, copy, and lock logic). 
 *  For non-1C accounts, no changes—system should behave exactly as today to avoid regression. 
 

 
This story covers all UI and functional changes in ESB PowerApp required to support Sales Skill for SOWs. 
It includes changes to:
 

 *  General Information Screen – Sales Skill selection, defaulting, required logic. 
 *  Feature Selection Screen – Filter features by offerings tied to selected Sales Skill. 
 *  Commitment Selection Screen – Filter offerings by feature + Sales Skill. 
 *  Review Screen – Display Sales Skill in read-only mode. 
 *  Copy SOW Pop-Up (UI) – Include Sales Skill in pop-up and cloned draft. 
 *  Lock Behavior – Once submitted and Active, lock Sales Skill field (End Date remains editable). 
 

 
This ensures Sales Skill flows consistently from creation ? filtering ? review ? copy ? active state, maintaining integrity across the SOW lifecycle. 


Business Requirements:
 

 *  General Information Screen 

 *  Add Sales Skill lookup (visible + required for 1C only). 
 *  Corporate H5 with CAM ? default = Hygiene, editable until user clicks on Next button. 
 *  Street H5 (no CAM) ? default = Sales Skill of launching Sales Skill account, locked. 
 *  Non-1C accounts ? Sales Skill hidden, behavior unchanged. 
 

 *  Feature Selection Screen 

 *  Derive Global Business from Sales Skill. 
 *  Display only Features tied to Offerings associated with that Global Business. 
 *  Hide Features with no offerings tied to the selected Sales Skill. 
 *  Non-1C accounts ? no change to filtering logic. 
 

 *  Commitment Selection Screen 

 *  For each Feature selected, show only Offerings tied to that Feature and derived Global Business. 
 *  Hide Offerings not linked to Sales Skill. 
 *  Non-1C accounts ? no change to commitment filtering. 
 

 *  Review SOW Screen 

 *  Add Sales Skill field in read-only mode. 
 *  Must carry forward from General Info screen. 
 *  Locked—cannot be edited at Review stage. 
 *  Non-1C ? field hidden, current fields only. 
 

 *  Copy SOW Pop-Up 

 *  Show Account Name, Start Date, End Date, and Sales Skill (for 1C). 
 *  Sales Skill is cloned into new draft record. 
 *  Non-1C ? pop-up unchanged, Sales Skill hidden. 
 

 *  Lock Sales Skill Behavior (Post-Activation) 

 *  Once SOW is submitted and Active ? lock Sales Skill field. 
 *  Only End Date editable. 
 *  Non-1C ? no changes.

column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 
 
 
 
 

 *  General Information Screen (https://ecolaboip.visualstudio.com/Dynamics%20365%20Convergence/_workitems/edit/861017) 

 *  Given I launch ESB from a corporate Organization account, in a 1C district with CAM populated, 

 *  When the General Info screen loads, 
 *  Then Sales Skill defaults to Hygiene, is editable, and required before proceeding. 
 

 *  Given i am on Street Organization account (CAM field is blank) and global business not equal to Nalco Water || Energy Services 

 *  I should not be able to see the ESB button on the ribbon. 
 

 *  Given I launch ESB from a street sales skill account (CAM is blank) in a 1C district,  

 *  When the General Info screen loads,  
 *  Then Sales Skill defaults to the account’s Sales Skill, is locked, and required (auto-satisfied).. 
 

 *  Given I launch ESB from a non-1C customer and organization account, 

 *  When the General Info screen loads, 
 *  Then Sales Skill field is hidden and behavior remains unchanged. 
 

 

 *  Feature Selection Screen (https://ecolaboip.visualstudio.com/Dynamics%20365%20Convergence/_workitems/edit/861018) 

 *  Given I selected Sales Skill = Hygiene in General Info on a 1C account, 

 *  When I reach the Feature Selection screen, 
 *  Then only Features tied to Offerings with Global Business = Food & Beverage (Hygiene) are displayed. 
 

 *  Given a Feature has no Offerings for the derived Global Business, 

 *  When I reach the Feature Selection screen, 
 *  Then that Feature is hidden. 
 

 *  Given I am on the Feature selection Screen, then I should see the Sales Skill value alongside Name, Account, Start/End Date, 

 

 *  Given I am on a non-1C account, 

 *  When I reach the Feature Selection screen, 
 *  Then all Features are displayed as today. 
 

 

 *  Commitment Selection Screen(https://ecolaboip.visualstudio.com/Dynamics%20365%20Convergence/_workitems/edit/861019) 

 *  Given I selected Sales Skill = Hygiene and Feature = Food Safety, 

 *  When I reach the Commitment screen, 
 *  Then only Offerings tied to Food Safety and Global Business = Food & Beverage are displayed. 
 

 *  Given an Offering tied to the Feature exists but only for Water, 

 *  When I view the Commitment screen with Sales Skill = Hygiene, 
 *  Then the Water-only Offering is hidden. 
 

 *  Given I am on the Feature selection Screen, then I should see the Sales Skill value alongside Name, Account, Start/End Date,
 

 

 *  Given I am on a non-1C account, 

 *  When I view the Commitment screen, 
 *  Then all Offerings display as today. 
 

 

 *  Review Screen(https://ecolaboip.visualstudio.com/Dynamics%20365%20Convergence/_workitems/edit/862784) 

 *  Given I am on the Review screen for a 1C account, 

 *  When the screen loads, 
 *  Then Sales Skill is displayed in read-only mode alongside Name, Account, Start/End Date, and Status. 
 

 *  Given I am on the Review screen for a non-1C account, 

 *  When the screen loads, 
 *  Then Sales Skill is not displayed. 
 

 

 *  Copy SOW Pop-Up 

 *  Given I click Copy for a 1C account, 

 *  When the pop-up loads, 
 *  Then Account Name, Start Date, End Date, and Sales Skill are displayed. 
 

 *  Given I click Copy for a non-1C account, 

 *  When the pop-up loads, 
 *  Then only Account Name, Start Date, End Date are displayed. 
 

 *  Given I open the Copy SOW pop-up, 

 *  When I click Back, 
 *  Then the pop-up should close without creating a new SOW. 
 

 

 *  Add Sales Skill Field to the Scope of Work Tile on the Home Screen 

 *  Given I am on the Home screen for a 1C account,
 

 *  When the I see the Scope of Work Tile,  
 *  Then I should see the Sales Skill values on the Sales Skill SoW grid, so that I can easily tell which sales skill the SOW belongs to  
 

 *  Given I am on the Home screen for a non-1C account, 

 *  When the I see the Scope of Work Tile,  
 *  Then Sales Skill is not displayed. 
 

 

 *  Add Sales Skill Field to the View All SOW's Screen 

 *  Given I am on the Home screen for a 1C account,
 

 *  When the I click the View All Sow's link, I am navigated to the Scope of Work screen 
 *  Then I should see Sales Skill values on the Sales Skill SoW grid, so that I can easily tell which sales skill the SOW belongs to 
 

 *  Given I am on the Home screen for a non-1C account, 

 *  When the I click the View All Sow's link, I am navigated to the Scope of Work screen 
 *  Then Sales Skill is not displayed. 
 

 

 

 

 

 *  Lock Sales Skill Behavior 

 *  Given a SOW for a 1C account is any status, 

 *  When I reopen/edit it, 
 *  Then the Sales Skill field is locked and only End Date is editable. 
 

 *  Given a SOW for a non-1C account is in any status, 

 *  When I reopen/edit it, 
 *  Then the system behaves as today.

column11:
Test Cases-

FEATURE SELECTION SCREEN FOR 1C ACCOUNTS

 *  The Sales Skill field should be non editable on the Feature selection screen 
 *  Given Sales skill value is Hygiene then Features tied to offerings with global business = Food & Beverage should be displayed in features screen 
 *  Given Sales skill value is Water then Features tied to offerings with global business = Nalco Water should be displayed in features screen 
 *  When a Feature has no offerings tied with global business=Food & Beverage then that feature should be hidden 
 

COMMITMENT SCREEN FOR 1C ACCOUNTS 

Scenario 3-Verify the features visible when we select sale skill = hygiene and feature =Food Safety & Quality 
 

 *  Commitment screen is the continuation to feature screen 
 *  Given sales skill =hygiene and Feature =Food safety selected in feature screen click on next to go to commitment screen 
 *  On commitment Screen, Sales Skill value should be visible alongside Name, Account, Start/End Date.
 
 *  The Sales Skill field should be non editable on the Commitment selection screen
 
 *  In commitment screen only Offerings tied to Food Safety & Quality and Global Business = Food & Beverage are displayed. 
 *  When any offering tied to feature but with global business =water then that offering should be hidden in commitment screen 
 

REVIEW SCREEN FOR 1C ACCOUNTS 


 
Scenario 4-Verify the sales skill field on review screen 

 

 *  After commitment screen click on next to go to review screen 
 *  On Review screen Sales Skill field is displayed in read-only mode alongside Name, Account, Start/End Date, and Status. 
 

 
 
 
 
Scenario 5-Validate copy functionality for 1C Accounts

 *  The copied SoW should also have the same sales skill as the original SoW 
 

 

 

 


 
Scenario 6-Validate sales skill field visibility on the scope of work tile on home screen 

 *  Log into FBU Ops Admin / Ops Admin Lead user 
 *  Open organization account and the district should be 1C district 
 *  Click on ESB Button from the organizational account 
 *  On the Home screen for a 1C account, sales skill field should be visible on the scope of work tile

 *  Click on View all SOW's Link and it should navigate to scope of work screen 
 *  Sales Skill values should be visible on the Sales Skill SoW grid, so that user can easily tell which sales skill the SOW belongs to  
 


 

GENERAL INFORMATION SCREEN FOR Non-1C ACCOUNTS 

Scenario 1 - Verify the sales skill field for Non-1C organizational Accounts on ESB

 *  In the commitment screen Sales skill field should not be visible and all offerings should display irrespective of global business same as existing. 
 *  The Features tied to offerings with global business of the Organization Account should be displayed in features screen

Scenario 2 - Verify the sales skill field for NW and ES organizational Accounts on ESB

 *  Open NW Organization Account and with District as NW Key ACC NA

 *  In the feature screen Sales skill field should not be visible and all features should display irrespective of global business same like existing functionality 
 *  In the commitment screen Sales skill field should not be visible and all offerings should display irrespective of global business same as existing. 
 *  The Features tied to offerings with global business of the Organization Account should be displayed in features screen 
 *  In review screen the sales skill field should not display 
 

 
 
Scenario 2 -Sales skill on sow tiles and sow grids for NON 1C Accounts

Scenario 3 -Copy Functionality for Non 1C Accounts

column8: ESB Power App: Update Select Commitments Screen: Display Only Offerings Tied to Selected Sales Skill and Feature.
column11:
As a sales user creating a Scope of Work (SOW) in the Enterprise Scope Builder (ESB) PowerApp,
I want the Select Commitments screen to only display offerings that match both the Sales Skill chosen on the General Information screen and the Feature selected on the Feature Selection screen,
 
So that I only configure commitments relevant to my selected Sales Skill and Feature, avoiding irrelevant or invalid options.
 

 
Key Design Logic:
 

 *  On the General Information screen, the user selects a Sales Skill (e.g., Hygiene ? derives Global Business = Food & Beverage). 
 *  On the Feature Selection screen, the user selects one or multiple features. 
 *  For each selected feature, the user is directed to a Select Commitments screen. 
 *  On this screen, only offerings that are: 

 *  Tied to the selected Feature, AND 
 *  Tagged with the Global Business derived from the selected Sales Skill, 
 *  Should be displayed. 
 

 *  Offerings not tied to the selected Sales Skill should be excluded. 
 

 
Example: 

 *  Sales Skill = Hygiene (Global Business = Food & Beverage). 
 *  Selected Feature = “Food Safety & Quality”. 
 *  Offerings tied to this feature include: 

 *  “Food Tissue Treatment” (Global Business = Food & Beverage)  displayed. 
 *  “Legionella Monitoring” (Global Business = Water)  hidden.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:

 *  Scenario 1 – Offering filtering by Sales Skill and Feature 

 *  Given I select a Sales Skill on the General Information screen and a Feature on the Feature Selection screen, 
 *  When I open the Select Commitments screen for that feature, 
 *  Then I should only see offerings tied to both the selected Feature and the Global Business derived from the chosen Sales Skill. 
 

 *  Scenario 2 – Offerings not tied to selected Sales Skill 

 *  Given an offering is tied to the selected Feature but only tagged to a different Global Business, 
 *  When I open the Select Commitments screen, 
 *  Then that offering should not be displayed. 
 

 *  Scenario 3 – Offerings tied to multiple Global Businesses 

 *  Given an offering is tied to the selected Feature and tagged to multiple Global Businesses, 
 *  When one of those Global Businesses matches the Sales Skill selected earlier, 
 *  Then the offering should be displayed. 
 

 *  Scenario 4 – Multiple Features selected 

 *  Given I select multiple Features on the Feature Selection screen, 
 *  When I navigate to the Select Commitments screen for each Feature, 
 *  Then I should only see offerings tied to that specific Feature and the Global Business linked to the Sales Skill chosen earlier.

column8: ESB Power App: Update General Information Screen: Add Required Sales Skill Selection  (Visible/Required for 1C Only).
column11:
As a sales user creating a Scope of Work (SOW) in the Enterprise Scope Builder (ESB) PowerApp,
I need the Sales Skill field to be visible and required when working with 1C accounts,
 
So that every new SOW is tied to the correct Sales Skill, ensuring accuracy in downstream logic while maintaining no changes for non-1C accounts.
 

 
This story introduces the Sales Skill lookup field on the General Information screen of the ESB PowerApp.
 

 *  For 1C districts (H5 or Sales Skill accounts linked to districts flagged as 1C): 

 *  Corporate H5 with CAM populated: 

 *  Sales Skill field displayed. 
 *  Default = Hygiene. 
 *  Field is editable and required before the user can proceed. 
 

 *  H5 without CAM (street accounts): 

 *  ESB launched from Sales Skill account directly. 
 *  Sales Skill field displayed. 
 *  Default = Sales Skill tied to the launching Sales Skill account. 
 *  Field is locked (not editable) but still required — automatically satisfied by the default value. 
 

 

 *  For non-1C districts: 

 *  Sales Skill field is hidden. 
 *  Screen behaves as per the current state.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:

 *  Scenario 1 – Corporate H5 in 1C with CAM populated 

 *  Given I launch ESB PowerApp from an H5 account linked to a 1C district with a CAM assigned, 
 *  When the General Information screen loads, 
 *  Then the Sales Skill field is displayed, defaulted to Hygiene, editable, and required for the user to select before proceeding. 
 

 *  Scenario 2 – H5 without CAM (street account) in 1C 

 *  Given I launch ESB PowerApp from a Sales Skill account linked to a 1C district (because the parent H5 has no CAM), 
 *  When the General Information screen loads, 
 *  Then the Sales Skill field is displayed, defaulted to the Sales Skill of the launching Sales Skill account, locked for editing, and required (satisfied by the default). 
 

 *  Scenario 3 – Non-1C district (H5 or Sales Skill account) 

 *  Given I launch ESB PowerApp from an H5 or Sales Skill account that belongs to a district not flagged as 1C, 
 *  When the General Information screen loads, 
 *  Then the Sales Skill field is hidden, and the screen behaves as per the current state (no validation for Sales Skill required).

column8: ESB Power App: Update Feature Selection Screen: Filter Features by Offerings Linked to Selected Sales Skill.
column11:
As a sales user creating a Scope of Work (SOW) in the Enterprise Scope Builder (ESB) PowerApp,
 
I want the Feature Selection screen to display only those features that are tied to offerings associated with the Global Business derived from my selected Sales Skill on the General Information screen,
 
So that I only see relevant features for the chosen Sales Skill (e.g., Hygiene or Water), ensuring accuracy and eliminating irrelevant feature options.
 

 
Key Design Logic:
 

 *  Sales Skill is selected on the General Information screen. 
 *  Global Business is auto-derived from the selected Sales Skill (e.g., Sales Skill = Hygiene ? Global Business = Food & Beverage). 
 *  ESB queries the Offerings table, retrieves all offerings linked to the derived Global Business. 
 *  From those offerings, ESB builds a distinct list of Features. 
 *  The Feature Selection screen displays only these filtered features. 
 *  Features without any offerings tied to the derived Global Business are excluded. 
 

 
Example: 

 *  Selected Sales Skill = Water. 
 *  Derived Global Business = Nalco Water. 
 *  Offerings tied to Nalco Water include “Analytical Services”. 
 *  Feature Selection screen shows: Analytical Services, 
 *  If selected Sales Skill = Hygiene then “Analytical Services” is hidden from the feature selection screen.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:

 *  Scenario 1 – Sales Skill selected on General Information screen 

 *  Given I select a Sales Skill on the General Information screen, 
 *  When I proceed to the Feature Selection screen, 
 *  Then only the features that are tied to offerings matching the derived Global Business for that Sales Skill are displayed. 
 

 *  Scenario 2 – Features without relevant offerings 

 *  Given a feature has no offerings tied to the derived Global Business, 
 *  When I view the Feature Selection screen, 
 *  Then that feature is hidden and not available for selection. 
 

 *  Scenario 3 – Multi-Sales Skill/Global Business offerings 

 *  Given an offering is tagged to multiple Global Businesses (e.g., both Water and Food & Beverage), 
 *  When I select a Sales Skill that derives to one of those Global Businesses, 
 *  Then the corresponding feature still appears on the Feature Selection screen.

column8: ESB Power App: Lock Sales Skill Field on Submitted/Active SOWs
column11:
As a sales user managing Scope of Work (SOW) records in the Enterprise Scope Builder (ESB) PowerApp,
I want the Sales Skill field to be locked for editing once a SOW has been submitted and activated,
 
So that I cannot mistakenly change the Sales Skill on an already active SOW, ensuring consistency and preventing downstream data integrity issues.
 

 
Key Notes:
 

 *  Current behavior: Once a SOW is submitted, only the End Date can be edited. 
 *  Required future behavior: Extend this lock to the Sales Skill field, so it is read-only once the SOW is in “Submitted” and “Active” status. 
 *  Applies only to SOWs tied to 1C H5 accounts/districts. 
 *  For non-1C accounts/districts, the existing behavior (no Sales Skill field present) remains unchanged.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria (Given / When / Then)

 *  Scenario 1 – Lock Sales Skill on Submitted/Active SOW 

 *  Given a Scope of Work has been submitted and is in “Active” status, 
 *  When I open the SOW in the ESB PowerApp and attempt to edit, 
 *  Then the Sales Skill field must be locked (read-only) and cannot be modified. 
 

 *  Scenario 2 – Editable fields post-submission 

 *  Given a Scope of Work has been submitted and is in “Active” status, 
 *  When I open the SOW in edit mode, 
 *  Then the only editable field should remain the End Date, consistent with current behavior. 
 

 *  Scenario 3 – Draft or Pending SOW 

 *  Given a Scope of Work is in “Draft” or “Pending Submission” status, 
 *  When I open the SOW in the ESB PowerApp, 
 *  Then the Sales Skill field must remain editable until the SOW is submitted. 
 

 *  Scenario 4 – Non-1C Accounts 

 *  Given a Scope of Work is tied to a non-1C H5 account or district, 
 *  When I open or edit the SOW, 
 *  Then the Sales Skill field should not appear at all, maintaining current system behavior.

column8: Dependent on Technical Spike: Merge Water SOW Line Items into Hygiene SOW During Account Consolidation
Dependent on Technical Spike: Deactivate Duplicate or Superseded SOWs Post-Merge
DC: Technical Spike: Analyze Active Water H5 SOWs for Re-Parenting to Surviving Hygiene H5s (1C) & Identify Mixed/Non-Convertible Scenarios
column11:
As a data conversion team, we need to analyze Water H5 ? Hygiene H5 SOW re-parenting feasibility for the 1C program, identify edge cases where Water H5s include child accounts not in scope of 1C, quantify impact, and recommend manual vs. automated creation paths for those exceptions—so we can finalize the R1 data-conversion plan without orphaning SOWs.

 

 *  In-Scope 

 *  Customers flagged by business as in scope for 1C. 
 *  Water H5 and Hygiene H5 identification & linkage. 
 *  Active SOWs on Water H5s only (inactive/expired are out of scope for re-parenting). 
 *  Detection of mixed H5s: Water H5 whose child accounts include both 1C and non-1C accounts. 
 *  Decision framework: when to re-parent, when to clone/create new SOW(s), when to leave as-is. 
 *  Delivery of scripts/queries to reproduce counts and exception files. 
 *  Mapping: Water H5 ? Hygiene H5 (surviving). 
 *  SOW extract (id, H5 id, status, dates, owner , Primary Owner ). 
 *  Account–H5 membership snapshot (child accounts per H5 with 1C in/out flag). 
 

 *  Inputs (from Business / Data) 

 *  Authoritative 1C customer list (accounts/H5s in scope). 
 

 *  Key Questions to Answer 

 *  For each Water H5 with active SOW, does every child account belong to the 1C list? 

 *  If yes ? candidate for automated re-parent to Hygiene H5. 
 *  If no (mixed) ? cannot blindly re-parent; propose manual or scripted SOW creation on Hygiene H5, leaving Water SOW in place for non-1C child accounts. 
 

 *  What is the volume of mixed H5s, and how many SOWs are impacted? 
 *  What is the recommended approach per case (manual vs automation) based on volume/complexity? 
 *  What are the controls (recon reports) to prove completeness/correctness? 
 

 *
column19: Moved out of state In Development
column22:
Acceptance Criteria 

 *  AC1 – Inventory of Re-Parent Candidates (Clean) 

 *  Given the 1C list and Water?Hygiene H5 mapping are provided 
 *  When the spike analysis is executed 
 *  Then a list of Water H5s with only 1C child accounts and their active SOWs is produced, marked Re-parent = YES, with counts per H5 and totals. 
 

 *  AC2 – Identification of Mixed H5 Exceptions 

 *  Given the 1C list and account–H5 membership are available 
 *  When the analysis detects Water H5s with at least one non-1C child account 
 *  Then those H5s are flagged Mixed = YES, their active SOWs are listed in an Exception File, and a recommended path (Manual or Automated Create) is proposed. 
 

 *  AC3 – Missing Mapping Exceptions 

 *  Given a Water H5 with active SOW lacks a mapped surviving Hygiene H5 
 *  When the analysis runs 
 *  Then the SOWs are listed in a Missing Mapping exception file with required business fields to resolve. 
 

 *  AC4 – Decision Framework & Recommendation 

 *  Given Mixed and Missing-Mapping exception volumes are quantified 
 *  When the spike concludes 
 *  Then a documented Decision Tree and a recommendation (manual vs. SSIS/script) are delivered with volume thresholds and risks. 
 

 *  Deliverables 

 *  Analysis Workbook : 

 *  Per Water H5: total child accounts, # in 1C / # not in 1C, mixed flag (Y/N). 
 *  Active SOW count per Water H5 (id, dates). 
 *  Surviving Hygiene H5 id (or missing mapping). 
 *  Disposition: Re-parent | Create New on Hygiene | Leave As-Is | Needs Mapping. 
 

 *  SQL/Query Pack (or equivalent) used to generate counts & exception lists. 
 *  Decision Tree  describing when to re-parent vs. create vs. skip. 
 *  Runbook Outline for the chosen approach. 
 *  Effort & Risk Summary with recommendation (manual vs SSIS/script) for mixed cases based on volume thresholds.

column8: DC: Populate Sales Skill Field on Migrated SOW Records.
column11:
As a Data Conversion Analyst,
I need to ensure that all Scope of Work (SOW) records impacted by the One Customer migration have their Sales Skill lookup field correctly populated,
 
So that users can clearly distinguish between Water and Hygiene SOWs on the surviving H5 account and downstream processes (e.g., trickle-down, filtering, reporting) function correctly.
 

 
Background & Rationale:
 

 *  In the current state, SOWs do not have an explicit Sales Skill field; all commitments are tied directly to H5 accounts. 
 *  In the future state, H5 accounts will support parallel SOWs for Water and Hygiene. 
 *  To differentiate and filter correctly, each SOW record must be tagged with the appropriate Sales Skill. 
 *  During migration, any SOWs being re-parented or merged into a surviving Hygiene H5 account must have the correct Sales Skill populated. 
 *  Business will provide mapping logic/rules to assign the correct Sales Skill (e.g., Water ? Nalco Water Sales Skill, Hygiene ? F&B Sales Skill).
column19: Moved out of state In QA
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 

 *  Scenario 1 – Populate Sales Skill on re-parented Water SOWs  

 *  Given a Water SOW is re-parented to a Hygiene H5 account during migration,  
 *  When the data conversion job runs,  
 *  Then the Sales Skill field on the SOW record must be populated with the appropriate Water Sales Skill.  
 

 *  Scenario 2 – Populate Sales Skill on existing Hygiene SOWs 

 *  Given a Hygiene SOW already exists on a surviving Hygiene H5 account, 
 *  When the data conversion job runs, 
 *  Then the Sales Skill field on the Hygiene SOW must be populated with the Hygiene Sales Skill if not already present. 
 

 *  Scenario 3 – Non-impacted SOWs 

 *  Given an SOW is on a non-1C H5 account, 
 *  When the data conversion job runs, 
 *  Then no changes are applied to the Sales Skill field and existing state is preserved. 
 

 *  Scenario 4 – Exception reporting 

 *  Given an SOW record is missing mapping data or cannot be assigned a valid Sales Skill, 
 *  When the data conversion runs, 
 *  Then the process must log the SOW ID in an exception report for business review and remediation.

column8: Add Sales Skill Lookup to Scope of Work Table in CRM (1C Only, Lock by default on CRM Forms).
column11:
As a user working with Scope of Work records in CRM,
 
I need the Sales Skill lookup field added to the Scope of Work table,
 
So that Sales Skill is correctly captured for 1C accounts but remains hidden and non-disruptive for non-1C accounts.
 

 
The field will be populated only via the Enterprise Scope Builder (ESP) PowerApp at creation time.
 
On CRM forms, the Sales Skill field will be displayed only if the H5 account is linked to a 1C district or linked to Sales Skill accounts belonging to 1C districts.
 
For non-1C accounts, the field remains hidden.
 
Where visible, the field must be read-only to ensure consistency, since ESP is the entry point.
 

 
Business Requirements: 

 *  Add a new lookup field on Scope of Work referencing the Sales Skill table. 
 *  Sales Skill field must be conditionally displayed on CRM forms (1C only). 
 *  The field must be read-only on CRM forms; no edits in CRM. 
 *  Non-1C accounts must remain unaffected; existing forms behave as today. 
 *  Once populated, Sales Skill must remain visible for audit in 1C accounts.
column14: CodeReviewed; Data Dictionary; FBU_QAPush_Oct_Major2; ProdPush_Nov_FBU_R1; ReadyforDemo; validated in QA; validated in Test
column19: Moved out of state Pending Prod Release
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Scenario 1 – Display field for 1C H5 account 

 *  Given an H5 account is linked to a district flagged as 1C or  linked to Sales Skill accounts belonging to 1C districts, 
 *  When a user opens a Scope of Work record tied to that H5, 
 *  Then the Sales Skill lookup field is displayed on the CRM form in read-only mode. (Move the Owner field from the General form to the Form Header and place the sales skill field in its place.) 
 

 *  Scenario 2 – Hide field for non-1C H5 account 

 *  Given an H5 account is not in a 1C district or not linked to Sales Skill accounts in a 1C district, 
 *  When a user opens a Scope of Work record tied to that H5, 
 *  Then the Sales Skill lookup field is not displayed on the CRM form. 
 

 *  Scenario 3 – Field Locking 

 *  Given a Scope of Work record has a Sales Skill field, 
 *  When a user opens the Scope of Work form in CRM, 
 *  Then the Sales Skill lookup field is read-only and cannot be updated manually.

column8: Add Multi-Select Global Business Option Set Field to Offering Table in CRM
column11:
As a CRM system user,
I need a multi-select option set field called Global Business to be added to the Offering table,
 
So that each Offering record can be explicitly tagged with the applicable global business (e.g., Nalco Water, Food & Beverage, Life Sciences, Textile Care),
 
And this field is visible on Offering forms and views for easy reference and management.
 

 
This story only covers adding the field, exposing it on the Offering form, and ensuring it is visible in the Offering entity views.
 
Any logic for filtering Offerings during Scope of Work creation will be handled in a separate user story.
column14: CodeReviewed; Data Dictionary; FBU_QAPush_Oct_Major1; ProdPush_Nov_FBU_R1; validated in QA; validated in Test
column19: Moved out of state Pending Prod Release
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 

 *  Scenario 1 – Field Creation 

 *  Given I am working with the Offering entity in CRM, 
 *  When the Global Business field is created as a multi-select option set, 
 *  Then I must be able to select one or more values (e.g., Nalco Water, Food & Beverage). 
 

 *  Scenario 2 – Offering Form Update 

 *  Given I open the Offering record form, 
 *  When the form loads, 
 *  Then I must see the Global Business field displayed and editable. (Add it below the Unit Type) 
 

 *  Scenario 3 – Offering View Update (Add it after the Feature Column) 

 *  Given I open the Offering grid view,(All the OOB views of this table) 
 *  When the view loads, 
 *  Then the Global Business column must be visible alongside existing Offering columns.(Add it after the Feature Column) 
 

 *  Scenario 4 – Backward Compatibility 

 *  Given existing Offerings already exist in CRM, 
 *  When I view those records, 
 *  Then they must continue to behave as before, with Global Business field available but unpopulated until updated.

column9: Update Global Business Values on Active Offerings Using Provided Mapping
column11:
As a CRM system administrator,
 
I need to update the Global Business multi-select option set field for all active Offering records,
 
So that each Offering is correctly tagged to its respective global business (e.g., Nalco Water, Food & Beverage, Life Sciences, Textile Care),
 
And downstream processes such as Scope of Work filtering and Feature/Offering visibility work correctly for One Customer (FBU) accounts.
 

 
Business stakeholders will provide a definitive mapping list (currently ~67 active offerings) that associates each Offering with one or more Global Business values.
 
The CRM team must update the Offering records accordingly, ensuring all active Offerings are aligned before FBU scope of work filtering logic is enabled.

column6: CRM: Base Customer Account Experience & Site Visibility Management
column11:
This feature introduces the Base Customer Account (BCA) in CRM — a new, unified customer record that represents the corporate or enterprise customer across all sales skills (Water and F&B). The BCA will act as the central hub for viewing and managing all downstream customer interactions, including associated accounts, sites, opportunities, assets, and service history. This change supports the One Customer model by improving transparency, reducing duplicate data, and enabling enterprise-level visibility.

 
From a business perspective, the BCA enables a 360° view of the customer across sales skills and regions. Users will now be able to easily understand which sites, accounts, and business relationships are part of a single enterprise, without navigating through fragmented records. The CRM user interface will be updated with new views, lookups, and dashboards that clearly present this relationship and make it easy to navigate.
 

 
From a technical implementation standpoint, the following changes are included: 

 *  A new BCA table/entity will be created in CRM, designed for read-only access for most users. 
 *  The BCA form will include aggregated views (e.g., lists of linked accounts, sites, opportunities) using controls such as PCF/ECF to summarize key related data. 
 *  Sales skill account forms will be updated to include a lookup field to BCA, which will only be visible when applicable (e.g., based on One Customer flag). 
 *  All CRM views will be reviewed and updated to ensure they reflect the BCA-to-account relationship accurately. New views will be introduced to support enterprise account search and reporting. 
 *  The BCA will include key metadata fields such as District, Sales Org, Market Segment, Sub-Segment, Global Business, and Sales Skill, enabling consistent customer segmentation and alignment across CRM and downstream systems. 
 *  Legacy logic that prevents duplicate ERP numbers across accounts will be reviewed and revised, enabling Water and F&B to coexist under the same ERP ID when applicable. 
 *  CRM plugins and validations will be updated to reflect the new logic for account creation, duplicate checks, and global business assignment. 
 *  Master data updates are a critical dependency: District, Sales Org, Segment, Market Segment, and Sub-Segment values will need to be aligned with the new One Customer structure. This will be managed through initial configuration and weekly load processes, and must be completed before BCA creation is functional. 
 *  This feature is tightly integrated with the customer setup process: during prospect-to-customer conversion, Sales Skill selection will drive downstream MDM and EBS behavior, including the creation of the BCA and its link to the originating account. 
 

 
This feature is foundational for One Customer enablement and will directly impact CRM forms, business rules, data quality, integrations, and master data alignment. It ensures users gain simplified navigation and complete visibility while enabling backend systems to operate on a harmonized enterprise structure.

Design Decision: Use Native N:N Relationships for Sales Skill Mapping (District–Sales Skill & Market Segment–Sales Skill)
column11:
Decision Statement:
We have decided to implement Sales Skill mappings (both District–Sales Skill and Market Segment–Sales Skill) using the native N:N relationship in CRM, rather than creating custom intersect tables.
 

 
Rationale:
 

 *  Latest CRM release supports advanced lookup filtering on standard N:N relationships, addressing the previous limitation. 
 *  No requirement exists for custom attributes on either relationship, making a custom intersect table unnecessary. 
 *  Native N:N provides simpler architecture, reduced maintenance, and better alignment with OOTB capabilities. 
 

 
Implications: 

 *  Data Dictionary must be updated to reflect native N:N relationships only for both District–Sales Skill and Market Segment–Sales Skill. 
 *  All references to custom intersect tables must be removed. 
 *  Any dependent user stories or technical spikes will leverage native relationships for filtering, reporting, and data model design. 
 

 
Action Items: 

 *  Ashish to rework the Data Dictionary and update the Technical Spike accordingly. 
 *  Updated Data Dictionary to be submitted to Siddharth for review. 
 *  Link this decision to related user stories (e.g., District–Sales Skill Mapping View, Market Segment–Sales Skill Mapping View).
