column8: Associate Hygiene and Water Sales Skills to All 1C Districts
column11:
As a system,
I want to assign both Water and Hygiene sales skills to every district flagged as 1C during cutover
 
so that all 1C districts are consistently enabled for both sales skills and ready for the One Customer model.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Given a district is flagged as 1C in the business-approved list 

 *  When the cutover process is executed 
 *  Then both Water and Hygiene sales skills must be associated with that district 
 

 *  Given a district is not flagged as 1C 

 *  When the cutover process is executed 
 *  Then no additional sales skills (Water or Hygiene) should be assigned to that district 
 

 *  Given the cutover has completed 

 *  When validation checks are performed 
 *  Then all 1C districts must show both Water and Hygiene sales skills in the district-to-sales skill mapping table 
 

 *  Given the cutover updates are applied 

 *  When results are compared against the business-approved 1C district list 
 *  Then each flagged district must reflect exactly two sales skill associations: Water and Hygiene 
 

 

Business Requirements: 
 

 *  All 1C districts must be configured with both Water and Hygiene sales skills at cutover. 
 *  Non-1C districts must remain unchanged — no new sales skills are to be assigned. 
 *  Associations must be created in the district-to-sales skill mapping table (or equivalent CRM structure). 
 *  After cutover, there should be no 1C district without both sales skills assigned. 
 *  The outcome must be validated against the business-approved 1C district list. 
 *  Any exceptions or missing associations must be flagged for correction before go-live.

column7: 6. Allow Multiple Sales Skill Accounts to Share the Same ERP Customer Number in CRM
column11:
Business Capability:
As part of the One Customer initiative, the business wants CRM to support scenarios where a single ERP customer number from EBS can be shared across multiple Sales Skill Accounts (e.g., Water and Hygiene). This reflects the new consolidated customer structure in ERP, where previously separate customer numbers for Water and Hygiene are now unified into a single number. 

 
For example:  

 *  The surviving Hygiene ERP Customer Number will be applied to both the Hygiene and Water Sales Skill Accounts in CRM. 
 *  Despite sharing the ERP number, both Sales Skill Accounts must remain distinct for sales execution, opportunity tracking, and access control. 
 

 
To maintain CRM data quality and downstream consistency: 

 *  CRM must enforce that Account Number + ERP System + Sales Skill combination is unique. 
 *  Business must define and drive the account merge rules during migration: 

 *  If more than one CRM account exists for the same ERP number and Sales Skill (e.g., four Hygiene accounts), they must be merged into one prior to applying the new structure. 
 *  Merge definitions (e.g., survivor selection, field precedence) will be finalized later by business stakeholders as part of refinement sessions. 
 

 

 
Any leftover duplicate cleanup post-migration will be handled through data conversion activities, but the primary merging strategy and decisions must be owned by business. 

 
Technical Implementation Considerations: 

 *  Core Plugin Logic: 

 *  Modify the synchronous plugin on CRM Account entity that currently blocks duplicate ERP customer numbers. 
 *  Plugin should enforce uniqueness based on the composite key: 

 *  (ERP Source System + ERP Customer Number + Sales Skill) 
 

 *  Ensure this logic applies consistently across create and update operations. 
 

 *  Merging Logic: 

 *  If CRM contains multiple accounts with the same ERP number and Sales Skill, they must be merged into one per skill. 

 *  Business will provide merge rules and survivor logic. 
 *  If not merged, the plugin will block updates due to duplicate constraint violations. 
 

 *  Business-led data analysis is required to identify merge candidates prior to implementation. 
 

 *  Alternative Feasibility (Requires Technical Spike): 

 *  Spike is needed to determine if the uniqueness plugin can alternatively allow: 

 *  Multiple CRM accounts to share the same ERP number and Sales Skill, only if they belong to different BCAs. 
 *  For example, allow: 

 *  Account 1 (ERP #123, Water, BCA A) 
 *  Account 2 (ERP #123, Water, BCA B) 
 

 *  But block if both are under the same BCA, as that would imply duplication. 
 

 *  The spike should evaluate: 

 *  Impact on plugin performance 
 *  Technical viability of checking BCA context at runtime 
 *  Risk of inconsistent downstream reporting or integrations 
 

 

 *  Other Technical Adjustments: 

 *  During conversion, update ERP Source System from legacy value (e.g., NLC_SAP) to the new standard ECL_EBS. 
 *  Plugin should account for the new source system name in validation logic. 
 

 

 
Expected Deliverables: 

 *  Updated CRM plugin logic to enforce uniqueness using (ERP Source System + ERP Customer Number + Sales Skill) key. 
 *  Technical design document outlining: 

 *  Plugin update 
 *  Edge case handling 
 *  Merge logic triggers 
 

 *  Documented business rules for merges, including survivor record determination, field precedence, and audit requirements (to be defined during refinement). 
 *  Outcomes of technical spike, exploring feasibility of uniqueness enforcement within BCA context. 
 *  Scripts or manual processes to identify and merge duplicate Sales Skill Accounts before conversion. 
 *  Test scenarios and validation for plugin behavior under create/update, migration, and data repair use cases. 
 *  CRM metadata updates to reflect: 

 *  Relaxed uniqueness constraint 
 *  Revised source system mappings

column8: TECHNICAL SPIKE: Identify existing duplicate-check plugin and document how existing logic will be updated
column11: As a CRM Developer, I need to identify the existing duplicate-check plugin logic for Accounts and document how it should be updated, so that the system can allow more than one account with the same ERP System and ERP Account Number when each has a different Sales Skill, while still preventing duplicates where all three values match. This will ensure the One Customer account model functions correctly without blocking valid account creation or updates.
column19: Moved out of state In Development
column22:
*  Locate & Document Current Plugin 

 *  Identify all plugins, steps, and configurations related to duplicate checking on Accounts. 
 *  Capture plugin assembly name, class, message (Create/Update), execution stage, filtering attributes, and execution order. 
 *  Document where the code is stored (repo, solution name) and in which environments the step is registered. 
 

 *  Analyze Current Logic 

 *  Describe how the duplicate check works today, including field comparison logic, case sensitivity, and active/inactive record handling. 
 *  Capture current validation messages and when they are displayed (pre-save vs post-save). 
 

 *  Define Proposed Change 

 *  Update uniqueness rule to: 

 *  Block if ERP System, ERP Account Number, and Sales Skill match. 
 *  Allow if ERP System and ERP Account Number match but Sales Skill differs. 
 

 *  Include pseudocode for new logic, handling null Sales Skill values appropriately for One Customer accounts. 

 *  Document special-case handling for: 
 *  Legacy accounts without Sales Skill. 
 *  Merges and deactivated records. 
 *  Bulk import and integration updates. 
 

 

 *  Edge Cases & Performance 

 *  Identify potential edge cases (e.g., whitespace, padding, null values, case sensitivity). 
 *  Recommend performance optimizations (e.g., indexes, FetchXML query adjustments) to keep plugin execution under acceptable latency. 
 

 *  Impact Assessment 

 *  List areas impacted (form saves, bulk imports, integrations, merges). 
 *  Include rollback plan in case of deployment issues. 
 

 *  Testing Approach 

 *  Define scenarios to confirm correct behavior: 

 *  Same ERP+Number, different Sales Skills ? allowed. 
 *  Same ERP+Number, same Sales Skill ? blocked with error. 
 *  Changing Sales Skill or ERP fields triggers re-validation. 
 *  Bulk import and API create/update behave consistently. 
 

 

 *  Deliverables 

 *  Technical documentation (memo or wiki) including: plugin inventory, current logic summary, proposed logic, pseudocode, risks, and test outline. 
 *  Screenshots or exports from Plugin Registration Tool showing step details. 
 *  Effort estimate and prerequisites for implementing the change.

column8: Enforce ERP Number + Sales Skill Uniqueness for BCA Linked Accounts (1C Districts Only)
column11:
As a CRM user, I need the system to allow more than one account with the same ERP customer number as long as each account belongs to a different Sales Skill, but only when the account is associated with a One Customer (1C) district, so that divisional accounts (e.g., Water and Hygiene) can be linked under the same Base Customer Account (BCA) without being blocked by duplicate validation.
For non-1C accounts, the current uniqueness rule (ERP System + ERP Number only) continues to apply.

 
Current State:
 
CRM enforces a uniqueness rule on accounts that blocks two accounts from having the same ERP System + ERP Customer Number. This was valid pre-One Customer but now blocks legitimate scenarios where different Sales Skills share the same ERP number.
 

 
Target State:
 
For 1C Accounts CRM must enforce uniqueness on (ERP System, ERP Customer Number, Sales Skill) instead of (ERP System, ERP Customer Number). This ensures duplicates are only blocked when Sales Skill is the same, while still preventing accidental same-skill duplicates. The existing duplicate validation should still work for non 1C accounts.
column19: Moved out of state Pending Prod Release
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria
 
 
 

 *  Allow Multiple Accounts for Different Sales Skills (1C Only) 

 *  Given an Active account exists in a 1C district with ERP System = X and Account Number = 123 for Sales Skill = Water 
 *  When I create another account in the same 1C district with ERP System = X and Account Number= 123 but Sales Skill = Hygiene 
 *  Then the system allows creation and links it under the same BCA. 
 

 *  Block Duplicates for Same Sales Skill (1C Only) 

 *  Given an active account exists in a 1C district with ERP System = X and Account Number = 123 for Sales Skill = Water 
 *  When I create another account in the same 1C district with ERP System = X and Account Number = 123 and Sales Skill = Water 
 *  Then the system blocks the creation and displays: 

 *  “This ERP number is already in use for the selected Sales Skill in this 1C district. Choose a different Sales Skill or use the existing account.” 
 

 

 *  Validation Applies in UI Forms (1C Only) 

 *  Given I enter account details in a CRM account form for a 1C district 
 *  When I attempt to save an account with duplicate ERP System + Account Number + Sales Skill 
 *  Then the system enforces the uniqueness rule and prevents the save. 
 

 *  Validation Applies in Data Imports (1C Only) 

 *  Given I import accounts into CRM for a 1C district 
 *  When a record violates ERP System + Account Number + Sales Skill uniqueness 
 *  Then the import fails for that record with the error message. 
 

 *  Validation on Sales Skill Changes (1C Only) 

 *  Given I update the Sales Skill on a prospect account in a 1C district (This can happen as long as the Account is Prospect and is created from the BCA Account sub-grids) 
 *  When the change would create a duplicate ERP System + Account Number + Sales Skill combination 
 *  Then the update is blocked. 
 

 *  Deactivation Reuse (1C Only)  

 *  Given an account in a 1C district with ERP System + Account Number + Sales Skill is deactivated  
 *  When I create a new account in the same 1C district with the same values  
 *  Then the system allows creation since the prior one is inactive.  
 

 *  Non-1C Accounts Follow Current Rules 

 *  Given an account belongs to a non-1C district 
 *  When I create or update an account with the same ERP System + Account Number as an existing account 
 *  Then the system blocks it under the existing rule (ignores Sales Skill). 
 

 

Business Requirements: 
 

 *  Enforce uniqueness on ERP System + ERP Number + Sales Skill only for 1C districts. 
 *  Preserve current uniqueness rules for non-1C accounts. 
 *  Ensure validation is applied across all entry points (UI, imports, APIs, integrations). 
 *  Provide clear and district-specific error messaging. 
 *  Ensure search and views distinguish accounts by ERP Number + Sales Skill. 
 

 

 
Developer Notes: 

 *  Uniqueness & Validation Rules 

 *  The system allows more than one active account with the same ERP System and ERP Customer Number if their Sales Skill values are different. 
 *  The system blocks create/update when ERP System, ERP Customer Number, and Sales Skill are all identical to an existing active account. 
 *  The rule applies across: 

 *  Form saves 
 *  Dataverse API/SDK updates 
 *  Imports and integration upserts 
 

 *  Validation message example: 

 *  “This ERP Number is already used for the selected Sales Skill. Choose a different Sales Skill or use the existing account.” 
 

 *  Changing the Sales Skill on an account is blocked if it would create a duplicate composite (ERP System + ERP Customer Number + Sales Skill). 
 

 *  Scope Control 

 *  Non-One Customer accounts (no Sales Skill) follow current uniqueness rules without change. 
 

 *  Data Conversion 

 *  Data conversion loads allow multiple accounts for the same ERP number when Sales Skills differ. 
 *  If a conversion would produce a same-skill duplicate, it is prevented with a clear message. 
 

 *  UI & Search 

 *  Standard account views include Sales Skill to distinguish accounts with the same ERP number. 
 *  Global Search results show both ERP number and Sales Skill for clarity. 
 

 *  Edge Cases 

 *  Deactivating an account frees up that composite key for reuse. 
 *  Temporary absence of Sales Skill uses non-1C validation rules.

column7: 5. Align Global Business Logic Using Sales Skill Instead of District for One Customer Accounts
column11:
Business Objective:
 
 
Business expects CRM to support the One Customer model by accurately reflecting the line of business (Water or Hygiene) through a clearly visible field on the customer account — without relying on outdated or misleading metadata such as the District-driven Global Business. 

 
To support the One Customer model and present a unified view of the business, CRM must shift away from legacy district-driven global business logic, which inaccurately implies separation between Water and Hygiene. With both divisions now operating under a single go-to-market model, relying on district-based population of the “Global Business” field misrepresents the business structure and introduces confusion among users. The objective is to ensure CRM reflects a consolidated line-of-business identity through the Sales Skill designation and to eliminate user-facing dependency on outdated metadata such as “Global Business.” This will foster a consistent, accurate, and future-ready user experience aligned with the business’s strategic transformation.
 

 
Business Requirements:
 

 *  Replace existing logic that auto-populates the Global Business field based on district with logic that derives business classification from the Sales Skill field. 
 *  Ensure the Sales Skill designation is clearly displayed on all CRM customer account forms, indicating whether an account aligns to Water, Hygiene, or another line of business. 
 *  Demote or remove the Global Business field from the user interface to avoid misinterpretation; it should no longer be a visible or editable field for users. 
 *  Ensure system-generated metadata (e.g., Market Segment, Sub-Segment) is driven from Sales Skill instead of Global Business to maintain consistency. 
 *  Provide a consistent user experience across all relevant forms, where Sales Skill becomes the primary field for business classification. 
 *  Ensure that this updated behavior applies to all accounts under the One Customer structure, including those within Food & Beverage, while retaining existing logic for legacy business units that are not part of One Customer. 
 *  Avoid any disruption to downstream processes or integrations that depend on the Global Business field by computing it in the background, based on Sales Skill. 
 *  Reinforce to users through form design that Water and Hygiene are not separate business entities by removing legacy fields that imply otherwise. 
 

 
Technical Implementation Considerations: 

 *  Introduce a new Sales Skill field (e.g., option set with values “Water”, “Hygiene”) on: 

 *  CRM Account entity (visible when district is marked as One Customer). 
 *  User entity (optional default value per user). 
 

 *  Update CRM logic so that Global Business is derived based on Sales Skill, not District, but only when the account is marked as One Customer. 

 *  For example: 

 *  Sales Skill = Water ? Global Business = Alco Water 
 *  Sales Skill = Hygiene ? Global Business = Food & Beverage 
 

 

 *  The Global Business field will remain in the system but should be removed from prominent sections of the Account form UI. It should not be user-editable. 
 *  Modify existing logic or business rules that default Market Segment and Sub-Segment, which may currently be tied to District, to instead use Sales Skill as the primary driver. 
 *  Add logic to prompt users to select a Sales Skill if one is not available from user defaults. 
 *  Hide Sales Skill and related behaviors when the account is not part of a One Customer district. 
 *  Perform technical spike(s) to: 

 *  Evaluate feasibility and design of user-level defaulting for Sales Skill. 
 *  Assess existing dependencies on Global Business field (e.g., plugin behavior, downstream integrations). 
 *  Validate any required updates to district metadata or custom scripting. 
 

 

 
Expected Deliverables: 

 *  New Sales Skill field (Account and User entity), implemented with appropriate visibility and security controls. 
 *  Revised form logic and field behavior to: 

 *  Control visibility of Sales Skill and Global Business fields. 
 *  Derive Global Business based on Sales Skill for One Customer accounts. 
 

 *  Refactored logic for Market Segment and Sub-Segment defaulting. 
 *  Updated data model documentation, including field-level metadata and defaulting logic. 
 *  Detailed outcomes from technical spike activities. 
 *  Updated solution design and test scenarios to reflect new user experience and system behavior for FBU accounts.

column8: TECHNICAL SPIKE: Determine Best Approach for Enforcing Sales Skill & Global Business Rules for 1-Customer Districts
column11: As a CRM developer, I need to investigate and determine the best technical approach for enforcing the rule that any District marked as 1-Customer = Yes must have at least one active Sales Skill associated, and that the Global Business field is handled correctly for such districts, so that data integrity is maintained and business rules are consistently applied.
column19: Moved out of state Pending PO Review
column22:
*  Identify Enforcement Approach 

 *  Evaluate at least two options (form script vs. plugin) for enforcing both: 

 *  Minimum one active Sales Skill when 1-Customer = Yes. 
 *  Proper Global Business behavior when 1-Customer = Yes. 
 

 *  Document the pros/cons of each option in terms of UI, server-side validation, and compatibility with API/bulk import. 
 *  Recommend the preferred option and rationale. 
 

 *  Sales Skill Rule Definition 

 *  Rule that a District with 1-Customer = Yes cannot be saved without at least one active Sales Skill linked. 
 *  Rule that removal or deactivation of the last active Sales Skill is not allowed; must display a clear, user-friendly error message. 
 *  Include logic to prevent these violations during both manual UI actions and programmatic/API operations. 
 

 *  Global Business Field Behavior 

 *  For 1-Customer = Yes: 

 *  Determine whether the Global Business field should be hidden or disabled in the form UI. 
 *  Define whether the field’s value should be cleared once or left but ignored. 
 *  Ensure downstream processes do not use District. Global Business for 1-Customer flagged districts. 
 

 *  For 1-Customer = No: 

 *  Confirm Global Business field is visible and editable. 
 *  If previously cleared/hidden, define reversion behavior (e.g., leave blank, allow re-entry). 
 

 

 *  Create & Update Scenarios 

 *  New District creation: 1-Customer flag initially not visible or defaulted to No; confirm behavior when later updated to Yes. 
 *  Existing District update: validate correct enforcement when toggling 1-Customer flag. 
 *  Ensure rules work consistently for both create and update events. 
 

 *  Documentation Deliverables 

 *  Provide a design document including: 

 *  Selected enforcement mechanism. 
 *  All event points covered (form save, association/disassociation, plugin triggers if used). 
 *  User-facing error/warning messages. 
 *  Known limitations, especially regarding data conversion and bulk import behavior.

column8: TECHNICAL SPIKE: Define approach to auto?derive “Global Business” from “Sales Skill” (while preserving district?based logic for non?1C)
column11:
As a CRM developer/architect, I need to analyze and recommend the best end?to?end design to set Global Business from Sales Skill for One?Customer (1C) accounts (in real time and on the server), while keeping the existing District ? Global Business logic for non?1C accounts, so that we avoid misclassification after district harmonization and maintain backward compatibility.

 
Goals / Questions to Answer
 

 *  Where is Global Business currently derived (form script, business rule, plug?in, or combination)? 
 *  What is the cleanest target design to: 

 *  trigger real?time updates on the form when Sales Skill changes, and 
 *  enforce server?side integrity for API/batch updates? 
 

 *  How will we source the mapping (Sales Skill ? Global Business) and handle missing/invalid mappings? 
 *  How do we branch logic: 1C accounts use Sales Skill, non?1C use District, without regressions? 
 *  What are the performance, security, and migration implications?
column19: Moved out of state Pending PO Review
column22:
*  Inventory of current logic 

 *  Document all places where Global Business is set or validated today (JS files, business rules, plug?ins/steps, workflows/Power Automate, synchronous/asynchronous steps, order of execution). 
 *  Note entity/event (Account OnCreate/OnUpdate), message pipeline stages, and any dependencies on District. 
 

 *  Proposed target design (form + server) 

 *  Provide a recommended approach that supports: 
 *  Real?time form update when Sales Skill changes (field?level change). 
 *  Server?side enforcement on Account Create/Update (including API/batch). 
 *  Feature flag/branching: If 1C = true ? derive from Sales Skill; else ? keep District logic. 
 *  Include process flow (field change ? derivation ? validation ? save). 
 

 *  Mapping strategy 

 *  Confirm use of a reference mapping (Sales Skill table with a required Global Business field). 
 *  Define error behavior when mapping is missing (form warning + save block; server error message). 
 *  Specify who owns/maintains mapping and how it’s transported across envs. 
 

 *  Edge?case handling 

 *  District changes on 1C accounts must not overwrite Global Business; Sales Skill remains the sole driver. 
 *  Sales Skill cleared ? Global Business cleared (and save blocked if mandatory). 
 *  Non?1C path unchanged (District continues to derive Global Business). 
 *  Bulk/API scenarios covered (no reliance on client scripts). 
 

 *  Security & auditing 

 *  Confirm Global Business remains user read?only and hidden (for 1C) and is only system?set. 
 

 *  Test strategy (what to test, not how) 

 *  List the test scenarios the delivery story must cover (1C vs. non?1C, API updates, missing mapping, field clear/reset, district change, performance). 
 

 *  Deliverables 

 *  Design notes with: 

 *  Current?state inventory (components & code locations). 
 *  Mapping model & error behaviors. 
 

 

 *  Lightweight POC (optional): show form change + server plug?in path using a stubbed mapping. 
 *  Effort estimate & story breakdown for build (form script change, plug?in changes, config, tests). 
 

 *  Document Final Approach 

 *  Record final approach, trade?offs considered (e.g., business rule vs. plug?in vs. JS), and rationale.

column8: Hide Global Business field from the UI for One Customer accounts.
column11:
As a CRM user, I want the Global Business field to be hidden from the Account form  when the account is flagged as One Customer (1C = Yes), so that I can work with the Sales Skill field instead and ensure consistency in ERP mapping without confusion. For non-1C accounts, the Global Business field should remain visible and editable as it functions today.
 
 
 

 
Context:

 *  Currently, the Global Business field is visible and editable on all account forms. 
 *  With the One-Customer initiative, for accounts flagged as 1-Customer = Yes, Global Business will be derived automatically from the selected Sales Skill. 
 *  For non-One-Customer accounts (including all, non-FBU, and legacy accounts), the Global Business field should continue to appear and function as it does today.
column19: Moved out of state Pending Prod Release
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 
 
 

 *  Visibility Rules 

 *  Given I am on an Account where One Customer flag on the District = Yes 

 *  When I view the form 
 *  Then the Global Business field is hidden, and the ERP System field is auto-set to ECL_EBS.  
 

 *  Given I am on an Account where One Customer flag on the District = No 

 *  When I view the form 
 *  Then the Global Business field remains visible and editable as per current behavior, and the ERP System field remains blank upon creation.  
 

 

 *  Automatic Behavior 

 *  Given I create or update a 1C Account with a Sales Skill 

 *  When the Sales Skill is selected 
 *  Then the Global Business field is automatically populated in the backend (not visible on the form) based on the Sales Skill. 
 

 *  Given I update a Sales Skill on a 1C Account 

 *  When the Sales Skill changes 
 *  Then the Global Business value updates immediately in the backend without requiring a save. 
 

 

 *  Edit Restrictions  

 *  Given an Account is marked as 1C  

 *  When a user tries to edit Global Business or ERP System  
 *  Then both fields are locked and not editable in all forms and views.  
 

 *  Given an Account is non-1C  

 *  When a user with security permissions edits Global Business  
 *  Then the system allows changes as per existing rules.  
 

 

 *  District Change Handling 

 *  Given an Account flagged as 1C is reassigned to a district that is not flagged as 1C 

 *  When this change is saved 
 *  Then the Global Business field becomes visible again and ERP System is no longer auto-populated. 
 

 

 

 
Business Requirements: 

 *  Hide the Global Business field on the Account form when One Customer = Yes. 
 *  Prevent editing of Global Business and ERP System fields for 1C Accounts (forms and grid views).  
 *  Ensure backend logic continues to populate Global Business based on Sales Skill selection for 1C Accounts. 
 *  Trigger immediate backend update of Global Business when Sales Skill changes (no save required). 
 *  Maintain current functionality for non-1C Accounts: 

 *  Global Business remains visible and editable. 
 *  ERP System remains blank at creation unless updated manually.  
 

 *  Ensure that if district changes to a non-1C district, the Account reverts to non-1C logic. 
 

 
Developer Notes: 

 *  Use form-level JavaScript / business rules to hide Global Business field for 1C Accounts. 
 *  Apply field-level security or disable field properties for ERP System and Global Business when One Customer = Yes. 
 *  Configure backend plugin/Power Automate to: 

 *  Derive Global Business from Sales Skill. 
 *  Update Global Business dynamically upon Sales Skill change. 
 

 *  Ensure field locking logic applies in both forms and grid views. 
 *  Update data model so Global Business updates are always captured, even when field is hidden. 
 

 *  Scope & Applicability 

 *  Applies only to accounts flagged as One Customer impacted (configurable flag on the District table). 
 *  Non-impacted accounts must continue using the current District?Global Business derivation logic. 
 

 *  Derivation Logic for One Customer Accounts 

 *  When Sales Skill is populated or changed, Global Business is automatically set to the value defined in the Sales Skill ? Global Business mapping table. 
 *  If Sales Skill is unchanged, Global Business remains unchanged. 
 *  The derivation must happen real time on the form and server-side using a plug-in. This line needs to be revisited once the SPIKE is completed for the Market Segment and Sales Skill  
 

 *  Mapping Source & Maintenance 

 *  Each Sales Skill record must have a mandatory Global Business mapping. 
 *  Mapping must be stored in a secure reference table editable only by admin roles. 
 

 *  Validation 

 *  If a user changes District on a One Customer account, it should not overwrite Global Business (derivation is driven solely by Sales Skill in this case). 
 *  On non-1C accounts, changing District continues to derive Global Business as today; Sales Skill is ignored for derivation. 
 

 *  UI & Security 

 *  For in-scope accounts, Global Business must be read-only to users (cannot be edited manually). 
 

 

 

 *  Test scenarios: 

 *  Account creation (1C vs. non-1C). 
 *  Sales Skill change. 
 *  District change (1C ? non-1C). 
 *  Security roles for editing Global Business on non-1C accounts.

column8: Global Business value should be set automatically based on the chosen Sales Skill.
column11:
As a CRM user working on a One Customer account, I want the Global Business field on the Account to be set automatically from the selected Sales Skill rather than the District, so that classification is accurate when both Water and Hygiene share the same District and the existing District?Global Business mapping can no longer be relied upon.

 
Current state:
 

 *  Today, Global Business is derived automatically based on the District field. 
 *  Districts are mapped 1:1 to a Global Business, and this mapping is used in real time to populate the Global Business field when a District is set or changed. 
 

 
Problem with current state for One Customer: 

 *  Under the One Customer initiative, Water and Hygiene districts will be merged into unified districts. 
 *  This means a District can no longer uniquely determine the correct Global Business. 
 *  Continuing with district-based derivation would cause incorrect Global Business values. 
 

 
Future state requirement: 

 *  For One Customer flagged accounts/districts, the Global Business value must be derived based on the Sales Skill selected on the account instead of District. 
 *  The derivation must happen in real time (on change of Sales Skill), not just on save. 
 *  Non-One Customer (out-of-scope) accounts should continue to use the existing District?Global Business logic without change.
column22:
*  Scope & Applicability 

 *  Applies only to accounts flagged as One Customer impacted (configurable flag on the District table). 
 *  Non-impacted accounts must continue using the current District?Global Business derivation logic. 
 

 *  Derivation Logic for One Customer Accounts 

 *  When Sales Skill is populated or changed, Global Business is automatically set to the value defined in the Sales Skill ? Global Business mapping table. 
 *  If Sales Skill is unchanged, Global Business remains unchanged. 
 *  The derivation must happen real time on the form and server-side using a plug-in. This line needs to be revisited once the SPIKE is completed for the Market Segment and Sales Skill  
 

 *  Mapping Source & Maintenance 

 *  Each Sales Skill record must have a mandatory Global Business mapping. 
 *  Mapping must be stored in a secure reference table editable only by admin roles. 
 

 *  Validation 

 *  If a user changes District on a One Customer account, it should not overwrite Global Business (derivation is driven solely by Sales Skill in this case). 
 *  On non-1C accounts, changing District continues to derive Global Business as today; Sales Skill is ignored for derivation. 
 

 *  UI & Security 

 *  For in-scope accounts, Global Business must be read-only to users (cannot be edited manually).

column8: Add One Customer (1C) Flag to District Table
column11:
As a CRM System/Operations Admin,
I want a One Customer (1C) flag field on the District table with proper defaulting, visibility rules, and updated views,
 
so that districts eligible for the One Customer initiative can be flagged, maintained consistently, and easily identified in lists.
column19: Moved out of state Pending Prod Release
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria :
 
 
 
 
 
 

 *  Field Creation & Form Behavior 

 *  Given I open an existing District record, when the record loads, then I see a new field on the General tab, Named Is Eligible for 1C? 
 *  Given I create a new District record, when the form first loads, then the Is Eligible for 1C is set as No by default. 
 *  Given I am a System Admin or Ops Admin Leads, when I edit the District form, then I can update the Is Eligible for 1C value. 
 *  Given I am any other user role, when I view the District form, then the Is Eligible for 1C is visible but read-only. 
 

 *  Default Value & Data Repair (Added to the master data user story) 

 *  Given the 1C flag field is created, when it is deployed, then the default value should be set to “No” for all records.  
 *  Given there are existing District records with null values, when the migration runs, then those values are backfilled to “No” to avoid nulls.  
 *  Given for the Districts which are truly 1C district, this 1C flag should be set as Yes  
 

 *  View Updates  

 *  Given I open the Active Districts view, when the view loads, then the 1C flag appears as the last column and is sortable & filterable.  
 *  Given I open the Inactive Districts view, when the view loads, then the 1C flag appears as the last column and is sortable & filterable.  
 *  Given I use Advanced Find or modern filters, when I query Districts, then the 1C flag is available as a filterable field. 
 

 

Business Requirements:

 *  Add a Is Eligible for 1C(Two-Option Yes/No) field to the District table. 
 *  Place the field under the General tab of the District form. 
 *  Ensure default value = No for all new District records. 
 *  Restrict edit permissions on the 1C flag to System Admin and Ops Admin roles. All other roles = read-only. 
 *  Update existing District records: set any null flag values to No. (Added to the master data user story)  
 *  Update the 1C districts to have a value of Yes in this 1C field. (Added to the master data user story) 
 

 
 
 
Developer Notes: 

 *  Field: ecl_iseligibleforonecustomer (display name: Eligible for One Customer) 

 *  Type: Two-Option (Yes/No) 
 *  Default: No 
 *  Display as Check box in the form 
 

 *  Form logic: 

 *  Defaulted as No 
 

 *  Security: 

 *  Editable by System Admin and Ops Admin Lead roles only. 
 *  Read-only for all other roles. 
 

 *  Data Repair:(Added to the master data user story)  

 *  Run migration job to set existing District records with null flag ? No.  
 *  Identify the true 1C district and Run migration job to set these District records with 1C flag ? Yes.

column7: 4. View and Global Search Enhancements for Base Customer Account (BCA) and Account Records
column11:
Business Objective
 
To ensure clear and consistent visibility of account ownership and line-of-business (Water vs. Hygiene) information under the One Customer model, while avoiding unnecessary disruption to existing user workflows. Enhancements will be applied only where they add value—specifically in subgrid views and global search—without altering the primary account list views used by the majority of users. This approach balances usability, clarity, and adoption, ensuring that One Customer accounts can be managed effectively while protecting continuity for the 80% of accounts that are not part of the model.
 

 
Business Requirements 

 *  Preserve existing account views: 

 *  The “My Accounts,” “My Team Accounts,” and “All Accounts” views must remain unchanged. 
 *  No new fields (e.g., Sales Skill or BCA lookup) should be added to these views to avoid confusion and retraining. 
 

 *  Enhance Base Customer Account (BCA) subgrid views: 

 *  All subgrid views on the BCA record must display the Sales Skill field so users can clearly distinguish between Water and Hygiene accounts. 
 

 *  Enhance Parent/Ultimate Parent Account subgrid views: 

 *  Subgrid views on Parent and Ultimate Parent Account records must include the Sales Skill field for all child accounts. 
 *  This ensures users can view line-of-business segmentation at higher account hierarchy levels. 
 

 *  Enable Global Search for BCA records: 

 *  BCA records must be searchable by BCA Account Number and Name. 
 *  Global search results for BCAs must display both Account Number and Name for clear identification. 
 

 *  Enhance Account Global Search results: 

 *  Search results for Accounts must include the Owner and Primary Owner fields to improve clarity of record responsibility. 
 *  The Owner and Primary Owner fields must be positioned at the end of the search results grid to preserve usability. 
 

 *  Consistency across account types: 

 *  Enhancements must apply equally to One Customer and non-One Customer accounts. 
 *  No duplicate or redundant views should be created; existing views must be extended where necessary. 
 

 

 
Technical Considerations 

 *  View Definitions: 

 *  Update BCA and Parent/Ultimate Parent Account subgrid definitions to include the Sales Skill field in a consistent column order. 
 *  Update Account global search result view to include Owner and Primary Owner fields, positioned at the end of the layout. 
 *  Add Account Number and Name fields to BCA global search result views. 
 

 *  Global Search Configuration: 

 *  Confirm the BCA table is indexed and enabled for global search. 
 *  Ensure search results respect CRM security roles (users see only permitted records). 
 

 *  Sorting and Filters: 

 *  Retain existing sort options (Account Name, Account Number). 
 *  Validate that adding new fields does not degrade query performance. 
 

 *  Regression Testing: 

 *  Confirm that “My Accounts,” “My Team Accounts,” and “All Accounts” views are unchanged. 
 *  Validate that global search results correctly display new fields. 
 *  Test BCA and Parent Account subgrids for proper Sales Skill visibility. 
 

 

 
Expected Deliverables  

 *  Updated BCA subgrid views with Sales Skill column. 
 *  Updated Parent/Ultimate Parent subgrid views with Sales Skill column. 
 *  BCA table enabled for Global Search, searchable by Account Number and Name. 
 *  Updated Account global search view with Owner and Primary Owner fields (added at the end). 
 *  Regression test results confirming: 

 *  No changes to “My Accounts,” “My Team Accounts,” or “All Accounts.” 
 *  Correct visibility and usability in subgrids. 
 *  Accurate and performant global search results.

column8: Update Global Search View for Accounts to Include Owner and Primary Owner

column7: 3. Establish a Connection Between Sales Skill Accounts and the BCA
column11:
Business Objective
 
Establish a formal relationship between Sales Skill Accounts and their corresponding Base Customer Account (BCA) in CRM to provide a unified, enterprise-level view of customer relationships. This will enable stakeholders to quickly understand the complete scope of the customer’s engagement across divisions, reduce navigation effort, and improve visibility of related records through a streamlined and intuitive user experience.

 
Business Requirements 

 *  Each Sales Skill Account in scope for the One Customer model must be associated with exactly one Base Customer Account in CRM. 
 *  The association must be clearly visible to users when viewing eligible account records, with placement and labeling that make the relationship immediately recognizable. 
 *  Users must be able to navigate directly from a Sales Skill Account to the linked BCA record in a single click, without searching manually. 
 *  The linked BCA must present an aggregated view of key customer information consolidated from all related Sales Skill Accounts, including divisional account details, associated sites, and relevant cross-division activities such as opportunities and service visits. 
 *  The BCA link must only be displayed for accounts participating in the One Customer model, ensuring that users working on legacy or standalone accounts are not presented with irrelevant or confusing information. 
 *  The determination of whether an account participates in the One Customer model must be driven by configurable business rules to allow future updates without major design changes. 
 *  The visual presentation of the BCA link and related content must maintain clarity and consistency across all eligible records, aligning with the existing CRM form design and minimizing disruption to established workflows. 
 

 

Technical Implementation: 

 *  A new lookup field will be added to the Account table, referencing the Base Customer Account entity. 
 *  Relationship Type: One-to-Many (BCA to many Sales Skill Accounts) 
 *  Display Control: Read-only lookup; visible only when applicable 
 *  Auditing: Enabled for tracking system-managed updates 
 *  Population: Set only through integration logic or system admin-controlled updates 
 *  Visibility logic is driven by the District field configuration: 

 *  A specific flag or classification will be added to the District master data to indicate that accounts under that district are part of the One Customer rollout. 
 *  If an account belongs to a district that is not flagged for One Customer, the Base Customer Account field will not appear to the user. 
 *  This logic ensures minimal disruption to users working on legacy or standalone accounts. 
 

 *  Field visibility and behavior on form load: 

 *  The Base Customer Account lookup field will not appear immediately when a new account form is opened. 
 *  It will only become visible after the account record is saved and the District value has been populated. 
 *  This ensures that the visibility logic respects the One Customer flag and avoids confusion during account creation. 
 

 

 
Field Visibility Logic Configuration: 

 *  Use business rules or JavaScript on form load to: 

 *  Evaluate the selected District 
 *  Check if the district is flagged as participating in One Customer 
 *  Show or hide the Base Customer Account field accordingly 
 

 *  Hide field during initial creation; show it only after save when District is known 
 

 
Security and Data Governance: 

 *  The field will be read-only for all business users 
 *  Field updates will be system-managed through integration or batch jobs 
 *  Users will not be able to manually select or change the BCA relationship 
 

 
Deliverables: 

 *  New BCA Lookup field on the Account form 
 *  District master data flag to drive One Customer visibility 
 *  Form load logic to handle field display based on saved District 
 *  Security role configuration to ensure field is read-only and audited 
 *  Click-through functionality for quick navigation to the linked BCA 
 *  Functional documentation for business users and development handover (including form behavior matrix)

column8: Enable Prospect Account Creation from BCA Associated Accounts Subgrid
column11:
As a CRM user,
I want to create a new prospect or account directly from the Associated Accounts subgrid on a Base Customer Account (BCA),
 
so that the new record is automatically linked to the BCA with required fields pre-populated and locked, ensuring consistent and accurate customer setup without manual linking or data entry errors.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Account Creation from Subgrid 

 *  Given I am an authorized CRM user, when I click “+ New” in the Associated Accounts subgrid, then a standard Account creation form opens. 
 *  Given I create a new account from this subgrid, then the BCA field is automatically set to the current BCA and locked. 
 *  Given I create a new account from this subgrid, then the following fields are auto-populated and locked: 

 *  Account Name (auto-populated from BCA, locked) 
 *  Account Number (auto-populated from BCA, locked) 
 *  District (auto-populated from BCA ,locked) 
 *  Owner (auto-populated from BCA, locked) 
 *  Account Type (set to Prospect, locked) 
 

 *  Given I open the creation form, then I cannot change or override any of these locked fields. 
 

 *  Standard CRM Behavior 

 *  Given I create a new prospect, then the record is created using the out-of-the-box Main Account form (no custom popup). 
 *  Given the new prospect is created, then it is automatically displayed in the Associated Accounts subgrid for that BCA. 
 

 

Business Requirements: 

 *  Users must be able to create new Prospects/Accounts directly from the Associated Accounts subgrid on a BCA record. 
 *  When creating from this subgrid, the new account must be auto-linked to the current BCA. 
 *  Certain fields must be auto-populated and locked to ensure data integrity. 
 *  Creation must follow standard CRM create form behavior (no custom popups). 
 *  Only users with appropriate CRM create privileges should see this option. 
 

Developer Notes: 
 

 *  Enable + New button on subgrid. 
 *  Auto-populate and lock fields via form field properties / Power Automate / lightweight logic (no heavy customization). 
 *  Ensure BCA lookup = current BCA is defaulted and locked. 
 *  Disable “Add Existing Account” button to enforce controlled creation flow. 
 *  Account Type = Prospect (default and locked). 
 *  Security: Option visible only for users with Account create rights.

column8: Demo Feedback: Rename Approval Comments Field to Approval / Rejection Comments on Account Approval Tab
column11:
As a user managing approvals on an account,
 
I need the Approval Comments field label updated to Approval / Rejection Comments,
 
So that it clearly communicates that comments can be provided both for approvals and rejections, reducing ambiguity for end-users.
 

 
Background & Rationale:
 

 *  Current functionality: When a user selects Work By on the account screen, two fields appear — Approval Status (Approved / Rejected) and Approval Comments. 
 *  Issue: The label Approval Comments implies that the field is only relevant for approvals, but it is also used when an approval is rejected. 
 *  Change required: Rename the field label to Approval / Rejection Comments (or simply Comments if business prefers a shorter label). 
 *  This is a minor UI label update, no change to data structure, logic, or validation required. 
 

 

Business Requirements: 

 *  Update the label for the Approval Comments field to read Approval / Rejection Comments. 
 *  Ensure that the field continues to appear only when Work By is selected. 
 *  Preserve all existing functionality: field visibility logic, data entry, and saved data remain unchanged. 
 *  Backward compatibility: existing records must display previously entered comments without loss or modification.
column19: Moved out of state Pending Prod Release
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 
 
 

 *  Scenario 1 – Approval Status Selected as Approved or Rejected 

 *  Given I select Work By on the account, 
 *  When the Approval Status field is set to Approved or Rejected  
 *  Then the comments field must be displayed with the label Approval / Rejection Comments (instead of Approval Comments). 
 *  When i choose approved or reject status, the changes should reflect on save of the record. 
 

 *  Scenario 2 – Approval Status Selected as Rejected  

 *  Given I select Work By on the account,  
 *  When the Approval Status field is set to Rejected,  
 *  Then the comments field must be displayed with the label Approval / Rejection Comments.  
 

 *  Scenario 3 – Backward Compatibility  

 *  Given existing records already contain values in the Approval Comments field,  
 *  When those records are opened,  
 *  Then the field label must show as Approval / Rejection Comments while preserving all existing comments.

column8: Auto-Populate and Lock SalesOrg on Account Form When Only One SalesOrg Exists for Selected District
column11:
As a sales user creating or editing an account,
I need the SalesOrg field to automatically populate and lock when there is only one SalesOrg tied to the selected District,
 
So that I don’t have to make an unnecessary selection and the account creation process becomes faster and less error-prone.
 

 
Background & Rationale:
 

 *  Currently, when creating an account, users first select a District. 
 *  SalesOrg values are filtered dynamically based on the selected District (via the Custom Intersect entity N:N relationship between District and SalesOrg). 
 *  Even when only a single SalesOrg exists for the selected District, users are still required to manually select it from the drop-down, adding redundant effort. 
 *  Business feedback from sprint demo: improve usability by automatically setting the SalesOrg field when only one option exists and prevent users from accidentally changing it. 
 *  For Districts tied to multiple SalesOrgs, the drop-down remains editable and behaves as it does today.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:

 *  Scenario 1 – Single SalesOrg Available 

 *  Given I am on the account creation form and select a District that has exactly one SalesOrg tied to it, 
 *  When the SalesOrg field is populated, 
 *  Then that single SalesOrg value must be automatically set and the field must be locked for editing. 
 

 *  
 
 *  Scenario 2 – Multiple SalesOrgs Available 

 *  Given I am on the account creation form and select a District that has multiple SalesOrgs tied to it, 
 *  When the SalesOrg drop-down is displayed, 
 *  Then all valid SalesOrgs must be available for selection and the field must remain editable. 
 

 *  Scenario 3 – Change of District 

 *  Given I initially select a District (auto-setting SalesOrg if only one exists), 
 *  When I change the District to another one, 
 *  Then the SalesOrg field must refresh to reflect the new District’s linked SalesOrgs (auto-populating and locking if only one exists, or remaining editable if multiple exist). 
 

 *  Scenario 4 – Backward Compatibility 

 *  Given I am editing an existing account record, 
 *  When the account already has a SalesOrg value stored, 
 *  Then the system must display the stored value and only enforce the auto-populate-and-lock logic if the District field is changed.

column8: Add Base Customer Account (BCA) Field  to Existing Account Records
column11:
As a CRM user,
 
 
I want existing account records to contain a Base Customer Account (BCA) lookup and a Lead Division Flag (Yes/No),
 
so that accounts can be associated with the correct BCA, and integrations can manage the lead division logic consistently across all accounts.
column19: Moved out of state Pending Prod Release
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 
 
 
 
 
 

 *  Field Visibility & District Dependency 

 *  Given an existing account record belongs to a District where the 1C flag = Yes, when I open the record, then the BCA lookup is displayed. 
 *  Given an existing account record does not belong to a District where the 1C flag = No, when I open the record, then the BCA lookup and Lead Division flag field is hidden.  
 *  Given an existing account record belongs/does not belong to a District where the 1C flag = Yes/No, when I open the record, then the new ERP Account Status field should be visible.
 

 *  ERP Account Status is a Global Option Set with the following values 

 *  Prospect 
 *  Active 
 *  Inactive 
 

 *  The Existing ERP Account status field (that has Blank, Active and Inactive values) should be hidden. As part of deploying this user story to production, this old field should be deleted from CRM 
 

 

 *  BCA Lookup Behavior 

 *  Given an account is linked to a BCA with ERP status = Prospect/Customer, then the BCA lookup is locked for editing. 
 *  Given an Account is created using the Add Sales Skill Button, the BCA on the new Sales Skill account record is locked for editing 
 

 *  Lead Division Flag Behavior  

 *  Given an existing 1C account record exists, when the form loads, then the Lead Division Flag is always visible and read-only (never editable by users).  
 

 *  Form Placement 

 *  Given I open an eligible account record, when the form loads, then the BCA lookup appears in : 

 *  The Account Information section, placed before the Corporate Account field. 
 *  The Corporate Manager fields remain hidden for Nalco Water 1C accounts only (District on the Account has the 1C flag). 
 

 

 

Business Requirements:

 *  Add BCA Lookup (field type: Lookup ? Base Customer Account). 
 *  Add Lead Division Flag (Two-Option Yes/No; default = No).  
 *  Ensure visibility logic: fields appear only for accounts in Districts where 1C flag = Yes. 
 *  Ensure BCA lookup behavior: 

 *  Auto-populate & lock when created under a BCA. 
 *  Editable only when Account Type = Prospect. 
 *  Lock once Account Type = Customer. 
 *  Updated by integrations as needed. 
 

 *  Ensure Lead Division Flag behavior:  

 *  Always visible when 1C = Yes.  
 *  Default to No.  
 *  Updated only by integrations.  
 *  Always read-only for users.  
 

 *  Place BCA lookup either in the header or Account Information section (before Corporate Account) — final placement to be confirmed. 
 *  Place Lead Division Flag on the Admin tab, locked by default. 
 


 
 
 
 
Developer Notes: 

 *  Fields to Create: 

 *  ecl_basecustomeraccountid (Lookup to Base Customer Account) 
 *  ecl_leaddivisionflag (Two-Option Yes/No; Default = No)  
 

 *  Form Logic: 

 *  Add a new One Customer section on relevant account forms. 
 *  Conditional visibility based on District’s 1C flag. 
 *  BCA Lookup: 

 *  Auto-inherit BCA ID when created from a BCA. 
 *  Editable only if Account Type = Prospect.  
 *  ALways locked once Account Type = Customer.  
 *  Lock/unlock controlled by form scripts or business rules. 
 

 *  Lead Division Flag:  

 *  Always read-only.  
 *  Updated by integration layer only.  
 

 

 *  Integration Behavior: 

 *  BCA Lookup populated/maintained by integration when available. 
 *  Lead Division Flag set via integration (Yes/No).  
 

 *  Placement Options: 

 *  BCA Lookup: 

 *  Option 1: Form Header (alongside Owner/Status). 
 *  Option 2: Account Information section (before Corporate Account field). 
 

 *  Lead Division Flag: Admin tab ? locked.  
 

 *  Testing Considerations: 

 *  Validate conditional visibility (1C = Yes vs. No). 
 *  Validate BCA inheritance when creating from BCA. 
 *  Validate Prospect vs. Customer lock/unlock behavior. 
 *  Validate integration updates for both fields. 
 *  Confirm view/filter availability if needed.

column7: 2. Present Consolidated Customer Details in the BCA Record
column11:
Business Objective 
The Base Customer Account (BCA) will provide a single, consolidated, read-only view of the enterprise customer relationship, rolling up key information from all associated divisional sales skill accounts (e.g., Water and Hygiene).
 
This “single pane of glass” will allow sales, service, and support teams to quickly see the complete customer picture without navigating across multiple accounts, improving efficiency, transparency, and decision-making.
 
The BCA will serve as the visibility layer — not a data entry point — ensuring customer information remains accurate by maintaining edits only at the individual sales skill account level.
 

 
Business Requirements 

 *  Read-Only Record 

 *  The BCA form will be read-only for all users. 
 *  Users cannot manually create, edit, or delete a BCA record. 
 *  BCAs will be created automatically via ERP/MDM integration. 
 

 *  Aggregated Customer Insights 

 *  Display high-level customer details: account name, account number (ERP source), parent account (if applicable), and assigned team members (CAM, District Manager, BDM, etc.). 
 *  Show linked Sales Skill Accounts for all divisions, grouped in a dedicated subgrid. 
 *  Roll up key records from all linked sales skill accounts into the BCA: 

 *  Opportunities 
 *  Contacts 
 *  Service Visits 
 *  Program/initiative records such as TVD, TSRs, etc. 
 

 *  Group related data into logical form tabs (e.g., Customer Overview, Opportunities, Contacts, Service). 
 *  In all the aggregated views display Sales Skill field to enable users to clearly identify which record in the sub-grid belongs to which sales skill 
 *  The final list of tabs and subgrids will be confirmed during design/user story creation. 
 

 *  Navigation & Visibility 

 *  While the BCA form itself is read-only, subgrid entries should allow click-through navigation to the source record for details or editing. 
 *  Maintain consistent visibility rules based on CRM security roles and account assignments. 
 

 *  Search & Quick Access 

 *  Enable global search on the BCA entity to allow quick lookups by account name or account number from anywhere in CRM. 
 *  Ensure search results link directly to the BCA form. 
 

 *  Data Ownership & Updates 

 *  All updates to customer-specific metadata, addresses, and contacts will continue to happen on individual sales skill accounts; the BCA will reflect these changes automatically through roll-up logic. 
 

 

 

Technical Considerations: 

 *  BCA and Sales Skill Accounts will have a direct lookup relationship. 
 *  However, downstream records (e.g., opportunities, service plans, activities) are not directly linked to BCA in CRM schema — they are linked to Sales Skill Accounts only. 
 *  Therefore, we require a technical spike to evaluate the best method for displaying these downstream records in a read-only grid on the BCA form: 
 *  Determine if aggregated subgrids or PCF controls can query related records using the BCA–Sales Skill link 
 *  Avoid creating complex referential relationships unless technically justified 
 *  Consider performance implications and user experience 
 *  Ensure the BCA entity is enabled for Relevance Search. 
 *  Configure the Quick Find View to include key searchable fields such as: 

 *  BCA Name 
 *  BCA Number 
 *  Legacy Account Number (if applicable) 
 

 *  
Customize the search result card layout to display meaningful metadata (e.g., name, number, status, business unit). 
 
 *  Search returns results based on name, number, and other configured fields. 
 *  Result card displays essential customer attributes in CRM global search pane. 
 

 
Spike deliverable should include:
 

 *  Prototype of read-only aggregated grid view 
 *  Performance test results for BCA load/render time 
 *  Decision matrix for PCF vs. subgrid vs. custom control 
 

 
Governance and Access Rules: 

 *  Users will not be able to create a BCA directly in CRM. 
 *  BCA should only be created via system integration with MDM and ERP (EBS). 
 *  Sitemap and navigation access to BCA will be restricted by role-based security. 
 

 
Expected Deliverables: 

 *  Finalized BCA form layout with defined tabs and sections 
 *  Aggregated grids implemented based on spike outcome 
 *  All tabs and data presented in a read-only manner 
 *  Technical spike output documented and reviewed 
 *  Role-based sitemap visibility applied 
 *  Error handling for missing/mismatched child records in aggregated views 
 *  Global search for BCA records enabled and tested.

column8: Update BCA Account Subgrid view to Display Approval Status and ERP Account Status
column11:
As a CRM user,
I want the BCA form’s account subgrid view  to display Approval Status and ERP Account Status for every linked sales-skill account,
 
so that I can clearly identify which sales-skill records are pending approval, approved, rejected, or still in prospect state, and understand their current ERP lifecycle status without opening each account individually.
 

 
This visibility is critical for scenarios where:
 

 *  New sales-skill accounts are created under an existing customer but remain pending approval until MDM processing is initiated. 
 *  ERP Account Status remains Prospect until IF10/IF17 updates are processed, even when the account type may be “Customer.” 
 *  Business users need to quickly verify readiness for CLM onboarding or customer setup. 
 

 
The subgrid should therefore present these two fields in a consistent and easily readable format directly within the BCA.

column8: Technical Spike: Evaluate PCF Controls for Advanced Aggregated Views
column11:
As a CRM solution team, we want to evaluate whether a PCF (PowerApps Component Framework) control can be used to provide aggregated views that display grandparent-level records (beyond the limits of FetchXML subgrids), so that we can achieve a consistent user experience across Base Customer Accounts (BCA) without introducing unsupported workarounds.

 
This spike will explore the feasibility, limitations, and design considerations of leveraging PCF controls for this purpose.
 

 
Scope of Investigation

 *  Current limitation: FetchXML-based subgrids cannot natively retrieve grandparent-level relationships. 
 *  Evaluate potential PCF approaches for: 

 *  Displaying aggregated views with the same look and feel as native subgrids. 
 *  Supporting filtering and sorting logic consistent with standard CRM views. 
 *  Handling large data volumes and performance considerations. 
 

 *  Identify whether any existing open-source or reusable PCF controls meet the requirement, or whether a custom control would need to be built. 
 *  Determine if this approach can fit into future releases where aggregated views are needed.
column22:
*  Approach Exploration 

 *  At least two approaches are evaluated (e.g., reusable community PCF, custom-built PCF). 
 *  Document pros/cons of each approach, including performance, maintainability, and user experience impact. 
 

 *  Feasibility Assessment 

 *  Confirm whether PCF can retrieve and display grandparent-level records. 
 *  Assess feasibility of supporting sorting, filtering, and paging. 
 *  Investigate whether Custom Web API calls can be combined with PCF for data retrieval.
 
 *  Identify technical blockers, if any. 
 

 *  Deliverables 

 *  Findings document summarizing evaluation. 
 *  Recommended approach (proceed with PCF / alternative approach). 
 *  Prototype or proof-of-concept (if feasible within spike timeframe). 
 *  List of risks, limitations, and open questions.

column8: Technical Spike: Evaluate Options for Displaying Related Records on BCA (FetchXML Filtering vs. PCF Control)
column11: As a Solution Lead/Technical Architect, I need to evaluate whether standard CRM subgrid controls with FetchXML filtering can meet the requirement to display related records (Opportunities, Contacts, Cases, etc.) at the Base Customer Account (BCA) level, or if a reusable PCF dataset control is required, so that I can determine the most feasible, maintainable, and scalable solution for the One Customer (1C) project.
column19: Moved out of state Pending PO Review
column22:
Overview:
We need to determine the best approach to display related records (e.g., Opportunities, Contacts, Cases) at the Base Customer Account (BCA) level without introducing direct relationships or schema changes (e.g., no additional BCA lookups). Two main paths exist: 

 *  Standard subgrid with custom FetchXML filtering 
 *  Reusable PCF dataset control that accepts configurable FetchXML/layout templates. 
 

 
The spike should evaluate feasibility, limitations, and effort for both approaches in a neutral, fact-based way, and recommend a proposed direction. 

 
Scope of Investigation 

 *  Standard Subgrid + FetchXML approach 

 *  Validate if setFilterXml or setFetchXml can inject link-entity joins (Account ? Opportunity, Account ? Contact, etc.) to filter by current BCA ID. 
 *  Identify if this approach allows returning extra columns from linked entities (e.g., Sales Skill Name from Account). 
 *  Confirm event options: when and how to run (onFormLoad, onTabStateChange, onViewChange). 
 *  Document known limitations (e.g., setFilterXml cannot include link-entity joins; only extra conditions on the target entity). 
 *  Estimate maintenance impact across ~10+ tabs. 
 

 *  Reusable PCF dataset control 

 *  Explore feasibility of building one PCF control that accepts as inputs: 

 *  targetEntity (e.g., opportunity, contact, case). 
 *  fetchTemplate with placeholders like {{BCAID}}. 
 *  layoutXml (columns to display). 
 

 *  Confirm PCF can: 

 *  Run custom FetchXML with joins. 
 *  Render grids with sorting, paging, click-through to record. 
 *  Support multiple configurable views per tab. 
 

 *  Assess reusability: one build vs. 10+ instances configured differently. 
 *  Estimate build/maintenance effort vs. subgrid customization. 
 

 

 
Deliverables 

 *  Document findings for both approaches: 

 *  Pros/Cons (technical feasibility, effort, performance, reusability, maintainability). 
 *  Limitations clearly spelled out (e.g., subgrid filtering cannot add columns from joins; PCF requires dev effort but is reusable). 
 

 *  Provide examples: 

 *  Simple FetchXML attempt with standard subgrid (include link-entity if possible). 
 *  Sample PCF config (inputs, fetchTemplate, layoutXml). 
 

 *  Recommendation of the approach best aligned with project timelines and scope. 
 *  Updated estimation (effort, risk, and maintainability).

column8: Standardize Team Members Tab for 1C District Accounts (Water & Hygiene)
column11:
As a CRM user,
I need a consistent Team Members tab experience across both Water and Hygiene accounts flagged as 1C,
 
so that I see the same roles (e.g., Account Manager, District Manager, AVP, CAM, etc.) and the same validation logic, regardless of whether I am viewing a Water or Hygiene account.
 

 
Current State: 

 *  Nalco Water Accounts (ERP System = NLC_SAP): 

 *  Team Members tab shows limited roles (Account Manager, District Manager, AVP, GAM, Account Team Members subgrid). 
 *  CAM fields are not surfaced. 
 

 *  Food & Beverage / Hygiene Accounts (ERP System = ECL_EBS): 

 *  Team Members tab shows full roles: Account Manager, Associate AM/Technician, District Manager, Sales Manager, BDM, AVP, Local CAM, F&B GAM, Associate District Manager, Account Team Members subgrid. 
 *  CAM validation logic already exists: 

 *  If Parent Account (H5) exists ? populate CAM from H5 and lock field. 
 *  If Parent Account (H5) is blank ? show CAM as editable. 
 

 

 

Future State: 
 

 *  For all 1C District Accounts (both Nalco Water and Hygiene), 

 *  The Hygiene Team Members layout and CAM validation logic must apply consistently. 
 *  Non-1C districts continue current behavior with no changes.
column19: Moved out of state Pending Prod Release
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 
 

 *  Given I am a CRM user viewing a 1C Nalco Water account, 

 *  When I open the Team Members tab, 
 *  Then I see the same Team Members fields and sections as on a Hygiene account (Account Manager, Associate AM/Technician, District Manager, Sales Manager, BDM, AVP, Local CAM, CAM, F&B GAM, Associate DM). 
 

 *  Given I am viewing a 1C account/Prospect (Water or Hygiene), 

 *  When the Parent Account (H5) field is populated, 
 *  Then the CAM value is auto-populated from the parent (H5) account and the CAM field is locked for editing. 
 

 *  Given I am viewing a 1C Prospect account (Water or Hygiene), 

 *  When the Parent Account (H5) field is blank, 
 *  Then the CAM field is visible and editable for the user. 
 

 

 *  Given I am viewing a non-1C Nalco Water account, 

 *  Then the current limited Team Members tab layout remains unchanged (no CAM). 
 

 

 
Business Requirements:

 *  All 1C district accounts (both Water and Hygiene) must share the Hygiene Team Members layout. 
 *  CAM logic must be standardized: 

 *  Parent account exists ? CAM inherited and locked. 
 *  Parent account missing on a Prospect Account ? CAM editable. 
 

 *  Ensure backwards compatibility: 

 *  Non-1C Water accounts continue using the current limited view. 
 

 *  Users must be able to see Account Team Members subgrid in all cases. 
 


 
 
Developer Notes:

 *  Form Configuration: 
 *  Reuse Hygiene Team Members form configuration and apply it to Water accounts when District.OneCustomerFlag = Yes. 
 *  Conditional rendering logic to determine layout: 

 *  If OneCustomer = Yes ? use Hygiene layout. 
 *  If OneCustomer = No ? retain current Water layout. 
 

 *  Field Logic: 

 *  CAM field population logic: 
 *  On load and on save, if Parent Account (H5) exists ? fetch CAM from H5, lock field. 
 *  If Parent Account blank ? enable CAM field for manual entry. 
 

 *  Extend existing CAM population plugin/JavaScript to also handle Water accounts under 1C. 
 *  Security: 

 *  Field-level security unchanged. All roles with access today continue to access these fields when visible. 
 

 *  Data Integrity: 

 *  Ensure existing Water accounts converted to 1C districts post-cutover automatically inherit correct CAM values from Parent Account. 
 *  Run migration scripts to backfill CAM where Parent Account exists. 
 

 *  Regression Testing: 

 *  Validate across scenarios: 

 *  1C Hygiene account (unchanged behavior). 
 *  1C Water account (new Hygiene-like behavior). 
 *  Non-1C Water account (unchanged current behavior).

column8: Add TVD tab on BCA Forms aggregated from related Accounts
column11:
As a CRM user,
I want a dedicated “TVD Programs” tab on the Base Customer Account (BCA) form containing Pipeline, In Process, Completed, and Value-Added Services sections,
 
So that I can view all TVD programs and value-added services aggregated from accounts linked to the BCA in one place.
column19: Moved out of state Pending Prod Release
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Pipeline Section 

 *  Given I am a CRM user on a BCA record, 
 *  When I navigate to the TVD Programs tab and open the Pipeline section, 
 *  Then I see all TVD records linked to accounts under this BCA where: 

 *  Status = Active 
 *  Stage Category = Approved or Identified 
 

 *  I should see a Sales Skill Column in the view that should help me clearly identify which TVD program belongs to which Sales Skill 
 *  Sorted by Program Title. 
 

 *  In Process Section 

 *  Given I am a CRM user on a BCA record, 
 *  When I navigate to the TVD Programs tab and open the In Process section, 
 *  Then I see all TVD records linked to accounts under this BCA where: 

 *  Status = Active 
 *  Stage Category = In Process 
 

 *  I should see a Sales Skill Column in the view that should help me clearly identify which TVD program belongs to which Sales Skill
 
 *  Sorted by Program Title. 
 

 *  Completed Section 

 *  Given I am a CRM user on a BCA record, 
 *  When I navigate to the TVD Programs tab and open the Completed section, 
 *  Then I see all TVD records linked to accounts under this BCA where: 

 *  Status = Active 
 *  Active Stage = “4. Implemented” or “5. Final Sign-Off” 
 

 *  I should see a Sales Skill Column in the view that should help me clearly identify which TVD program belongs to which Sales Skill
 
 *  Sorted by Program Title. 
 

 *  Value-Added Services Section 

 *  Given I am a CRM user on a BCA record, 

 *  When I navigate to the TVD Programs tab and open the Value-Added Services section, 
 *  Then I see by default all Active Value-Added Services linked to accounts under this BCA, sorted by Service Name. 
 

 *  Given I am a CRM user on a BCA record, 

 *  When I switch views in the Value-Added Services section, 
 *  Then I can see Inactive Value-Added Services linked to accounts under this BCA. 
 

 *  I should see a Sales Skill Column in the view that should help me clearly identify which Value Added Service belongs to which Sales Skill
 
 

 *  Security & Permissions 

 *  Given I am a CRM user with access to accounts and TVD programs, 
 *  When I view the TVD Programs tab, 
 *  Then I only see TVD programs and services according to CRM record-level security permissions. 
 

 

 *  Restrict Adding New TVD  from the BCA Subgrids 

 *  Given I am a district manager CRM USER viewing a BCA, 

 *  When I try to add a new TVD  from the BCA screen TVD Tab /Subgrid, 
 *  Then I should not have the option to create a new TVD  . 
 

 *  Given I want to create a new TVD  , 

 *  When I go into an existing customer account record, 
 *  Then I should be able to create and save the new TVD  from there, following the current process. 
 

 

 

 

 

 

Business Requirements

 *  A new “TVD Programs” tab must be added to the BCA form. 
 *  The tab must include four sections: Pipeline, In Process, Completed, and Value-Added Services. 
 *  Each section must display TVD programs or services aggregated from accounts associated with the BCA. 
 *  Each section must use CRM standard subgrid controls; no custom pop-ups or scripts are required. 
 *  Views must display only the relevant TVD programs based on defined filter conditions (status and stage). 
 *  Value-Added Services must include a view selector, defaulting to Active services, with an option to switch to Inactive services. 
 *  All displayed records must be automatically linked to accounts under the current BCA. 
 *  Sorting must default to Program Title (for TVD programs) and Service Name (for value-added services). 
 *  Security must align with CRM role-based access and record-level permissions. 
 *  Subgrid views must display the required columns as defined in developer notes. 
 *  The BCA must provide a read-only aggregated view of TVD  linked to associated customer accounts. 
 *  The “New TVD  ” option must be removed/hidden from the BCA interface. 
 *  Users must only be able to create TVD  under existing customer account records (not BCAs). 
 *  Existing TVD  creation flows under customer accounts remain unchanged. 
 *  Ensure that TVD  associations continue to sync correctly with Existing Customer Accounts and BCAs, but creation is restricted. 
 

Developer Notes: 
 
 
 

 *  General Setup 

 *  Add a new “TVD Programs” tab to the BCA form. 
 *  Create four Sections under this tab: Pipeline, In Process, Completed, Value-Added Services. 
 *  Each section has a subgrid that uses direct relationships between Accounts (linked to BCA) ? TVD Programs / Value-Added Services. 
 

 *  Filters / Conditions 

 *  Pipeline: Status = Active, Stage Category = Approved OR Identified. 
 *  In Process: Status = Active, Stage Category = In Process. 
 *  Completed: Status = Active, Active Stage = “4. Implemented” OR “5. Final Sign-Off.” 
 *  Value-Added Services: 

 *  Default view = Active Value-Added Services. 
 *  Alternative view = Inactive Value-Added Services. 
 

 

 *  Columns  

 *  1C- TVD Programs Pipeline View: 

 *  Program Title 
 *  Stage Category 
 *  Sales Skill 
 *  Total Annual Savings 
 *  Total Annual Savings (Mgmt Rate) 
 *  Expense Investment 
 *  Capital Investment 
 *  Customer Fiscal Yr Begins Date 
 *  Program Identified Date 
 *  Customer Approved Date 
 *  Actual Start Date 
 *  Actual Implementation Date 
 *  Customer Sign Off Date 
 *  Primary Owner 
 *  Responsible Rep 
 *  AVP 
 *  District Manager 
 *  CAM (Account) (Account) 
 

 *  1C- TVD Programs In Process View: 

 *  Program Title 
 *  Stage Category 
 *  Sales Skill 
 *  Total Annual Savings 
 *  Total Annual Savings (Mgmt Rate) 
 *  Expense Investment 
 *  Capital Investment 
 *  Customer Fiscal Yr Begins Date 
 *  Program Identified Date 
 *  Customer Approved Date 
 *  Actual Start Date 
 *  Actual Implementation Date 
 *  Customer Sign Off Date 
 *  Primary Owner 
 *  Responsible Rep 
 

 *  1C- TVD Programs Completed View: 

 *  Program Title 
 *  Stage Category 
 *  Sales Skill 
 *  Total Annual Savings 
 *  Total Annual Savings (Mgmt Rate) 
 *  Expense Investment 
 *  Capital Investment 
 *  Customer Fiscal Yr Begins Date 
 *  Program Identified Date 
 *  Customer Approved Date 
 *  Actual Start Date 
 *  Actual Implementation Date 
 *  Customer Sign Off Date 
 *  Primary Owner 
 *  Responsible Rep 
 

 *  1C- Value-Added Services Views (Active and Inactive): 

 *  Name 
 *  Value Added Service Type 
 *  Sales Skill 
 *  Created On Date 
 *  Implemented Date 
 *  Total Value(Local) 
 *  Total Value (Base) 
 *  Responsible Rep 
 *  Primary Owner (Account) (Account) 
 *  Summary 
 *  Account Name (Account) (Account) 
 *  Account Number (Account) (Account) 
 *  Owner 
 *  Global Region (Account) (Account) 
 *  Country (Account) (Account) 
 

 

 

 

 *  Sorting Behavior 

 *  Pipeline, In Process, Completed ? Sorted ascending by Program Title. 
 *  Value-Added Services ? Sorted ascending by Service Name. 
 

 *  Security 

 *  Subgrid records respect CRM role-based security. 
 *  Users only see TVD programs and services they are authorized to view.
