Scenario 1: TVD programs tab in BCA form 

 
1.Login into CRM as FBU AM/DM/Ops Admin 
2.Open the BCA entity from the sitemap
3.Validate a new "TVD Programs tab" should be added to the Base Customer Account (BCA) form and that displays all related TVD programs from linked Accounts sharing the same BCA number 
4.Validate the tab contains following sections as mentioned below
 
                     Pipeline Section
                     In Process Section
                     Completed Section
                     Value-Added Services Section

 
Scenario 2A: Pipeline Section 

 
1.Login into CRM as FBU AM/DM/Ops Admin 
2.Open the BCA entity from the sitemap 
3.Navigate to TVD Programs tab 
4.Validate the sub grid shows all Active TVD records related to any Active Account linked to the current BCA. 
 
5.Verify the TVD Program Stage Category = Approved or Identified
6.Validate that Sales Skill column added in the column view 
7.Validate TVD programs can be sorted by Program Title. 

 

Scenario 2B: In Process Section 

 
1.Login into CRM as FBU AM/DM/Ops Admin 
2.Open the BCA entity from the sitemap 
3.Navigate to TVD Programs tab 
4.Validate the sub grid shows all Active TVD records related to any Active Account linked to the current BCA.
 
5.Verify the TVD Program Stage Category = In Process 
6.Validate that Sales Skill column added in the column view
 
7.Validate TVD programs can be sorted by Program Title. 


 
Scenario 2C: Completed Section 

 
1.Login into CRM as FBU AM/DM/Ops Admin 
2.Open the BCA entity from the sitemap 
3.Navigate to TVD Programs tab 
4.Validate the sub grid shows all Active TVD records related to any Active Account linked to the current BCA. 
5.Verify the TVD Program Stage Category = “Implemented” or "Final Sign-Off”
 
6.Validate that Sales Skill column added in the column view
 
7.Validate TVD programs can be sorted by Program Title. 

 
Scenario 2D: Value-Added Services Section 

 
1.Login into CRM as FBU AM/DM/Ops Admin 
2.Open the BCA entity from the sitemap 
3.Navigate to TVD Programs tab 
4.Validate the default view is Active Value-Added Services and all Active Value-Added Services linked to accounts under this BCA 
5.Validate by switching to the Inactive Value-Added Services view and all Inactive Value-Added Services linked to accounts under this BCA. 
6.Validate the service can be sorted by service names 
 
7.Validate that Sales Skill column added in the column view.

Scenario 3: Security 

1.Validate only users with permission to view TVD Programs linked Sales Skill Accounts will see records in these sub grids 
2.Validate ability to open or interact with TVD records follows standard CRM security model (Existing functionality)

 
 

Scenario 4: Restrict Adding New TVD from the BCA Sub grids 

1.Validate none of the business roles should not allow to create a new TVD in the BCA form 
2.Validate if user wants to create a new TVD, then user should go into an existing customer account record and create an TVD 
3.Validate user should be able to create and save the new TVD from the existing customer account following the current process 
4.Validate the created TVD record should show under the BCA's TVD Program tab

column8: Add RTW /Lost Business tab aggregated from related Accounts
column11:
As a CRM user,
 
I want a dedicated “RTW /Lost Business” tab on the Base Customer Account (BCA) form,
 
So that I can view all RTW /Lost Business aggregated from accounts linked to the BCA in one place.
column14: CodeReviewed; FBU_QAPush_Nov_Major1; ProdPush_Nov_FBU_R1; ReadyforDemo; validated in QA; validated in Test
column19: Moved out of state Pending Prod Release
column22:
*  Tab & Section Setup 

 *  A new tab named “RTW /Lost Business” is added to the BCA form. 
 *  The tab contains two sections: 

 *  Active Retain to Win  
 *  Lost Business 
 

 

 *  Active Retain to Win Section 

 *  The subgrid shows all Active Retain to Win records related to any Active Account linked to the current BCA. 
 *  The default view for this subgrid is “1C- Active Retain to Win ”. 
 *  The view selector in this section allows the user to select between: 

 *  1C- Active Retain to Win (Default view) 
 *  1C- Inactive Retain to Win  
 *  1C- All Retain to Win 
 

 *  Each of these views keeps its current column set exactly as it is today, with one change: 

 *  Add the Sales Skill field immediately after the Account Number column. 
 

 *  The Views should be sorted based on the Name field in ascending order 
 

 

 *  Lost Business Section 

 *  The subgrid shows all Lost Business records related to any Active Account linked to the current BCA. 
 *  The default view for this subgrid is “1C- Lost Business”. 
 *  Add the Sales Skill field immediately after the Account Name column. 
 

 *  Column Set for 1C- Active Retain to Win View 

 *  The view columns (existing order, with Sales Skill added after Account Number) are: 

 *  Name 
 *  Risk Status 
 *  Account 
 *  Account Number (Account) (Account)  
 *  Sales Skill 
 *  At Risk Amount (Base) 
 *  At Risk Amount (Local) 
 *  At Risk Date 
 *  At Risk Description 
 *  Primary Competitor 
 *  Risk Type 
 *  Country (Account) (Account) 
 *  Owner 
 *  Primary Owner 
 *  District Manager 
 *  CAM (Account) (Account) 
 *  Local CAM (Account) (Account) 
 *  AVP 
 

 

 

 *  Column Set for 1C- Inactive Retain to Win View 

 *  The view columns (existing order, with Sales Skill added after Account Number) are: 

 *  Name 
 *  Risk Status 
 *  Account 
 *  Account Number (Account) (Account)  
 *  Sales Skill 
 *  At Risk Amount (Base) 
 *  At Risk Amount (Local) 
 *  At Risk Date 
 *  At Risk Description 
 *  Primary Competitor 
 *  Risk Type 
 *  Country (Account) (Account) 
 *  Owner 
 *  Primary Owner 
 

 

 *  Column Set for 1C- All Retain to Win View 

 *  The view columns (existing order, with Sales Skill added after Account Name) are: 
 

 

 *  Name 
 *  Risk Status 
 *  Account 
 *  Account Number (Account) (Account)  
 *  Sales Skill 
 *  At Risk Amount (Base) 
 *  At Risk Amount (Local) 
 *  At Risk Date 
 *  At Risk Description 
 *  Primary Competitor 
 *  Risk Type 
 *  Country (Account) (Account) 
 *  Owner 
 *  Primary Owner 
 

 

 

 

 *  Column Set for 1C- Lost Business View 

 *  The view columns (existing order, with Sales Skill added after Account Name) are: 

 *  Lost Business Name 
 *  Account 
 *  Sales Skill 
 *  Date Lost 
 *  Created On 
 *  Lost Portion 
 *  Lost Reason 
 *  Annual Loss Amount (Local) 
 *  Lost Annual Value (Mgmt Rate) 
 *  Annual Loss Amount (Base) 
 *  Currency 
 *  DM Reviewed 
 *  DM Reviewed Date 
 *  City (Account) (Account) 
 *  State/Province (Account) (Account) 
 *  Country (Account) (Account) 
 *  District (Account) (Account) 
 *  Primary Owner 
 *  Market Segment (Account) (Account) 
 *  Subsegment (Account) (Account) 
 *  Lost Area 
 *  PAC 
 *  Corporate Account (Account) (Account) 
 *  Corporate Manager (Account) (Account) 
 *  Lost To Competitor 
 

 

 

 

 

 *  Sales Skill Field Behavior 

 *  Sales Skill displays the Sales Skill value from the linked Sales Skill Account record. 
 *  Appears immediately after Account Number/Name in all applicable views. 
 *  Allows filtering and sorting like other standard view columns. 
 

 *  Security 

 *  Only users with permission to view Opportunities for the linked Sales Skill Accounts will see records in these subgrids. 
 *  Ability to open or interact with opportunities follows standard CRM security model. 
 

 *  Restrict Adding New RTW /Lost Business from the BCA Subgrids 

 *  Given I am a district manager viewing a BCA, 

 *  When I try to add a new RTW /Lost Business from the BCA screen RTW /Lost Business Tab /Subgrid, 
 *  Then I should not have the option to create a new RTW /Lost Business . 
 

 *  Given I want to create a new RTW /Lost Business , 

 *  When I go into an existing customer account record, 
 *  Then I should be able to create and save the new RTW /Lost Business from there, following the current process. 
 

 *  Additional Notes: 

 *  The BCA must provide a read-only aggregated view of RTW /Lost Business linked to associated customer accounts. 
 *  The “New RTW /Lost Business ” option must be removed/hidden from the BCA interface. 
 *  Users must only be able to create RTW /Lost Business under existing customer account records (not BCAs). 
 *  Existing RTW /Lost Business creation flows under customer accounts remain unchanged. 
 *  Ensure that RTW /Lost Business associations continue to sync correctly with Existing Customer Accounts and BCAs, but creation is restricted.

column8: Add Opportunities tab aggregated from related Accounts.
column11:
As a CRM user,
 
 
I need an Opportunities tab on the Base Customer Account (BCA) form that displays all related opportunities from linked Accounts sharing the same BCA number,
 
so that I can see both open and closed opportunities in one place, distinguish them by Sales Skill, and easily switch between standard opportunity views.

column22:
*  Tab & Section Setup 

 *  A new tab named “Opportunities” is added to the BCA form. 
 *  The tab contains two sections: 

 *  Open Opportunities 
 *  Closed Opportunities 
 

 

 *  Open Opportunities Section 

 *  The subgrid shows all open opportunities related to any Active Account linked to the current BCA. 
 *  The default view for this subgrid is “1C- All Open Opportunities ”. 
 *  Add the Sales Skill field immediately after the Account Number column. 
 

 *  Closed Opportunities Section 

 *  The subgrid shows all closed opportunities related to any Sales Skill Account linked to the current BCA. 
 *  The default view for this subgrid is “1C- All Closed Opportunities”. 
 *  The view selector in this section allows the user to select between: 

 *  1C- All Closed Opportunities  (default) 
 *  1C- All Lost Opportunities  
 *  1C- All Won Opportunities  
 

 *  Each of these views keeps its current column set exactly as it is today, with one change:  
 *  Add the Sales Skill field immediately after the Account Number column. 
 

 *  Column Set for 1C- All Open Opportunities View 

 *  Sort Est. Close Date (Older to Newest) 
 *  The view columns (existing order, with Sales Skill added after Account Number) are: 

 *  Opportunity Name 
 *  Account 
 *  Sales Skill (new position after Account ) 
 *  Opportunity Stage 
 *  Market Segment 
 *  Sub-Segment 
 *  Estimated Revenue Local 
 *  Estimated Revenue Base 
 *  Estimated Close Date 
 *  Primary Owner 
 *  Owner 
 *  AVP 
 *  District Manager 
 *  CAM 
 *  State Address 
 *  State 1 
 *  City 
 *  State 
 *  Country 
 *  Global Region 
 *  Corporate Account 
 *  PAC Code 
 *  Unit 
 *  Application 
 *  Innovation Growth 
 *  Technology Platform 
 *  Business Development Manager 
 

 

 *  Column Set for 1C- All Closed Opportunities View 

 *  Sort: Actual Close Date (newest to oldest)
 
 *  The view columns (existing order, with Sales Skill added after Account Number) are: 

 *  Opportunity Name 
 *  Account 
 *  Account Number  
 *  Sales SKill 
 *  Sales Skill  
 *  Opportunity Stage 
 *  Segment 
 *  Subsegment 
 *  Estimated Revenue (Local) 
 *  Est. Revenue (Base) 
 *  Est. Close Date 
 *  Actual Revenue 
 *  Actual Revenue (Mgmt Rate) 
 *  Actual Close Date 
 *  Primary Owner 
 *  Owner 
 *  AVP 
 *  District Manager 
 *  CAM (Account) (Account) 
 *  Street 1 (Account) (Account) 
 *  City (Account) (Account) 
 *  State/Province (Account) (Account) 
 *  Country (Account) (Account) 
 *  Global Region (Account) (Account) 
 *  Corporate Account (Account) (Account) 
 *  PAC Code 
 *  Unit (Unit) (Opportunity Unit) 
 *  Application 
 *  Innovation Growth 
 *  Technology Platform 
 *  Business Development Manager 
 

 

 *  Column Set for 1C- All Lost Opportunities View 

 *  Sort Est. Close Date (Older to Newest)
 
 *  The view columns (existing order, with Sales Skill added after Account Name) are: 

 *  Opportunity Name 
 *  Account 
 *  Sales Skill 
 *  City (Account) (Account) 
 *  Estimated Revenue (Local) 
 *  Est. Revenue (Base) 
 *  Status 
 *  Status Reason 
 *  Opportunity Stage 
 *  Est. Close Date 
 *  Actual Close Date 
 *  Primary Owner 
 *  Owner 
 *  Account Number (Account) (Account) 
 *  Corporate Account (Account) (Account) 
 *  Account Type (Account) (Account) 
 *  Street 1 (Account) (Account) 
 *  State/Province (Account) (Account) 
 *  District (Account) (Account) 
 *  Plant Type 
 *  PAC Code 
 *  Unit 
 *  Application 
 *  Technology Platform 
 

 

 *  Column Set for 1C- All Won Opportunities View 

 *  Sort Actual Close Date (Newest to Oldest)
 
 *  The view columns (existing order, with Sales Skill added after Account Number) are: 

 *  Opportunity Name 
 *  Account 
 *  Sales Skill 
 *  City (Account) (Account) 
 *  Actual Revenue 
 *  Actual Revenue (Mgmt Rate) 
 *  DM Reviewed 
 *  Actual Close Date 
 *  Opportunity Stage 
 *  Primary Owner 
 *  Owner 
 *  AVP 
 *  District Manager 
 *  CAM (Account) (Account) 
 *  Account Number (Account) (Account) 
 *  Corporate Account (Account) (Account) 
 *  Account Type (Account) (Account) 
 *  Street 1 (Account) (Account) 
 *  State/Province (Account) (Account) 
 *  District (Account) (Account) 
 *  Plant Type 
 *  PAC Code 
 *  Unit 
 *  Application 
 *  Technology Platform 
 *  Status 
 *  Status Reason 
 

 

 

 

 

 *  Sales Skill Field Behavior 

 *  Sales Skill displays the Sales Skill value from the linked Sales Skill Account record. 
 *  Appears immediately after Account Number in all applicable views. 
 *  Allows filtering and sorting like other standard view columns. 
 

 *  Security 

 *  Only users with permission to view Opportunities for the linked Sales Skill Accounts will see records in these subgrids. 
 *  Ability to open or interact with opportunities follows standard CRM security model. 
 

 *  Restrict Adding New Opportunity from the BCA Subgrids 

 *  Given I am a Sales Rep / District Manager / Ops Admin viewing a BCA, 

 *  When I try to add a new opportunity from the BCA screen Opportunity Tab / Subgrid, 
 *  Then I should not have the option to create a new opportunity . 
 

 *  Given I want to create a new opportunity , 

 *  When I go into an existing customer account record, 
 *  Then I should be able to create and save the new opportunity from there, following the current process. 
 

 *  Additional Notes: 

 *  The BCA must provide a read-only aggregated view of opportunity linked to associated customer accounts. 
 *  The “New Opportunity” option must be removed/hidden from the BCA interface. 
 *  Users must only be able to create opportunity under existing customer account records (not BCAs). 
 *  Existing opportunity creation flows under customer accounts remain unchanged. 
 *  Ensure that opportunity associations continue to sync correctly with Existing Customer Accounts and BCAs, but creation is restricted.

As a CRM user,
I need a Contacts tab on the Base Customer Account (BCA) form that aggregates all related contacts from the linked Sales Skill Accounts,
 
so that I can see all contact details in one place, filter them by Account Number and Sales Skill, and easily distinguish which account and business line each contact belongs to.
column14: ACChanged; FBU_QAPush_Oct_Major2; ProdPush_Nov_FBU_R1; validated in Test

column22:
*  Tab & Subgrid Setup 

 *  A new Section named “Contacts” is added to the BCA form on the Summary Tab. 
 *  The section contains a Contacts subgrid showing contacts related to all Sales Skill Accounts linked to the BCA. 
 *  The subgrid uses an aggregated view that displays contacts regardless of which Sales Skill Account they belong to. 
 *  Relationship logic is based on linked Sales Skill Accounts to the BCA (no custom scripts required for population). 
 

 *  Views in the Contacts Tab 

 *  Two views are available via the view selector in this subgrid: 

 *  1C- Active Contacts – Default view. 
 *  1C- All Contacts – Shows both active and inactive contacts. 
 

 *  Both views contain the same column set, but differ by the record status filter. 
 

 *  Displayed Columns (Order and Changes) 

 *  Columns in both views, in order: 

 *  Contact Name (Full Name) 
 *  Sales Skill (new) 
 *  Account Name 
 *  Email 
 *  Position 
 *  Job Title 
 *  Buying Role 
 *  Mobile Phone Number 
 *  Global Region 
 *  Country 
 *  District 
 

 

 *  Column Behavior 

 *  Sales Skill column shows the Sales Skill value from the linked Sales Skill Account. 
 *  New Sales Skill column: 

 *  Appear immediately after Contact Name in the view. 
 

 

 *  Sorting Defaults 

 *  Default sort order: 

 *  Contact Name (ascending) 
 

 

 *  This sorting applies to both Active Contacts and All Contacts views. 
 

 *  Filtering Defaults 

 *  Active Contacts view: shows only contacts with Status = Active. 
 *  All Contacts view: shows all contacts, regardless of status. 
 *  Users can apply additional filters in the view selector using standard CRM functionality. 
 

 *  Security 

 *  Only users with permission to view the contacts for the linked Sales Skill Accounts will see them in the subgrid. 
 *  Ability to open or edit contacts is governed by standard CRM security roles. 
 

 *  Restrict Adding New Contacts from the BCA 

 *  Given I am a district manager viewing a BCA, 

 *  When I try to add a new contact from the BCA screen, 
 *  Then I should not have the option to create a new contact. 
 

 *  Given I want to create a new contact, 

 *  When I go into an existing customer account record, 
 *  Then I should be able to create and save the new contact from there, following the current process. 
 

 *  Additional Notes: 

 *  The BCA must provide a read-only aggregated view of contacts linked to associated customer accounts. 
 *  The “New Contact” option must be removed/hidden from the BCA interface. 
 *  Users must only be able to create contacts under existing customer account records (not BCAs). 
 *  Existing contact creation flows under customer accounts remain unchanged. 
 *  Ensure that contact associations continue to sync correctly with Sales Skill Accounts and BCAs, but creation is restricted.

column8: Add Account Section (Associated Accounts Subgrid) to BCA Summary Tab
column11:
As a CRM user,
 
I need an Accounts section on the Base Customer Account (BCA) form Summary Tab containing all associated Accounts subgrid,
 
so that I can see all accounts linked to the BCA, view key account details in one place.
column19: Moved out of state Pending Prod Release
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Subgrid Presence & Behavior 

 *  Given I am an authorized CRM user, when I open a BCA record, then I see an Account section on the Summary tab containing the Associated Accounts subgrid. 
 *  Given I am viewing the Associated Accounts subgrid, when I click on an account record, then the account form opens using standard CRM navigation. 
 *  Given I am in the subgrid, when I apply filters or sorting, then I can filter/sort using CRM’s standard subgrid controls. 
 *  Given I do not have access to certain accounts, when I view the subgrid, then only accounts I am permitted to see (based on record-level security) are displayed. 
 

 *  Displayed Columns 

 *  Given I am in the Associated Accounts subgrid, then I see the following columns in this order: 

 *  Account Name 
 *  Sales Skill 
 *  City 
 *  State/Province 
 *  Country 
 *  Account Type 
 *  Parent Account 
 *  Corporate Account 
 *  Market Segment 
 *  Sub-Segment 
 *  Sales Region 
 *  Sales Sub-Region 
 *  Primary Owner 
 *  Associate AM/Technician 
 *  Associate District Manager 
 *  AVP 
 *  CAM 
 *  Local CAM 
 *  BDM 
 *  Sales Manager 
 *  Corporate Manager 
 *  Owner 
 

 *  Given the subgrid loads, then records are sorted by Account Name (ascending) by default. 
 

 

 

 
Business Requirements: 

 *  A new Account section must be added to the Base Customer Account (BCA) Summary tab. 
 *  This section must display an Associated Accounts subgrid showing all accounts linked to the current BCA. 
 *  The relationship must be a direct lookup relationship between BCA and Accounts. 
 *  Users must be able to view key account details (columns defined below) in one place. 
 *  Subgrid must follow standard CRM behavior for opening and navigating to account records. 
 *  Users must be able to create new accounts(Prospects) from the BCA Account Subgrids based on their CRM security privileges. 
 

 

 
Developer Notes: 

 *  Tab & Subgrid Setup 

 *  A new Section named “Accounts” is added to the BCA form on the Summary Tab. 
 *  The subgrid uses the direct relationship between BCA and Accounts (via the BCA lookup on Account). 
 *  The subgrid automatically displays all related Accounts for the current BCA without custom scripts. 
 

 *  Subgrid Behavior 

 *  From this subgrid, users can: 

 *  Open related Account records. 
 *  Create a new Prospect or Account directly under the BCA (auto-linking the BCA lookup).  

 *  While Creating an Account from the Account Subgrid on the BCA, the following fields should be auto populated on the Account Form  

 *  Account Name (Locked)  
 *  Account Number (Locked)  
 *  District (Locked)  
 *  Owner (Locked)  
 *  Account Type = Prospect (Locked)  
 *  BCA = Current BCA (Locked)   
 

 

 *  Add Existing Account button should be disabled on the Subgrid.  
 

 *  Standard CRM create forms are used; no custom popups or JavaScript required.  
 

 *  Displayed Columns 

 *  The subgrid view shows the following columns in this order: 

 *  Account Name 
 *  Account Number  
 *  Sales Skill 
 *  City 
 *  State/Province 
 *  Country 
 *  Account Type 
 *  Parent Account (displaying the linked Organizational Account)
 
 *  Corporate Account 
 *  Market Segment 
 *  Subsegment 
 *  Sales Region 
 *  Sales Subregion 
 *  Primary Owner 
 *  Associate AM / Technician 
 *  Associate District Manager 
 *  District Manager 
 *  AVP 
 *  CAM 
 *  Local CAM 
 *  BDM 
 *  Sales Manager 
 *  Corporate Manager 
 *  Owner 
 

 

 

 *  View & Filtering 

 *  The subgrid uses a standard Account view pre-configured with the above columns. 
 *  Default sort order is Account Name ascending. 
 *  Users can apply additional filters using standard CRM subgrid view controls. 
 

 *  Security 

 *  Only users with permissions to view the related Accounts can see records in the subgrid. 
 *  The ability to create new Accounts from the subgrid follows standard CRM security roles and privileges.

column7: 10. Tab Visibility and Behavior Updates for 1C District Accounts
column11:
Business Capability & Overview:
To harmonize the user experience across Nalco Water, Hygiene, and Food & Beverage (F&B) accounts in the 1C model, CRM must update tab visibility and behavior logic. Certain tabs (Customer Setup, Ship-To, Cases/TSR) should be hidden or shown based on the 1C flag to prevent duplicate or unnecessary records, ensure alignment with future-state CLM-driven processes, and deliver a consistent experience across account types. 

 
Business Requirements: 

 *  Customer Setup Tab 

 *  Current Behavior: 

 *  Hygiene: Customer Setup tab appears when account type = Prospect; no auto-creation on Opportunity closure. 
 *  Nalco Water: Customer Setup record auto-created upon Opportunity closure. 
 

 *  Future Behavior (1C Accounts): 

 *  For all 1C accounts (Nalco Water, Hygiene, F&B): 
 *  Hide the Customer Setup tab. 
 *  Disable automatic creation of Customer Setup record when Opportunity is closed. 
 *  Prevent users from manually creating Customer Setup records. 
 

 *  Non-1C Accounts: 

 *  Continue with current behavior (no change). 
 

 

 *  Ship-To Tab 

 *  Current Behavior: 

 *  Nalco Water: Ship-To tab visible. 
 *  Hygiene: Ship-To tab hidden. 
 

 *  Future Behavior: 

 *  For Nalco Water 1C: Hide the Ship-To tab (align with Hygiene). 
 *  For Nalco Water non-1C: Keep Ship-To tab visible. 
 *  For Hygiene: Remains hidden (no change). 
 

 

 *  Sites Tab 

 *  Current Behavior: 

 *  Hygiene: No Sites tab. 
 *  Nalco Water: Sites tab visible (multiple Ship-Tos can align with sites). 
 

 *  Future Behavior: 

 *  Hygiene: No Sites tab (no change). 
 *  Nalco Water: Sites tab remains visible for both 1C and non-1C (no change). 
 

 

 *  Opportunities Tab 

 *  No changes required (remains as-is). 
 

 *  Service Visits Tab 

 *  No changes required for tab visibility. 
 *  (Note: Sold-To vs. Ship-To logic handled under a separate requirement). 
 

 *  Cases / TSR Tab 

 *  Current Behavior: 

 *  Nalco Water: Cases/TSR tab visible (may show both Cases + TSR). 
 *  Hygiene: Only TSR tab visible. 
 

 *  Future Behavior (1C Accounts): 

 *  Nalco Water 1C: Hide the Cases/TSR tab and display only the TSR tab (to align with Hygiene). 
 *  Nalco Water non-1C: Keep current Cases/TSR behavior. 
 *  Hygiene: No change (only TSR tab visible). 
 

 

 

 
Technical Considerations: 

 *  Tab visibility controlled via form-level logic and security roles: 

 *  Tabs hidden dynamically where 1C Flag = Yes. 
 *  Tabs unchanged where 1C Flag = No. 
 

 *  Customer Setup auto-creation logic on Opportunity close must be disabled for Nalco Water 1C. 
 *  Cases/TSR tab adjustment: ensure TSR tab only is visible for 1C Nalco Water. 
 *  No changes required for Sites tab ? explicitly ensure visibility logic does not change. 
 

 
Deliverables: 

 *  Updated CRM account form configurations: 

 *  Customer Setup tab hidden for all 1C accounts. 
 *  Ship-To tab hidden for Nalco Water 1C; visible for non-1C. 
 *  Cases/TSR tab hidden for Nalco Water 1C; TSR tab remains visible. 
 *  Sites tab unchanged (Nalco Water: always visible; Hygiene: always absent). 
 

 *  Logic updates to disable Customer Setup auto-creation on Opportunity close for 1C Nalco Water. 
 *  Regression testing for 1C and non-1C scenarios to ensure alignment. 
 *  Documentation for training and change management.

column8: Show Only TSR Tab for Nalco Water 1C Accounts (Hide Cases/TSR Tab)
column11:
As a sales rep or district manager working on a Water sales skill account flagged for 1C,
I want the Cases tab hidden and only the TSR (Technical Service Requests) tab visible,
 
So that the user experience is consistent with Hygiene accounts and aligned to the One Customer model.
column19: Moved out of state Pending Prod Release
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:

 *  Given I open a Water sales skill account flagged as 1C, 

 *  When I navigate to the account form, 
 *  Then the Cases/TSR tab must not be visible, and only the TSR tab should be displayed. 
 

 *  Given I open a non-1C Nalco Water account, 

 *  When I navigate to the account form, 
 *  Then the Cases/TSR tab should remain visible (existing functionality)  as it does today. 
 

 *  Given I open a Hygiene sales skill account (1C or non-1C), 

 *  When I navigate to the account form, 
 *  Then the Cases tab should remain hidden and the TSR tab should remain visible, consistent with today’s behavior. 
 

 

 
Business Requirements: 

 *  Hide the Cases/TSR tab for Water sales skill accounts flagged as 1C. 
 *  Display the TSR tab only for these accounts, mirroring Hygiene behavior. 
 *  No changes for: 

 *  Hygiene accounts (Cases already hidden, TSR shown). 
 *  Non-1C Nalco Water accounts (Cases and TSR both remain as is today). 
 

 *  Ensure that all existing TSR data continues to display correctly under the TSR tab for impacted accounts. 
 

 
Developer Notes: 

 *  Implement tab visibility logic on the account form: 

 *  OneCustomerFlag = Yes ? Hide Cases tab, show TSR tab (for Water sales skill accounts). 
 *  OneCustomerFlag = No ? Maintain current Nalco Water behavior (Cases + TSR visible). 
 

 *  Hygiene forms require no change (Cases already hidden, TSR shown). 
 *  Verify that role-based access does not override tab visibility (Sales Reps, DMs, AMs, Ops Admins, etc.). 
 *  Ensure data integrity: TSR records continue to display in the TSR tab after changes. 
 *  Regression testing required for opportunity closure and service visit flows to confirm no dependencies on Cases tab visibility.

column14: FBU_QAPush_Oct_Major1; ProdPush_Nov_FBU_R1; ReadyforDemo; TechDocNotAdded; validated in Test
column19: Moved out of state Pending Prod Release
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 

 *  Given I open a Water sales skill account flagged as 1C, 

 *  When I navigate to the account form, 
 *  Then the Ship-To tab must not be visible. 
 

 *  Given I open a non-1C Nalco Water account, 

 *  When I navigate to the account form, 
 *  Then the Ship-To tab should remain visible, working as it does today. 
 

 *  Given I open a Hygiene or F&B sales skill account (1C or non-1C), 

 *  When I navigate to the account form, 
 *  Then the Ship-To tab should continue to be hidden (unchanged from current behavior). 
 

 

 
Business Requirements: 

 *  For Water sales skill accounts flagged as 1C, hide the Ship-To tab on the account form. 
 *  For non-1C Nalco Water accounts, continue to display the Ship-To tab as per current behavior. 
 *  Hygiene and F&B accounts are unaffected since Ship-To is already hidden today. 
 *  Ensure no residual Ship-To logic (lookups, validations) interferes with account save or update operations. 
 

 
Developer Notes 

 *  Apply form logic to conditionally hide/show the Ship-To tab based on: 

 *  OneCustomerFlag = Yes ? Hide tab for Water accounts. 
 *  OneCustomerFlag = No ? Keep tab visible for Nalco Water accounts. 
 

 *  Hygiene and F&B accounts ? no change (Ship-To already hidden). 
 *  Verify visibility settings across all security roles (Sales Rep, DM, AM, Ops Admin, etc.). 
 *  Regression testing: confirm that hiding the tab does not break related service visit or site logic. 
 *  Ensure tab visibility logic is applied consistently across main form(s) used for accounts.

column8: Hide Customer Setup Tab for All 1C Accounts
column11:
As a sales rep or district manager,
I want the Customer Setup tab to be hidden on all 1C accounts (Water, Hygiene, F&B),
 
So that I cannot manually create or edit customer setup records in CRM, since customer setup will now be managed through CLM/MDM.
column14: CodeReviewed; FBU_QAPush_Oct_Major1; ProdPush_Nov_FBU_R1; ReadyforDemo; validated in Test
column19: Moved out of state Pending Prod Release
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 

 *  Given I am viewing a Water or Hygiene sales skill account flagged as 1C, 

 *  When I open the account form, 
 *  Then the Customer Setup tab is hidden and I cannot access or create customer setup records. 
 

 *  Given I am viewing an F&B account flagged as 1C, 

 *  When I open the account form, 
 *  Then the Customer Setup tab is hidden and I cannot access or create customer setup records. 
 

 *  Given I am viewing a non-1C Nalco Water account, 

 *  When I open the account form, 
 *  Then the Customer Setup tab should appear and behave as it does today. 
 

 

 
Business Requirements: 

 *  The Customer Setup tab must be hidden for all accounts where the 1C flag = Yes (Water, Hygiene, F&B). 
 *  Non-1C accounts (e.g., Nalco Water legacy accounts) should remain unchanged — Customer Setup tab remains visible. 
 *  Auto-creation of customer setup records on opportunity close for Water 1C accounts must be disabled.  
 *  Ensure consistent behavior across all roles (reps, district managers, account managers, ops admins). 
 *  Users should not receive misleading validation errors related to customer setup when the tab is hidden. 
 

 
Developer Notes:

 *  Update CRM form logic to conditionally hide the Customer Setup tab when OneCustomerFlag = Yes. 
 *  Apply this condition to both Prospect and Customer sales skill accounts under 1C. 
 *  For Water sales skill accounts flagged as 1C, disable the plugin/workflow that auto-creates customer setup on opportunity close.  
 *  Confirm no orphaned workflows or background jobs are triggered for 1C scenarios.  
 *  Ensure security roles prevent users from accessing customer setup entities via advanced find or API. 
 *  Regression test: 

 *  For non-1C Nalco Water accounts, confirm Customer Setup tab and auto-creation still work as today. 
 *  For 1C accounts (Water, Hygiene, F&B), confirm tab is hidden and auto-creation disabled.

column8: Hide Corporate Manager and Corporate Classification  Field on 1C Water Accounts and Align CAM Population to H5 Parent
column11:
As a CRM user,
I want the Corporate Manager field on Water sales-skill accounts to be hidden for all 1C districts
 
so that users do not rely on outdated Water-specific hierarchy logic
 
and the CAM field is consistently derived from the H5 parent account rather than from legacy Water account values.
 

 
This ensures that the CAM assignment model is unified in the 1C structure and remains aligned with the One Customer parent-child hierarchy.
column14: CodeReviewed; FBU R2 Release; FBU_QAPush_Dec_Major3; ReadyforDemo; validated in QA; validated in Test
column19: Moved out of state In QA
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Hide Corporate Manager and Corporate Classification on 1C Water Accounts 

 *  Given an account is flagged as a 1C account (1C District = Yes) 
 *  And the account’s Sales Skill = Water 
 *  When a user opens the Water account form 
 *  Then the Corporate Manager field and Corporate Classification  must be hidden from the form 
 *  And the Corporate Manager field and Corporate Classification  must not be editable or visible anywhere on the UI. 
 

 *  Show Corporate Manager on Non-1C Water Accounts  

 *  Given an account is not a 1C account (1C District = No)  
 *  And the account’s Sales Skill = Water  
 *  When a user opens the account form  
 *  Then the Corporate Manager and Corporate Classification  field must remain visible  
 *  And continue to function as it does today.  
 

 *  Update CAM Population Logic (1C Model Only) 

 *  Given a child Water account belongs to an H5 parent account 
 *  And the H5 account has a CAM value populated 
 *  When the CAM value is added or updated on the H5 account 
 *  Then the CAM (Customer Account Manager) value must automatically populate/update on all child accounts 
 *  And this must occur regardless of the child account’s global business/Sales Skill value 
 *  And only the CAM value from the H5 should be considered the source of truth in the 1C model. 
 

 

Dev Note: 
 
As of today the Corporate Manager field on the Hygiene Prospect, Customer and Organization Accounts is hidden. The code change needed is to hide the field on the 1C Water Prospect and Customer Accounts

column8: Enable Corporate/Street Field Visibility and Automated CAM-Based Classification for 1C Accounts
column11:
As a CRM user,
I want the Corporate/Street classification field on account records to appear only for accounts that belong to the 1C structure,
 
so that the field is consistently visible and automatically populated using CAM assignment for both Water and Hygiene sales-skill accounts,
 
while preserving the current-state behavior for non-1C accounts.
column14: CodeReviewed; FBU R2 Release; FBU_QAPush_Dec_Major5; validated in QA; validated in Test
column19: Moved out of state In QA
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  1Visibility for 1C Accounts 

 *  Given an account belongs to a district where Eligible for 1C = Yes 
 *  And the account’s sales skill is Water or Hygiene 
 *  When the account form loads 
 *  Then the Corporate/Street field must be visible. 
 

 *  Hidden for Non-1C Water Accounts 

 *  Given an account’s global business is Nalco Water 
 *  And its district is not eligible for 1C 
 *  When the account form loads 
 *  Then the Corporate/Street field must be hidden. 
 

 *  Auto-Population Logic for 1C Accounts 

 *  Given an account is part of the 1C structure 
 *  When the account is saved 
 *  Then the Corporate/Street field must populate based on CAM assignment: 

 *  CAM present ? Corporate 
 *  CAM absent ? Street 
 

 *  Given a 1C account currently shows Street 
 *  When a CAM is added 
 *  Then the field must update automatically to Corporate. 
 *  Given a 1C account currently shows Corporate 
 *  When the CAM is removed 
 *  Then the field must update automatically to Street. 
 

 *  Field Is Always Read-Only 

 *  Given the Corporate/Street field is visible 
 *  When a user attempts to edit its value 
 *  Then the field must be read-only.

column7: 1. Support a New Base Customer Account (BCA) Record in CRM
column11:
Business Objective
The Base Customer Account (BCA) in CRM will serve as the enterprise-level customer record, acting as the foundational anchor for associating divisional sales skill accounts and aligning with downstream systems such as MDM, CDM, and EBS.
 
The rationale for selecting Option 1 (creating a dedicated custom entity for BCA) is to minimize risk, reduce system complexity, and avoid negative impacts on CRM performance while ensuring flexibility for future enhancements.
 
Establishing a distinct BCA record will provide a consolidated, read-only view of the customer relationship at the highest level, improving visibility for stakeholders across divisions, enabling accurate data aggregation, and supporting unified reporting, customer insights, and integration consistency.
 

 
Business Requirements 

 *  Introduce a new Base Customer Account entity in CRM to represent the enterprise-level customer record. 
 *  Ensure the BCA contains core enterprise-level customer metadata that applies across all business units. 
 *  Capture mandatory fields including: 

 *  Account Name (sourced from ERP) 
 *  Account Number (sourced from ERP) 
 

 *  Include optional fields for parent account reference (e.g., H5 corporate account linkage) to enable corporate hierarchy visibility. 
 *  Provide ability to associate team members/owners (e.g., CAM, District Manager, BDM) for visibility tracking and collaboration. 
 *  The BCA form should be read-only for most users, intended for visibility and roll-up insights, not for direct edits. 
 *  Ensure the BCA can support aggregated view components, such as related records, subgrids, and customer-level insights. 
 *  Establish integration readiness so the BCA aligns with downstream systems’ account structures (e.g., CDM site alignment, EBS Sold-To linkage). 
 

 
Technical Considerations:
 

 *  A technical spike will be required during the design phase to: 

 *  Finalize the list of required fields 
 *  Determine correct field types (lookup, optionset, text, etc.) 
 *  Review naming conventions and alignment with existing data models 
 *  Define form layout and security model in coordination with the technical architect 
 

 *  The output of the spike will include a finalized data dictionary and metadata definitions for the BCA table, which will be reviewed and approved prior to build. 
 *  The spike will also confirm whether existing CRM logic (e.g., plugins or workflows) will require modification to support the introduction of the BCA entity. 
 

 
Expected Deliverables:  

 *  BCA entity created in CRM with defined fields and relationships 
 *  Initial form layout and sitemap visibility configuration 
 *  Data dictionary and metadata schema updated to reflect the BCA entity 
 *  Documented spike findings and validated design for field mapping and usage 
 

 
This requirement is limited to CRM-side modeling of the BCA and does not include integration logic, which is handled in separate features. However, it establishes the foundational data structure that other processes will depend on.

column8: Create Base Customer Account (BCA) entity with minimal required core fields, populated only via integration.
column11:
As a CRM user,
I need a Base Customer Account (BCA) record type with the minimum required core fields and a clear form layout,
 
so that I can view key customer details in a consistent, business-friendly format without being able to manually edit them.
column19: Moved out of state Pending Prod Release
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 

 *  Access & Open 

 *  Given I am a CRM user (DM, CAM, AM etc) with access, when I navigate via the sitemap to Base Customer Accounts, then I can open any BCA record successfully. 
 

 *  Read-Only Behavior 

 *  Given I have a BCA record open, when I attempt to edit any field or save, then I cannot make changes. 
 *  Given the record is open, then the UI does not show options to Create, Edit, or Delete a BCA. 
 

 *  Field Presence & Labels 

 *  Given I open a BCA record, then I see the fields: Base Customer Account Number, Customer Name, ERP Status and Owner. 
 *  The ERP Account Status should be a global option set with the following values 

 *  Prospect 
 *  Active 
 *  Inactive 
 

 *  Given the form is displayed, then all labels use business-friendly names with no acronyms. 
 

 *  Required vs. Optional 

 *  Given I open a BCA record, then Base Customer Account Number and Customer Name are populated. 
 

 *  Form Layout Consistency 

 *  Given I open multiple BCAs, then the form layout, sections, and tabs appear consistent across records and easy to navigate. 
 *  The sequence of Tabs on the form should be in this orders 

 *  Summary (The Summary Tab should also display the Subgrids for Accounts (Sales Skills) and Contacts0 
 *  Opportunities 
 *  TVD Programs 
 *  RTW/Lost Business 
 *  Admin (Created On, Modified On, Created By, Modified By, Status, Status Reason) 
 

 

 

 
 
Business Requirements  

 *  Navigation & Visibility 

 *  All authorized users (District Manager, Corporate Account Manager, Account Manager, Sales Rep) can see Base Customer Accounts in the CRM sitemap. 
 *  All these users can open any BCA record they have access to. 
 

 *  Read-Only Experience 

 *  When a BCA record is opened, all fields are read-only for all business roles. 
 *  Users do not see options to Create, Edit, or Delete a BCA record. 
 

 *  Form Content & Layout 

 *  Users should see the following fields on the BCA form: 

 *  Base Customer Account Number 
 *  Customer Name 
 *  ERP Account Status
 
 *  Owner (should be in header) 
 

 *  Field labels are business-friendly (no internal acronyms). 
 *  The form layout is clear, logical, and consistent across records. 
 *  Tabs/sections are clearly labeled and space is reserved for future related data (Accounts, Opportunities, etc.). 
 

 *  Data Validation  

 *  Base Customer Account Number and Customer Name are always populated. 
 

 

 


Developer Notes 

 *  Entity Creation 

 *  A new entity called Base Customer Account (BCA) is created in CRM. 
 *  The entity appears in the CRM navigation for authorized roles. 
 *  The entity has a single main form available for R1. 
 

 *  Core Fields on the Form 

 *  Base Customer Account Number – text, required, read-only in CRM. 
 *  Customer Name – text, required, read-only in CRM. 
 *  ERP Account Status –  

 *  The ERP Account status should be a global option set with the following values 

 *  Prospect 
 *  Active 
 *  Inactive 
 

 

 *  Owner – out-of-the-box, read-only for business users. 
 *  Standard system fields (Created On, Modified On, Created By, Modified By) appear by default. 
 *  All labels are business-friendly (no internal acronyms). 
 

 *  Timeline 

 *  Timeline should not be enabled for this new table 
 

 *  Form Layout 

 *  Fields are arranged in a logical, easy-to-read layout for business users. 
 *  Sections and tabs are clearly labeled and logically grouped. 
 *  Space is reserved on the form for future subgrids/tabs (e.g., Accounts, Opportunities, Contacts, Service Plans), but these will be configured in other stories. 
 

 *  Field Accessibility 

 *  All core fields listed above are read-only for business roles. 
 *  Integration/system roles may have edit access as determined in separate security stories. 
 

 *  UI Command Availability 

 *  Create, Edit, and Delete commands for BCA are hidden or disabled for business roles.

column8: Create Active and My Team's Active BCA Views in CRM Sitemap
column11:
As a CRM user,
 
 
 
I need the views for Base Customer Accounts — Active ,  My Active BCA and My Team's Active BCA Views — accessible from the CRM sitemap,
 
so that I can quickly locate, search, and filter BCAs by their current status and key business details.
column19: Moved out of state Pending Prod Release
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Navigation & Default View 

 *  Given I am an authorized CRM user, when I navigate via the sitemap to Base Customer Accounts, then the link appears above the Accounts table in the Customer section. 
 *  Given I open the Base Customer Account sitemap link, then the default view displayed is My Teams Active Base Customer Accounts.  
  

 *  Active Base Customer Accounts View 

 *  Given I select Active Base Customer Accounts, when I open the view, then I only see records where Status = Active. 
 *  Given I am in the Active BCA view, when the view loads, then I see the columns Base Customer Account Number, Customer Name, ERP Status and Owner. 
 *  Given I am in the Active BCA view, when I search or filter, then I can search across all displayed columns and apply additional filters using standard CRM view controls. 
 

 *  Inactive Base Customer Accounts View   

 *  Given I select Inactive Base Customer Accounts, when I open the view, then I only see records where Status = Inactive.   
 *  Given I am in the Inactive BCA view, when the view loads, then I see the columns Base Customer Account Number, Customer Name, ERP Status  and Owner.   
 *  Given I am in the Inactive BCA view, when I search or filter, then I can search across all displayed columns and apply additional filters using standard CRM view controls. 
 

 *  My Active Base Customer Accounts View (This should be default view for this table)  

 *  Given I select My Active Base Customer Accounts, when I open the view, then I only see active records owned by me (the logged-in user).  
 *  Given I am in the My Active BCA view, when the view loads, then I see the columns Base Customer Account Number, Customer Name, ERP Status  and Owner.  
 *  Given I am in the My Active BCA view, when I search or filter, then I can search across all displayed columns and apply additional filters using standard CRM view controls.  
 

 *  My Team’s Active Base Customer Accounts View 

 *  Given I select My Team’s Active Base Customer Accounts, when I open the view, then I only see active records owned by members of my team. 
 *  Given I am in the My Team’s Active BCA view, when the view loads, then I see the columns Base Customer Account Number, Customer Name, ERP Status  and Owner. 
 *  Given I am in the My Team’s Active BCA view, when I search or filter, then I can search across all displayed columns and apply additional filters using standard CRM view controls. 
 

 *  Security & Role Access 

 *  Given I am an unauthorized CRM user, when I navigate via the sitemap, then I do not see the Base Customer Account link. 
 *  Given I am an authorized CRM user, when I access these views, then I only see BCA records permitted by my record-level security. 
 

 

 

 
Business Requirements: 

 *  Base Customer Account (BCA) views must be available directly from the CRM sitemap for authorized CRM roles. 
 *  The following views must be created and accessible: 

 *  Active Base Customer Accounts 
 *  Inactive Base Customer Accounts  
 *  My Active Base Customer Accounts 
 *  My Team’s Active Base Customer Accounts 
 

 *  The default view when opening from the sitemap must be My Active Base Customer Accounts. 
 *  Each view must display only BCAs matching its respective filter (active, inactive, user-owned, team-owned). 
 *  Displayed columns must be Base Customer Account Number, Customer Name, ERP Status  and Owner with business-friendly labels. 
 *  Views must respect record-level security; users can only see BCAs they have permission to view. 
 *  These views must be added to the following model-driven apps: Ecolab Admin and Ecolab Sales. 
 

 

 
Developer Notes: 

 *  Sitemap Navigation 

 *  A Base Customer Account navigation link is visible in the CRM sitemap for authorized roles. This BCA table should appear in the Customer Section just above the Accounts Table on the following Model Driven apps 

 *  Ecolab Admin  
 *  Ecolab Sales 
 

 *  Clicking the link displays the Active Base Customer Accounts view by default. 
 *  Users can switch to the My Active BCA and My Team's Active BCA Views from the view selector. 
 

 *  Active Base Customer Accounts 

 *  View Name & Access 

 *  View name: “Active Base Customer Accounts”. 
 

 *  Filter Logic 

 *  Shows only BCA records with Status = Active. 
 

 *  Displayed Columns 

 *  Base Customer Account Number 
 *  Customer Name 
 *  ERP Status
 
 *  Owner 
 *  MDM Site ID  
 *  ERP Account Status 
 

 *  Column Behavior 

 *  All column labels are business-friendly, exactly as named above. 
 *  Default sort order is Customer Name ascending. 
 

 *  Search & Filter 

 *  Users can search by any displayed column. 
 *  Users can add additional filters using standard CRM view controls. 
 

 

 *  Inactive Base Customer Accounts 

 *  View Name & Access 

 *  View name: “Inactive Base Customer Accounts”. 
 

 *  Filter Logic 

 *  Shows only BCA records with Status = Inactive. 
 

 *  Displayed Columns 

 *  Base Customer Account Number 
 *  Customer Name 
 *  ERP Status
 
 *  Owner
 
 *  MDM Site ID  
 *  ERP Account Status 
 

 *  Column Behavior 

 *  All column labels are business-friendly, exactly as named above. 
 *  Default sort order is Customer Name ascending. 
 

 *  Search & Filter 

 *  Users can search by any displayed column. 
 *  Users can add additional filters using standard CRM view controls. 
 

 

 *  My Active Base Customer Accounts 

 *  View Name & Access 

 *  View name: “My Active Base Customer Accounts”. 
 

 *  Filter Logic 

 *  Shows only BCA records with Status = Active. 
 *  The Filter should be similar to the My Account view as shown in the snapshot below 
 *  [Image]
 
 

 *  Displayed Columns 

 *  Base Customer Account Number 
 *  Customer Name 
 *  ERP Status
 
 *  Owner
 
 *  MDM Site ID 
 *  ERP Account Status 
 

 *  Column Behavior 

 *  All column labels are business-friendly, exactly as named above. 
 *  Default sort order is Customer Name ascending. 
 

 *  Search & Filter 

 *  Users can search by any displayed column. 
 *  Users can add additional filters using standard CRM view controls. 
 

 

 *  My Team's Active Base Customer Accounts 

 *  View Name & Access 

 *  View name: “My Team's Active Base Customer Accounts”. 
 

 *  Filter Logic 

 *  Shows only BCA records with Status = Active. 
 *  The Filter should be similar to the My Team's Account view as shown in the snapshot below 
 *  [Image]
 
 

 *  Displayed Columns 

 *  Base Customer Account Number 
 *  Customer Name 
 *  ERP Status
 
 *  Owner
 
 *  MDM Site ID 
 *  ERP Account Status 
 

 *  Column Behavior 

 *  All column labels are business-friendly, exactly as named above. 
 *  Default sort order is Customer Name ascending. 
 

 *  Search & Filter 

 *  Users can search by any displayed column. 
 *  Users can add additional filters using standard CRM view controls. 
 

 

 

 

 *  Security 

 *  Only authorized CRM roles can see the sitemap link and access these views. 
 *  Both views respect record-level security (users see only BCAs they are allowed to view). 
 

 *  OOB Views Updates 

 *  Ensure all OOB views like Advanced Find, Quick Find Views are updated to have the following columns only 

 *  Base Customer Account Number 
 *  Customer Name 
 *  ERP Status
 
 *  Owner 
 

 

 *  Model Driven Apps where these views to be added 

 *  Ecolab Admin  
 *  Ecolab Sales

column8: Configure BCA Ownership & Assignment to District Team (Create/Update Sync with Lead Division)
column11:
As a CRM system, I need to automatically assign ownership of a Base Customer Account (BCA) record to the appropriate District Team based on the linked Division Sales Skill account, so that users with team-level roles only see and access BCAs for their assigned districts.
As a business user, I need ownership reassignment to stay synchronized when Division information changes, so that visibility and access always remain aligned with the correct district team without requiring manual intervention.
column22:
MOVE TO USER STORY USER STORY 846371 
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 
 

 *  BCA Ownership 

 *  Given a new Prospect is created 

 *  When the District on a prospect is linked and saved, 
 *  Then ownership of the BCA should automatically be assigned to the District Team corresponding to that District. 
 

 

 *  District Change Sync  

 *  Given an existing BCA is linked to District A’s district team,  

 *  When the District on  changes to District B,  
 *  Then ownership should automatically transfer to District B’s district team.  
 

 

 *  No Manual Overrides 

 *  Given a business user with read-only access, 

 *  When they open a BCA record, 
 *  Then the Owner field must remain locked, with no ability to manually edit or override team assignment. 
 

 

 

Create a new integration story for the District Updates via PZ integration and the impact on BCA Ownership. 
Add another validation user story that the District cannot be different on the Hygiene and Water account tied to the same BCA 
Nice to Have Story: Add a nightly job if there any Customer accounts whose ownership is different than that of the BCA and have them fixed. 
 
Business Requirements: 

 *  BCA ownership must always align with the District Team of the Division Sales Skill account. 
 *  On create, system must set Owner = District Team automatically. 
 *  On update, ownership must re-sync to the new district team if Division changes. 
 *  Business users must not have edit privileges on the Owner field. 
 

 
Developer Notes:

 *  Ownership Assignment Logic 

 *  Implement a plugin/Power Automate flow on BCA create and update: 

 *  Retrieve linked Division Sales Skill account. 
 *  Identify associated District Team. 
 *  Assign BCA Owner to that team. 
 

 

 *  Field Locking 

 *  Lock Owner field on BCA form for all business roles (read-only). 
 *  Integration/service accounts bypass restriction. 
 

 *  Testing Scenarios 

 *  BCA creation with valid Division ? auto-assigned to correct District Team. 
 *  Division change ? ownership re-assigned. 
 *  Integration record creation/update ? assignment enforced. 
 *  Unauthorized manual override ? blocked.

column6: CRM Prospect to Customer Setup Process Enablement for One Customer Model
column11:
This feature enables a modernized, end-to-end prospect-to-customer setup process in CRM tailored for the One Customer model. Today, CRM allows the creation of prospect accounts that follow a legacy setup flow where customer numbers are issued after setup and not linked until after validation. Under the One Customer model, the sales skill–specific accounts (Water and Hygiene) will be tied to a unified ERP Customer Number and grouped via a Base Customer Account (BCA). To align with this, a redesigned setup experience is required.

 
The feature will ensure that once a prospect is created under a flagged 1C district, the standard MDM validation flow—including address standardization, duplicate checks, and legal entity verification—is triggered automatically. Upon successful validation and business approval, the conversion to customer account will occur. The MDM system will then determine if the prospect corresponds to an existing ERP customer number (i.e., an existing BCA). If matched, MDM will link the new sales skill account to the BCA and issue the same ERP customer number in CRM. If unmatched, a new BCA will be created and synchronized back to CRM.
 

 
This capability ensures that CRM users can manage prospect creation without duplicating customers, that setup is standardized and future-proof, and that sales skill alignment and data accuracy are maintained throughout the lifecycle. The end goal is to provide a clean, unified customer footprint in CRM, MDM, and ERP while ensuring seamless user experience and data governance.
 
Key Business Goals: 

 *  Provide a clean, guided experience for creating prospects under the One Customer model. 
 *  Ensure all 1C district prospects follow a standardized MDM integration flow from the start. 
 *  Enable automatic ERP number issuance and association with existing or new BCAs. 
 *  Reduce manual intervention, errors, and duplicate customer creation. 
 *  Maintain regulatory compliance and master data consistency across systems (CRM, MDM, ERP). 
 *  Support creation of sales skill accounts under existing BCAs (e.g., add Water to existing Hygiene BCA). 
 *  Align customer setup timelines and logic between field users, MDM, and ERP teams. 
 

 
Technical Implementation Considerations: 

 *  Trigger Logic: When a prospect is created under a 1C-flagged district, initiate standard MDM API flow for validation and staging. 
 *  Validation Checks: Reuse or refactor logic to validate address, legal entity, potential duplicates, and Cisco-Libc logic. 
 *  MDM Communication: Post-prospect creation, send data to MDM for staging until customer setup is triggered. 
 *  BCA Matching: Once setup is triggered, MDM compares the prospect with existing ERP customers. If matched, send back the BCA and ERP number to CRM. If unmatched, generate a new ERP number and create a new BCA. 
 *  ERP Integration: Ensure EBS receives appropriate updates for creating sales skill under the correct ERP customer. 
 *  Prospect Conversion: Once approved, prospect record is converted to customer type, linked to BCA, and updated with the ERP number. 
 *  Account Creation Flexibility: 

 *  Option A: User can directly create a sales skill account under an existing BCA from the BCA form. 
 *  Option B: User creates standalone prospect; MDM matches and links during setup process. 
 

 *  Form Behavior: 

 *  When sales skill is selected (Water/Hygiene), logic should infer ERP system and link accordingly. 
 *  ERP system field updates dynamically depending on selection (e.g., NLC_SAP ? ECL_EBS). 
 

 *  Error Handling & Logging: Capture all validation errors and warnings for user review before submission. 
 *  Security & Visibility: Ensure proper access is granted to create and view prospects under BCA, while preventing unauthorized number overrides or duplicate creations. 
 *  Number Swap Support: Ensure new customer number is correctly reflected on sales skill account post-MDM matching or override. 
 

 
Expected Deliverables: 

 *  Updated CRM forms and business rules for prospect creation under 1C districts. 
 *  Trigger logic to call MDM APIs from prospect creation (not just customer setup). 
 *  Updated integration to handle matching and ERP number assignment via MDM. 
 *  Auto-linkage logic between Sales Skill Account and Base Customer Account. 
 *  Rules to suppress or display BCA field depending on customer type, district flags. 
 *  Audit logs for validation steps and setup transitions. 
 *  Data dictionary updates to include new fields or logic flags introduced (e.g., Sales Skill type, ERP system override). 
 *  Regression test scenarios across CRM ? MDM ? ERP for both matched and unmatched flows.

Able to see 1C-PROSPECT / CUSTOMER ACCOUNTS PENDING APPROVAL view with PROSPECTS SALES SKILL ACCOUNTS
