Able add HYGIENE and/or WATER Sales Skill from ADD SALES SKILL Button to CUSTOMER
1C – Prospect / Customer Account Pending Approval/Rejection Views
15. Prevent Duplicate Prospect Creation Across Sales Skills in CRM
column11:
Business Capability Overview:
In today’s CRM implementation, there is limited visibility when similar or duplicate prospect records are created across business divisions such as Water, Hygiene. With the introduction of the One Customer model and unified Base Customer Account (BCA) structure, it is critical to prevent the creation of redundant prospect accounts that may already exist in another division or for the same sales skill. 

 
This capability aims to introduce robust duplicate detection logic at the point of prospect creation, ensuring that users are alerted — or blocked — from creating new prospects if a similar prospect already exists in the enterprise. This avoids siloed pipelines, enhances customer visibility, and upholds the integrity of BCA relationships.
 

 
Business Requirements: 

 *  CRM must automatically surface real-time warnings or errors if a user attempts to create a new prospect account where: 

 *  A Base Customer Account already exists for the same business name or address, and 
 *  The same sales skill (e.g., Water, Hygiene) is already associated with a customer or prospect under that BCA. 
 

 *  Prospect creation should be blocked if the exact BCA and sales skill combination already exists in the system — regardless of which BU/division is initiating it. 
 *  CRM must ensure users can see existing prospects or customer records across divisions, to avoid unintentional duplication due to lack of visibility. 
 *  Duplicate detection must work both: 

 *  When creating a prospect from a BCA record, and 
 *  When creating a net new standalone prospect not linked to any BCA. 
 

 *  Where feasible, CRM should leverage MDM’s existing duplicate detection logic (via API) to enhance accuracy and enterprise-wide validation. 
 

 
Technical Considerations: 

 *  A technical spike is required to evaluate: 

 *  Whether MDM can provide duplicate checks during prospect creation (as it does today during customer setup). 
 *  What matching logic (e.g., fuzzy match, address match, name + sales skill + region) will be used to identify duplicates. 
 *  What UI feedback should be shown — warnings vs. blocking messages — and where (form-level, popup, or inline). 
 

 *  Duplicate checks should be triggered: 

 *  On save or form load (depending on performance and UX evaluation), 
 *  And possibly via pre-save plugin or JavaScript. 
 

 *  If using MDM APIs: 

 *  CRM must send minimal prospect metadata (name, address, sales skill), 
 *  MDM must return potential matches and optionally the customer number or BCA ID, 
 *  CRM must be able to interpret and act on this (e.g., prevent save, or suggest linking). 
 

 *  A fallback CRM-only logic (without MDM) should also be considered in case MDM response is slow or unavailable. 
 

 
Expected Deliverables: 

 *  Defined duplicate detection rule set and logic (fuzzy name, address, sales skill match, etc.). 
 *  Updated prospect account creation forms and scripts with duplicate warning/block logic. 
 *  Optional integration with MDM APIs for enhanced enterprise-wide duplicate detection. 
 *  Configuration or development of user-friendly error/warning messages to guide users when duplicates are found. 
 *  Unit test cases and UAT support to validate duplicate prevention logic. 
 *  Documentation of matching criteria and administrative controls for refinement in future releases.

column7: 14. Enable Early MDM Prospect Sync and Conditional BCA Linking During Prospect Creation in CRM (Deferred Backlog)
column11:
Business Capability Overview:
In the current CRM process, integration with MDM and downstream systems (such as EBS) only begins once a formal customer setup process is triggered, which typically occurs after the opportunity reaches a certain stage. However, for long-term lifecycle management and to align with One Customer principles, the business envisions a future-state capability where CRM prospect creation alone should automatically initiate interaction with MDM. 

 
This early sync should allow MDM to perform address validation, deduplication, and determine if the prospect already aligns to an existing customer record in EBS. If so, MDM should respond with the EBS customer number and allow CRM to link the prospect directly to the appropriate Base Customer Account (BCA) — avoiding duplication and simplifying the downstream customer setup.
 

 
This will enable tighter integration between CRM and MDM, better master data governance, and improved readiness for true customer lifecycle management.
 

 
Business Requirement: 

 *  When a new prospect is created in CRM, especially in FBU-flagged districts under the One Customer model, it should automatically trigger an API call to MDM, passing along address and company data for validation. 
 *  MDM should evaluate: 
 *  Whether this prospect already exists as a customer in EBS. 
 *  If so, MDM returns the EBS customer number, which CRM uses to: 

 *  Flip the prospect to a customer. 
 *  Link it to the existing Base Customer Account (BCA) using the returned EBS customer number. 
 

 *  If the prospect does not exist in EBS, MDM should hold the record (staging) and wait for CRM to trigger the full customer setup process later. 
 *  Upon full customer setup initiation, MDM will proceed with its standard flow — determining whether it is a net-new customer or a new sales skill under an existing customer, and interacting with EBS accordingly. 
 *  This allows: 

 *  Early lifecycle visibility in MDM for pipeline prospects. 
 *  Proper BCA linking for existing customers even before full setup. 
 *  Better planning and reduced duplication. 
 

 

 
Technical Considerations: 

 *  Trigger Point: Modify CRM logic to initiate MDM sync upon creation of a prospect record in FBU-flagged districts. 
 *  API Enhancements: 

 *  New lightweight prospect creation API between CRM and MDM. 
 *  Should include company name, address, email domain, etc. 
 

 *  MDM Responsibilities: 

 *  Validate and check for duplicates. 
 *  Respond with customer number if match is found in EBS. 
 *  Maintain staging record until setup is completed in CRM. 
 

 *  CRM Enhancements: 

 *  Logic to accept EBS customer number from MDM and auto-link BCA. 
 *  Logic to flip prospect ? customer if match is confirmed. 
 *  Error handling for failed match or MDM unavailability. 
 

 *  Security: Ensure proper logging, traceability, and audit. 
 *  Optional Enhancement: Future-proof by allowing delayed matching capability (e.g., if data improves later). 
 

 
Deliverables: 

 *  Technical spike to evaluate CRM feasibility for early MDM sync trigger. 
 *  API definition and documentation for CRM-to-MDM prospect exchange. 
 *  CRM workflow customization to initiate MDM call on prospect creation. 
 *  Error handling design for failed match or MDM delay. 
 *  UI update (optional): Status indicator on prospect form to show “MDM match found / pending.” 
 *  Business process documentation for One Customer lifecycle alignment. 
 *  Regression testing of standard customer setup flow to ensure no conflicts. 
 *  Deferred backlog tracking: Mark this as a post-Go-Live item unless accelerated as part of broader Customer Lifecycle Management scope.

column7: 13. ERP Source Assignment & Validation Logic Post-Conversion for One Customer Accounts
column11:
Business Capability and Objective
 
 
The One Customer model requires harmonized customer structures across Water and Hygiene. A critical capability is ensuring that ERP source assignment logic in CRM is updated post-conversion and that 1C Water (NALCO order) accounts receive the same governance checks as FBU Hygiene accounts.

 
Objective:
 

 *  Guarantee that One Customer (1C) accounts, particularly FBU Water accounts, are routed to EBS post-conversion, regardless of their global business field (e.g., NLCWater). 
 *  Maintain correct routing for non-1C accounts, ensuring they continue to follow current NLCSAP integration logic. 
 *  Enable address validation, duplicate checks, and setup governance checks for 1C Water (NALCO order) accounts, aligning them with existing FBU Hygiene processes. 
 *  Ensure a clear separation of routing behavior and setup validation between One Customer–participating accounts and the rest of the Water business. 
 

 
Business Requirements 

 *  ERP Source Update on Conversion 

 *  When a Prospect converts to a Customer, CRM must update the ERP Source System field based on One Customer routing rules. 
 *  If account has: 

 *  Global Business = Nalco Water + 1C District Flag = TRUE ? ERP Source must be ECL_EBS. 
 *  Global Business = Nalco Water + 1C District Flag = FALSE ? ERP Source remains NLC_SAP. 
 

 *  Hygiene (EBS) and non-FBU accounts ? continue existing routing rules unchanged. 
 

 *  1C Flag as Driver 

 *  The 1C flag must be the primary driver for conditional ERP source assignment logic. 
 

 *  Address Validation & Duplicate Checks 

 *  If an Nalco Water account is flagged under a 1C District and is undergoing the Customer Setup process, then: 

 *  It must undergo the same address validation, duplicate check, and customer setup governance checks that currently apply to FBU Hygiene accounts. 
 

 *  These checks must be explicitly triggered only for 1C Water accounts; non-1C Water accounts must remain excluded. 
 

 *  Form/UI Behavior 

 *  ERP Source field on the CRM form must correctly reflect ERP system assignment post-conversion. 
 *  Where 1C District Flag = TRUE, form must show ERP Source as EBS. 
 

 *  MDM Integration Alignment 

 *  After conversion, MDM APIs will: 
 *  Assign the correct ERP system (EBS). 
 *  Update the CRM account with the correct ERP account number. 
 *  Flip the account from Prospect to Customer. 
 

 *  BCA Creation Trigger 

 *  When MDM updates the account (Prospect ? Customer), and the following conditions are met: 

 *  Account ERP Source updated to EBS. 
 *  Base Customer Account (BCA) lookup is empty. 
 *  District is flagged as 1C. 
 

 *  Then CRM must automatically trigger a workflow to: 
 *  Create a new Base Customer Account (BCA) record with the same account name and number. 
 *  Associate the new BCA record with the converted Customer account. 
 

 

 
Technical Considerations 

 *  Workflows / Plugins 

 *  Implement CRM workflow or plugin on Account update event (Prospect ? Customer conversion). 
 *  Condition checks: ERP Source, District Flag (1C), BCA lookup. 
 

 *  ERP Source Logic 

 *  Overwrite global business–driven routing logic where 1C flag applies. 
 *  Retain existing NLC_SAP routing logic for non-1C Water accounts. 
 

 *  Form Changes 

 *  Ensure ERP Source field dynamically updates on account form when 1C logic applies. 
 

 *  Validation 

 *  Explicitly enable address validation, duplicate check, and setup governance rules for 1C Water accounts during the Customer Setup process. 
 

 

 

 

 
Deliverables 

 *  New Workflow / Plugin to update ERP Source System field on Account post-conversion using 1C routing logic. 
 *  Conditional logic for FBU Water accounts: Global Business = Nalco Water+ 1C Flag = TRUE ? ERP Source = EBS. 
 *  Form/UI update to reflect ERP Source overwrite on Account record. 
 *  Automation: Trigger creation of a Base Customer Account (BCA) record on conversion when conditions are met. 
 *  Validation enablement: Address validation, duplicate checks, and setup checks for 1C Water accounts (NALCO order), aligned with Hygiene process. 
 *  Audit trail for ERP Source field updates (pre- and post-conversion values). 
 *  Unit tests & regression tests to validate: 

 *  Non-FBU accounts unaffected. 
 *  Hygiene accounts continue EBS logic. 
 *  1C FBU Water accounts correctly routed to EBS and subjected to duplicate/validation checks.

column8: Override ERP Source Routing for 1C Nalco Water at Customer Setup Initiation
column11: As a system, I need to determine ERP routing at the moment a Customer Setup request is initiated so that Nalco Water accounts in 1C districts are routed via ECL_EBS (EBS) through MDM, instead of the legacy NLC_SAP (Nalco SAP) path. Non-1C Nalco Water accounts must continue using NLC_SAP (Nalco SAP). Hygiene/F&B behavior remains unchanged.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 

 *  Route 1C Nalco Water via EBS 

 *  Given an account has Global Business = Nalco Water and the account’s District is flagged as One Customer (1C = Yes) 

 *  When a Customer Setup request is initiated for the account 
 *  Then the ERP Source for that request must be set to ECL_EBS (EBS) and routed via MDM. 
 

 

 *  Retain Non-1C Nalco Water on NLC_SAP 

 *  Given an account has Global Business = Nalco Water and the account’s District is not One Customer (1C = No) 

 *  When a Customer Setup request is initiated 
 *  Then the ERP Source for that request must remain NLC_SAP (Nalco SAP) and follow the legacy routing path. 
 

 

 *  Hygiene/F&B Unchanged 

 *  Given an account belongs to Hygiene/F&B lines where routing already uses MDM ? ECL_EBS 

 *  When a Customer Setup request is initiated 
 *  Then routing remains ECL_EBS (EBS) with no change. 
 

 

 *  Validate that the users are successfully able to complete the customer set up process for both Hygiene and water accounts. 
 *  Hide Global Business Field on the Customer Set Up Forms 
 


 

 

 

 

 
Business Requirements:

 *  The routing decision must occur at Customer Setup initiation, not at account conversion. 
 *  Primary driver: District 1C flag (Yes/No). 
 *  For 1C Nalco Water: route via ECL_EBS (EBS) through MDM. 
 *  For non-1C Nalco Water: route via NLC_SAP (Nalco SAP) (no change). 
 *  Hygiene/F&B: no change, continue via ECL_EBS (EBS) through MDM. 
 *  The chosen ERP Source must be used by downstream integrations spawned by the setup request. 
 

Developer Notes:

 *  On creation of the Customer Setup record (or equivalent initiation event). 
 *  Decision logic: 

 *  If District.IsOneCustomer = true AND GlobalBusiness = Nalco Water ? set ERP Source = ECL_EBS. 
 *  Else if GlobalBusiness = Nalco Water AND District.IsOneCustomer = false ? set ERP Source = NLC_SAP. 
 *  Else (Hygiene/F&B already on MDM?ECL_EBS) ? no change. 
 

 *  Persistence: Store the ERP Source on the setup request payload/record so downstream processes use it. 
 *  Re-initiations should reapply the rule; post-submission status changes should not. 
 *  Form/UI: No UI changes required in this story (routing is integration/system-driven). 
 *  Testing: 

 *  1C Nalco Water ? setup initiation sets ECL_EBS. 
 *  Non-1C Nalco Water ? setup initiation keeps NLC_SAP. 
 *  Hygiene/F&B ? unchanged (ECL_EBS). 
 *  Re-initiation vs. post-submission behavior verified.

column8: Enable Duplicate Check for 1C Nalco Water Accounts
column11: As a user, I need the ability to run duplicate account checks for 1C Nalco Water accounts during the Customer Setup process, so that these accounts follow the same duplicate-check flow currently applied to F&B/Hygiene accounts. This ensures that no duplicate customer records are created and that data quality standards are consistent across One Customer districts.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:

 *  Enable Duplicate Check for 1C Nalco Water 

 *  Given an account belongs to a 1C district and has Global Business = Nalco Water 

 *  When a user progresses through the Customer Setup process 
 *  Then the system must run duplicate checks against MDM, just like it does for F&B/Hygiene accounts. 
 

 

 *  Duplicate Detection 

 *  Given the duplicate check is initiated 

 *  When potential duplicates are found 
 *  Then the user must be presented with the same review/correction options as in F&B/Hygiene accounts. 
 

 

 *  No Duplicates 

 *  Given the duplicate check is initiated 

 *  When no duplicates are found 
 *  Then the user can proceed with customer setup without interruption. 
 

 

 *  Non-1C Accounts Unchanged 

 *  Given an account belongs to a non-1C district, even if Global Business = Nalco Water 

 *  When customer setup is performed 
 *  Then duplicate checks must follow current (non-1C) behavior, without change. 
 

 

 

 
Business Requirements: 

 *  Extend duplicate check functionality to 1C Nalco Water accounts in Customer Setup. 
 *  Apply the same rules, workflows, and error-handling used for F&B/Hygiene accounts. 
 *  Ensure duplicates must be resolved before setup can proceed. 
 *  Preserve existing behavior for all non-1C Nalco Water accounts. 
 

 
Developer Notes: 

 *  Trigger Point: Duplicate check runs automatically after address validation is completed for 1C Nalco Water accounts. 
 *  Condition Logic: 

 *  If District.IsOneCustomer = true and GlobalBusiness = Nalco Water ? initiate duplicate check. 
 *  Otherwise ? retain current routing/behavior. 
 

 *  Integration: Call existing MDM duplicate-check service (same endpoint used today for F&B/Hygiene). 
 *  UI/UX: 

 *  Present duplicates with the same interface (confirmation, resolution options) as for F&B/Hygiene. 
 *  Block submission until duplicates are addressed. 
 

 *  Audit: Log duplicate check events/results in audit history. 
 *  Testing: 

 *  Positive: 1C Nalco Water account with duplicate ? duplicate flagged, user required to resolve. 
 *  Positive: 1C Nalco Water account with no duplicate ? user allowed to proceed. 
 *  Negative: non-1C Nalco Water ? no duplicate check triggered. 
 *  Regression: F&B/Hygiene ? unchanged.

column8: Enable Address Validation for 1C Nalco Water Accounts
column11: As a user, I need the ability to initiate address validation for 1C Nalco Water accounts during the Customer Setup process, so that these accounts follow the same MDM-driven address validation flow currently applied to F&B/Hygiene accounts. This ensures consistent data quality and alignment across all One Customer districts.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:

 *  Enable Validation for 1C Nalco Water 

 *  Given an account belongs to a 1C district and has Global Business = Nalco Water 
 *  When a user initiates address validation during customer setup 
 *  Then the address must be validated through MDM, following the same process as F&B/Hygiene accounts. 
 

 *  Validation Flow 

 *  Given a user has initiated address validation for a 1C Nalco Water account 
 *  When MDM returns results 
 *  Then the validated address must be displayed and applied, with success/failure handling consistent with F&B/Hygiene accounts. 
 

 *  Non-1C Accounts Unchanged 

 *  Given an account belongs to a non-1C district, even if Global Business = Nalco Water 
 *  When the user performs customer setup 
 *  Then no address validation process is triggered, and existing behavior remains unchanged. 
 

 *  Consistency 

 *  Given address validation is triggered for a 1C Nalco Water account 
 *  Then the user experience, outcomes, and required corrections must be the same as for F&B/Hygiene accounts. 
 

 

 
Business Requirements:

 *  Extend MDM-driven address validation to 1C Nalco Water accounts. 
 *  Apply the same validation rules, error handling, and correction steps currently enforced for F&B/Hygiene. 
 *  Ensure customer setup cannot be completed without passing address validation, same as F&B/Hygiene accounts. 
 *  No changes for non-1C Nalco Water accounts. 
 

Developer Notes:

 *  UI/Trigger: Enable address validation initiation via the existing ALPHA4 button for 1C Nalco Water accounts. 
 *  Condition Logic: 

 *  If District.IsOneCustomer = true and GlobalBusiness = Nalco Water ? show ALPHA4 button + enable validation. 
 *  Otherwise ? retain current behavior. 
 

 *  Integration: Invoke existing MDM validation service (same endpoint as F&B/Hygiene). 
 *  BPF Impact: Ensure validation is a gating step in customer setup flow for 1C Nalco Water. 
 *  Audit: Log validation events in audit history as done today for F&B/Hygiene. 
 *  Testing: 

 *  Positive: 1C Nalco Water account ? validation triggered, validated address applied. 
 *  Negative: non-1C Nalco Water account ? no validation triggered. 
 *  Regression: F&B/Hygiene ? unchanged.

column8: Automate BCA Creation and Linkage for 1C Accounts (Nalco Water & Hygiene)
column11: As a system, I need to automatically create and/or link a Base Customer Account (BCA) for 1C Nalco Water and 1C Hygiene accounts once the customer setup process is completed, so that accounts are consistently tied to their corresponding BCA and downstream processes can rely on a unified customer record.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 

 *  BCA Linkage for 1C Accounts 

 *  Given an account belongs to a 1C district and customer setup is completed 

 *  When MDM updates the account in CRM with an EBS account number and flips the account type from Prospect to Customer, Updates the ERP System to ECL_EBS 
 *  Then the account must be linked to a corresponding BCA in CRM. 
 

 

 *  Existing BCA Found 

 *  Given the EBS account number already exists in the Base Customer Account table 

 *  When linkage is triggered 
 *  Then the account must be linked to that existing BCA. 
 

 

 *  New BCA Creation 

 *  Given the EBS account number does not exist in the Base Customer Account table (Account Name, Account Number From EBS, Owner = Owner of the prospect account) 

 *  When linkage is triggered 
 *  Then a new BCA must be created and linked to the account. 
 

 

 *  Linkage Completion 

 *  Given BCA linkage is completed (whether new or existing) 
 *  Then the account’s BCA field in CRM must be populated, and the account must be available for navigation via BCA. 
 

 *  Non-1C Accounts Unchanged 

 *  Given the account does not belong to a 1C district 
 *  When customer setup is completed 
 *  Then no BCA automation should be triggered; existing behavior is preserved. 
 

 

 
Add New Nice To Have user story: When Account Name changes on the Lead Division Account (After customer set up) Update the name on the BCA 

 
Business Requirements: 

 *  Automate BCA creation and linkage for 1C Nalco Water and 1C Hygiene accounts. 
 *  Ensure all 1C accounts are connected to a BCA post–customer setup. 
 *  Reuse existing BCA if available, otherwise create a new one. 
 *  Maintain current behavior for all non-1C accounts. 
 *  Ensure consistent navigation and reporting through the BCA relationship. 
 

 
Developer Notes: 

 *  Trigger Event: 

 *  Customer setup completion updates from MDM (via EBS integration). 
 *  Specifically when: 
 *  ERP System is flipped to ECL_EBS (EBS), 
 *  Account type is changed Prospect ? Customer, 
 *  BCA Field Doesn't contain Data 
 *  Account number is Updated. 
 

 *  Condition: 

 *  If District.IsOneCustomer = true 
 

 *  Process Logic: 

 *  Check if EBS Account Number exists in Base Customer Account table. 
 *  If yes ? retrieve BCA GUID and update account’s BCA lookup. 
 *  If no ? create new BCA record, capture GUID, update account’s BCA lookup. 
 

 *  linkage should not create duplicate BCAs if one already exists. 
 *  Integration Notes: 

 *  MDM ? CRM update carries EBS account number, Account Type and ERP System. 
 *  CRM automation (workflow/plugin/Power Automate) executes linkage logic. 
 *  Error handling required if MDM update arrives but BCA creation/linkage fails. 
 

 *  Testing Scenarios: 

 *  Positive: 1C Nalco Water account setup completed ? existing BCA found ? linked. 
 *  Positive: 1C Hygiene account setup completed ? no BCA found ? new BCA created and linked. 
 *  Negative: Non-1C Nalco Water account ? no BCA automation triggered. 
 *  Regression: F&B/Hygiene accounts outside 1C ? unchanged behavior.

column7: 12. Integrate Sales Skill into MDM Prospect Conversion API and Data Flow
column11:
Business Capability Overview
As part of the One Customer transformation, Sales Skill is a critical attribute that identifies the business line managing a customer relationship (e.g., Water, Hygiene). Today, CRM stores Sales Skill as friendly, user-facing labels (e.g., “NALCO Water”, “Hygiene”), which are used throughout the system for filtering, territory assignment, opportunity management, and visibility control. 

 
However, EBS and MDM systems rely on internal codes for Sales Skills, and these codes must be properly interpreted to maintain alignment between CRM and ERP systems. This requirement ensures that MDM becomes the central authority responsible for receiving friendly Sales Skill names from CRM, interpreting them via a maintained mapping, and forwarding the appropriate Sales Skill codes to EBS.
 

 
Business Requirements 

 *  CRM will send friendly Sales Skill names (e.g., “Water”, “Hygiene”) in all customer and prospect setup requests via MDM APIs. 
 *  MDM must maintain a mapping table between CRM-friendly names and EBS-required codes. For example: 

 *  CRM “Water” ? MDM ? EBS Sales Skill Code: WTR_EBS 
 *  CRM “Hygiene” ? MDM ? EBS Sales Skill Code: HYG_EBS 
 

 *  The mapping logic must be owned and maintained by MDM, not by CRM or EBS. 
 *  MDM APIs must translate the incoming Sales Skill from CRM and include the appropriate Sales Skill Code in the payload sent to EBS. 
 *  CRM must not store or manage the ERP Sales Skill codes — CRM acts purely as the originator and consumer of friendly names. 
 *  Any updates to the Sales Skill list or mappings must follow a governance and version control process within MDM. 
 

 
Technical Considerations 

 *  CRM Layer: 

 *  Sales Skill will be stored and transmitted as a friendly label (e.g., string value “Water” or “Hygiene”). 
 *  No additional fields or lookup tables should be created in CRM to store ERP codes. 
 *  CRM team will share a mapping definition (friendly name to code) with MDM team to bootstrap and validate MDM-side logic. 
 *  No duplicate validation or code transformation logic should reside in CRM. 
 

 *  MDM Layer: 

 *  MDM will store a Sales Skill mapping configuration, either as a lookup table or configurable logic, that maps CRM Sales Skill names to EBS Sales Skill codes. 
 *  During API ingestion, MDM will: 

 *  Validate the Sales Skill friendly name. 
 *  Perform transformation based on mapping logic. 
 *  Send the correct Sales Skill code to EBS in the downstream payload. 
 

 *  MDM APIs must also expose this logic or result to CRM if required for display or validation. 
 

 *  EBS Layer: 

 *  Receives only Sales Skill codes from MDM. 
 *  No expectation of mapping logic or user-friendly labels in EBS. 
 *  Mapping and transformation should already be complete by the time payload reaches EBS. 
 

 *  Technical Spike Consideration: 

 *  A spike should be initiated to confirm whether the mapping logic is feasible in MDM and that APIs can support this transformation. 
 *  If for any reason MDM cannot support this translation, CRM may need to consider a secondary mapping layer — which is not preferred and should be avoided. 
 

 

 
Deliverables 

 *  CRM-to-MDM Sales Skill mapping document (initial definition). 
 *  MDM mapping configuration table (Sales Skill Friendly Name ? ERP Code). 
 *  Updated MDM API specifications supporting mapping logic. 
 *  Sample payloads and data dictionaries (before and after transformation). 
 *  Integration and regression test plan across CRM ? MDM ? EBS for both prospect and customer flows. 
 *  Governance documentation for Sales Skill mapping updates and ownership roles.

column7: 11. Prospect to Customer Conversion and Sales Skill Expansion with BCA Alignment
column11:
Business Capability & Overview
 
 
 
The One Customer Initiative requires a consistent, reliable process for moving prospects to customers and expanding sales skills under a Base Customer Account (BCA).

 

 *  R1 (Manual Interim Process) 

 *  Reps will continue to create prospects in CRM, but all records must be validated by Sales Ops before they are approved. 
 *  The process is manual by design: Sales Ops will review each new prospect, verify against the CLM UI, and either approve or reject the record. 
 *  A prospect BCA will only be created when the prospect is approved. If a duplicate is found, the record is rejected and linked to the correct existing BCA. 
 *  Notifications remain outside CRM (via formsite/emails), with statuses in CRM used as guardrails for visibility. 
 

 *  R2 (Future Automated Process) 

 *  The manual process will be replaced with automation once CLM APIs are available. 
 *  CRM will directly validate duplicates through MDM, create and align BCAs and sales skills, and notify Ops Admins through integrated workflows. 
 *  Sales Ops will still oversee approvals, but the mechanics will be simplified through system integration. 
 

 

 

 

 
 

 
Business Requirements 
The system must support the following business requirements:

 

 *  Prospect Creation & Status Tracking 

 *  Reps must be able to create prospects in CRM and receive a unique system-assigned identifier (P-number). 
 *  Newly created prospects must be flagged in a pending review status until validated by Sales Ops. 
 

 *  Sales Ops Validation & Decisioning 

 *  Sales Ops must have visibility into all pending prospects via a dashboard or list view in CRM. 
 *  Sales Ops must use the CLM UI to validate whether the prospect is new or a duplicate. 
 *  Sales Ops must be able to approve or reject prospects directly within CRM. 
 

 *  Prospect Approval Process 

 *  When a prospect is approved, the system must automatically create a Prospect BCA linked to the account. 
 *  The BCA must inherit core details (account name, owner, P-number) and be assigned an ERP status of “Prospect.” 
 

 *  Duplicate Prospect Handling 

 *  If a prospect is identified as a duplicate, Sales Ops must be able to mark it as rejected in CRM. 
 *  Sales Ops must then link the prospect to the correct existing BCA using the Add Sales Skill function. 
 *  If no BCA exists for the duplicate, the system must create one and then link the records. 
 *  All related data (contacts, opportunities) from the rejected record must move automatically to the correct account. 
 

 *  Sales Skill Expansion for Existing Customers 

 *  Reps must be able to request the addition of a new sales skill for an existing customer using the Add Sales Skill function. 
 *  Requests from reps must go into pending review status and be validated by Sales Ops. 
 *  Sales Ops must also be able to add sales skills directly, with their entries being automatically approved. 
 

 *  Opportunity Controls 

 *  The system must prevent opportunities from being closed when linked to accounts in pending review status. 
 *  Opportunities must only be allowed to close once the account is approved by Sales Ops. 
 

 *  Notifications & Communications 

 *  CRM must not introduce new notify buttons in R1. 
 *  Reps must continue to use external forms or email to notify Ops Admins for customer setup readiness. 
 *  CRM statuses (Pending Review, Approved, Rejected) must serve as the internal guardrails for visibility and control. 
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 
Technical Considerations 

 *  Review if New status field is needed for Pending Review, Approved, Rejected on prospect and sales skill accounts. 
 *  Automation required for: 

 *  Auto-creating a Prospect BCA on approval. 
 *  Enforcing opportunity restrictions based on status. 
 *  Auto-linking or merging rejected prospects into correct BCAs. 
 

 *  Enhanced Add Sales Skill button logic (different for reps vs Sales Ops). 
 *  Data handling for rejected records: ensure contacts, opportunities, and other child entities move correctly. 
 *  CLM API integration deferred to R2, but design must anticipate eventual automation. 
 

 

 

 
Deliverables 

 *  Updated CRM workflow for prospect creation, validation, approval, and rejection. 
 *  Prospect BCA automation upon approval. 
 *  Add Sales Skill functionality aligned with role-based differences (Rep vs Ops). 
 *  Opportunity closure restrictions tied to account status. 
 *  Sales Ops dashboards for monitoring pending prospects. 
 *  Documentation for: 

 *  R1 Manual Process (with external forms/emails). 
 *  R2 Automation Roadmap (CLM API integration). 
 

 *  User training guides for Reps and Sales Ops.

column8: Update Existing “Prospect Accounts Pending Approval” View to Exclude 1C District Accounts
column11: As a Sales Ops/CRM user, I want the existing system view Prospect Accounts Pending Approval to exclude all 1C district accounts, so that the view continues to only show pending approval prospects for non-1C geographies (e.g., Europe, other regions outside North America). This ensures that new 1C processes using dedicated views (e.g., 1C Prospect Accounts Pending Approval) remain separated and do not overlap with legacy regional workflows.
column19: Moved out of state Pending Prod Release
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:

 *  Given I am a Sales Ops user reviewing the Prospect Accounts Pending Approval view 

 *  When the system applies the filter criteria 
 *  Then no accounts belonging to 1C districts are displayed. 
 

 *  Given I am a Sales Ops user reviewing the Prospect Accounts Pending Approval view 

 *  When I search or filter prospects 
 *  Then only non-1C district accounts in “Pending Approval” status appear in the list. 
 

 *  Given a prospect belongs to a 1C district 

 *  When it is in “Pending Approval” status 
 *  Then it should appear only in the new view 1C Prospect Accounts Pending Approval and not in the legacy Prospect Accounts Pending Approval view. 
 

 *  Given a prospect belongs to a non-1C district 

 *  When it is in “Pending Approval” status 
 *  Then it should continue to appear in the Prospect Accounts Pending Approval view without change. 
 

 

 
Business Requirements: 

 *  Update the filter criteria of the existing system view Prospect Accounts Pending Approval to explicitly exclude 1C district accounts. 
 *  Ensure all current columns and formatting in the view remain unchanged. 
 *  Confirm that existing users of this view (Sales Ops, BU Admins for Europe and other regions) continue to see the same information for non-1C districts. 
 *  Ensure that 1C districts leverage the dedicated 1C Prospect Accounts Pending Approval view that has already been created. 
 *  Prevent overlap: no 1C accounts should show in both views simultaneously. 
 

 
Developer Notes 

 *  Existing view: Prospect Accounts Pending Approval (system view). 
 *  Update filter criteria to exclude records where District = 1C flagged districts. 
 *  Do not remove or alter columns in the existing view. 
 *  Cross-check alignment with the newly created view 1C Prospect Accounts Pending Approval to ensure no duplication of records. 
 *  Confirm that BQ District Manager column continues to appear in the existing (non-1C) view. 
 *  Regression test to confirm: 

 *  1C accounts appear only in the 1C-specific view. 
 *  Non-1C accounts remain unaffected in the legacy view.

column8: UI for Add Sales Skill Button – Owner Selection & Record Creation
column11:
As a CRM user (Sales Rep, District Manager, CAM, AM, or Ops Admin),
I want an “Add Sales Skill” button available on eligible Sales Skill accounts,
 
so that when I click it, I can select the correct primary owner via a dialog and create a new Sales Skill account linked to the same BCA, ensuring the record is created with the right ownership and context.
column19: Moved out of state Pending Prod Release
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 
 
 
 
 
 

 *  Button Visibility – 1C Only 

 *  Given I open a Sales Skill account of type Prospect or Customer, 
 *  When the district is flagged as 1C = Yes, 
 *  Then I should see the “Add Sales Skill” button in the command bar or form actions.  
 *  And if both Water and Hygiene Sales Skill accounts are already linked to the BCA, 
 *  Then the button must be hidden. 
 *  And for non-1C districts, the button must never be visible. 
 

 *  Dialog Launch & Owner Selection 

 *  Given I click the “Add Sales Skill” button, 
 *  When the dialog opens, 
 *  And it must display a dropdown of potential Primary owners: 

 *  Default = logged-in user. 
 *  Filtered list = all users in the related district team ( to which customer is aligned) + North America BDMs. Reps should only see the District Team members in the Dropdowns. Only BDM's should be able to see the BDM's in the Drop Downs along with the District Team members  
 *  Search must be supported. 
 

 

 *  Dialog Options 

 *  Given the dialog is open, 
 *  When I select an owner and click Submit, 
 *  Then the system must automatically open the new record in a full CRM form view, showing the cloned data with the newly set ownership and Sales Skill. 
 *  Then the dialog must call the backend API (from previous story) to clone the Sales Skill account, passing the selected owner ID.  
 *  When I click Cancel, 
 *  Then no action is taken and the dialog closes. 
 

 *  Post-Submit Behavior  

 *  Given I successfully submit the dialog, 
 *  Then the system must automatically open the new record in a full CRM form view, showing the cloned data with the newly set ownership and Sales Skill.  
 *  As an AM/DM, i should not be able to make any changes to the newly created record apart from Primary Owner. 
 

 *  Error Handling 

 *  Given the API fails or cannot create the record, 
 *  Then I must see a clear error message indicating the issue.
 
 

 

 

 

 
Developer Notes: 

 *  Implement button logic in CRM command bar ? launch custom HTML web resource dialog. 
 *  Reuse CRM styling/CSS for consistency. 
 *  Dropdown population logic: 

 *  Query users linked to BCA team. 
 *  Include BDMs regardless of team membership. 
 

 *  Pass selected owner ID + source account ID to backend API. 
 *  Backend API returns GUID of new Sales Skill account. 
 *  Use Xrm.Navigation.openForm (or equivalent) to open new record by GUID. 
 *  Ensure client-side error handling if API fails. 
 *  Test end-to-end flow: visibility ? dialog ? owner selection ? record creation ? form open.

column8: Rename System View “1C – Prospect Account Pending Approval” to “1C – Prospect / Customer Account Pending Approval” and Update Filter Logic
column11:
As a CRM Administrator, I need to rename the existing system view currently titled “1C – Prospect Account Pending Approval” to “1C – Prospect / Customer Account Pending Approval”, and also update its filter criteria to include both Prospect and Customer account types so that approvers and business users can view all One Customer (1C) accounts that are pending approval, regardless of account type.

 
Currently, the view is restricted to only Prospect-type accounts with “Pending for Approval” status.
 
With the One Customer enhancements, Customer-type accounts created through the “Add Sales Skill” process can also enter the Pending for Approval status and must be visible in the same approval view.
 

 
The change should ensure that approvers have a unified view showing both Prospect and Customer records awaiting approval, without altering any other filters or layout configurations.
 

 
Business Requirements: 

 *  Locate the existing system view named “1C – Prospect Account Pending Approval.” 
 *  Rename the view to “1C – Prospect / Customer Account Pending Approval.” 
 *  Update the filter logic as follows: 

 *  Existing filter (current): 
 *  Account Status = Active 
 *  Approval Status = Pending for Approval 
 *  Account Type = Prospect 
 *  Related District ? Contains Data 
 *  Related District ? Eligible for One Customer = Yes 
 

 *  Updated filter (new): 

 *  Account Status = Active 
 *  Approval Status = Pending for Approval 
 *  Account Type = Prospect OR Customer 
 *  Related District ? Contains Data 
 *  Related District ? Eligible for One Customer = Yes 
 

 *  Keep all existing view columns, sorting, and security roles unchanged. 
 *  Ensure the view continues to appear under the correct navigation area for Sales, Approvals, or Account Management. 
 *  Verify that the updated view continues to display only accounts belonging to One Customer (1C) districts. 
 *  Confirm that the view name and updated logic are deployed consistently across all environments (Dev, Test, UAT, and Production).
column19: Moved out of state Pending Prod Release
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 

 *  Given the system currently contains the view “1C – Prospect Account Pending Approval” 

 *  When the view is renamed 
 *  Then it must appear in CRM as “1C – Prospect / Customer Account Pending Approval.” 
 

 *  Given the view’s filter logic currently restricts results to Account Type = Prospect 

 *  When the filter condition is updated 
 *  Then the results should show both Prospect and Customer accounts pending approval, and no other functionality, columns, or layout should change. 
 

 *  Given the system currently contains the view “1C – Prospect Accounts Rejected” 

 *  When the view is renamed 
 *  Then it must appear in CRM as “1C – Prospect / Customer Accounts Rejected” 
 

 

 *  Given an account is not in a 1C-eligible district or does not meet approval criteria 

 *  When the view is refreshed 
 *  Then it must not appear in the results.

column8: Provide Reps a “Send for Setup” Button to Notify Ops Admin Teams for Prospect or Sales Skill Setup in 1C Districts
column11:
As a sales rep, district manager, or account manager in a 1C district,
I want the ability to click a “Send for Setup” button on a Sales Skill Account record (account type = prospect or customer),
 
So that I can notify Ops Admin or BU Admin teams to take the necessary setup actions in CLM (manually in R1, automated in R2).
 

 
This button must:
 

 *  Be visible only for 1C districts (hidden for non-1C). 
 *  Send a notification to Ops Admin/BU Admin teams when clicked. 
 *  Display different messages depending on the ERP status and number type (P-number vs CLM number vs ERP number). 
 *  Hide itself (or show a “notification already sent” message) after the notification is triggered, with the ability for the user to override and resend if truly necessary. 
 *  Be future-proof for R2 where the same button will trigger the automated CLM API integration instead of sending only an email.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:

 *  Scenario 1 – Prospect BCA (ERP Status = Prospect, Number = P-number): 

 *  Given I am on a Sales Skill Account linked to a Prospect BCA with a P-number 

 *  When I click “Send for Setup” 
 *  Then an email notification is sent to Ops Admin/BU Admin team with the message: 

 *  “New prospect requires setup in CLM. Please create this account in CLM and update the CLM number in CRM once available.” 
 

 

 

 *  Scenario 2 – Prospect BCA (ERP Status = Prospect, Number = CLM number): 

 *  Given I am on a Sales Skill Account linked to a Prospect BCA with a CLM number 

 *  When I click “Send for Setup” 
 *  Then an email notification is sent to Ops Admin/BU Admin team with the message: 

 *  “New sales skill requires setup in CLM for an existing prospect. Please initiate the sales skill addition in CLM.” 
 

 

 

 *  Scenario 3 – Customer BCA (ERP Status = Customer, ERP number present): 

 *  Given I am on a Sales Skill Account linked to a Customer BCA 

 *  When I click “Send for Setup” 
 *  Then an email notification is sent to Ops Admin/BU Admin team with the message: 

 *  “New sales skill requires setup in CLM for an existing customer. Please initiate the sales skill addition in CLM.” 
 

 

 

 *  Post Notification Behavior: 

 *  Given I have clicked “Send for Setup” 

 *  Then the button is hidden OR shows a message “Notification already sent on . Do you want to send again?” 
 *  And if I choose to resend, a new notification is sent and the date is updated. 
 

 

 

 
Business Requirements: 

 *  The “Send for Setup” button must: 

 *  Be visible only for 1C districts. 
 *  Be accessible to Sales Rep, District Manager, Account Manager, and Ops Admin roles. 
 *  Trigger different notification templates based on ERP status and number type. 
 *  Record the date and time of notification sent for audit and duplicate prevention. 
 *  Prevent duplicate notifications unless the user explicitly chooses to resend. 
 

 *  The notification must always go to a predefined Ops Admin/BU Admin distribution list. 
 *  Messaging must be short, clear, and business-friendly — avoid technical jargon like CLM, ERP, API in user-facing UI. 
 *  R1 = Email notification. 
 *  R2 = Automated CLM API call using the same button.(Not in scope for this user story) 
 

 
Developer Notes: 

 *  Button placement: on Sales Skill Account form ribbon (visible for 1C only). 
 *  Role-based visibility: implement via security roles & form logic. 
 *  Notification logic: 

 *  R1: Send email using CRM workflow / Power Automate flow to Ops Admin DL. 
 *  R2: Replace email action with API call to CLM service. (Not in scope for this user story) 
 

 *  Implement flag field (e.g., NotificationSent = Yes/No + DateTime) on Sales Skill Account to track and prevent duplicates. 
 *  For resend: if flag exists, show confirmation prompt before resending. 
 *  Ensure button label “Send for Setup” remains unchanged between R1 and R2 for continuity.  
 *  Notification templates should be stored centrally (configurable for future edits).

column8: Prospect Creation Defaults to Pending For Approval in 1C Districts
column11:
As a CRM user creating a new prospect in a 1C district,
I want the system to automatically assign the record a Pending Review status (or Approved if created by Sales Ops),
 
So that all new prospects undergo the correct initial validation workflow before approval or rejection decisions are taken.
column19: Moved out of state Pending Prod Release
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Prospect Creation by Sales Rep 

 *  Given I am a Sales Rep creating a prospect account in a 1C district, 

 *  When I save the record, 
 *  Then the system must set the Approval status to Pending For Approval. 
 

 

 *  Prospect Creation by Sales Ops 

 *  Given I am a Sales Ops user creating a prospect account in a 1C district, 

 *  I see the Approval Tab visible on the Account form 
 *  When I save the record, 
 *  Then the system must set the Approval status to Pending For Approval. 
 *  I can go to the Approval tab and set the Worked By Field and the Approval status to Approved. 
 

 

 *  Prospect created by Sales Rep but is reviewed by Sales Ops 

 *  Given I am a Sales Ops viewing a prospect account in a 1C district, 

 *  I see the Approval Tab visible on the Account form 
 *  I can go to the Approval tab and set the Worked By Field and the Approval status to either Approved/Rejected. 
 

 

 

 

 *  Non-1C District Accounts 

 *  Given I am creating a prospect in a non-1C district  , 

 *  When I save the record, 
 *  Then the record should follow the existing CRM logic with no Pending Review step. 
 *  The current show and hide functionality for the Approval Tab should remain unchanged  
 

 

 

 
Business Requirements: 

 *  All new prospects created in 1C districts by Sales Reps must default to Pending For Approval. 
 *  Prospects created by Sales Ops in 1C districts default directly to Pending For Approval but Sales ops should have ability to Approve/Reject them using the Approval Tab functionality. 
 *  Prospects in non-1C districts are unaffected; continue with current CRM behavior. 
 *  No duplicate detection or approval/rejection logic is included here (separate stories cover those). 
 

 
Developer Notes: 

 *  Evaluate whether to: 

 *  Extend the existing Prospect Status field with new values (Pending for Approval, Approved), or 
 *  Create a new custom field for prospect review status. 
 

 *  Apply logic only where District.1CFlag = Yes. 
 *  Build conditional defaulting: 

 *  If created by Sales Rep ? Pending for Approval. 
 *  If created by Sales Ops ? Approved. 
 

 *  Regression test to confirm: 

 *  Non-1C districts remain unchanged. 
 *  Prospect status correctly defaults based on creator role.

column8: Propagate Account Number and ERP Account Status Updates Across BCA and Linked Sales Skill Accounts (1C Districts Only)
column11:
As an Ops Admin or BU Admin working on account setup in CRM for 1C districts,
I want any update to the account number or Account Type field on a Sales Skill Account (account type = Prospect or Customer) to automatically propagate to the associated BCA record and all other Sales Skill Accounts linked to that BCA,
 
So that account numbers Account Types and BCA ERP Status remain consistent across all related records without requiring duplicate manual updates.
 

 
This functionality should:
 

 *  Apply only to 1C districts (where the district’s “One Customer” flag = Yes). 
 *  Be triggered when the account number field is updated either manually or via integration/automation. 
 *  Ensure that BCA and all linked Sales Skill Accounts always have the same account number. 
 *  Leave non-1C districts completely unaffected (no updates, no propagation).
column19: Moved out of state Pending Prod Release
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 
 
 
 
 
 

 *  Scenario 1 – Account Number Updated on Sales Skill Account (1C District): 

 *  Given I am on a Sales Skill Account in a 1C district, 

 *  When the account number field is updated, 
 *  Then the same account number automatically updates on the linked BCA record, (the BCA account number is overwritten with the new value) 
 *  And the same account number is propagated to all other Sales Skill Accounts linked to that BCA. 
 

 

 *  Scenario 2 – Account Type Updated on Sales Skill Account to Customer (1C District): 

 *  Given I am on a Sales Skill Account in a 1C district, 

 *  When the account type field or Account Number Field is updated from Prospect to Customer, 
 *  Then the BCA ERP Account Status should be updated to Active 
 *  And the account type should be updated to Customer on all other Sales Skill Accounts linked to that BCA. 
 *  And the ERP System should be updated to ECL_EBS on all Sales Skill Accounts linked to that BCA. 
 

 

 *  Scenario 3 – Account Number Updated on Non-1C District Account: 

 *  Given I am on a Sales Skill Account in a non-1C district, 

 *  When the account number field is updated, 
 *  Then no propagation occurs and only that Account is updated. 
 

 

 

 
Business Requirements: 

 *  Updates must propagate automatically without manual intervention. 
 *  The propagation must happen in real-time (immediately upon save/update of account number). 
 *  Applicable only for 1C districts. 
 *  Ensure data consistency: all linked Sales Skill Accounts under the same BCA must share the same account number as the BCA. 
 *  BCA ERP Status and the Account Type should always be in sync 
 *  Protect against partial updates: if propagation fails mid-way, system must log an error and retry. 
 *  Non-1C records should retain current behavior (no changes, no propagation). 
 

 

 
Developer Notes:

 *  Implement via CRM plugin/flow/Power Automate triggered on update of Account Number field in Sales Skill Account entity. 
 *  Logic: 

 *  Detect if Sales Skill Account belongs to a 1C district (check district “One Customer” flag). 
 *  Identify the linked BCA record. 
 *  Update BCA AccountNumber field with new value. 
 *  Update all other Sales Skill Accounts linked to that BCA with the same value. 
 

 *  Error handling: 

 *  Ensure transactional integrity — either all updates succeed, or none. 
 *  Log failures in error tracking for remediation. 
 

 *  R1: Triggered when Ops Admin manually enters account number or updates it post-CLM setup. 
 *  R2: Triggered when CLM/ERP integration automatically updates account number via interface. 
 *  Maintain an audit trail (modified by, modified on) for all records updated. 
 *  Confirm that existing duplicate detection rules for account numbers still function as expected (don’t bypass them).

column8: Prevent New Prospect Number Generation When Linked to an Existing BCA
column11:
As a Sales Rep or District Manager,
I want any new Sales Skill Account (Account Type = Prospect) created under an existing Prospect BCA in a 1C district (where the district’s 1C flag = Yes) to inherit the BCA’s existing prospect number,
 
So that all prospect sales skill accounts tied to a 1C Prospect BCA share the same prospect number, ensuring data consistency and avoiding duplicate P-numbers.
 

 

 
Ensure that if a prospect is added under an existing Base Customer Account (BCA), the account inherits the BCA’s prospect number instead of generating a new one.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 

 *  Scenario 1 – Sales Skill Account Under Prospect BCA (1C District) 

 *  Given I create a new Sales Skill Account (Account Type = Prospect) under an existing Prospect BCA in a 1C district 

 *  When I save the new account 
 *  Then the account must inherit the prospect number from the BCA instead of generating a new one. 
 

 

 *  Scenario 2 – Sales Skill Account Without BCA Link (1C District) 

 *  Given I create a new Sales Skill Account (Account Type = Prospect) in a 1C district that is not linked to a BCA 

 *  When I save the account 
 *  Then CRM must generate a new unique P-number as per today’s logic. 
 

 

 *  Scenario 3 – Non-1C Districts 

 *  Given I create a new Sales Skill Account (Account Type = Prospect) in a district where the 1C flag = No 

 *  When I save the account 
 *  Then CRM must use the current P-number generation logic only (no inheritance from BCA). 
 

 

 *  Scenario 4 – Data Integrity Validation  

 *  Given I attempt to manually override a prospect number on a Sales Skill Account (Account Type = Prospect) linked to a 1C Prospect BCA  

 *  When I try to save changes  
 *  Then CRM must prevent the override and enforce consistency with the Prospect BCA’s assigned number.  
 

 

 

 
Business Requirements: 

 *  This rule applies only for 1C districts (1C flag = Yes). 
 *  For 1C districts: 

 *  If the Sales Skill Account (Account Type = Prospect) is linked to a Prospect BCA ? Inherit BCA’s prospect number. 
 *  If it is not linked ? Generate new P-number. 
 

 *  For non-1C districts: continue existing CRM logic with no change. 
 *  Enforce one Prospect BCA = one P-number across all linked Sales Skill Accounts (Account Type = Prospect). 
 *  Ensure clean mapping at cutover: all 1C prospects must be tied to Prospect BCAs with the correct P-number inheritance. 
 *  Duplicate number detection handled separately (cross-reference existing duplicate detection user story). 
 

 
Developer Notes: 

 *  Modify CRM prospect number generation logic: 

 *  Add conditional check for 1C district flag. 
 *  If 1C flag = Yes + BCA linked ? Inherit P-number. 
 *  If 1C flag = Yes + no BCA link ? Generate new unique P-number. 
 *  If 1C flag = No ? Retain current logic. 
 

 *  Prevent manual override: 

 *  Apply save-time validation for accounts tied to 1C Prospect BCAs. 
 

 *  Ensure automation is triggered after cutover to backfill BCAs and align with 1C prospect logic. 
 *  R1 scope: CRM logic change. 
 *  R2 scope: Validate synchronization with CLM/MDM once integrated.

column8: Prevent “Closing (Won)” for Opportunities Linked to Customer Accounts in “Pending for Approval” Status (1C Districts Only)
column11:
As a CRM Business User, I need the system to restrict users from closing opportunities as Won when the related Customer Sales Skill Account is in “Pending for Approval” status, so that opportunities tied to unapproved customer records cannot be finalized prematurely.

 
This rule should apply only to accounts belonging to One Customer (1C) districts. 
For non-1C districts, the behavior should remain unchanged, allowing opportunities to be closed regardless of the account’s approval status.
 

 
Once the customer account’s approval status transitions to Approved, users should then be allowed to close opportunities as Won following standard business rules.
 

 
Currently, there is no restriction on closing opportunities linked to customer accounts regardless of approval status. With the 1C implementation, an additional control is required to ensure the approval workflow is completed before revenue recognition or deal closure occurs.
 

 
Business Requirements: 

 *  Identify opportunities where the parent Account (Customer Sales Skill Account) belongs to a 1C district. 
 *  During the Close as Won operation (button click or stage change to “Won”): 

 *  The system must check the Approval Status of the related Account. 
 *  If the Approval Status = Pending for Approval, the system must block the Close as Won action. 
 *  The user should receive a clear message such as: 
 *  “This opportunity cannot be closed as Won because the associated customer account is still Pending for Approval.” 
 

 *  The Close as Lost operation must continue to be allowed. 
 *  If the Account’s Approval Status = Approved, users must be able to Close as Won without restriction. 
 *  For non-1C district accounts, no change in behavior — opportunities can be closed normally regardless of approval status. 
 *  The rule must apply consistently across: 

 *  The Close as Won button 
 *  The Opportunity Business Process Flow (BPF) when moving to the “Won” stage 
 *  Any automation or workflow that programmatically closes opportunities as Won.
column14: FBU_QAPush_Nov_Major3; PRNotRaised; ProdPush_Nov_FBU_R1; ReadyforDemo; validated in QA; validated in Test
column19: Moved out of state Pending Prod Release
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 

 *  Given an opportunity belongs to an Prospect / Customer account in a 1C district and the account’s Approval Status = Pending for Approval 

 *  When a user attempts to Close the Opportunity as Won 
 *  Then the system must prevent the action and display a message stating that the associated account is pending approval. 
Error: Account Pending Sales Ops Approval 
The account is currently under review and pending approval from Sales Operations.
Please contact the Sales Ops team to complete the approval process before claiming the opportunity as Won. 
 

 

 *  Given an opportunity belongs to an Prospect / Customer account in a 1C district and the account’s Approval Status = Approved 

 *  When the user performs to Close the opportunity as Won 
 *  Then the system must allow the closure to proceed successfully. 
 

 *  Given an opportunity is associated with a non-1C district account 

 *  When a user performs Close as Won 
 *  Then the opportunity must close normally, regardless of the account’s approval status. 
 

 *  Given a user attempts to Close as Lost for an opportunity under a 1C district 

 *  When the Prospect / Customer account’s approval status is Pending for Approval 
 *  Then the system must still allow the Close as Lost action to complete successfully. 
 

 

 
Dependencies: 

 *  Account Approval Status field and Approval Tab must already exist and function correctly. 
 *  Approval workflow and status transition (Pending for Approval ? Approved) must be in place.

column11:
Test Scenarios:

column8: Ensure Corporate Account (Ultimate Parent) is Cloned and Synced Across Sales Skills During Add Sales Skill
column11:
As a CRM user,
I want the Corporate Account (Ultimate Parent) value to be automatically inherited and kept in sync when creating or updating sales-skill accounts through the Add Sales Skill process
 
so that all sales-skill versions of an account consistently reflect the correct corporate parent and data remains aligned across Water and Hygiene sales-skill accounts.
 

 
This ensures that when a new sales-skill account is cloned or when users manually update the Corporate Account field, the value remains unified across all accounts linked to the same BCA in the 1C model.
column14: CodeReviewed; FBU R2 Release; FBU_QAPush_Dec_Major3; ReadyforDemo
column19: Moved out of state In QA
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Clone Corporate Account When Creating a New Sales Skill (Hygiene ? Water) 

 *  Given a user clicks Add Sales Skill on a Hygiene account 
 *  And that Hygiene account has a Corporate Account (Ultimate Parent) value 
 *  When the system creates the new Water sales-skill account 
 *  Then the Corporate Account value must be copied to the newly created Water account 
 *  And the Water account must save the same Corporate Account value. 
 

 *  Clone Corporate Account When Creating a New Sales Skill (Water ? Hygiene) 

 *  Given a user clicks Add Sales Skill on a Water account 
 *  And that Water account has a Corporate Account value 
 *  When the system creates the new Hygiene sales-skill account 
 *  Then the Corporate Account value must be copied from the Water account 
 *  And users may review and update it after creation if needed. 
 

 *  Corporate Account Sync Across All Sales Skills Under the Same BCA 

 *  Given multiple sales-skill accounts (Water and Hygiene) belong to the same BCA 
 *  When a user updates the Corporate Account value on any one of those accounts 
 *  Then the system must automatically update the same field on all other sales-skill accounts linked to the same BCA 
 *  And all related sales-skill accounts must remain in sync with the updated value. 
 

 *  Sync Only Within 1C Structure 

 *  Given a Water or Hygiene account is not part of the 1C district 
 *  When the Corporate Account field is edited 
 *  Then no sync should occur 
 *  And the field remains independent per account (existing behavior).

column8: Enable Account Search by Address, Name, or Number in CRM
column11:
As a Sales Rep or District Manager,
I want to be able to search for account records in CRM using address, account name, or account number,
 
So that I can quickly find existing sales skill account records (whether prospects or customers) and avoid creating duplicates.
 

 

 

 

 

 
Allow reps to search accounts using address as well as existing name or number fields, to make it easier to find customers or prospects.
column19: Moved out of state Pending Prod Release
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 
 

 *  Scenario 1 – Search by Address 

 *  Given I am a Sales Rep or District Manager in CRM 

 *  When I search for an account by entering an address (full or partial) in the global search or quick find view 
 *  Then the system should return all matching sales skill account records that contain that address information 
 

 

 *  Scenario 2 – Search by Name 

 *  Given I am a Sales Rep or District Manager in CRM 

 *  When I search for an account by account name 
 *  Then the system should return matching sales skill account records, including both prospects and customers 
 

 

 *  Scenario 3 – Search by Number 

 *  Given I am a Sales Rep or District Manager in CRM 

 *  When I search for an account using its account number (P-number, CLM number, or ERP number) 
 *  Then the system should return the exact matching sales skill account record linked to that number 
 

 

 

 
Business Requirements: 

 *  The CRM Quick Find View for Accounts must be enhanced to include the following searchable fields: 

 *  Account Name 
 *  Account Number (P-number, CLM number, ERP number) 
 *  Address (Street1, City, State, Postal Code — any of these should return results) 
 

 *  Search must return Sales Skill Account Records only (prospects or customers). 
 *  Search results must include records regardless of whether they are linked to a Prospect BCA or Customer BCA. 
 *  Users must be able to distinguish in the search results whether the returned record is: 

 *  A Sales Skill Account linked to a Prospect BCA, or 
 *  A Sales Skill Account linked to a Customer BCA. 
 

 *  No change in the current behavior for searching by name or number; only address-based search capability is net-new. 
 *  Search results should display account type (Prospect vs Customer) and Sales Skill clearly to aid user selection. 
 

 
Developer Notes: 

 *  Update Account entity Quick Find View in CRM to add Address1: Line1, Address1: City, Address1: Postal Code, and other relevant address fields into the indexed search fields. 
 *  Ensure search indexing performance is tested — particularly for address fields, which may increase result size. 
 *  Security: Respect existing CRM security roles/record visibility rules. Search should only return records the user has access to. 
 *  Regression test: Ensure global search performance is not degraded, and existing filters on inactive accounts still work as designed.

         Scenario 2: Verify Search by Account Name.

column8: Detect and Alert Users of Duplicate Prospects Across Sales Skills Before Save
column11:
As a Sales Rep or District Manager,
I want CRM to automatically check for duplicates when I create a new prospect sales skill account,
 
So that I am alerted if a similar prospect already exists at the same location and can link to it instead of unintentionally creating a duplicate.
 

 

 

 
When reps create a new prospect account, CRM should check for duplicates (based on address and other details) and guide users to link to an existing record instead of creating a duplicate.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 

 *  Scenario 1 – Duplicate Prospect Detected 

 *  Given I enter prospect details (address, name, sales skill) and click Save for 1 C District 

 *  When CRM detects a matching prospect in the system (based on address + fuzzy match rules) 
 *  Then a pop-up message appears with two clear options: 

 *  Recommended Option (highlighted): “Existing prospect with similar details found for [XYZ] Sales Skill. [View Record] ? Use ‘Add New Sales Skill’ if needed.” 
 *  Secondary Option: “Proceed Anyway (Not Recommended).” 
 

 

 

 *  Scenario 2 – User Selects “View Record” 

 *  Given I select the “View Record” option from the duplicate detection pop-up 

 *  When the record opens 
 *  Then I am navigated to the existing prospect sales skill account form, where I can use the Add New Sales Skill button to continue. 
 

 

 *  Scenario 3 – User Selects “Proceed Anyway” 

 *  Given I select the “Proceed Anyway” option from the duplicate detection pop-up 

 *  When the record is saved 
 *  Then CRM creates a new prospect sales skill account without linking to the existing one. 
 

 

 *  Scenario 4 – No Duplicate Found 

 *  Given I enter prospect details and click Save 

 *  When no duplicate is found 
 *  Then no pop-up is shown, and the record is saved successfully as a new prospect. 
 

 

 *  Scenario 5 – Non-1C Districts 

 *  Given I enter prospect details and click Save 

 *  When I save the account 
 *  Then no pop-up is shown, and the record is saved successfully as a new prospect. 
 

 

 

 
Business Requirements: 

 *  Duplicate detection must trigger before save of a new prospect sales skill account. 
 *  Matching rules must include: 

 *  Address (primary, fuzzy match supported). 
 *  Name (exact or partial, depending on business rules). 
 

 *  Pop-up must always: 

 *  Show a recommended option to view and link to the existing record. 
 *  Provide a secondary option to proceed anyway, clearly marked as not recommended. 
 

 *  Messages must be short, crisp, and clear (business-friendly wording): 

 *  Recommended Option Label: “Similar prospect exists. [View Record] ? Use ‘Add New Sales Skill’ to continue.” 
 *  Secondary Option Label: “Proceed Anyway (Not Recommended).” 
 

 *  If the user chooses “View Record,” system must: 

 *  Open the existing sales skill account form. 
 *  Allow user to continue by clicking the Add New Sales Skill button. 
 

 *  If no duplicates exist, record saves without interruption. 
 *  Duplicate bypass (Proceed Anyway) must be logged for audit purposes. 
 

 
Developer Notes: 

 *  Implement pre-save duplicate detection plugin/logic on the prospect sales skill entity. 
 *  Leverage fuzzy address matching + name . 
 *  Pop-up implementation: 

 *  Modal dialog with two action buttons (default highlight on “View Record”). 
 *  Labels and text must be configurable for easy business-driven updates. 
 

 *  “View Record” button must: 

 *  Open the matched record (form view). 
 *  Not create a new record during this action. 
 

 *  “Proceed Anyway” button must: 

 *  Complete the save and create a new record. 
 *  Write an entry to audit log with user, timestamp, record details, and “duplicate bypassed.” 
 

 *  If multiple duplicates are found, system should display the closest/highest match and allow the user to choose which one to view. 
 *  Ensure performance: duplicate check must not significantly delay save operations. 
 *  R1: Duplicate detection handled in CRM. 
 *  R2: Upgrade to CLM/MDM service-driven duplicate check (to replace or augment CRM logic).

column8: Data Migration- Create a Prospect BCA and Update Sales Skill at Cutover
column11:
As a Sales Operations Lead,
 
I want all in-scope prospect accounts at cutover to be automatically linked to a Prospect BCA and updated with the correct Sales Skill,
 
So that every prospect has a standardized structure (Prospect BCA + Sales Skill account) before go-live, enabling consistent future customer setup and avoiding duplicate handling issues.
 

 
Business Acceptance Criteria:

 *  Scenario 1 – Create Prospect BCA for Every In-Scope Prospect for 1C project 

 *  Given I have a finalized list of in-scope prospect accounts provided by the business 

 *  When the cutover process is executed 
 *  Then the system must automatically create a new Prospect BCA record for each prospect account (if one does not already exist) 
 

 

 *  Scenario 2 – Populate Sales Skill on Prospect Accounts 

 *  Given I have a prospect account included in the cutover scope 

 *  When the Prospect BCA is created 
 *  Then the Sales Skill field on that prospect must be populated as per business-provided mapping rules 
 

 

 *  Scenario 3 – Handle Multiple Prospects at the Same Address 

 *  Given there are two or more prospect accounts with the same address that the business has determined are not duplicates 

 *  When the cutover process runs 
 *  Then the system must ensure they are tied to the same Prospect BCA (not separate ones) 
 

 

 *  Scenario 4 – Exclude Out-of-Scope Prospects 

 *  Given a prospect account is not included in the business-provided cutover scope list 

 *  When the cutover process runs 
 *  Then no Prospect BCA should be created for it 
 

 

 

 
Business Requirements: 

 *  Business must provide a cleaned, finalized list of prospects in scope for cutover. 

 *  List must exclude duplicates and invalid records. 
 *  Business must define logic for grouping multiple prospects at the same address. 
 

 *  For each prospect in the list: 

 *  Create a Prospect BCA in CRM (if not already existing). 
 *  Use the prospect’s CRM-generated P-number as the BCA number. 
 *  Set ERP Status = Prospect on the new BCA. 
 *  Populate Sales Skill field on the prospect account based on business-defined mapping. 
 

 *  If multiple prospects are deemed non-duplicates at the same address: 

 *  Link them to the same Prospect BCA (do not create multiple BCAs). 
 

 *  Ensure the output structure at cutover is: 

 *  Prospect BCA ? one or more Prospect Sales Skill Accounts (prospects) 
 

 *  Exclude prospects not identified in scope. 
 

 
Developer Notes: 

 *  Migration script required to: 

 *  Iterate through the provided list of prospect accounts. 
 *  Check if BCA already exists; if not, create a new Prospect BCA record. 
 *  Populate the BCA number with the P-number from the prospect. 
 *  Update ERP Status on the BCA = “Prospect.” 
 *  Update Sales Skill field on prospect accounts per mapping rules. 
 *  Handle grouping rules: if multiple prospects are mapped to the same BCA, ensure all are linked correctly. 
 *  Dependencies: 

 *  Business to provide finalized list of in-scope prospects and address grouping/duplicate-handling rules prior to execution. 
 

 

 

 *  Ensure migration is idempotent (rerun safe) — does not create duplicate BCAs if executed multiple times. 
 *  Validate migration with reconciliation reports (number of prospects in scope vs number of BCAs created). 
 *  Regression testing: confirm that non-scope prospects are untouched. 
 *  At cutover, automatically create a Prospect BCA for each prospect account and ensure the sales skill field is populated

column8: Create Prospect BCA upon Prospect Approval
column11:
As a Sales Ops user,
When I approve a prospect account in CRM that does not yet have a Base Customer Account (BCA) tied to it,
 
I want the system to automatically generate a new Prospect BCA record,
 
So that the prospect is properly linked to a BCA and the BCA inherits the correct identifiers, status, and ownership.
column14: CodeReviewed; FBU_QAPush_Oct_Major1; ProdPush_Nov_FBU_R1; ReadyforDemo; validated in QA; validated in Test
column19: Moved out of state Pending Prod Release
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:

 *  BCA Creation on Approval 

 *  Given I am a Sales Ops user approving a prospect in CRM, 
 *  When the prospect does not have an existing BCA linked, 
 *  Then the system must automatically create a new BCA record. 
 

 *  BCA Number Assignment 

 *  Given a new BCA is created, 
 *  Then the BCA Number should be inherited directly from the Prospect P-Number on the account. 
 

 *  Name Inheritance 

 *  Given a new BCA is created, 
 *  Then the BCA Name should inherit the value from the Prospect Account Name field. 
 

 *  ERP Status Setting 

 *  Given a new BCA is created, 
 *  Then the ERP Status of the BCA should default to Prospect. 
 

 *  Ownership Propagation 

 *  Given a new BCA is created, 
 *  Then the Owner of the Prospect Account should also be assigned as the Owner of the new BCA. 
 

 *  Linking Back to Prospect 

 *  Given a new BCA is created, 
 *  Then the Base Customer Account Field on the Prospect Sales Skill Account should be updated with the newly created Prospect BCA . 
 

 *  Non-1C Accounts Exclusion 

 *  Given a Prospect belongs to a non-1C district, 
 *  Then this automation should not apply and no BCA should be created. 
 

 

 
Business Requirements: 

 *  Every approved Prospect in a 1C district must have a BCA created and linked if one does not already exist. 
 *  BCA must inherit P-Number, Name, ERP Status, and Owner directly from the Prospect Account. 
 *  System must update the Prospect’s BCA Lookup with the new BCA automatically. 
 *  For non-1C Prospects, current CRM process remains unchanged (no auto BCA creation). 
 *  Ensures consistency in linking Sales Skill Accounts to BCAs and prevents manual errors in setup. 
 

 
Developer Notes: 

 *  Confirm whether to leverage existing BCA creation plugin/logic or create a new workflow for this scenario. 
 *  Ensure logic checks if BCA Lookup is already populated; if yes, skip creation. 
 *  Create/update process should run synchronously on status change to Approved. 
 *  Update Prospect Account’s BCA Lookup field with the new BCA record’s GUID. 
 *  Ensure error handling if BCA creation fails (log entry + alert). 
 *  Security: Only users with appropriate Sales Ops/Admin roles should trigger the automation. 
 *  Unit test: Approving a Prospect ? New BCA is created, linked, and populated as expected.
