 *  Once a new BCA is created, verify the Owner of the BCA should be same as the Prospect Account Owner (i.e the District Team)
 
 

 *  Validate Linking Back to Prospect 

 *  Once a new BCA is created, verify the Base Customer Account Field on the Prospect Sales Skill Account should be updated with the newly created Prospect BCA .
 
 

 *  Validate Non-1C Accounts Exclusion 

 *  If a Prospect belongs to a non-1C district, then verify this auto BCA creation should not apply and no BCA should be created.
 
 

 *  Validate BCA Creation on Rejection 

 *  As a Ops Admin when rejecting a prospect (Approval Status: Rejected) that is owned by a 1C District when the prospect does not have an existing BCA linked, verify the system should NOT automatically create a new BCA record  
 

 *  Validate BCA Creation on Approving a Rejected Prospect 

 *  As a Ops Admin when approving a rejected prospect (Approval Status: Approved) that is owned by a 1C District when the prospect does not have an existing BCA linked, verify the system should automatically create a new BCA record

column8: Create 1C- Prospect Accounts Rejected System View
column11:
As a Sales Ops user,
 
When I mark a prospect as Rejected,
 
I want the prospect to automatically appear in a 1C- Prospect Accounts Rejected System View,
 
So that I can easily review all rejected records, identify the correct active accounts, and take manual action such as merging or re-approving as needed.
column19: Moved out of state Pending Prod Release
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 
 
 
 
 
 

 *  Rejected Prospect Visibility 

 *  Given a Sales Ops user rejects a prospect, 
 *  When the Approval status is set to Rejected, 
 *  Then the record should appear in the 1C- Prospect Accounts Rejected System View. 
 

 *  Critical Information in View 

 *  Given a rejected prospect is displayed in the view, 
 *  Then the following information should be shown: 
 

 

 *  Account Name 
 *  Account Name 2 
 *  Account Number 
 *  Sales Skill 
 *  City 
 *  State/Province 
 *  Country 
 *  Account Type 
 *  Corporate Account 
 *  District 
 *  Primary Owner 
 *  Owner 
 *  Market Segment 
 *  Subsegment 
 *  Description (Subsegment) (Subsegment) 
 *  Sales Region (District) (District) 
 *  Sales Subregion (District) (District) 
 *  Approval Status 
 *  Associate District Manager (District) (District) 
 *  District Manager (District) (District) 
 *  AVP (District) (District) 
 *  BDM 
 *  CAM 
 *  Local CAM 
 *  GAM (Corporate Account) (Corporate Account) 
 *  Associate AM / Technician 
 *  Sales Manager 
 *  Created On 
 

 

 

 

 *  Filtering 

 *  Given a user opens the Rejected Prospect view, 
 *  Then only records with Approval status = Rejected, District Has 1C flag and Status = Inactive should appear. 
 

 *  Merge Preparation  

 *  Given a rejected prospect is in the view,  
 *  When the Sales Ops user determines the correct active record,  
 *  Then they should activate the Rejected record first and 
 *  Then they should be able to use standard CRM Merge functionality manually to merge the rejected prospect into the active record.  
 

 *  Deactivation on Merge  

 *  Given a rejected prospect is merged into another account,  
 *  Then the rejected record should automatically be deactivated via out-of-the-box CRM behavior.  
 

 *  Re-Approval Flexibility  

 *  Given a rejected prospect was marked in error,  
 *  When a Sales Ops user updates its status back to Approved by activating the record and changing the Worked By 
 *  Then the standard approved prospect process (including BCA creation/linking) should apply.  
 

 *  Sorting 

 *  The view should be sorted from Newest to Oldest based on Created On 
 

 

 
Business Requirements: 

 *  A 1C- Prospect Accounts Rejected system view must exist in CRM to surface all rejected prospects for Sales Ops review. 
 *  Sales Skill column must be included to help identify alignment. 
 *  The view should mimic “1C- Prospect Accounts Pending Approval” with only filter adjusted to pull Prospects with Approval Status = Rejected 
 *  Sales Ops should be able to update statuses manually (Rejected ? Approved) where appropriate. 
 *  Merging rejected prospects into active accounts will be a manual process using CRM’s native merge; this user story only ensures the visibility and setup for rejected records. 
 

 
Developer Notes: 

 *  Create a new System View called “1C- Prospect Accounts Rejected ” 
 *  Filtering: Approval Status = Rejected, Status = Inactive and District is flagged as 1C 
 *  Columns: replicate “1C- Prospect Accounts Pending Approval” view 
 *  Confirm native merge functionality works seamlessly on records with Rejected status. 
 *  Regression test: Verify rejected records do not appear in Pending or Approved dashboards/views. 
 *  The view should be visible in the Ecolab Sales and Ecolab Admin MDA

column8: Block Opportunity Closure for Pending or Rejected 1C Accounts
column11:
As a CRM DM ,
 
I want the system to prevent me from closing opportunities when the linked 1C account is in Pending for Approval or Rejected status,
 
So that Sales Ops can first validate or correct the account setup and ensure data integrity before opportunities are finalized.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: (Validation Only, No Development Effort Needed)
 
 

 *  Scenario 1 – Pending for Approval 

 *  Given I am a DM  working on an opportunity linked to a 1C account (prospect or customer sales skill) 
 *  And the account’s status = Pending for Approval 
 *  When I attempt to close the opportunity as Won 
 *  Then the system should block the closure as long as the Account Type on the Account is Prospect 

 

 

 *  Scenario 2 – Rejected Accounts 

 *  Given I am a DM  working on an opportunity linked to a 1C account 
 *  And the account’s status = Rejected 
 *  When I attempt to close the opportunity as Won  
 *  Then the system should block the closure as long as the Account Type on the Account is Prospect 

 

 

 *  Scenario 3 – Approved Accounts 

 *  Given I am a DM  working on an opportunity linked to a 1C account 
 *  And the account’s status = Approved 
 *  When I attempt to close the opportunity as Won 
 *  Then the system should block the closure as long as the Account Type on the Account is Prospect 
 

 *  Scenario 4 – Non-1C Accounts 

 *  Given I am a DM  working on an opportunity linked to a non-1C account 
 *  When I attempt to close the opportunity as Won or Lost 
 *  Then the system should block the closure as long as the Account Type on the Account is Prospect 
 

 *  Scenario 5 – Customer Accounts 

 *  Given I am a DM working on an opportunity linked to a account with Account Type = Customer 
 *  When I attempt to close the opportunity as Won or Lost 
 *  Then the system should allow me to close the opportunity 
 

 

 

 
Business Requirements: 

 *  Opportunities linked to 1C Prospect accounts in Pending for Approval or Rejected or Approved status must not be closable. 
 *  Opportunities can be closed normally once the account is in Converted to Customer.

column8: Backend API for Add Sales Skill – Clone Sales Skill Account
column11:
As a CRM system,
I need a backend API service that can create a new Sales Skill account record under the same Base Customer Account (BCA) when invoked,
 
so that users can expand an existing customer or prospect to additional sales skills without creating duplicate or unlinked records.

 *  Sales Skill Defaulting 

 *  Given a Sales Skill account is cloned, 
 *  When the API executes, 
 *  Then the Sales Skill field must be automatically set to the “other” skill (e.g., Water ? Hygiene or Hygiene ? Water), and the field must be locked. 
 

 *  Ownership Assignment 

 *  Given a new Sales Skill record is created, 
 *  When the record is saved, 
 *  Then the record must be assigned an owner. 
 *  Note: For testing purposes in this story, ownership will temporarily be assigned to a fixed test/system user (e.g., CRM Online or dummy DM). A future UI story will introduce dynamic primary owner selection and integrate with this API. 
 

 *  Record Linkage 

 *  Given a new Sales Skill record is created, 
 *  When the record is saved, 
 *  Then the record must be automatically linked to the same BCA as the source account. 
 

 

 

 

 

 
Business Requirements: 

 *  Support creation of Sales Skill accounts only for 1C districts. 
 *  Inherit field values from the source account as per mapping table. 
 *  Always default the Sales Skill field to the opposite skill and lock it. 
 *  Ensure ownership assignment follows the temporary fixed-user approach for this story. 
 *  Ensure non-1C districts cannot invoke this API. 
 

 
Developer Notes: 

 *  Build a custom API/plugin that: 

 *  Accepts the Source Sales Skill Account ID. 
 *  Clones the record and links it to the same BCA. 
 *  Temporarily assigns ownership to a fixed test/system user (hardcoded or configurable). 
 

 *  This story validates cloning logic and field mapping. 
 *  Follow-up UI/Dialog story will: 

 *  Collect primary owner from the user, 
 *  Pass it to this API, 
 *  Replace fixed ownership assignment with dynamic selection. 
 

 *  Implement error handling and clear error messages. 
 *  Capture audit logs: source account, new account, assigned owner.

column8: Automatically Set “Pending for Approval” Status for New Sales Skill Customer Records (1C Districts)
column11:
As a CRM Functional User, when I create a new sales skill record under an existing customer using the Add Sales Skill button, the newly created record must automatically have its approval status set to “Pending for Approval.”
Even though the new account record is of Account Type = Customer, the Approval tab should remain visible and accessible on the account form to allow the review and approval process to proceed. 
This behavior must apply only to One Customer (1C) districts. 
For non-1C districts, the current logic remains unchanged:
 

 *  The Approval tab should remain hidden for Customer-type accounts. 
 *  The approval fields should not be auto-populated or editable. 
 

 
This change ensures that any new sales skill account created within 1C districts undergoes the same approval process as prospects, maintaining consistency and governance across divisions. 

 
Business Requirements 

 *  When a user clicks Add Sales Skill on an existing customer account within a 1C district, the system must: 

 *  Automatically set the Approval Status = Pending for Approval on the new record. 
 *  Ensure that the Approval tab is visible on the new account form. 
 *  Allow approvers or authorized roles to access and complete the approval workflow from the Approval tab. 
 

 *  For non-1C districts, the system must: 

 *  Maintain current behavior (Approval tab hidden, no approval status set). 
 *  Not apply any approval workflow logic for customer-type accounts created via Add Sales Skill. 
 

 *  The Account Type for the newly created record should remain Customer. 
 *  The logic must execute automatically as part of the Add Sales Skill creation process — no manual intervention required. 
 *  The “Pending for Approval” status must trigger the standard approval workflow already defined for the 1C approval process.
column19: Moved out of state Pending Prod Release
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 

 *  Given a user is in a 1C district and clicks Add Sales Skill on an existing Customer account 

 *  When the new Customer (sales skill) record is created 
 *  Then the system must automatically set its Approval Status = Pending for Approval and display the Approval tab on the account form. 
 

 *  Given a newly created Customer record under a 1C district has Approval Status = Pending for Approval 

 *  When the account form is opened 
 *  Then the Approval tab must be visible and accessible, allowing approvers (Ops Amin) to complete the review process. 
 

 *  Given a user is in a non-1C district and adds a new sales skill under an existing Customer  

 *  When the new Customer record is created  
 *  Then the Approval tab must remain hidden, and no “Pending for Approval” status should be applied.  
 

 *  Given a customer in a 1C district is created in CRM via Integrations  

 *  Then the system must automatically set its Approval Status = Approved and display the Approval tab on the account form.

column8: Automatically Create and Link a Prospect BCA When a New Prospect Account is Created
column11:
As a Sales Rep or District Manager in a 1C District,
I want CRM to automatically create and link a Prospect BCA whenever I create a new Sales Skill Account (Account Type = Prospect),
 
So that all 1C prospect accounts are properly tied to a Prospect BCA and downstream CLM/MDM processes remain consistent.
 

 

 
When a new prospect account is created in CRM, the system should automatically generate a Prospect BCA record (with status = Prospect) and link it to that account.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:

 *  Scenario 1 – New Prospect Created (1C Only) 

 *  Given I create a new Sales Skill Account (Account Type = Prospect) in a 1C District 

 *  When I save the record 
 *  Then CRM should automatically create a Prospect BCA and link it to the new account. 
 

 

 *  Scenario 2 – BCA Field Values 

 *  Given CRM creates a new Prospect BCA 

 *  When the record is created 
 *  Then it should inherit the following values from the linked Sales Skill Account: 

 *  Name = Sales Skill Account Name 
 *  Account Number = Sales Skill Account Number (P-number or inherited number if linked to an existing BCA) 
 *  ERP Status = Prospect 
 *  Owner = Owner of the Sales Skill Account (district-based ownership) 
 

 

 

 *  Scenario 3 – Automatic Linking 

 *  Given the Prospect BCA is created 

 *  When the account save completes 
 *  Then the new BCA must automatically populate in the BCA lookup field on the Sales Skill Account record. 
 

 

 *  Scenario 4 –  Non-1C Accounts 

 *  Given I create a Account  with District not flagged as 1C 

 *  When I save the record 
 *  Then CRM must not create a Prospect BCA. 
 

 *  This story applies only to 1C Districts and only for Prospect-type Sales Skill Accounts. 
 

 

 
Business Requirements: 

 *  Automatically create and link a Prospect BCA whenever a new Prospect Sales Skill Account is created in a 1C District. 
 *  Prospect BCA creation must be automatic and require no manual input. 
 *  Field mapping for BCA creation: 

 *  Name ? inherit from Sales Skill Account Name 
 *  Account Number ? inherit from Sales Skill Account’s Account Number 
 *  ERP Status ? set to Prospect 
 *  Owner ? inherit from Sales Skill Account Owner 
 

 *  Ensure one-to-many relationship: Prospect BCA ? multiple Prospect Sales Skill Accounts. 
 *  For non-1C districts or non-prospect accounts, no change in behavior. 
 

 
Developer Notes: 

 *  Extend account creation plugin/workflow logic: 

 *  On create of Sales Skill Account (Account Type = Prospect) AND District.Flag = 1C ? auto-create new BCA record if lookup empty. 
 *  Populate fields as per mapping. 
 *  Link Sales Skill Account back to BCA. 
 

 *  Ensure BCA number (Account Number) uses the same P-number logic as the account. 
 *  Restrict functionality explicitly to 1C Districts only.

column8: Auto-Create BCA for Newly Created EBS Customer Accounts via the EBS ADF Pipeline (1C Districts)
column11:
As a CRM system, when a new customer account (type = Customer) is created in CRM via the EBS integration pipeline, and that account belongs to a district flagged as One Customer (1C), the system should automatically:
 

 *  Create a Base Customer Account (BCA) record if one does not already exist for the customer. 
 *  Populate the BCA with the same Name and Account Number as the new Sold-To/Customer account. 
 *  Set the ERP Account Status = Active. 
 *  Link the new Sales Skill account to the BCA and set the Sales Skill field appropriately (Water/Hygiene). 
 

 
If the account is already linked to an existing BCA (e.g., additional Water/Hygiene skill accounts created under the same customer), no new BCA should be created. The existing BCA should be retained, and the new Sales Skill account should be linked to that BCA. 

 
This ensures that all new EBS customer accounts created in CRM under 1C districts are always associated with a valid BCA.


Business Requirements: 

 *  Automatically create a BCA record for any new EBS customer (Sold-To) account created in CRM, when: 

 *  Account Type = Customer 
 *  District is flagged as One Customer (1C) 
 *  No existing BCA link is present 
 

 *  Populate the BCA with: 

 *  Name = Customer Account Name 
 *  Account Number = Customer Account Number (from EBS) 
 *  ERP Account Status = Active 
 

 *  Update the new account: 

 *  Set BCA Lookup to the newly created BCA (or existing one if found). 
 *  Set Sales Skill field based on the account’s global business (Water/Hygiene). 
 *  Confirm ERP Account Status on the Sales Skill account = Active. 
 

 *  Skip BCA creation if: 

 *  Another Sales Skill account for the same customer is already linked to a BCA. 
 *  District is not flagged as 1C.
column19: Moved out of state Pending Prod Release
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 

 *  New Customer in 1C District 

 *  Given a new Customer account is created in CRM, 
 *  And the account’s District has the “Is Eligible for One Customer” flag = Yes, 
 *  When the account is not already linked to a BCA, 
 *  Then CRM should automatically create a new BCA, copy the Account Name and Account Number, set ERP Account Status = Active, and link the new account to that BCA. 
 

 *  Customer Already Linked to BCA 

 *  Given a new Sales Skill account is created in CRM, 
 *  And another Sales Skill account for the same customer already exists and is linked to a BCA, 
 *  When the new account is processed, 
 *  Then no new BCA should be created, and the new sales skill account should be linked to the existing BCA, with Sales Skill field set appropriately. 
 

 *  Non-1C District Customer 

 *  Given a new customer account is created in CRM, 
 *  And the District is not flagged as One Customer, 
 *  When the account is processed, 
 *  Then CRM should not auto-create or link a BCA.

column9: Handle RACE conditions for BCA creation when ingesting through ADF, Bulk import or Integration
column11:
As a CRM system, when a new customer account (type = Customer) is created in CRM the BCA should be automatically created. The BCA creation would happen through Sync plugin on Pre-operation stage of Account Create.
 

 
Problem - Bulk ingestion of Customer Accounts could run into a RACE condition where 2 Sales Skill accounts are processed parallelly in CRM and both trying to create a BCA record as it already doesn't exist. 

 
Solution - Leverage Alternate keys and use Upsert instead of Create 

 *  
 *  Define an Alternate Key on the Base Account entity using the Account Number. 
 *  This enforces uniqueness at the database level. 
 *  If two plugin executions try to create a Base Account with the same Account Number, one will fail due to the key constraint. Handle the exception in catch block. 

 *  The exception on create of second BCA request can be handled in catch block. Try to Retrieve the BCA record and associate the BCA with the Sales Skill Account.  
 


 
 
 

The use of Alternate Key will ensure we will not have duplicate records in BCA entity by any means (UI, or backend logic). 
 
Catch block will handle the error out record and do the association with BCA.

column7: 11. Modernize Customer Setup UI to Include Sales Skill, ERP Source, and BCA Auto-Linking Logic
column11:
Business Capability Overview
 
As part of the One Customer initiative, the CRM customer setup process must evolve to reflect new foundational elements — Sales Skill, ERP System Source, and the Base Customer Account (BCA) relationship — which were not previously required in the legacy setup flow. The current customer setup interface does not accommodate these new dimensions and therefore requires modernization to ensure business users and system integrators can properly process new and converted customers under the One Customer model. 

 
The business expects that the modernized UI will:
 

 *  Surface and capture new mandatory fields (Sales Skill, ERP Source, BCA Number). 
 *  Auto-detect and link newly created customer accounts to the correct BCA when a match is found. 
 *  Support different flows based on whether the customer is net-new or part of an existing BCA family. 
 *  Guide CRM users (e.g., Sales Ops, District Coordinators) through a cleaner and more structured setup experience. 
 

 
This is essential to ensure the accuracy of downstream integration, user clarity, and to maintain data consistency across CRM, MDM, and EBS. 
Business Requirements 

 *  The Customer Setup UI must be updated to support: 

 *  Sales Skill selection (Water, Hygiene, etc.) as a required field (Inherited from the Prospect Account). 
 *  ERP Source (e.g., ECL_EBS, NALCO_SAP) either auto-detected or manually selected. 
 *  Base Customer Account Number — The MDM API's should return the BCA Number and indicate if the BCA is newly created in EBS or it already exists in EBS. 
 

 *  If a prospect account is being converted to a customer and MDM identifies that a BCA already exists for the same entity: 

 *  The UI must display or auto-link the record to that BCA. 
 

 *  Display warnings or prompts when a conflict is detected (e.g., same Sales Skill + ERP + account number already exists). 
 *  Use the One Customer flag configured at the district level to help system understand if enhanced setup flow is required. 
 *  Provide flexibility to handle both: 

 *  Net-new customers (no prior BCA linkage). 
 *  Sales Skill expansions (e.g., adding a Water record under an existing Hygiene customer). 
 

 *  Enforce any additional validation rules depending on the Sales Skill and ERP source selected. 
 *  Incorporate user role–based visibility where appropriate (e.g., hiding ERP source selection from general users, but showing it for admin roles). 
 *  If an existing Base Customer Account (BCA) is not found for the customer number returned from MDM during the customer conversion process, the system must automatically create a new BCA using the returned customer number. Once created, the system will immediately link the converted sales skill account to this new BCA without requiring manual user intervention. This ensures complete automation of BCA creation and linkage for One Customer–flagged districts.
 
 

 
Technical Considerations 

 *  Introduce or expose the following fields on the Customer Setup form: 

 *  Sales Skill (Required). 
 *  ERP System Source (Required for 1C customers). 
 *  Base Customer Account Lookup (Optional or Auto-linked). 
 

 *  Create logic (plugin, real-time workflow, or Power Automate) to: 

 *  Auto-link to existing BCA based on matching rules (e.g., company name, address, legacy ID). 
 *  Suggest BCAs when more than one potential match is found. 
 

 *  Technical spike required to: 

 *  Finalize BCA linking logic. 
 *  Define validation rules and dependencies between Sales Skill, ERP source, and account ownership. 
 *  Determine whether Sales Skill and ERP Source should be editable post-setup. 
 

 *  Validate impact to current form logic, plugins, and automations. 

 *  Ensure no regressions in legacy setup flows (non–One Customer districts). 
 

 *  Establish guidelines for auto-setting or defaulting ERP Source based on the selected district, global business, and sales skill. 
 *  Capture telemetry or logging for debugging BCA linking errors during setup. 
 

 
Expected Deliverables 

 *  Updated Customer Setup UI with new attributes (Sales Skill, ERP Source, BCA lookup). 
 *  Functional auto-linking logic to associate customer records to BCAs where appropriate. 
 *  Field-level validations and business rules reflecting One Customer design. 
 *  Role-based access design for sensitive fields (e.g., ERP source). 
 *  Spike output: documented logic and rules for matching BCA, sales skill, ERP defaults. 
 *  Regression testing across all customer creation scenarios (1C and non-1C). 
 *  Updated training documentation and user enablement content. 
 *  Internal review sessions and refinements with Sales Ops and Tech leads to finalize form behavior and logic.

column7: 10. Revamp Prospect Creation Experience to Support Sales Skill–Based Entry and Validation
column11:
Business Capability Overview
 
Under the One Customer model, prospect creation in CRM must evolve to a more structured and sales skill–driven experience. Today, prospects can be created with minimal validation and without a consistent approach to aligning them with specific sales skills (e.g., Water, Hygiene).  

 
In the future-state model, business users—particularly sales reps—must be able to create prospects that are explicitly tied to a sales skill (or sales division) at the time of creation. The system should enforce early validation rules to prevent duplication, ensure address quality, and correctly prepare records for integration with MDM and EBS.
 

 
The business expects this revamp to provide:
 

 *  A cleaner, more guided UI during prospect creation. 
 *  Clear designation of the intended sales skill. 
 *  Validation logic appropriate to One Customer–flagged districts. 
 *  Alignment with downstream setup and integration processes. 
 

 
Business Requirements 

 *  Allow users to select the Sales Skill (Water, Hygiene, etc.) at the time of prospect creation. 
 *  Automatically apply validations based on: 

 *  Selected District (including whether it is flagged for One Customer). 
 *  Sales Skill assignment. 
 *  Territory and division consistency rules. 
 

 *  For prospects in 1C-flagged districts, enforce: 

 *  Address validation rules (via MDM integration). 
 *  Duplicate check against existing CRM accounts and MDM. 
 *  Immediate MDM sync (covered separately in another requirement). 
 

 *  Business logic must drive user prompts or warnings if: 

 *  Sales skill is left blank. 
 *  An invalid combination of district and sales skill is chosen. 
 

 *  Ensure ability to enter prospects that are intended for new sales skill branches of existing customers (e.g., Water rep creating a Water prospect under a Hygiene customer). 
 *  Support UI elements such as: 

 *  Auto-population of related fields based on district selection. 
 *  Visual indicators of One Customer applicability. 
 *  Optional toggle to mark whether prospect should link to existing BCA (if known). 
 

 *  System should tag each prospect record appropriately to allow downstream teams to: 

 *  Route through the correct customer setup process. 
 *  Avoid setup bottlenecks due to missing or ambiguous sales skill alignment. 
 

 

 
Technical Considerations 

 *  Extend CRM Prospect form to include required and optionally recommended fields: 

 *  Sales Skill 
 *  Is 1C Flagged District 
 *  Intended Division 
 

 *  Modify form-level logic to: 

 *  Enable or disable specific fields based on territory selection. 
 *  Trigger validation on save or autosave events. 
 

 *  Update business rules or plugins to enforce validation: 

 *  Cross-check sales skill, division, and territory compatibility. 
 *  Prevent duplicate entries by comparing with existing prospects and accounts (CRM + MDM). 
 

 *  Ensure compatibility with downstream logic for: 

 *  MDM sync trigger. 
 *  Customer setup conversion flow. 
 

 *  UI/UX must be designed for clarity: 

 *  Distinct fields and tooltips for sales skill tagging. 
 *  Mandatory/optional field indicators. 
 *  Inline validation feedback messages. 
 

 *  Any legacy scripts, plugins, or forms used in prospect creation must be reviewed and either updated or deprecated. 
 *  A technical spike is not required at this stage but may be needed if issues arise during regression testing or UX compatibility reviews across different sales skill forms. 
 

 
Expected Deliverables 

 *  Updated Prospect creation form in CRM with required fields and validations. 
 *  Enhanced field validation logic (plugin or rule-based) for 1C district and sales skill tagging. 
 *  Tooltips, visual cues, and UI indicators supporting user guidance. 
 *  Documentation of business rules and validation logic. 
 *  Regression testing for prospect creation under different district and sales skill combinations. 
 *  Change management materials and updated user training assets.
These items are candidates for Post Release 2 backlog consideration.  These items are not in scope for Release 1 or Release 2.

column6: Update TSR Form Quick View to Display “Sales Skill” Instead of “Global Business” for 1C Ac
column11:
As a CRM user (Sales Rep, CAM, or Technical Resource),
I want to see the Sales Skill value displayed on the Account Quick View section of the TSR form instead of the Global Business field whenever the TSR is linked to a 1C-enabled account,
 
so that I can clearly identify whether the TSR belongs to Water or Hygiene and ensure I am viewing the correct division context aligned with the One Customer (1C) model.
 

 
Context and Background
Today, on the Technical Service Request (TSR) form, there is an Account Quick View Form that displays summary information from the linked Account record. 
This Quick View currently shows details such as Account Name, Number, and Global Business (e.g., Nalco Water, Food & Beverage, Life Sciences).
 

 
However, under the One Customer (1C) model:
 

 *  The Global Business field is being phased out for 1C accounts. 
 *  The Sales Skill field now represents the correct business classification (e.g., Water or Hygiene). 
 *  Future logic and form visibility will rely on Sales Skill rather than Global Business. 
 

 
To support this transition, the Quick View Form on TSR must be updated to show: 

 *  Sales Skill when the linked account is a 1C account (IsOneCustomer = Yes), 
 *  Global Business for all non-1C accounts to preserve backward compatibility. 
 

 
This change ensures users have an accurate and consistent business context on TSR records, supporting correct routing, reporting, and harmonization efforts in future releases. 

 
Functional and Technical Scope 

 *  Modify the Account Quick View form referenced on the TSR entity. 
 *  Introduce conditional display logic: 

 *  If IsOneCustomer = Yes, show Sales Skill; hide Global Business. 
 *  If IsOneCustomer = No, show Global Business; hide Sales Skill. 
 

 *  Ensure field labels and values render properly in Unified Interface (modern UI). 
 *  No changes to underlying Account entity logic — read-only display only. 
 *  Validate compatibility with existing scripts, forms, and embedded components.

column6: TVD Financial Impact System (Within E3D Ecolab 3D) - Regression Testing Only
column11:
Context:  
 
•TheFinancial Impact system within Ecolab 3D is designed to visualize the valuedelivered to customers through various programs and technologies. It aggregatesdata from CRM and other sources to: 
 
•Presentcustomer-facing dashboards showing delivered, pipeline, and potential value. 
 
•Supportinternal reporting and strategic decision-making. 
 
•EnableAI-driven identification of best-in-class opportunities.  
 
•Thedashboard supports filtering by sales skill,allowing users to view data specific to Hygiene or Water divisions. Thisensures that both teams can track and communicate the value delivered to theirrespective customers effectively 
 
•CRMSnowflake view displays the CRM TVD program in E3D: 
 
•Depending on the CRM stage of theproject, it will show it various E3D stages: Pipeline 
 
OrPotential

•Hygiene& Water. As-is. No requirement for change.

•Customers:Toview financial impact dashboards via Ecolab 3D. 
 
•GlobalBI Team: Tomanage internal Power BI dashboards for tracking TVD programs. 
 
•CRMand Snowflake Teams: Tomanage data flow and integration. 
 
•AIand Data Science Teams: Tomine CRM data for predictive opportunities  
 
Downstream Systems/Integration: 
 
•CRM:Sourceof TVD program data. 
 
•Snowflake:AggregatesCRM data for visualization and reporting. 
 
•Ecolab3D: Displaysfinancial impact dashboards to customers. 
 
•PowerBI: Usedinternally to track TVD program performance. 
 
•AIModels: UseSnowflake data to identify and suggest new opportunities 
 
Impact Considerations (Useof Account, Ship-To, and Site field values): 
 
•Site:Primary driver for data alignment and visualization. 
 
•AccountNumber:Used to associate TVD programs with customer records. 
 
•SalesSkill:Will be added to differentiate program types (e.g., hygiene vs. water). 
 
•Ship-To:Not directly used in Financial Impact but may affect account alignment 
•Visualization in E3D/BI is owned by a different team and is not in scope for the CRM team

1.CRMdata is ingested into Snowflake views managed by the CRM team. 
 
3.Snowflaketo Ecolab 3D

1.AIidentifies best-in-class opportunities based on completed programs and surfacesthem in Ecolab 3D

column6: TVD (Total Value Delivered) Calculator (Not CRM) - Testing needed post changes done by the TVD Calculator Team
column11:
Context: 
 
•TheTVD solution  is designedto streamline, capture, calculate, and communicatecustomer value deliveredthrough Ecolab’s solutions. It enables scalable, repeatable, and globallyleverageable documentation of value across customer sites. Value is categorized(e.g., business impact, operational, environmental) and monetized (e.g.,savings, avoidance, revenue) to support internal tracking and customer-facingreporting. It is used to increase the account growth rate,andincrease account retention. It offers industry expert and AI Guided valuerecomendations.  
 
•Desktopand mobile (Online only. No Offline mode. 
 
•60-70calculators exist today. Continuously expanding.  
 

 
Groups: 
 
•Water& Hygiene As-is. No change to this. 
 

 
Personas: 
 
•SalesRepresentatives:To document and manage value delivery projects. 
 
•AccountManagers:To maintain TVD records, trigger push to CRM creation of a Project record, andprogress the Project through CRM stages. 
 
•Financeand Marketing Teams:For reporting, analysis, and customer communication. 
 
•EcolabTVD Calculator Team: Responsiblefor all TVD API updates and TVD app management. 
 

 
Downstream Systems/Integration: 
 
•CRM:Central repository for TVD program (Project) records and lifecycle management.  
 
•SnowflakeViews:Aggregates CRM data for downstream consumption. 
 
•Ecolab3D:Visualizes financial impact for customers. 
 
•PowerBI:Used internally to monitor TVD program performance. 
 
•AIGuided Potential:Surfaces best-in-class opportunities based on completed TVD programs 
 

 
Impact Considerations (Useof Account, Ship-To, and Site field values): 
 
•Site isthe primary driver for TVD program creation and calculator alignment As-Is.  
 
•AccountNumber isselected to direct the TVD program to the correct customer record As-Is.. 
 
•Sold-Tovalue from TVD system is used to create the CRM record As-Is. 
 
•Ship-To isnot directly used in the TVD calculator or CRM integration but may appear inaccount alignment scenarios.. 
 
•SalesSkill (e.g.,hygiene or water) to-be:will be added by Ecolab TVD team to differentiate program types.Ecolabhas time in sprint to add Sales Skill selection within the calculator.  Sales Skill value (Water vs Hygiene) can bederived by the logged in user rep as each rep is aligned with either Water orHygiene.  
 
•ActionLog generated by and in TVD does not push to CRM As-Is. This will not change. 
•TVDCalculator Team to update calculator UI for sales skill. Due Date: 10/03/2025 
•EcolabTVD Calculator Team to Update CRM API to include sales skill. DueDate: 10/03/2025 
 

 
Business Process Flow: 
 
1.Initiation 
 
1.ATVD program is initiated either manually via the TVD app or triggeredsystematically by the Guided Value Power App 
 
2.TVDApp Input Selection 
 
1.Usersselect customer site and account number, Sold-To address. 
 
3.TVDApp Calculation 
 
1.Runcalculators to identify value 
 
2.CreateProjects and Action Logs to document and manage value delivery projects. 
 
3.ActionLog projects are managed here in the TVD App rather than in CRM.  
 
4.CRMIntegration 
 
1.TheTVD Calculator result (Program/Project data) is pushed to CRM via the TVDCalculator API, resulting in creation of a TVD program/project record in CRM(related to an Account).  (Action Logs donot push to CRM.) 
 
5.CRMLifecycle Management 
 
1.Theprogram/project progresses through CRM stages: Identified ? Approved ? InProcess ? Implemented ? Final Sign-off. 
 
6.Reporting& Visualization 
 
1.CRMdata flows into Snowflake views, which feed: 
 
1.Ecolab 3D (Financial Impact) forcustomer-facing dashboards. 
 
2.Power BI for internal tracking

column6: TECHNICAL SPIKE: Investigate Best Approach to Restrict Sales Skill and District Changes When Customer Setup Exists
column11: As part of implementing restrictions on Sales Skill and District updates once a Customer Setup record exists for an account, we need to determine the optimal technical design and enforcement approach in CRM. This spike will focus on identifying the correct trigger points, evaluating options (JavaScript vs. server-side plugin/business rules), ensuring security role handling for Admin overrides, and confirming that restrictions apply to all update methods (UI, bulk edit, imports, API).
column14: Hold; Not In R1; NotNeeded; TECHNICAL SPIKE
column22:
*  Identify Enforcement Mechanism 

 *  Evaluate whether the restriction should be implemented via: 

 *  JavaScript (UI only) 
 *  Server-side plugin (recommended for all channels) 
 *  Combination of both for best UX + enforcement. 
 

 

 *  Document pros/cons of each and recommend the final approach. 
 

 *  Check Existing Logic 

 *  Locate and review any existing JavaScript or plugins that currently handle Sales Skill, District, or Customer Setup logic. 
 *  Identify points where the new restriction logic can be integrated or where refactoring is needed. 
 

 *  Validation & Mapping Logic 

 *  Confirm where and how the one-to-one District ? Sales Skill mapping is stored and validated. 
 *  Ensure this mapping is leveraged consistently in the restriction logic. 
 

 *  Output Deliverables 

 *  Technical design recommendation document. 
 *  List of impacted components (forms, scripts, plugins, integrations). 
 *  Implementation steps with effort estimate.

column6: Technical Spike: Implement Cross-Account Duplicate Contact Detection Logic for BCA-Linked Accounts
column11: Evaluate and design a scalable approach to detect potential duplicate Contacts across all Existing Customer Account Records linked to the same Base Customer Account (BCA), warn users pre-save, and offer two actions: Use Existing Contact or Create Anyway—while preserving current single-account duplicate detection.
column14: Not In R1; NotNeeded; TECHNICAL SPIKE
column22:
Scope & Key Questions

 *  Scope: Contact create/update flows (form, quick create, import, API), only when the parent account has a BCA link. 
 *  Keep: Existing within-account duplicate rules as-is. 
 *  Questions to answer 

 *  Best hook(s) to run cross-account check (client vs. server vs. hybrid) without regressions? 
 *  Data keys for match: confirm Name + Phone + Buying Role (case/whitespace/format normalization rules). 
 *  Result UX: unified warning modal with matched rows; feasibility for quick create & mobile. 
 *  “Use Existing Contact”: safest way to reference/associate the found contact (and any limits). 
 *  Security: ensure results respect row-level security; avoid leaking contact data. 
 

 

 
Options to Investigate
A. Server-side only 
Pre-operation plugin / sync workflow: blocks or injects warnings? (How to present a user choice?) 

 
B. Client-first + server fallback (hybrid)
 
Client (form onSave / quick create) calls custom action to search duplicates; show modal; pass user choice.
 
Server plugin re-validates on save for non-form channels (API/import). 

 
C. PCF for warning UX
 
PCF to render results & actions; still backed by custom action + server plugin. 

 
Provide recommendations and creation additional user stories based on the findings of this SPIKE

column6: Service Visits tab under BCA.
column11:
As a CRM user,
I need a Service Visits section under the Service Visits tab on the Base Customer Account (BCA) form,
 
so that I can see all service visits from accounts linked to the same Base Customer Account Number, with key details in one place and the ability to switch between open and completed visits.
column19: Moved out of state In Development
column22:
*  Section & Aggregation Logic 

 *  Create a Service Visits tab and create a section named Service Visits. 
 *  The section contains a subgrid that aggregates service visits from all accounts linked to the same Base Customer Account Number as the current BCA. 
 *  The subgrid pulls data directly based on the relationship to the accounts associated with that BCA. 
 

 *  Views Available 

 *  Two views are available in the subgrid’s view selector: 

 *  All Open Service Visits – Default view. 
 *  All Completed Service Visits – Same columns, sorting, and layout as the open view, but filtered for completed visits. 
 

 

 *  Displayed Columns (Order) 

 *  Both views display the following columns in this order: 

 *  Service Visit Number 
 *  Sold-To Account Name 
 *  Account Number  
 *  Sales Skill (new – appears immediately after Account Number) 
 *  First Scheduled Date 
 *  Target Start Date 
 *  Target End Date 
 *  System Status 
 *  Service Performed by 
 *  City 
 *  State/Province 
 *  Country 
 *  Sales Region 
 *  Sub-Region 
 *  Recurring Services 
 *  Scheduled Name 
 *  Service Type 
 *  Service Visit Type 
 *  Technology Platform 
 *  Priority 
 *  Service Visit Owner 
 *  Purpose 
 *  Summary of Service Visit 
 *  First Committed Date 
 *  Date Completed by Technician 
 *  Date Completed by Back Office 
 *  Payment Method 
 *  Customer Selling Price 
 *  PO Number 
 *  Billing Arrangement Number 
 *  SAP Service Order Number 
 *  Created By 
 *  Created On 
 *  Account Name 
 *  Site/Ship-To Account Name 
 *  Site/Ship-To Account Number 
 

 

 *  Column Behavior 

 *  Sales Skill: 

 *  Displays the Sales Skill value from the linked account. 
 *  Appears immediately after Account Number in both views. 
 

 *  All columns are sortable and filterable using standard CRM view functionality. 
 

 *  Sorting Defaults 

 *  Default sort for both views: 

 *  Sort by First Scheduled Date ascending 
 

 

 *  Filtering Defaults 

 *  All Open Service Visits: Only visits with an open status are displayed. 
 *  All Completed Service Visits: Only visits with a completed status are displayed. 
 

 *  Security  

 *  Only users with permission to view service visits for the related accounts can see them in the subgrid.  
 *  Ability to open or edit service visits follows standard CRM security roles.

column6: Require Sales Skill Selection When Creating Opportunities on H5 Accounts (1C Only)
column11:
As a CAM,
I want the ability to select the Sales Skill when creating an opportunity on an H5 (Org) account linked to a 1C district,
 
So that opportunities are clearly distinguished as Water or Hygiene and downstream processes (reporting, forms, BPF logic) can behave consistently across the unified H5 structure.
 

 
This applies to:
 

 *  Quick Create Form – Sales Skill must be a visible, required dropdown before saving. 
 *  Full Opportunity Form – Sales Skill must appear in the Details section and reflect the chosen value (Water/Hygiene). 
 *  H5/Org Accounts linked to 1C districts only – Non-1C accounts remain unaffected. 
 

 
The Global Business field on H5 is being hidden and set to Food & Beverage by default in the backend. Therefore, the Sales Skill field on Opportunities becomes the key indicator for whether the opportunity is Water or Hygiene.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:

 *  Visibility Rule (1C vs Non-1C) 

 *  Given I open the Quick Create or full Opportunity form from an H5 account, 
 *  When the H5 is linked to at least one Sales Skill account in a district flagged as 1C = Yes, 
 *  Then the Sales Skill field must appear and be required. 
 *  Given I open the same forms for an H5 not linked to any 1C Sales Skill accounts, 
 *  Then the Sales Skill field should not appear (no change from today). 
 

 *  Quick Create Requirement 

 *  Given I open the Quick Create Opportunity form on a 1C-linked H5 account, 
 *  When I attempt to save without selecting a Sales Skill, 
 *  Then I should receive a validation error preventing save until a value is selected. 
 

 *  Full Opportunity Form Display 

 *  Given I create or open an Opportunity on a 1C-linked H5 account, 
 *  Then the Sales Skill field must be visible in the Details section of the form and must display the selected value. 
 

 

 
Business Requirements: 

 *  Add Sales Skill field to Quick Create Opportunity form for H5 accounts (1C only). 
 *  Make Sales Skill required before save on Quick Create. 
 *  Add Sales Skill to Details section of the full Opportunity form (1C only). 
 *  Enforce visibility rules: only show Sales Skill if H5 is linked to Sales Skill accounts in 1C districts. 
 *  Ensure Sales Skill values are written to the Opportunity record for downstream reporting and logic. 
 *  Non-1C H5/Org accounts: no changes; Sales Skill field not visible.

R2 – Nice to Have: Validate Removal of District ? SalesSkill Mapping When Active Accounts Exist
column11:
As a System Admin or Ops Admin,
I want the system to warn me when attempting to remove a District ? SalesSkill mapping that has active Accounts linked,
 
so that I do not unintentionally break relationships or cause orphaned Accounts.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:

 *  Given I am a System Admin or Ops Admin, 

 *  When I attempt to remove a SalesSkill mapping from a District, 
 *  Then the system checks for active Accounts linked to that District/SalesSkill. 
 

 *  Given active Accounts exist for that District/SalesSkill, 

 *  When I try to remove the mapping, 
 *  Then the system blocks the removal and provides a clear message: 
 *  “This District ? SalesSkill mapping cannot be removed because active Accounts are still associated. Please reassign or deactivate those Accounts before proceeding.” 
 

 *  Given no active Accounts exist, 

 *  When I remove the mapping, 
 *  Then the system allows the removal to proceed. 
 

 

 
Business Requirements: 

 *  Prevent removal of District ? SalesSkill mappings if active Accounts are dependent on them. 
 *  Provide clear user messaging when blocking the removal. 
 *  Ensure validation applies only to active Accounts (inactive Accounts should not block removal). 
 *  Applies only to System Admins and Ops Admins, as they are the only roles who can perform this action. 
 

 
Developer Notes: 

 *  If custom intersect entity: 

 *  Add a pre-deactivate plugin to check for active Account associations before deactivation. 
 

 *  If native N:N relationship: 

 *  Implement a custom plugin/interceptor to prevent deletion if active Accounts exist. 
 

 *  Maintain audit log of blocked attempts and successful removals. 
 *  Consider including this as part of a broader data integrity validation framework for 1C.

column6: Post R2 Future Scope
column11:
Future Scope:

 *  As a user, I require the ability to hide or make optional the Pack Code field for EBS accounts so that unnecessary data entry is avoided. 
 *  As a user, I require the ability to differentiate required fields based on Sales Skill instead of Global Business so that form logic aligns with future-state architecture. 
 *  As a user, I require the ability to map SAP Work Centers to EBS equivalents so that service orders are routed correctly. 
 *  As a user, I require the ability to update existing recurring services with new EBS work centers so that data integrity is maintained post-cutover. 
 *  As a user, I require the ability to maintain consistent reporting fields across water and hygiene teams so that management has unified visibility.

column6: Post R2 Future Backlog Candidates - WPS Service Visit Process -
column11:
*  As a user, I require the ability to remove Pack Code as a required field for water accounts so that I can streamline TSR creation. 
 *  As a user, I require the ability to update SAP Work Centers based on EBS mappings so that service orders are correctly processed. 
 *  As a user, I require the ability to harmonize VAS types across divisions so that dropdowns are consistent. 
 *  As a user, I require the ability to bulk upload VAS with filters for hygiene so that only relevant data is imported. 
 *  As a user, I require the ability to manage service types with updated SER codes so that EBS integration is seamless. 
 



Business Context: 
 
•Water Purity Solutions, which is a distinct part of the business focused on delivering water purification services and solution 
 
•WPS operates with its own customer base but also sells through existing business units such as Nalco Water and other Nalco divisions. 
 
•The WPS system is designed to: 
 
•Support water purification services across various business units. 
 
•Enable recurring service scheduling, particularly for tasks like DI bottle exchanges, which are common in WPS operations. 
 
•Integrate with CRM and SAP systems to manage service visits, billing arrangements, and technician assignments. 
 
•Auto-generate service visits every 30 days (instead of the standard 90 days) to accommodate the dynamic nature of WPS service cycles 1 
 
•This setup ensures that WPS can maintain high service standards while aligning with broader organizational processes and reporting structures. 
 
•The WBS (Water Purity Solutions) WPS services and processes are integrated across both Water and Hygiene teams, and the CRM setup reflects that shared usage. 
 
•The WPS process leverages the same service visit and recurring service framework as the broader Field Service organization 
 
Groups: Water & Hygiene 
Personas: 
 
•Sales Representatives: Initiate TSRs and VAS entries. 
 
•Technical Resource Managers: Approve TSRs and assign Subject Matter Experts. 
 
•Subject Matter Experts: Execute service visits. 
 
•Field Service Technicians: Handle service orders and recurring services. 
 
•Service Operations Team: Validate and manage service schedules and SAP work center mappings. 
 
•Product Owners: Oversee harmonization and integration efforts ( Christy Murray). 
 
•Leadership: Includes Corey DeMarco, who receives consolidated reporting across divisions 
 
Business Process Flow: 
 
1.TSR Creation: 
 
1.Sales Rep selects TSR group, type, application area, and enters issue/scope. 
 
2.Optional fields: Opportunity, TVD Program, Retain to Win. 
 
3.TSR is routed for approval (manager step varies by division). 
 
4.Technical Resource Manager assigns SME and approves travel. 
 
5.TSR is finalized with resolution method and risk assessment. 
 
2.VAS Creation: 
 
1.Created manually by Sales Rep or team member. 
 
2.Automatically generated for Life Sciences via TSR. 
 
3.Created from service activity (district visits). 
 
4.Bulk uploaded quarterly for lab analysis. 
 
3.Recurring Services: 
 
1.Sales Rep sets up preventive maintenance plans. 
 
2.Includes ship-to selection, technology platform, service type, assets, billing arrangement. 
 
3.Auto-generates service visits based on schedule. 
 
4.Service Orders: 
 
1.Validated by operations team. 
 
2.Includes SAP work center, labor codes, and order types. 
 
3.Data sent to SAP for execution. 
 
Downstream Systems/Integration:
•SAP/EBS Integration: 
 
•Work centers, billing arrangements, and service types must align with EBS codes. 
 
•Mapping required between current SAP and future EBS work centers . 
 
•Reporting Consistency: 
 
•Harmonized fields across divisions ensure unified reporting for managers. 
 
•Field Visibility: 
 
•Global Business and Sales Skill fields drive form behavior and required inputs. 
 
•Data Conversion: 
 
•Existing open service orders must be updated with new EBS work center 
 
Impact Considerations:
•CRM Account form fields SAP Division & SAP Distribution Channels. Integration of these fields to SAP & EBS. 
 
•Global Business vs. Sales Skill: 
 
•Drives visibility and requirement of fields like Pack Code and Cost Center. 
 
•Future state will hide Global Business and use Sales Skill instead. 
 
•Ship-To Selection: 
 
•Determines service location; future state aims for alignment with Sold-To. 
 
•Account Merging: 
 
•Impacts group setup and form behavior; harmonization needed to avoid dual screens

column6: NICE TO HAVE: Add validation to ensure Sales Skill is valid for district if district is changed.
column11:
As a CRM user,
I want the system to validate that the selected Sales Skill is valid for the chosen District,
 
so that incorrect Sales Skill/District combinations are not saved.
column14: Nice to Have; Not In R1; NotNeeded
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Scope (1C only) 

 *  Given an account belongs to a 1C district 
 *  When District or Sales Skill is created/updated 
 *  Then the system must validate the District–Sales Skill combination. 
 *  Given an account belongs to a non-1C district 
 *  When District or Sales Skill is created/updated 
 *  Then behavior remains unchanged (no new validation). 
 

 *  Real-time filtering (UX) 

 *  Given I select or change the District on a 1C account in the UI 
 *  When I open the Sales Skill dropdown 
 *  Then only Sales Skills valid for that District are shown. 
 

 *  District change clears incompatible Sales Skill 

 *  Given a 1C account has Sales Skill A and I change District to one where A is invalid 
 *  When the form recalculates 
 *  Then the Sales Skill field is cleared and enabled for a new valid selection. 
 

 *  Save-time server validation — UI 

 *  Given I edit a 1C account in the UI 
 *  When I attempt to save a District–Sales Skill combination that is not valid 
 *  Then the save is blocked and I see: 

 *  “Selected Sales Skill is not valid for the chosen District. Please select a valid Sales Skill.” 
 

 

 *  Save-time server validation — Data Import 

 *  Given I import accounts that include 1C records 
 *  When a row contains an invalid District–Sales Skill pair 
 *  Then that row fails with the same validation error; other valid rows proceed. 
 

 *  Mapping changes over time 

 *  Given Ops Admin update the District?Sales Skill allowed list 
 *  When a user later saves a 1C account with an out-of-date combination 
 *  Then the save is blocked until a valid Sales Skill is selected. 
 

 *  Valid path — no prompts 

 *  Given a 1C account has a valid District–Sales Skill combination 
 *  When I save 
 *  Then the record saves without warnings. 
 

 

Business Requirements:

 *  Apply District–Sales Skill validation to 1C accounts only; do not change behavior for non-1C accounts. 
 *  Provide real-time filtering in the UI so users only see valid Sales Skills for the selected District. 
 *  Automatically clear Sales Skill when District changes to one where the current Sales Skill is invalid. 
 *  Enforce a server-side validation rule at save time across all channels (UI, imports, API/SDK, integrations, offline sync). 
 *  Use a clear, business-friendly error message (see BAC) and keep messaging consistent across channels. 
 *  Support mapping changes over time; previously saved invalid combos must be corrected before the next successful save. 
 *  No additional prompts when combinations are valid; keep UX simple and consistent.

column6: Introduce Default Currency at Country Level and Standardize Account Currency Derivation
column11:
As a business user,
I need account currency to be consistently and automatically determined based on the country-level default currency
 
so that currency values are standardized across CRM, integrations, and processes, regardless of who or what system creates the account.
 

 
Today, account currency defaults incorrectly based on the creating user’s personal settings or integration behavior, resulting in inconsistent values (e.g., unintended USD). To correct this, a default currency must be stored at the Country level, maintained as business master data. Account currency should then always derive from that default currency during creation by any channel—CRM user, PowerApps, API integration, or data migration.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Default Currency Maintained at Country Level 

 *  Given the Country table includes a “Default Currency” field 
 *  When a user views any Country record 
 *  Then the Default Currency field must be visible on the Country record 
 *  And the field must display a valid default currency value for that country 
 *  And Finance (or designated business owners) must be able to review and validate that the currency assigned to each country is correct prior to cutover. 
 

 *  Account Currency Must Always Derive from Country Default Currency 

 *  Given a new account is being created (prospect, customer, or sales-skill account) 
 *  When the user or system sets the country for that account 
 *  Then the account currency must automatically populate from the Country’s default currency value 
 *  And must not depend on the user’s personal settings 
 

 *  Applies to All Account Creation Channels 

 *  Given an account is created via any channel 

 *  CRM UI 
 *  API / Integration 
 *  Automated creation during sales-skill addition 
 *  Data migration / conversion 
 

 *  When the account is created 
 *  Then the account currency must always come from the Country default currency value.

column6: Include BCA Number (unique, from MDM) and implement duplicate detection during integration sync.
column11:
As a CRM user,
I need the Base Customer Account Number on the Base Customer Account (BCA) to be unique across the system and protected by duplicate-prevention rules for integration-created records,
 
so that the integration from MDM cannot create duplicate BCAs and a single customer is always represented by one BCA record.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Uniqueness Enforcement 

 *  Given I am reviewing BCAs in CRM, when I search by Base Customer Account Number, then only one record exists for each number. 
 

 *  Integration Sync 

 *  Given the integration sends a payload with a Base Customer Account Number that already exists in CRM, when the record is processed, then the existing BCA is updated and no duplicate is created. 
 

 *  UI Restrictions 

 *  Given I am a business user (DM, CAM, AM, Sales Rep), when I open a BCA record, then the Base Customer Account Number field is visible but always read-only. 
 *  Given I attempt to create a new record from the CRM UI, then I do not see an option to create a BCA. 
 

 *  Validation & Views 

 *  Given I open the default BCA view, then I see Customer Name and Base Customer Account Number displayed so that I can verify the correct customer record. 
 

 

 
Business Requirements: 

 *  The Base Customer Account (BCA) number must be unique across CRM. 
 *  A single customer can only have one BCA record in CRM. 
 *  Integration from MDM must always use the BCA number provided by MDM; duplicates cannot be created. 
 *  If a BCA already exists with the same BCA number, the integration must update the existing record, not create a new one. 
 *  Business users (DM, CAM, AM, Sales Rep) must not be able to create or edit the BCA number through the CRM UI. 
 *  Users must be able to see the BCA number alongside Customer Name in default views so they can confirm uniqueness. 
 

 

 
Developer Notes: 

 *  Uniqueness Scope 

 *  The Base Customer Account Number is the system-wide unique identifier for BCA. 
 *  Payloads from MDM must use this number; any record with the same number should map to the same BCA (no new record is created). 
 *  There is exactly one BCA per Base Customer Account Number in CRM. 
 

 *  Normalization Before Matching 

 *  Before duplicate check, the Base Customer Account Number is normalized by: 

 *  Removing leading/trailing spaces. 
 

 *  Duplicate check uses the normalized value. 
 

 

 *  UI Behavior for Business Users 

 *  Business users cannot create BCAs from the UI. 
 *  Business users cannot edit the Base Customer Account Number. 
 *  Any attempt to change the number in the UI is blocked by permissions. 
 

 *  Views & Validation 

 *  Default BCA views display Customer Name and Base Customer Account Number so users can verify uniqueness.

column6: Implement CAM/GAM support in existing EBS Integration (D365-Snowflake-D)
column11: As a data engineer working on the Ecolab Snowflake Integrations project, I want to add support for CAM (Customer Account Manager) and GAM (Global Account Manager) roles in the ADF pipelines and dataflows, including CRM data cleanup and collaboration with the MAP 2.0 team to identify assignments and views, so that these roles are accurately mapped and integrated into account alignments.The new requirement for CAM/GAM support involves enhancing ADF to handle these managerial roles in account alignments. This includes performing data cleanup on the CRM side to ensure data quality, working with the MAP 2.0 team to locate and use the correct Snowflake view for assignments, and updating pipelines/dataflows with necessary modifications. Focus on minimal changes, leveraging existing sources where possible, and ensuring scalability for the Food and Beverage "One Customer" initiative.From other story:As a data engineer working on the Ecolab Snowflake Integrations project, I want to support Organizational Accounts (also known as H5 accounts) in the ADF pipelines and dataflows, so that these account types are properly handled in the EBS and MAP 2.0 integrations without data loss or misalignment.Organizational Accounts (H5) represent a specific account type in Ecolab's hierarchy, requiring dedicated handling in ADF to ensure they are included in sold-to alignments and CRM updates. This involves updating sources, joins, and sinks in relevant pipelines/dataflows, with potential new lookups for H5-specific attributes. Coordinate with business stakeholders to define H5 requirements and test with sample data.Pre-requisite:-    CRM data cleanup completed for CAM/GAM fields (e.g., removing duplicates, standardizing formats).
column22: *   CRM data cleanup completed for CAM/GAM fields (e.g., removing duplicates, standardizing formats).*   MAP 2.0 team provides the appropriate view/table for CAM/GAM assignments.Scenario, when populating an Account *   ADF pipelines/dataflows modified to include CAM/GAM mappings (e.g., new joins, derivations in Account_DF).*   New data sources added if required (though most likely not).*   Unit tests validate CAM/GAM assignments for sample accounts.*   Larger tests confirm no impact on existing workflows.

column6: Enable Global Search for Base Customer Account (BCA)
column11:
As a District Manager (DM) or Corporate Account Manager (CAM),
I want the Base Customer Account (BCA) entity to be searchable via Global Search,
 
So that I can quickly locate BCAs by account number or name and directly access enterprise-level customer information without additional navigation steps.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria:
 

 *  Given I am a DM or CAM 

 *  When I search using a BCA number or name in Global Search, Then the system must return the relevant BCA record in the results. 
 

 *  Given the search results include BCA records 

 *  When they are displayed, Then the results must show BCA Name and BCA Number fields for clear identification. 
 

 *  Given Global Search is enabled for BCA 

 *  When other entities (like Accounts, Contacts) are also searched, Then performance and filtering must remain consistent across all entities. 
 

 

 
Business Requirements:

 *  Enable Base Customer Account (BCA) as a searchable entity in Global Search. 
 *  Ensure BCA Name and BCA Number are the default fields displayed in the results grid. 
 *  Maintain Global Search performance standards when querying across entities. 
 *  Navigation from results should link directly to the selected BCA record. 
 *  Ensure compatibility with existing security permissions for users who have access to BCAs. 
 

 
Developer Notes: 

 *  Configure Global Search Indexing for the BCA entity. 
 *  Add BCA Name and BCA Number as visible columns in the Global Search results view. 
 *  Validate that the BCA entity is included in the Relevance Search (Dataverse search) configuration. 
 *  Ensure search results are permission-trimmed so users only see BCAs they have access to. 
 *  Perform regression testing to confirm enabling BCA in Global Search does not affect performance or results for Accounts, Contacts, or other entities. 
 *  Provide screenshots of updated search results for documentation and training reference.

column6: Enable 1C Section on District Form with Sales Skill Association Grid
column11:
As a CRM Ops Admins or a System Admin user, I want the District record form to display a dedicated “1C” section (on the General tab) when the One Customer (1C) flag = Yes, so that I can manage required Sales Skill associations for 1C districts.
This ensures that every district marked as 1C has at least one active Sales Skill linked, prevents invalid deactivations, and enforces governance around global business values.
column22:
Business Acceptance Criteria: 

 *  Enable 1C Section 

 *  Given a District record exists, 
 *  When the 1C flag is set to Yes, 
 *  Then the 1C section and Sales Skill subgrid are displayed on the form. 
 

 *  Require at Least One Sales Skill 

 *  Given a District record is being updated, 
 *  When a user sets 1C = Yes, without linking at least one active Sales Skill, 
 *  Then the system prevents save and shows error: 

 *  “At least one active Sales Skill must be associated before enabling One Customer.” 
 

 

 *  Hide New, Deactivate and Activate button on the Sales Skill Subgrid 

 *  Active and Deactivate button should not be enabled on the Sale Skill Subgrid
 
 *  Users should not be able to create a new Sales Skill from this Subgrid 
 

 *  Global Business Lock 

 *  Given a District has Global Business populated, 
 *  When 1C = Yes, 
 *  Then Global Business is hidden and locked but its existing value remains stored. 
 

 *  1C Update (Yes ? No) 

 *  Given a District has 1C = Yes with Sales Skills linked, 
 *  When the user sets 1C = No, 
 *  Then Global Business becomes visible and editable again, while existing Sales Skill associations remain. 
 

 *  Prevent Removing Last Sales Skill 

 *  Given a District with 1C = Yes has one active Sales Skill linked, 
 *  When a user attempts to remove or deactivate that last Sales Skill, 
 *  Then the system blocks the action and shows error: 

 *  “At least one active Sales Skill must remain linked while One Customer is enabled.” 
 

 

 *  Tool Tip Messaging 

 *  Tooltip on Sales Skill subgrid explains: 

 *  “Districts flagged as One Customer must always have at least one active Sales Skill linked.” 
 

 

 *  Security & Audit 

 *  Only authorized users (Ops Admin Lead, System Admin) can update 1C flag and manage Sales Skill associations. 
 *  All changes to 1C flag, Global Business, and Sales Skill links are audited with timestamp and user ID. 
 

 

Business Requirements: 

 *  Add a “1C” section on the District form, located under the General tab. 
 *  The section should contain: 

 *  1C Flag (already implemented separately; not in scope here). 
 *  Sales Skill subgrid to display/manage linked Sales Skills. 
 

 *  Behavior when 1C Flag = Yes: 

 *  Subgrid becomes visible and editable. 
 *  At least one active Sales Skill must always remain linked. 
 *  If a user attempts to set 1C = Yes without linking a Sales Skill ? system prevents save. 
 

 *  Global Business field: 

 *  Remains populated with existing value but becomes hidden and locked. 
 

 *  Behavior when 1C Flag is updated from Yes ? No: 
 *  Global Business field becomes visible and editable again. 
 *  Sales Skill subgrid remains visible (if associations exist). 
 *  Associations are not deleted but no longer enforce restrictions. 
 *  Validation: 

 *  Cannot remove or deactivate the last active Sales Skill when 1C = Yes. 
 *  Deactivation/removal allowed for other Sales Skills if ?1 active remains. 
 

 *  Security: 

 *  Only Ops Admins and System Admins can change the 1C flag and manage associations. 
 

 

 
Developer Notes:

 *  Subgrid should be conditionally visible only when 1C = Yes. 
 *  Coding needed for the Add Existing Sales Skill Button for Ops Admin Leads 
 *  Save logic must enforce “at least one active Sales Skill” rule for both UI and API calls. 
 *  Lock/hide Global Business when 1C = Yes, restore visibility/edit when 1C = No. 
 *  Ensure auditing is enabled on 1C flag, Global Business, and Sales Skill link entity. 
 *  Error handling must be consistent across UI and API (prevent invalid updates from integrations).
